Sense.DEF: the sixth letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第六个字母

Sense.DEF:
the fourth note in the musical
scale18
of C
major
or the musical
key
based on this note
Sense.TRAN: F音〔C大调音阶的第四音〕﹔F调

Sense.DEF: a mark given to a student’s work to show that it is not good enough
Sense.TRAN: F级〔表示学业成绩不及格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got an F in chemistry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我化学得了个F。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Fahrenheit 华氏温度
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water boils at 212˚F.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水在212华氏度时沸腾。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= female 女性﹔雌性动物
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= false 假的﹔错的
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= forte , used in music to show that a part should be played or sung loudly 〔乐谱中的〕强音记号
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= female 女性﹔雌性动物

Sense.DEF:
the fourth note in a musical
scale18
according to the
sol-fa
system
the organization that is in charge of professional and amateur football in England and Wales
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰和威尔士的〕足球协会﹐足协
Sense.EXAMPLE: the FA Cup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足总杯

Sense.DEF: nothing
a US government organization which is responsible for making sure that aircraft and airports are safe for people to use
extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fab new car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆极好的新车

Sense.DEF: a traditional short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fable of the fox and the crow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狐狸和乌鸦的寓言故事

Sense.DEF: fables or other traditional stories
Sense.TRAN: 寓言故事﹐神话传说〔总称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: monsters of fable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传说中的怪物

Sense.DEF: famous and often mentioned in traditional stories
Sense.TRAN: 寓言[传奇]中著名的﹔寓言[传奇]中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fabled ‘Fountain of Youth’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传说中的“青春泉”

Sense.DEF: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: our new range of fabrics and wallpapers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们新的织物和墙纸系列

GramExa.EXAMPLE: printed cotton fabric
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 印花棉织物

Sense.DEF: the fabric of a society is its basic structure, way of life, relationships, and traditions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drug abuse poses a major threat to the fabric of our society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸毒对我们的社会结构造成严重威胁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s social fabric is disintegrating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的社会结构正在瓦解。

Sense.DEF: the fabric of a building is its basic structure, including walls and the roof
Sense.TRAN: 某建筑物的基本结构〔包括墙和屋顶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need to preserve the fabric of the church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保存那座教堂基本结构的必要性

Sense.DEF: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方被控捏造证据。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Fabricate is used mainly in writing, for example in journalism and legal contexts. In everyday English, people usually say make something up.
F2NBox.TRAN: fabricate主要用于书面语﹐如新闻和法律文本。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说make something up
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They accused him of making the whole thing up.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们指责他编造了整件事情。

Sense.DEF: to make or produce goods or equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

Sense.DEF: a piece of information or story that someone has invented in order to deceive people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Of course, it might all be complete fabrication.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐这也许全都是编造出来的。

Sense.DEF: the process of making or producing something
a liquid that you put in water when washing clothes in order to make them feel softer
Sense.TRAN: 〔洗衣时用的〕织物柔软剂﹐衣物柔顺剂

Sense.DEF: extremely good or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look fabulous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去美极了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fabulous meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰盛的一餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room has fabulous views across the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个房间可以看到美丽的湖景。

Sense.DEF: very large in amount or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Duke’s fabulous wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位公爵的巨额财富

Sense.DEF: fabulous creatures, places etc are mentioned in traditional stories, but do not really exist
Sense.TRAN: 神话寓言中的﹐传说中的

Sense.DEF: extremely rich, expensive etc
Sense.TRAN: 极其富有的/昂贵的/成功的等

Sense.DEF: the front of a building, especially a large and important one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指大型重要建筑物的〕正面

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the facade of the cathedral
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大教堂的正面

Sense.EXAMPLE: an impressive building with a red brick facade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正面为红砖的雄伟建筑

Sense.DEF: a way of behaving that hides your real feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Behind her cheerful facade , she’s a really lonely person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在开朗的外表下﹐她其实是个非常孤独的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She managed to maintain a facade of bravery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她努力维持勇敢的表象。

Sense.DEF: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a beautiful face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她面容秀美。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face was white with fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吓得脸煞白。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A big smile spread across his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸上绽开了灿烂笑容。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt like punching him in the face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想给他脸上来一拳。
Sense.HINTTRAN: You say that something is on sb’s face, not ‘in sb’s face’. 表示“某物在某人脸上”时用on﹐不用in: You’ve got a mark on your face. 你脸上有块污渍。

Sense.DEF: an expression on someone’s face
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll never forget my father’s face – I’d never seen him so upset before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远也忘不了父亲的表情——我以前从没见他那么难过。

Sense.DEF: to not laugh or smile, even though something is funny
having a face that has a particular colour or shape
Sense.TRAN: 脸色苍白的/脸圆圆的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pale-faced youth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脸色苍白的年轻人

Sense.DEF: showing a particular expression on your face
Sense.EXAMPLE: Negotiators emerged grim-faced after the day’s talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过一天的谈判之后﹐谈判代表们表情严峻地走了出来。

Sense.DEF: a person

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who you have not seen before
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are a few new faces in class this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年班上来了几个新面孔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Gordon is a familiar face someone who you know or have seen many times before at the Shrewsbury Flower Show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈登是什鲁斯伯里花展上的老面孔了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the same old faces people who you see often, especially too often at our meetings every week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每周开会都是那几张老面孔。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who is famous from television, magazines, films etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked around at the sea of faces lots of people seen together in the cafeteria.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她环顾餐厅里的一张张面孔。

Subsense.DEF: if two people are standing face to face, they are very close and are looking at each other

GramExa.PROPFORM: meet sb/talk to sb/explain sth etc face to face
GramExa.GLOSS: to meet someone and talk to them, instead of just hearing about them, talking to them on the phone etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 当面见某人/与某人说话/解释某事等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve never met her face to face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有跟她见过面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘You could have just phoned.’ ‘I wanted to explain things face to face.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你打个电话就可以嘛。”“我想当面解释。”

GramExa.PROPFORM: come face to face/find yourself face to face (with sb)
GramExa.GLOSS: to meet someone, especially in a way that surprises or frightens you
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 迎面碰上（某人）〔尤指感到吃惊或害怕〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At that moment he came face to face with Sergeant Burke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐他迎面碰上了伯克中士。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The two men stood face to face without a word.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个人面对面站着﹐一言不发。

Subsense.DEF: if you come face to face with something difficult, you experience it and have to deal with it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was the first time he’d ever come face to face with death.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他第一次直面死亡。

GramExa.PROPFORM: bring sb face to face with sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes one is brought face to face with facts which cannot be ignored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时人得面对一些不能忽视的事实。

Sense.LEXUNIT: say sth/tell sb sth to their face
Sense.DEF: if you say something unpleasant to someone’s face, you say it to them directly, rather than to other people
Sense.TRAN: 当面说某事/告诉某人某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told him to his face just what I thought of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当面告诉了他我对他的看法。

Sense.DEF: with the face or front towards the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keith was lying face down on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思趴在床上。

Sense.DEF: with the face or front towards the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: The body was lying face up in the rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体仰面躺在雨中。

Sense.DEF: in a situation where there are many problems, difficulties, or dangers
Sense.TRAN: 面对某事物〔指问题﹑困难﹑危险〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is amazing how Daniels has survived in the face of such strong opposition from within the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔斯面对党内那么强烈的反对还是挺了过来﹐真不简单。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something seems true but that you think there may be other facts about it which are not yet clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks, on the face of it, like a minor change in the regulations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从表面上看﹐这好像是规章制度上的一个小小改动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the face of it, his suggestion makes sense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从表面上看﹐他的建议合乎情理。

Subsense.DEF: the nature or character of an organization, industry, system etc, and the way it appears to people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: technology that has changed the face of society
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变了社会面貌的技术
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is this the new face of the Tory party?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就是英国保守党的新面貌吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: the qualities of an organization, industry etc which people find unacceptable or acceptable
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某事物丑陋的/不可接受的/可接受的一面
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the unacceptable face of capitalism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资本主义不可接受的一面

Subsense.DEF: the general appearance of a particular place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the changing face of the landscape
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断变化的地貌

Sense.DEF: the face of a mountain, cliff etc is a steep vertical surface or side

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fell and died while attempting to climb the north face of Mont Blanc.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在攀登勃朗峰北坡时坠崖身亡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The cliff face was starting to crumble into the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 崖面开始崩裂坠入大海。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheer very steep rock face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡直的岩面

Sense.DEF: the front part of a clock or watch, where the numbers and hands are
if you lose face, you do something which makes you seem weak, stupid etc, and which makes people respect you less
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t want to back down accept defeat in an argument and risk losing face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想认输失面子。

Sense.DEF: if you do something to save face, you do it so that people will not lose their respect for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both countries saved face with the compromise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了这个妥协方案﹐两个国家都保全了面子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: disappear/vanish from/off the face of the earth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you have no idea where someone is and have not seen them in a very long time
Sense.TRAN: 从地球上消失〔用于表示不知道某人在哪里﹐长久没有见到他们〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen Paul in ages; he seems to have vanished off the face of the earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很久没见到保罗了﹐他好像已经从地球上消失了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the face of the earth
Sense.DEF: used when you are emphasizing a statement to mean ‘in the whole world’
Sense.TRAN: 天底下﹐世界上〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she was the last woman on the face of the earth, I still wouldn’t be interested!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就算天底下只剩她一个女人﹐我也不感兴趣！

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will not get or keep a particular job because they are not the kind of person that the employer wants
to be very determined that something should not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local Labour Party has set its face against the scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的工党坚决反对这个计划。

Sense.DEF: the part of a mine from which coal, stone etc is cut
one of the outside surfaces of an object or building
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cube has six faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立方体有六个面。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
racket
or
bat
etc that you use to hit the ball
behaviour, criticisms, remarks etc that are in your face are very direct and often shocking or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑批评﹑评论等〕当面的﹐直截了当的﹐不留情面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bingham has a very ‘in your face’ writing style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾厄姆文笔非常犀利。

Sense.DEF: if someone gets in your face, they really annoy you
used to tell someone in an impolite way to go away because they are annoying you
used as a way of talking about someone when you cannot remember their name
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw old what’s his face in school yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨天在学校里见到了那个老什么来着。

Sense.DEF:
to put
make-up
on
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just need to run upstairs and put my face on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得上楼去化一下妆。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: do sth till you’re blue in the face
be staring sb in the face
wipe sth off the face of the earth
wipe the smile/grin off sb’s face
have sth written all over your face

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 漂亮的/美丽的/英俊的等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her face was beautiful in the morning light.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸在晨曦的映衬下明媚动人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her face was round and jolly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸圆圆的﹐表情很快活。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tears rolled down her thin face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪水从她瘦削的脸庞滑落。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His face suddenly became pale and I thought he was going to faint.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然脸色煞白﹐我以为他要晕倒了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Maggie looked at him with a sad face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉看着他﹐一脸悲伤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Shelley looked at the children’s happy faces.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢利看着孩子们开心的笑脸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing no emotion or thoughts
with a lot of small lines, especially because of old age
one that shows you are not pleased about something
an unhappy expression
becomes red
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His face went red with embarrassment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他窘得涨红了脸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes pale
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I saw her face go pale when he walked in.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走进来的时候﹐我看到她脸色煞白。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they start to look happy
they start to look angry or threatening
they look sad or disappointed
to change your expression to make people laugh or to show you are angry, disappointed etc

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had a rather surprised look on her face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表情相当惊讶。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人脸上的微笑/咧嘴笑/皱眉
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a mischievous grin on her face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一脸坏笑。

Collocate.COLLOC: you can see sth in sb’s face
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: you know what someone is feeling from the expression on their face
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 你能看见某人脸上的某种表情
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She could see the despair in his face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能看出他脸上的失望之情。

Collocate.COLLOC: sth is written all over sb’s face
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: their feelings can be seen very clearly in their expression
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某种感情写在某人脸上

Sense.DEF: if you face or are faced with a difficult situation, or if a difficult situation faces you, it is going to affect you and you must deal with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emergency services are facing additional problems this winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年冬天﹐应急服务机构面临更多难题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President faces the difficult task of putting the economy back on its feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统面临着恢复经济的艰巨任务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: McManus is facing the biggest challenge of his career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克马纳斯正面临着事业上的最大挑战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the project comes to an end, many workers now face an uncertain future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着工程结束﹐许多工人现在前途未卜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He must face the prospect of financial ruin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他必须面对破产的可能性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was faced with the awful job of breaking the news to the girl’s family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我眼下有一个头疼的任务﹐要向那女孩的家人通报这一消息。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the difficulties faced by the police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方面临的困难
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he is found guilty, he faces up to 12 years in jail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他被判有罪﹐就将面临最多12年的刑期。

GramExa.GLOSS: have legal charges brought against you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was the first member of the former government to face criminal charges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是第一个面临刑事指控的前政府成员。

Sense.DEF: to accept that a difficult situation or problem exists, even though you would prefer to ignore it
Sense.TRAN: 正视﹐面对﹐接受〔困难局面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many couples refuse to face the fact that there are problems in their marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多夫妻拒绝承认婚姻已出现问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to face facts , Rachel. You can’t survive on a salary that low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得面对现实﹐雷切尔﹐这么低的工资不够生活的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to face the awful truth that she no longer loved him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不接受这个可怕的事实: 她已不再爱他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Face it, kid. You’re never going to be a rock star.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对现实吧﹐孩子﹐你永远也成不了摇滚乐歌星的。

Sense.DEF: if you can’t face something, you feel unable to do it because it seems too unpleasant or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to go back to college – I just can’t face it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想再回去上大学——我无法面对这事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t face the thought of going into town when it’s this hot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么热﹐我真不想去城里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t face the prospect of another divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无法正视可能又要离婚的事实。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t face driving all the way to Los Angeles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不愿意一路开车到洛杉矶。

Sense.DEF: to talk or deal with someone, when this is unpleasant or difficult for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re going to have to face him sooner or later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你迟早都要面对他的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how I’m going to face her after what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了这些事﹐我真不知道如何面对她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident left her feeling depressed and unable to face the world be with people and live a normal life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起事故后她很消沉﹐无法面对生活。

Sense.DEF: to be opposite someone or something, or to be looking or pointing in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men stood facing each other, smiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个人微笑着面对面站着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he turned to face her, he seemed annoyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转身面对着她﹐似乎生气了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lunch is served on the terrace facing the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午餐安排在面对大海的露天平台上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a south-facing garden
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝南的花园

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dining room faces east.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐厅朝东。

Sense.DEF: to play against an opponent or team in a game or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martinez will face Robertson in tomorrow’s final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天的决赛中马丁内斯将迎战罗伯逊。

Sense.DEF: to accept criticism or punishment for something you have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔为自己的所为〕接受批评[惩罚]

Sense.DEF:
a building that is faced with stone,
concrete
etc has a layer of that material on its outside surfaces
Sense.TRAN: 以石块/混凝土等砌面[抹面﹐覆盖]

Sense.DEF: to deal in a strong and confident way with someone who opposes you
Sense.TRAN: 〔用坚定和自信的方式〕压倒﹐挫败﹐慑服
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harrison successfully faced down the mob of angry workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里森把那伙愤怒的工人压了下去。

Sense.DEF: to fight, argue, or compete with someone, or to get into a position in which you are ready to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two candidates will face off in a televised debate on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位候选人将在周五的电视辩论中正面交锋。

Sense.DEF: to accept and deal with a difficult fact or problem
Sense.TRAN: 勇于面对〔难以接受的事实或问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll never offer you another job; you might as well face up to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决不会再给你一个工作机会了﹐你还是接受现实吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to face up to the fact that he was guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须接受他是有罪的这一事实。

Sense.DEF:
a
social networking website
started in 2004
Sense.TRAN: 脸谱网〔社交网站﹐创立于2004年〕

Sense.DEF:
the king, queen, or
jack
in a set of playing cards
Sense.TRAN: 花牌﹐人头牌〔指纸牌中的K, Q, J〕

Sense.DEF: a small square cloth used to wash your face or hands
Sense.TRAN: 〔小块方布做的〕洗脸巾﹐洗手巾

Sense.DEF: a thick cream used to keep the skin on your face soft and smooth
a faceless person, organization, or building has nothing that makes them special, interesting, or different - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑机构或建筑物〕无个性的﹐缺乏特征的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had become just another faceless bureaucrat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已成为千人一面的官僚中的一员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: faceless modern office blocks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千篇一律的现代办公楼群

Sense.DEF: if you have a facelift, you have an operation in which doctors remove loose skin from your face in order to make you look younger
Sense.TRAN: 除皱整容术﹔面部拉皮手术

Sense.DEF: work or repairs that make a building or place look newer or better
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new owner had given the pub a facelift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新老板对酒吧进行了翻修。

Sense.DEF: a fight or argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: a face-off between police and rioters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察与暴乱者的冲突

Sense.DEF:
the start of a game of
ice hockey
a thick cream that you spread over your face and leave on for a short time, in order to clean and improve your skin
powder that you put on your face in order to make it look less shiny
an action or arrangement that prevents you from losing other people’s respect
a face-saving action or arrangement prevents you from losing other people’s respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: a face-saving compromise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保全面子的妥协

Sense.DEF: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has travelled extensively in China, recording every facet of life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在中国游历颇广﹐记录下了生活的方方面面。

Sense.DEF: consisting of many different parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题很复杂﹐涉及诸多方面。

Sense.DEF: one of the flat sides of a cut jewel
time that you spend at your job because you want other people, especially your manager, to see you there, whether or not you are actually doing good work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在上司面前表现的〕露面时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here we reward performance, not face time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这里奖励的是业绩﹐不是露面时间。

Sense.DEF: time that you spend talking to someone when you are with them, rather than on the telephone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In return for his donation, he wanted face time with the President.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出面见总统﹐以此作为捐款的回报。

Sense.DEF: saying things that are intended to be clever and funny but are really silly and annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so facetious!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么乱开玩笑！
Sense.EXAMPLE: facetious comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不当的戏谑评论

Sense.DEF: a face-to-face meeting, conversation etc is one where you are with another person and talking to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a face-to-face interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对面的采访

Sense.DEF: to accept a situation or accept what someone says, without thinking there may be a hidden meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t always take his remarks at face value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话你不应该总是只听表面意思。

Sense.DEF: the value or cost shown on the front of something such as a stamp or coin
Sense.TRAN: 〔邮票﹑钱币等的〕面值﹐票面价值

Sense.DEF: on your face or relating to your face
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victor’s facial expression didn’t change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克托脸上的表情没有变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: facial hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脸部的汗毛

Sense.DEF: if you have a facial, you have a beauty treatment in which your face is cleaned and creams are rubbed into it
a thick substance which you use to clean the skin on your face thoroughly
Sense.TRAN: 面部磨砂膏﹐磨砂洁面霜

Sense.DEF: a facile remark, argument etc is too simple and shows a lack of careful thought or understanding
Sense.TRAN: 〔话语﹑论点等〕肤浅的﹐信口开河的
Sense.EXAMPLE: facile generalizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肤浅的概括

Sense.DEF: a facile achievement or success has been obtained too easily and has no value
Sense.EXAMPLE: a facile victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻易取得的胜利

Sense.DEF: to make it easier for a process or activity to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers can be used to facilitate language learning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用电脑可使语言学习更方便。

Sense.DEF: someone who helps a group of people discuss things with each other or do something effectively
something that helps a process to take place
rooms, equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某种目的而提供的〕设施﹐设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: All rooms have private facilities private bathroom and toilet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有房间都有独立盥洗室。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has its own pool and leisure facilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店拥有自己的游泳池和休闲设施。
卫生间设施
Sense.EXAMPLE: childcare facilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童保育设施

Sense.DEF: a special part of a piece of equipment or a system which makes it possible to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔设备或系统的〕特殊装置﹐特色功能
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there a call-back facility on this phone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电话有回拨功能吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bank account with an overdraft facility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可透支的银行账户

Sense.DEF: a place or building used for a particular activity or industry, or for providing a particular type of service
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-secret research facility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个绝密的研究中心
Sense.EXAMPLE: the finest indoor sports facility in the US
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国最好的室内运动场所

Sense.DEF: a natural ability to do something easily and well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has an amazing facility for languages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有惊人的语言天赋。

Sense.DEF: the toilet, used to be polite
Sense.TRAN: 卫生间﹐厕所〔礼貌的说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Excuse me, I have to use the facilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我得去一下洗手间。

Sense.DEF: an outer surface of a wall or building made of a different material from the rest in order to make it look attractive
material fastened to the inside of a piece of clothing to strengthen it
parts of a jacket, coat etc around the neck and wrists which have a different colour from the rests
Sense.TRAN: 〔领口或袖口不同颜色的〕镶边﹐饰边﹐贴边

Sense.DEF: an exact copy of a picture, piece of writing etc

a
fax
a piece of information that is known to be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is full of facts about the World Cup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书全是有关世界杯的真实信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: First of all, we need to know the facts of the case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我们需要了解案子的相关事实。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that something is definitely true or that something definitely happened
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The divorce rate is twice as high as in the 1950s – that’s a fact.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的离婚率是20世纪50年代的两倍——事实就是如此。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to reply to a statement that you find surprising, interesting, or difficult to believe
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘She used to be a professional singer.’ ‘Is that a fact?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “她过去是个专业歌手。”“真的吗？”

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a situation and saying that it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our decision to build the museum in Hartlepool was influenced by the fact that there were no national museums in the North East.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们之所以决定在哈特尔浦建造博物馆﹐是因为东北地区没有国家级的博物馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to help me, despite the fact that I asked him several times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我求了他好几次﹐他还是拒绝帮助我。

GramExa.PROPFORM: given the fact (that)/in view of the fact (that)
GramExa.GLOSS: used when saying that a particular fact influences your judgement about something or someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Given the fact that this is their first game, I think they did pretty well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到这是他们的首场比赛﹐我认为他们表现得很好了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: due to the fact (that)/owing to the fact (that)
GramExa.GLOSS: because
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school’s poor exam record is largely due to the fact that it is chronically underfunded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校考试成绩差﹐主要是由于长期以来资金不足。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact we didn’t win when we were so close is very disappointing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们与胜利失之交臂﹐这真令人沮丧。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are adding something, especially something surprising, to emphasize what you have just said
Subsense.TRAN: 事实上〔用于补充说明﹐强调前面所说的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I know the mayor really well. In fact, I had dinner with her last week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟市长很熟﹐事实上﹐我上周还和她一起吃过饭呢。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that the truth about a situation is the opposite of what has been mentioned
Subsense.TRAN: 事实上﹐实际上〔用于强调实际情况与刚提及的恰恰相反〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They told me it would be cheap but in fact it cost me nearly $500.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对我说便宜﹐但实际上这花了我将近500美元。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her teachers said she was a slow learner, whereas in actual fact she was partially deaf.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师都说她学得慢﹐而其实她部分失聪。

Sense.DEF: used when you are telling someone what is actually true in a particular situation, especially when this may be difficult to accept, or different from what people believe
Sense.TRAN: 事实是/实际情况是〔尤指事实难以接受或与人们所想不同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact of the matter is that he’s just not up to the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况是他根本就不能胜任那份工作。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying about a situation is true and people must realize this
Sense.TRAN: 事实是﹐真实的情况是〔用于强调所说的某一情况为事实﹐人们必须意识到〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact remains that the number of homeless people is rising daily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现实就是无家可归的人每天都在增加。

Sense.DEF: situations, events etc that really happened and have not been invented
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the novel is based on fact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小说的大部分以真人真事为基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a news reporter’s job to separate fact from fiction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者的职责就是要区分真实和虚构。

Sense.DEF: the basic details, numbers etc concerning a particular situation or subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here are a few facts and figures about the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是该国的一些基本资料。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the things that have happened or the things someone has done show clearly that something is true
after something has happened or been done, especially after a mistake has been made
Sense.TRAN: 情况发生后﹐事后〔尤指错误发生后〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report outlines the basic facts concerning the case.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告概述了此案的基本事实。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is a well-known fact that new cars lose a lot of their value in the first year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新车第一年就贬值得厉害﹐这大家都知道。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: information that is definitely true and can be proven

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 历史的真相/科学的事实

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: only the basic general facts of a situation

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 告诉某人真相/提供事实真相
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Newspapers have a duty to give their readers the facts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸有责任告诉读者真相。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: find out what actually happened in a situation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police are still piecing together the facts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方仍在努力拼凑出真相。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say what you know is true
say only what you know is true
used to say that something is definitely true
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I know for a fact that she is older than me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以肯定她比我大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make sure that what you say or believe is correct
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You should get your facts straight before making accusations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 指责前先要弄清事实真相。

Sense.DEF: an official trip, visit etc during which you try to find out facts and information about something for your organization, government etc
a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: struggles between the different factions within the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内的派系斗争
Sense.EXAMPLE: the leaders of the warring factions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交战各派的领导人

Sense.DEF: disagreements and arguments between different groups within an organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织内部的〕派系斗争﹐派系纠纷
Sense.EXAMPLE: jealousy and faction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫉妒和内讧

Sense.DEF: disagreements between different groups within an organization
made to happen artificially by people rather than happening naturally
an unpleasant situation that exists and that must be accepted
Sense.TRAN: 生活的现实﹐必须面对的事实
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mass unemployment seems to be a fact of life nowadays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模失业似乎就是如今不得不面对的现实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Persuading others to accept the hard financial facts of life is not a very popular job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说服他人接受严峻的经济现实不是个好差事。

Sense.DEF: the details about sex and how babies are born
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum told me the facts of life when I was twelve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我12岁的时候妈妈向我传授性知识。

Sense.DEF: a small and quite interesting piece of information that is not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Web is a prime source of insignificant factoids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万维网是小趣闻的主要来源。

Sense.DEF: one of several things that influence or cause a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vaccination program has been a major factor in the improvement of health standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接种疫苗计划是健康水平得以提高的一个主要因素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The weather could be a crucial factor in tomorrow’s game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气情况会是影响明天比赛的一个关键因素。

GramExa.GLOSS: the most important factor
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We liked both houses, but price was the deciding factor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两幢房子我们都喜欢﹐但价格才是决定性因素。

Sense.DEF: a particular level on a scale that measures how strong or effective something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: factor 15 suntan oil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防晒系数为15的防晒油
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even in July the wind chill factor the degree to which the air feels colder because of the wind can be intense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至在七月份风寒指数也会很高。

Sense.LEXUNIT: by a factor of five/ten etc
Sense.DEF: if something increases or decreases by a factor of five, ten etc, it increases or decreases by five times, ten times etc
a number that divides into another number exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: 3 is a factor of 15.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3是15的因子。

Sense.DEF: to divide a number into factors
Sense.TRAN: 将…分解为因子﹐把…化为因数

Sense.DEF: to include a particular thing in your calculations about how long something will take, how much it will cost etc
to not include something in your calculations about how long something will take, how much it will cost etc
Sense.TRAN: 不将…计入﹔不把…考虑在内

Sense.DEF: the result when you multiply a whole number by all the numbers below it
Sense.EXAMPLE: factorial 3=3×2×1

Sense.DEF: a building or group of buildings in which goods are produced in large quantities, using machines
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car factory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车制造厂
Sense.EXAMPLE: factory workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂工人

Sense.DEF:
a type of farming in which animals are kept inside, in small spaces or small
cages
, and made to grow or produce eggs very quickly

Subsense.DEF: the area in a factory where goods are made
the ordinary workers in a factory, rather than the managers

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s been a lot of talk on the factory floor among the ordinary workers about more layoffs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车间工人议论纷纷﹐说还会有更多的裁员。

Sense.DEF: a servant or worker who has to do many different kinds of jobs for someone
a piece of paper giving all the most important information about something
based on facts or relating to facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to keep your account of events as factual as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要尽量如实地说明情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Libraries are stores of factual information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆是事实资料的宝库。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report contained a number of factual errors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告中有一些与事实不符的错误。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文件的内容真实无误。

Sense.DEF: a department or group of related departments within a university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Faculty of Law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法学院

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Engineering Faculty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程学院

Sense.DEF: all the teachers in a university
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

Sense.DEF: a natural ability, such as the ability to see, hear, or think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: the patient’s mental faculties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人的神志

GramExa.PROPFORM: in full possession of all your faculties
GramExa.GLOSS: able to see, hear, think etc in the normal way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the faculty of sight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 视觉官能

Sense.DEF: a particular skill that someone has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a great faculty for absorbing information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吸收信息的能力很强。

Sense.DEF:
a football competition open to all
amateur
and professional football teams in the FA in England and Wales. It is the most important football competition in England.
Sense.TRAN: 足总杯〔英格兰最重要的足球赛事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool won the FA Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦队赢得了足总杯。

Sense.DEF: something that people like or do for a short time, or that is fashionable for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest in organic food is not a fad, it’s here to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对有机食品的兴趣不是一时的风尚﹐它是长久的喜好。

Sense.DEF: someone who is faddy dislikes many kinds of food - used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackie’s a terribly faddy eater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰姬挑食得很。

Sense.DEF: to gradually disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes of a peace settlement are beginning to fade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成和平协议的希望日渐渺茫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the years her beauty had faded a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岁月流逝﹐她的美貌已略逊当年。

Sense.DEF: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fading evening light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐暗的暮色
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of faded jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun had faded the curtains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

Sense.DEF: to become weaker physically, especially so that you become very ill or die
if a team fades, it stops playing as well as it did before
to seem unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our problems fade into insignificance when compared with those of the people here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此处人们的问题相比﹐我们的问题微不足道。

Sense.DEF: to appear slowly or become louder, or to make a picture or sound do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Additional background sound is faded in at the beginning of the shot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镜头一开始﹐背景音渐渐响起。

Sense.DEF: to disappear slowly or become quieter, or to make a picture or sound do this
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔画面〕淡出﹐渐隐﹔（使）〔声音〕渐弱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He slid a control to fade out the music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他滑动控制器﹐让音乐声渐渐减弱。

Sense.DEF:
solid waste material from the
bowels

a
fairy
to waste time doing unnecessary things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop faffing around!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别没事瞎忙活！

Sense.DEF: a cigarette

a very offensive word for a
homosexual
man. Do not use this word.
to be a boring or difficult thing to do

a young student in some British
public schools
who has to do jobs for an older student
Sense.TRAN: 小跟班〔英国一些公学里受高年级学生使唤的低年级学生〕

Sense.DEF: the end of a cigarette that someone has finished smoking
extremely tired
used to say that you are too tired or bored to do something
Sense.TRAN: 我可吃不消〔用于表示自己太累或太厌烦而不愿去做某事〕

Sense.DEF: a ball made of meat mixed with bread, which is cooked
Sense.TRAN: 〔由碎肉和面包屑做成并煮熟的〕肉丸子

Sense.DEF:
a very offensive word for a
homosexual
man. Do not use this word.
small sticks that are tied together, used for burning on a fire

a woman who likes to spend a lot of time with
homosexual
male friends - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢与男同性恋者在一起的女人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 32˚ and boils at 212˚
Sense.TRAN: 华氏温度〔冰点为32度﹐沸点为212度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 72˚ Fahrenheit 72 degrees on the Fahrenheit scale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 72华氏度

Sense.DEF: to not succeed in achieving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来和平谈判可能会失败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He failed in his attempt to regain the world title.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他未能夺回世界冠军头衔。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors failed to save the girl’s life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生没能救活这个小女孩。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably been completely unsuccessful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万人戒过烟﹐都以惨败告终。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his efforts to save his failing marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挽救自己濒危婚姻的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: If all else fails, you may be advised to have an operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是其他方法都不见效的话﹐恐怕你还是动手术的好。

Sense.DEF: to not do what is expected, needed, or wanted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letter failed to arrive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信没有寄到。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Firms that fail to take advantage of the new technology will go out of business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 未能利用新技术的公司会被淘汰。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government are failing in their duty to protect people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政府未能尽到保护人民的责任。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Fail to do something is used mainly in writing and in formal contexts. In everyday English, people usually say do not do something instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: fail to do something主要用于书面语或正式文章。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说do not do something

Subsense.DEF: to not pass a test or examination
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I failed my driving test the first time I took it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次驾照考试没过关。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He failed maths but passed all his other subjects.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他数学没及格﹐但是其他科目都通过了。

Subsense.DEF: to decide that someone has not passed a test or examination
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her work was so bad that I had no choice but to fail her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她考得太差了﹐我只能给她不及格。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed by something that you do not accept or understand
Sense.TRAN: 我不明白〔用于表示为不愿接受或不理解的事而生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fail to see why you find it so amusing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你为什么觉得那么好笑。

Sense.DEF: if a company or business fails, it is unable to continue because of a lack of money
if a part of a machine or an organ in your body fails, it stops working
Sense.TRAN: 〔机件或人体器官〕失灵﹐丧失功能
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine failed on take-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎在起飞过程中失灵了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital said that his kidneys were failing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院说过他的肾脏在逐渐衰竭。

Sense.DEF: if your sight, memory, health etc is failing, it is gradually getting weaker or is not as good as it was
Sense.EXAMPLE: Failing eyesight forced him to retire early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 视力衰退迫使他提前退休。

Sense.DEF: to do something or happen so regularly that people expect it
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandson never fails to phone me on my birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的孙儿从来不会忘记在我生日那天打电话给我。

Sense.DEF: if your courage etc fails, or if it fails you, you suddenly do not have it when you need it
Sense.TRAN: 你的勇气/意志/胆量消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to leave immediately, before her courage failed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须趁自己还有勇气马上离开。

Sense.DEF: to not do what someone has trusted you to do
Sense.TRAN: 使某人失望﹐有负于某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel I’ve failed my children by not spending more time with them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没能多花些时间陪伴孩子﹐我觉得让他们失望了。

Sense.DEF: if crops fail, they do not grow or produce food, for example because of bad weather

if the
rain s a lot of rain that falls at a particular time each year
fail, they do not come when expected or it does not rain enough
Sense.TRAN: 〔在该下雨的季节〕无雨﹐不下雨﹐下雨少

Exponent.DEF: to not succeed – used about people, plans, methods etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plan failed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划失败了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They failed to persuade her to change her mind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没能说服她改变主意。

Exponent.DEF: if something you do goes wrong, it fails after starting well
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The experiment went wrong when the chemicals combined to form a poisonous gas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验出了问题﹐化学物质反应生成了一种有毒气体。

Exponent.DEF: if something does not work, it does not do what you want it to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drugs don’t work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药不见效。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tried to fix it with glue, but that didn’t work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图用胶水来固定它﹐但没有用。

Exponent.DEF: to not have the result you wanted
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His first attempt to get a teaching job was unsuccessful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想从事教学工作的初次尝试没有成功。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The search was unsuccessful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜寻一无所获。

Exponent.DEF: to be unsuccessful, with the result that you have wasted your efforts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government’s 5-year plan to modernize the economy was a complete failure.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政府旨在实现经济现代化的五年计划完全失败了。

Exponent.DEF: if a plan or action backfires, it does the opposite of what it was intended to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His plan to get attention backfired, and instead of being promoted he lost his job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想抓人眼球的计划产生了反作用﹐非但没能升职﹐反而丢了工作。

Exponent.DEF: if you try to do something in vain, you fail to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They tried in vain to save him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想要救他﹐却是徒然。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All her efforts had been in vain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的努力都白费了。

Subsense.DEF: if you do something without fail, you always do it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tim visits his mother every day without fail.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆每天必去看望他的母亲。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone very firmly that they must do something
Subsense.TRAN: 务必﹐一定〔用于坚决地告诉别人一定要做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I want that work finished by tomorrow, without fail!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求那项工作必须在明天之前完成﹐不得有误！

Sense.DEF: an unsuccessful result in a test or examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a fail in history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我历史考试不及格。

Sense.DEF: someone who wanted to be an actor etc but was unsuccessful
Sense.TRAN: 不成功[失败]的演员/作家等

Sense.DEF: a fault or weakness
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love him, despite his failings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管他有种种缺点﹐我还是爱他。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if your first suggestion is not successful or possible, there is another possibility that you could try
Sense.TRAN: 如果不行〔用于说明如果第一个建议行不通时还可能做的另一件事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will probably have the conference at the Hyatt Hotel or, failing that, at the Fairmont.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可能会在凯悦大酒店开会﹐如果不行的话﹐就改在费尔蒙特酒店。

Sense.DEF: a fail-safe machine, piece of equipment etc contains a system that makes the machine stop working if one part of it fails
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备等〕有自动防止故障装置的﹐有安全保障装置的

Sense.DEF: a fail-safe plan is certain to succeed
a lack of success in achieving or doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the conference’s failure to reach an agreement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议未能达成一致

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is not successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

Sense.DEF: an act of not doing something which should be done or which people expect you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Failure to produce proof of identity could result in prosecution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法出示身份证明可能会被起诉。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a business has to close because of a lack of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business failures in Scotland rose 10% last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年苏格兰的企业破产率上升了10%。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a machine or part of your body stops working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cause of the crash was engine failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坠机原因是引擎故障。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He died from kidney failure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于肾衰竭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a failure in the computer system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机系统故障

Sense.DEF: an occasion when crops do not grow or produce food, for example because of bad weather
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of crop failures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接二连三的庄稼歉收

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A series of rescue attempts ended in failure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列救援行动都以失败告终。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be certain to fail
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rebellion was doomed to failure from the start.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次叛乱从一开始就注定要失败。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was too proud to admit failure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很骄傲﹐不肯认输。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 完全的/十足的/彻底的失败
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The project ended in total failure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目以彻底失败告终。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to emphasize how bad a failure is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The experiment was considered a dismal failure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次实验被认为是一次惨败。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a failure that is someone’s personal fault

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fear of failure should not deter you from trying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要因为畏惧失败而不敢尝试。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The risk of failure for a new product is very high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新产品失败的风险很大。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Dropping out of college would be an admission of failure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 从大学退学就是承认失败。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a situation in which someone has failed many times in the past
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some children have a history of failure at school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些孩子在学校里经历过失败。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a series of failures

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a high failure rate in the restaurant industry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐饮业倒闭率很高。

Sense.DEF: difficult to see, hear, smell etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a faint smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她淡淡一笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very faint noise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很微弱的声响
Sense.EXAMPLE: the faint light of dawn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微弱的晨光

Sense.DEF: a very small or slight hope etc
Sense.TRAN: 微弱的希望/很小的可能性/些微的可能等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faint hope that they might be alive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们渺茫的生还希望

Sense.DEF: to not know anything at all about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have the faintest idea what you’re talking about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点都不知道你在说什么。

Sense.DEF: feeling weak and as if you are about to become unconscious because you are very ill, tired, or hungry
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生病﹑疲倦或饥饿而〕虚弱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat made him feel quite faint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高温令他感觉很虚弱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was faint with hunger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿昏了。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都显得有点吃惊。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: The sun shone faintly through the clouds.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 微弱的阳光透过云层照射下来。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several fans fainted in the blazing heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个球迷在炽热高温下晕过去了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you were very surprised by something
Sense.TRAN: 我差点昏过去〔表示很惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I nearly fainted when they told me the price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们告诉我价格时﹐我差点昏过去。

Sense.DEF: an act of becoming unconscious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fell down in a faint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她昏倒了。

Sense.DEF: not trying very hard, because you do not want to do something, or you are not confident that you can succeed
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不想做或没有信心而〕半心半意的﹐未尽全力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a rather faint-hearted attempt to stop him from leaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有尽力挽留他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is not for the faint-hearted
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that something is difficult and needs a lot of effort
Sense.TRAN: 某事不是弱者所能干的〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a fair situation, system, way of treating people, or judgment seems reasonable, acceptable, and right
Sense.EXAMPLE: All we are asking for is a fair wage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所要求的只是一份合理的薪水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: £150 is a fair price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 150英镑是个合理的价钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the right to a fair trial
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公正审判权

Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think is the fairest solution?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为最合理的解决方式是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report is a fair summary of the issues facing us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告对我们所面临的问题做了一个适当的总结。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is fair to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems fair to give them a second chance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再给他们一次机会似乎是应该的。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that it is right to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s only fair that we tell him what’s happening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将发生的事情告诉他﹐这才公平。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you think what you are saying is correct or reasonable
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s fair to say that by then he had lost the support of his staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恰当地说﹐那时他已经失去了员工的支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t carry on working such long hours. It’s not fair on my family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作时间这样长﹐我干不下去了﹐那对我家人不公平。

Sense.DEF: treating everyone in a way that is right or equal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does Eric get to go and I don’t? It’s not fair!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么埃里克能去我不能？这不公平！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life isn’t always fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活并非总是公平的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old law wasn’t fair to women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条旧法律对女性不公平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You pay him $10 an hour – it’s only fair that I should get the same.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给他每小时10美元﹐那我也应该得到同样的报酬才公平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My boss expects a lot – but he’s very fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的老板要求很高——但是他很公平。

Sense.DEF: quite a large size, number etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve still got a fair amount of work left to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还有很多工作要做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had travelled a fair way quite a long distance by lunch time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到中午时分﹐我们已走了很多路。

GramExa.GLOSS: it is quite likely that something will happen
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某事发生的可能性很大
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a fair chance we’ll be coming over to England this summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年夏天我们很可能会去英格兰。

Sense.DEF: someone who is fair, or who has fair hair or skin, has hair or skin that is very light in colour
a fair fight, game, or election is one that is played or done according to the rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔拳击﹑比赛﹑选举〕公平的﹐根据规则进行的

Sense.DEF: neither particularly good nor particularly bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her written work is excellent but her practical work is only fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的笔头功夫很出色﹐但实际动手能力却只是一般。

Sense.DEF: weather that is fair is pleasant and not windy, rainy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It should be generally fair and warm for the next few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的几天天气总体来说晴朗暖和。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have had more than your fair share of sth
Sense.DEF: to have had more of something, especially something unpleasant, than seems reasonable
Sense.TRAN: 遇到某事太多了〔尤指不愉快之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor old Alan! He’s had more than his fair share of bad luck recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的老艾伦！他最近遇到的倒霉事太多了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb a fair crack of the whip
Sense.DEF: to give someone the opportunity to do something, especially so that they can show that they are able to do it
Sense.TRAN: 给某人一个机会〔尤为了让他们证明有能力〕

Sense.DEF: to treat someone, or to be treated, in a way that gives everyone the same chances as everyone else
Sense.TRAN: 给某人/获得公平的待遇[均等的机会]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women don’t always get a fair shake in business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性在工作上并不是总能获得公平的待遇。

Sense.DEF: using any method to get what you want, including dishonest or illegal methods

Sense.LEXUNIT: all’s fair in love and war
Sense.DEF: used to say that in some situations any method of getting what you want is acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 情场和战场﹐两者皆不厌诈〔指在某些情况下可以为达到目的而不择手段〕

Sense.DEF: pleasant and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fair maiden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的少女

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree with someone’s suggestion or that something seems reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think we should split the bill.’ ‘Fair enough.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我觉得应该大家平摊费用。”“行。”

Sense.DEF: used when adding something after someone has been criticized, which helps to explain or excuse what they did
Sense.EXAMPLE: She should have phoned to tell us what her plans were although, to be fair, she’s been very busy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她应该打个电话把她的计划告诉我们。不过﹐说句公道话﹐她一直很忙。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to be unreasonable or criticize someone too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now Pat, be fair, the poor girl’s trying her hardest!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了帕特﹐要公道一些﹐那个可怜的女孩子尽力了！

Sense.DEF: used when you think it is fair that someone should do something, especially because of something that has happened earlier
Sense.TRAN: 应当公道才是﹐大家应该公平
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, fair’s fair – I paid last time so it’s your turn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得了﹐应当公平才是——上次我付钱﹐所以这次该你了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a remark or criticism seems reasonable

Sense.LEXUNIT: you can’t say fairer than that
Sense.DEF: used to say that an offer you are making to someone is the best and fairest offer they can possibly get
Sense.TRAN: 这是再公道不过了﹐无法比这再合理了
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you £25 for it – you can’t say fairer than that, can you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我付给你25英镑——这是再公道不过了﹐不是吗？

Sense.DEF: used humorously to admit that you should not be doing something that someone has caught you doing
Sense.TRAN: 这是罪有应得﹐活该被抓个正着〔幽默说法﹐表示承认不应该做某事〕

Sense.DEF: if you do something with your own fair hands, you do it yourself without any help – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 用自己的双手﹐亲自〔幽默用法〕

Exponent.DEF: treating people equally or in the way that is right
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s not fair that she gets paid more than me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她报酬比我高﹐这不公平。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone has the right to a fair trial.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何人都享有公正审判权。

Exponent.DEF: morally right and fair
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a just punishment
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公正的处罚
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a just cause
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 正义事业
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a just society
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公正的社会
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you think it was a just war?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为这场战争是正义的吗？

Exponent.DEF: fair and sensible according to most people’s standards
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a reasonable request
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 正当的请求
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lateness, without a reasonable excuse, will not be tolerated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无故迟到是不允许的。

Exponent.DEF: giving fair and equal treatment to all sides of an argument or subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Balanced reporting of the news is essential.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对新闻进行全面公正的报道很重要。

Exponent.DEF: giving fair and equal treatment to everyone, especially when it would be easy to favour one particular group
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drama takes an even-handed look at the consequences of violent crime, both on attackers and their victims.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电视剧以公正的眼光来看待暴力犯罪的后果﹐对袭击者和受害者一视同仁。

Exponent.DEF: giving equal treatment to everyone involved
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need an equitable solution to this problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一个合理的方案来解决这一问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a more equitable distribution of wealth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 更加公平的财富分配

Sense.DEF: a form of outdoor entertainment, at which there are large machines to ride on and games in which you can win prizes
an outdoor event, at which there are large machines to ride on, games to play, and sometimes farm animals being judged and sold
Sense.TRAN: 集市〔有大型可骑乘的游戏设施﹑各式游戏﹐有时还对牲畜进行评比并出售〕

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州/县集市

Sense.DEF: an event at which people or businesses show and sell their products
Sense.TRAN: 书展/古玩展/手工艺品展销会/交易会等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Frankfurt Book Fair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法兰克福书展
Sense.EXAMPLE: an antiques fair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古玩展
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trade fair where companies show their newest products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商品交易会
Sense.EXAMPLE: a craft fair where people sell handmade products such as jewellery, paintings etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手工艺品展销会

Sense.DEF: an event where people go to get information about different kinds of jobs
an outdoor event with games and things to eat and drink, usually organized to get money for a school, club etc
Sense.TRAN: 一般为学校﹑俱乐部等筹款的〕义卖会

Sense.DEF: a market where animals and farm products are sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔出售牲畜和农产品的〕市场﹐集市
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horse fair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马市

Sense.DEF: to win a competition, sports match etc honestly and without cheating
Sense.TRAN: 正大光明地赢得（某物）/打败某人

Sense.DEF: to do something in a fair and honest way
Sense.EXAMPLE: In international trade, very few countries play fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在国际贸易中﹐很少有国家遵守游戏规则。

Sense.DEF: a neat copy of a piece of writing
real or true
if someone or something is fair game, it is acceptable, reasonable, or right to criticize them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The young star’s behavior made her fair game for the tabloid press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位年轻明星的行为使她自己成了小报批评的对象。

Sense.DEF:
an open space on which a
fair21
takes place
someone who is likely to succeed because someone in authority likes them
Sense.EXAMPLE: the boss’s fair-haired boy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板的宠儿

Sense.DEF: more than a little, but much less than very
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house had a fairly large garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She speaks English fairly well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她英语讲得还不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The instructions seem fairly straightforward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 操作指南似乎很简明。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is fair, honest, and reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the degree, force etc of an action
Sense.TRAN: 简直﹐竟然〔用于强调某个行为动作的程度﹑力度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fairly raced past us on his bike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他骑车从我们身旁一晃而过。

Sense.DEF: able to understand and judge situations fairly and always considering other people’s opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a fair-minded man – I’m sure he’ll listen to what you have to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个公正的人——我相信他会倾听你要说的话。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: the basic fairness of the judicial system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司法制度的基本公正性

Sense.DEF: used after you have just criticized someone, in order to add something that explains their behaviour or performance
Sense.TRAN: （为某人）说句公道话﹐公正地说〔用于在批评某人后说一些有利于他的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tardelli had a poor match, although in fairness he was playing with a knee injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔尔德利在场上表现很差﹐但说句公道话﹐他是带着膝伤参加比赛的。

Sense.DEF: playing according to the rules of a game without cheating
Sense.EXAMPLE: rules designed to ensure fair play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在确保比赛公平的规则

Sense.DEF: fair treatment of people without cheating or being dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British tradition of fair play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国人待人处世公平的传统
Sense.EXAMPLE: This kind of behavior violates many people’s sense of fair play .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种行为有违许多人的公平意识。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think what someone did was right
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has to earn money somehow, so fair play to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他必须想办法赚钱﹐这没有错。

Sense.DEF: women

the activity of making, buying, and selling goods in a way that is morally right, for example by making sure that international
labour
laws are obeyed, that the environment has not been damaged by making the goods, and that the people who grow or make a product have been paid a fair price for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: fair trade bananas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平的香蕉贸易

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
golf course
that you hit the ball along towards the hole
someone who only wants to be your friend when you are successful
Sense.TRAN: 同甘不共苦的朋友﹐只能同享福不能共患难的朋友

Sense.DEF: a small imaginary creature with magic powers, which looks like a very small person

an offensive word for a
homosexual
man
Sense.TRAN: 相公﹐兔子 〔对男同性恋者的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF: a very small cake
Sense.TRAN: 精灵蛋糕﹐仙女蛋糕﹐纸杯蛋糕〔一种很小的蛋糕〕

Sense.DEF: a woman with magic powers who saves someone from trouble, in a story
someone who helps people when they are in trouble
an imaginary place where fairies live
a place that looks very beautiful and special
Sense.TRAN: 仙境﹐幻境﹐美丽神奇的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: At night, the harbor is a fairyland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚﹐港口美如仙境。

Sense.DEF: small coloured lights used especially to decorate a Christmas tree
a children’s story in which magical things happen
a story that someone has invented and is difficult to believe
Sense.TRAN: 谎言﹔骗人话﹔不可信的事

Sense.DEF: extremely happy, lucky etc in a way that usually only happens in children’s stories
Sense.TRAN: 童话里才有的﹔童话般的﹔极其美满幸福的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fairytale romance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 童话般的爱情故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kiss was a fairytale ending to the evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个吻给那个夜晚画上了美满幸福的句号。

Sense.DEF: something that has already happened or been done and cannot be changed
a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I still have faith in him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他仍有信心。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Have faith, Alexandra,’ he said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “要有信心﹐亚历山德拉。”他说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The public has lost faith in the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众已对政府失去信心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s really helped restore my faith in human nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事确实恢复了我对人性的信念。

Subsense.DEF: belief and trust in God
Subsense.TRAN: 对上帝的信仰﹔宗教信仰
Subsense.EXAMPLE: deep religious faith
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚定的宗教信仰

GramExa.EXAMPLE: my faith in God
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对上帝的信仰

Subsense.DEF: one of the main religions in the world
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People from all faiths are welcome.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎各界宗教人士。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: members of the Jewish faith
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犹太教信徒

Sense.DEF: to stop supporting or believing in a person, organization, or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could he tell them the truth without breaking faith with the Party?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他如何才能向他们说明实情﹐同时又不会背弃该党呢？

Sense.DEF: to continue to support or believe in a person, organization, or idea
Sense.TRAN: 恪守对某人/某物的信任[支持]

Sense.DEF: honest and sincere intentions
Sense.EXAMPLE: He proposed a second meeting as a sign of his good faith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他建议再举行一次会议﹐以表示他的诚意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman who sold me the car claimed she had acted in good faith had not meant to deceive me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个卖车给我的女人声称她是诚心诚意的。

Sense.DEF: intentions that are not honest or sincere
something you do that shows you trust someone completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allowing Ken to be in charge of the project was a total act of faith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让肯来负责该计划完全是出于对他的信任。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who share a particular set of religious beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: In any faith community there are varying levels of commitment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何一个宗教团体内﹐虔诚程度也各有差别。

Sense.DEF: remaining loyal to a particular person, belief, political party etc and continuing to support them
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人﹑信念﹑政党等〕忠诚的﹐忠实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faithful friend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠诚的朋友
Sense.EXAMPLE: years of faithful service to the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为公司多年忠诚的服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: our faithful family dog, Bogey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家的忠犬博吉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faithful member of the church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会的忠实信徒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He remained faithful to his principles to the last.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他至死忠于自己的原则。

Sense.DEF: representing an event or an image in a way that is exactly true or that looks exactly the same
Sense.TRAN: 如实的﹐准确可靠的﹔忠于原事[物]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faithful account of what had happened
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对所发生之事的如实报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faithful reproduction of the original picture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠于原画的复制品

Sense.DEF: if you are faithful to your wife, boyfriend etc, you do not have a sexual relationship with anyone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you think Bob’s always been faithful to you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得鲍勃一直对你忠诚吗？

Sense.DEF: able to be trusted or depended on
Sense.EXAMPLE: my faithful old Toyota
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那可靠的旧丰田车

Subsense.DEF: the people who are very loyal to a leader, political party etc and continue to support them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hess still has the support of the party faithful .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫斯仍有忠实党员的支持。

Subsense.DEF: the people who believe in a religion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: church bells calling the faithful to evening prayer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 召唤信徒晚祷的教堂钟声

Sense.DEF: a loyal follower, supporter, or member
Sense.TRAN: 忠实的追随者[支持者﹐成员]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A handful of old faithfuls came to the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些多年的忠实追随者来参加会议了。

Sense.DEF: in a loyal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had served the family faithfully for 40 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已忠心耿耿地为这家人服务了40年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann faithfully promised never to tell my secret.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安信誓旦旦地保证决不把我的秘密说出去。

Sense.DEF: in a regular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wrote faithfully in her journal every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天必记日记。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every year, we faithfully make a trip up there to see him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每年都一定会去那里看望他。

Sense.DEF: the usual polite way of ending a formal letter, which you have begun with Dear Sir or Dear Madam
Sense.TRAN: 忠实于您的〔正式信件结尾所用的客套话﹐信的开端用Dear Sir或Dear Madam〕

Sense.DEF: a method of treating illnesses by praying
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过祈祷来治病的〕信仰疗法

Sense.DEF: someone who is faithless cannot be trusted
Sense.TRAN: 不忠实的﹐不能信赖的﹐背信弃义的﹐不守信义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faithless friend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能信赖[不忠诚]的朋友

Sense.DEF: a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting was judged a fake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画被鉴定为赝品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones can spot a fake from 20 feet away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯在20英尺开外就能认出假货。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not what they claim to be or does not have the skills they say they have
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her psychologist turned out to be a fake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的心理医生原来是个骗子。

Sense.DEF: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: fake fur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造毛皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fake ID card
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假身份证
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fake 20 dollar bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张20美元的伪钞

Sense.DEF: not real and seeming to be something it is not, in order to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave a fake name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我报了个假名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was speaking with a fake German accent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她假装德国口音说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fake smile of friendliness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装出来的友善微笑

Sense.DEF: to make something seem real in order to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She faked her father’s signature on the cheque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在支票上伪造了其父的签名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The insurance company suspected that he had faked his own death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险公司怀疑他制造了自己死亡的假象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results of the experiments were faked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些实验的结果都是伪造出来的。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be ill, interested etc when you are not
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought he was really hurt but he was faking it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为他真受伤了﹐可他只是装出来的。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to move in one direction, but then move in another, especially when playing sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育比赛中〕做（…的）假动作
Sense.EXAMPLE: He faked a pass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了个传球的假动作。

Sense.DEF: to deceive someone by making them think you are planning to do something when you are really planning to do something else

the practice of riding a
skateboard
backwards
a travelling Hindu or Muslim holy man
Sense.TRAN: 〔印度教的〕苦行者﹔〔伊斯兰教的〕托钵僧

Sense.DEF:
fried balls of an Arabic food made with
chickpeas
Sense.TRAN: 炸豆丸子﹐炸豆泥〔阿拉伯食品〕

Sense.DEF: a bird that kills and eats other animals and can be trained to hunt
someone who trains falcons to hunt
the skill or sport of using falcons to hunt
Sense.TRAN: 放鹰狩猎技巧﹔放鹰狩猎运动

Sense.DEF: to move or drop down from a higher position to a lower position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tree was about to fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那棵树快要倒下了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book fell from his hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书从他手上跌落。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enough rain had fallen to flood the grounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨量很大﹐淹没了地面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rob fell down the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布从楼梯上跌了下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She flushed and her eyes fell she looked down .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸一红﹐垂下了眼帘。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly go down onto the ground after you have been standing, walking, or running, especially without intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell and hit my head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跌了一跤﹐撞到了头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He slipped and fell on the ice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在冰面上滑倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lizzie fell down and hurt her knee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉齐跌伤了膝盖。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter was playing by the river when he fell in fell into the water .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得在河边玩着玩着﹐掉进了水里。

GramExa.GLOSS: move down to the ground so that your body is resting on your knees
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fell to her knees beside his body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跪倒在他的尸体旁边。

Sense.DEF: to go down to a lower level, amount, price etc, especially a much lower one
Sense.TRAN: 〔水平﹑数量﹑价格等﹐尤指较大幅度地〕下跌﹐下降﹐降低
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rate of inflation was falling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率正在下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island is warm all year round and winter temperatures never fall below 10 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛全年温暖﹐冬季气温从不低于10度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He believes that educational standards are falling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为教育水准在下降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Advertising revenue fell from $98.5 million to $93.3 million.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告收益从9,850万美元跌至9,330万美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of subscribers had fallen to 1,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 订阅人数已降至1,000人。

GramExa.GLOSS: by a large amount
GramExa.EXAMPLE: London share prices fell sharply yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天伦敦股价大跌。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say an amount or level goes down rather than falls .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常用go down表示数量或水平下降﹐而不用fall
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: House prices have gone down again.

Sense.DEF: to start to be in a new or different state
Sense.TRAN: 进入〔新的或不同的状态〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll stay with her until she falls asleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会一直陪着她﹐直到她睡着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think that I’ve fallen in love with Angela.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我爱上安杰拉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell ill with flu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患感冒﹐病倒了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Albert fell silent and turned his attention to his food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伯特沉默下来﹐将注意力转移到食物上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was empty for many years and fell into disrepair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子空置多年﹐变得破旧不堪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One false step can mean falling into debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 走错一步就可能意味着负债。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fell into despair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他陷入绝望。

Sense.DEF: to belong to or be part of a particular group, area of responsibility, range of things, or type of things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many illnesses fall into the category of stress-related illnesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多疾病都与压力有关。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leaders fall into two categories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导分两类。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge said that this matter did not fall within the scope of the auditor’s duties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官称这件事不属于审计员的职责范畴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job falls under the heading of ‘sales and marketing’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个职位属于“市场营销”一类。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meat production falls under the control of the Agriculture Department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉类生产由农业部管辖。

Sense.DEF: to be less than the amount or standard that is needed or that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: This year’s profit will fall short of 13%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的利润将不足13%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would sack any of his staff who fell short of his high standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会将没有达到他高标准的员工都开除掉。

Sense.DEF: to get a very serious illness or be attacked or deceived by someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Breastfed babies are less likely to fall victim to stomach disorders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母乳喂养的宝宝不太会出现胃部不适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who fall victim to violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力受害者

Sense.DEF: if night etc falls, it starts to become dark at the beginning of the night
Sense.EXAMPLE: It grew colder as night fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜幕降临﹐气温越来越低。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darkness had fallen by the time we reached home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家的时候天已经黑了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a person, group, or place becomes quiet, sad etc
Sense.TRAN: 安静下来/寂静下来/悲伤起来等
Sense.EXAMPLE: A long silence fell between us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我俩沉默了很长时间。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something or being involved with something, often without intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell into conversation with some guys from New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始与几个纽约来的家伙聊了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had fallen into the habit of having a coffee every time he passed the coffee machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他养成了习惯﹐每次经过咖啡机都要喝一杯。

Subsense.DEF: if parts of a situation that you have been trying to understand fall into place, you start to understand how they are connected with each other
Subsense.TRAN: 变得一清二楚﹔变得条理清楚﹔变得明朗
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, all the details started falling into place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然间﹐所有的细节都明朗起来。

Subsense.DEF: if the parts of something that you want to happen fall into place, they start to happen in the way that you want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was lucky because everything fell into place at exactly the right time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真幸运﹐一切都来得正当时。

Subsense.DEF: to break into many pieces
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The book had been well used and finally fell to pieces.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书被频繁使用﹐最后散了架。

Subsense.DEF: if something such as a plan or a relationship falls to pieces, it stops working properly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The family is falling to pieces.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家庭散了。

Sense.DEF: if something is falling to pieces, it is in very bad condition, especially because it is very old
Sense.TRAN: 快散架了〔尤因其相当旧〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house is falling to pieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子都快散架了。

Sense.DEF: if a joke, remark, or performance falls flat, it fails to interest or amuse people
Sense.TRAN: 〔笑话﹑说话或表演〕达不到预期效果﹐无法逗人笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marlow’s attempts at jokes fell flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马洛讲的笑话没有把大家逗乐。

Sense.DEF: to do something which makes someone angry or which breaks a rule, with the result that you are punished
Sense.TRAN: 激怒某人/违反某事物〔从而受到惩处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is worried that his teenage kids will fall foul of the law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他担心他那几个十几岁的孩子会犯法。

Sense.DEF: to fail, or to stop being done, used, or made
Sense.TRAN: 半途而废﹔不再进行﹔停止使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Health reform was one of his goals that fell by the wayside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗改革是他的目标之一﹐却在半途夭折了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luxury items fall by the wayside during a recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济衰退时期﹐奢侈品乏人问津。

Sense.DEF: to stop being liked by people in authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fell from grace for the first time when he was convicted of drink-driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判犯有酒后驾驶罪后﹐第一次失去了人们的信任。

Sense.DEF: to be forced to leave an important job or position, or lose the respect that people had for you
Sense.TRAN: 从高位跌落〔指被迫离开要职或失去了人们的尊重〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: fall into the hands/clutches of sb
Sense.DEF: if something or someone falls into the hands of an enemy or dangerous person, the enemy etc gets control or possession of them
Sense.TRAN: 落入某人的手中/控制中
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants to prevent the business falling into the hands of a competitor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想阻止公司落入对手的手中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must not let these documents fall into the wrong hands .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定不能让这些文件落到坏人手中。

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake that many people make
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t fall into the trap of feeling guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要陷入自责的误区。

Subsense.DEF: to start to walk next to someone else, at the same speed as them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Holly slowed her pace and fell into step with the old man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍莉放慢步子﹐与老人并肩齐行。

Subsense.DEF: to start doing something in the same way as the other members of a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other countries on the Council are expected to fall into step with the US.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计理事会的其他成员国将会与美国步调一致。

Sense.DEF: to obey someone or do what other people want you to do, especially when you do not want to do it at first
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most countries have signed the treaty but some are reluctant to fall into line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数国家已签署了该条约﹐但也有些国家不愿顺从。

Sense.DEF: to hang down loosely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His dark hair fell over his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那深色的头发垂落下来﹐遮住了脸庞。

Sense.DEF: to shine on a surface or go onto a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last rays of sunlight were falling on the fields.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夕阳的余晖照在田野上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arthur’s shadow fell across the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿瑟的影子投映在门口。

Sense.DEF: to happen on a particular day or at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to dedicate this record to all whose anniversaries fall at this time of year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要将这张唱片献给所有在此时庆贺纪念日的人们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her birthday will fall on a Friday this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年她的生日是在星期五。

Sense.DEF: if a leader or a government falls, they lose their position of power
Sense.EXAMPLE: The previous government fell after only six months in office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前政府执政仅六个月便下台了。

Sense.DEF: if a place falls in a war or an election, a group of soldiers or a political party takes control of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city fell to the advancing Russian armies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座城市被挺进的俄军攻陷。

Sense.DEF: to be killed in a war
to hit a particular place or a particular part of someone’s body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first punch fell on his nose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一拳打在他的鼻子上。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s voice or a sound falls, it becomes quieter or lower

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s as easy as falling off a log
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very easy to do
to be neither one type of thing nor another, or be unable to choose between two ways of doing something
if a request, suggestion, joke etc falls on stony ground, it is ignored or people do not like it
Sense.TRAN: 〔要求﹑建议﹑笑话等〕不被人理睬﹐未产生预期效果

Sense.DEF: if words fall from someone’s lips, they say them
if an opportunity falls into someone’s lap, they get it without having made any effort to get it
used to say that a particular part of a word, phrase, or piece of music is emphasized or is played more loudly than the rest
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the word ‘report’, the stress falls on the second syllable. report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个词﹐重音落在第二个音节上。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly go down onto the floor when standing, walking, or running
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She fell on the stairs and broke her ankle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在楼梯上摔了一跤﹐脚踝骨折。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children are always falling over.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子老是摔跟头。

Exponent.DEF: to fall or almost fall when you hit your foot against something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone might trip over those toys.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能会有人被那些玩具绊倒的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tripped on a piece of wood.
