Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被一根木头绊了一跤。

Exponent.DEF: to fall or almost fall when you are walking on a wet or very smooth surface
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She slipped and hurt her ankle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她滑了一下﹐伤了脚踝。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was scared I would slip on the highly polished floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板擦得好亮﹐我怕会滑倒。

Exponent.DEF: to almost fall when you put your foot down in an awkward way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He stumbled and almost fell.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个踉跄,差点跌倒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of our porters stumbled on the rough ground.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面高低不平﹐我们的一个搬运工绊了一跤。

Exponent.DEF: to fall suddenly and heavily to the ground, especially when you become unconscious
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the runners collapsed halfway through the race.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一名赛跑选手半途昏倒了。

Exponent.DEF: to become unsteady so that you start to fall over
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She lost her balance on the first step and fell down the stairs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚上楼梯的第一个梯阶就失去平衡﹐摔了下来。

Exponent.DEF: to fall forwards so you are lying on your front on the ground
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She fell flat on her face getting out of the car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下车时摔了个嘴啃泥。

Sense.DEF: to laugh a lot about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was so funny everyone just fell about laughing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太滑稽了﹐所有人都捧腹大笑。

Sense.DEF: if an organization, system, relationship etc falls apart, it stops being effective or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be reckless or your plans may fall apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别鲁莽﹐否则你的计划可能会失败。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The health service is falling apart at the seams .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健制度行将崩溃。

Sense.DEF: to be in very bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tommy’s old bicycle was rusty and falling apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤米的旧自行车锈迹斑斑﹐都快散架了。

Sense.DEF: to break into pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book fell apart in my hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本书在我手里散了架。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to deal with your personal or emotional problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to get some rest or she was going to fall apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须休息﹐否则要崩溃了。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s world or life falls apart, something very bad and serious happens which changes their life
Sense.EXAMPLE: When his wife left him, his world fell apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子离他而去﹐他的世界就此垮了。

Sense.DEF: to slope down
Sense.EXAMPLE: From where we stood, the ground fell away sharply to the valley floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面从我们所站之处陡然向谷底倾斜。

Sense.DEF: to become separated from something after being fixed to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint was falling away in patches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几块地方油漆在剥落。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling falls away, you stop having it, usually suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The view from the top was wonderful and our tiredness fell away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶上景色秀美﹐我们疲惫顿消。

Sense.DEF: to decrease
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demand for our more theoretical courses has fallen away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我们增开理论课的需求已经减少了。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers fall back, they move back because they are being attacked
Sense.EXAMPLE: He yelled for his men to fall back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大喊着叫手下人后撤。

Sense.DEF: to move backwards because you are very surprised, frightened etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scott fell back a pace in astonishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特吃惊地后退了一步。

Sense.DEF: to decrease
Sense.EXAMPLE: When inflation started to rise, house prices fell back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀开始上升时﹐房价就回落了。

Sense.DEF: to go back to doing something or behaving in a way which you did before
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was amazed at how easily I fell back into the old routine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很奇怪自己这么容易就回到了以前的生活习惯。

Sense.DEF: to use something or depend on someone’s help when dealing with a difficult situation, especially after other methods have failed

GramExa.PROPFORM: have sb/sth to fall back on
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has no relatives to fall back on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有亲戚可以依靠。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Where negotiation fails, they must fall back on the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判解决不了的﹐他们就必须依靠法律来解决。

Sense.DEF: to go more slowly than other people so that they gradually move further ahead of you
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother was chatting and didn’t notice that he had fallen behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妈妈在聊天﹐没注意到他已经落到后面了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hurt her ankle and had fallen behind the others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤了脚踝﹐落在了别人的后面。

Sense.DEF: to become less successful than other people, companies, countries etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: After her time in hospital, Jenny’s parents are afraid she has fallen behind educationally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮住了一段时间医院﹐父母担心她学习跟不上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies that are not market-driven risk falling behind the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不以市场为导向的公司有可能在竞争中落败。

Sense.DEF: to fail to finish a piece of work or pay someone money that you owe them at the right time
Sense.TRAN: 不能按时完成（工作）﹔拖欠（还款）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After losing his job, he fell behind with his mortgage payments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业后﹐他拖欠了抵押贷款的偿还。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The project has fallen behind schedule .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工程已经误期了。

Sense.DEF: if a building is falling down, it is in very bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bridge is falling down and will need a million dollars to repair it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座桥破旧不堪﹐需要一百万美元来维修。

Sense.DEF: to fail because of a particular reason or in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s where the whole argument falls down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就是整个论点站不住脚的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is falling down on the supervisory aspects of his job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在监管方面的工作做得不太好。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local authority is falling down on the job of keeping the streets clean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方当局在保持街道清洁方面做得不够。

Sense.DEF: to be tricked into believing something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is too smart to fall for that trick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很精明﹐不会上那种当的。

Sense.DEF: to start to love someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was the summer I worked at the fairground, and met and fell for Lucy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就是那个夏天﹐我在露天游乐场工作﹐遇到露西并爱上了她。

Sense.DEF: to like a place as soon as you see it
if the roof, ceiling etc falls in, it falls onto the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔屋顶﹑天花板等〕坍倒﹐塌下﹐垮掉

Sense.DEF: to start walking or forming a line of people behind someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His men fell in behind him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手下在他身后集队。

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere quickly by relaxing your body and letting it fall on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned and fell into his arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转身扑进他的怀里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We fell into bed, exhausted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们倒在床上﹐精疲力竭。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell into the job really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我其实是碰巧做起这个工作的。

Sense.DEF: to accept someone’s ideas, decisions etc and not disagree with them
Sense.TRAN: 赞同﹐接受〔某人的想法﹑决定等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once she explained her problem, he was happy to fall in with her plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一说明自己的问题﹐他就欣然同意了她的计划。

Sense.DEF: to become friendly with a person or group of people after meeting them by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell in with the wrong crowd in her teens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她十几岁的时候结交了坏朋友。

Sense.DEF: if part of something falls off, it becomes separated from the main part
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door handle keeps falling off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门把手老是掉下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A button had fallen off her jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的外套上掉了一颗纽扣。

Sense.DEF: if the amount, rate, or quality of something falls off, it decreases
Sense.EXAMPLE: Audience figures fell off during the second series of the programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目的第二期播出时﹐收看人数有所减少。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb nearly/almost fell off their chair
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone was very surprised when something happened
Sense.TRAN: 某人差点从椅子上掉下来〔用于表示某人十分惊奇〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I saw my brother on the stage I nearly fell off my chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到弟弟在台上﹐我差点没从椅子上掉下来。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: fall off the back of a lorry

Sense.DEF: if a duty or job falls on someone, they are responsible for doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The responsibility usually falls on the mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 担子一般都落在母亲身上。

Sense.DEF: to eagerly start eating or using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell on the food as if she hadn’t eaten for days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她狼吞虎咽﹐好像几天没吃饭似的。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly attack or get hold of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the older boys fell on him and broke his glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些大一点的男孩突然扑向他﹐打碎了他的眼镜。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes etc fall on something, you notice it
Sense.TRAN: 某人的目光落在某物上
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes fell on her bag. ‘Are you going somewhere?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的目光落在她的包上。“你是不是要去什么地方？”

Sense.DEF: to experience difficulties and problems in your life such as not having enough money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aim is to raise money for workers who have fallen on hard times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目的是为境遇艰难的工人筹款。

Sense.DEF: to leave your job because your organ-ization has done something wrong, and you are taking responsibility for it
Sense.TRAN: 〔为所在机构的错误〕背黑锅辞职
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was clear that the Prime Minister wanted her to fall on her sword.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然﹐总理想让她辞职来承担责任。

Sense.DEF: to have a quarrel

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carrie’s always falling out with people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽老是跟人争吵。

Sense.DEF: if a tooth or your hair falls out, it is then no longer attached to your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drugs made her hair fall out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药令她掉发。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers fall out, they stop standing in a line and move away to different places
to fall onto the ground or to fall from an upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tommy fell over and cut his knee badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤米摔了一跤﹐膝盖摔破一大块。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her bike fell over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的自行车倒了。

Sense.DEF: to hit your foot against something by mistake and fall to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell over the dog and broke her front teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被那只狗绊了一跤﹐磕碎了门牙。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fall over yourself to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be very eager to do something, especially something you do not usually do
Sense.TRAN: 忙不迭地做某事﹐急着做某事〔尤指一般不做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were falling over themselves to help her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在尽力帮她。

Sense.DEF: if an agreement, plan, sale etc falls through, it is not completed successfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The studio planned to make a movie of the book but the deal fell through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影公司计划把那本书拍成电影﹐但是没有谈成。

Sense.DEF: if a duty or job falls to someone, they are responsible for doing it, especially when this is difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指困难或令人不悦的事〕落在〔某人身上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It fell to me to give her the bad news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这个坏消息告诉她的任务落在了我身上。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They fell to work with a will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们满腔热情地开始干了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fell to thinking about how nice a warm bath would be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始思忖起洗个热水澡该有多么舒服啊。

Sense.DEF: movement down towards the ground or towards a lower position
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first fall of autumn leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋叶始落
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rise and fall of the dancers’ bodies creates a pattern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞者身体的起伏构成了一幅图案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Evans had a fall fell to the ground and broke her leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯太太摔了一跤﹐跌断了一条腿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stretched out his hands to break his fall prevent himself from falling too quickly and hurting himself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸出双手撑了一下﹐不让自己摔得太重。

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the amount, level, price etc of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量﹑水平﹑价格等的〕下降﹐降低﹐减少

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a fall in oil prices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价下跌了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sharp fall in the birth rate in European countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲国家出生率的急剧下降

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their industrial output went down again in December, which meant a fall of 2.2% over the year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 12月﹐他们的工业产量再次下降﹐那就意味着全年减少了2.2%。

Sense.DEF: the season between summer and winter, when leaves change colour and the weather becomes slightly colder
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eleanor plans to go to Southwestern Community College this fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉诺打算今年秋天去上西南社区学院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is beautiful in the fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方秋天的景色很美。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone or something loses their position of power or becomes unsuccessful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president lived on for twenty years after his fall from power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位总统下台后活了二十年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the story of Napoleon’s rise and fall period of success followed by failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑的兴衰史
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rumours are that the company is heading for a fall is likely to fail soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传闻这家公司要倒闭了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone stops being respected by other people or loses their position of authority, especially because they have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因做错事后〕不再受人尊敬﹐失去权威
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the head of the intelligence service until his fall from grace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失去人们的信任之前﹐他是情报部门的负责人。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a country, city etc is defeated by an enemy
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑城市等的〕陷落﹐沦陷﹔战败﹐败亡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fall of Jerusalem in AD70
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公元70年耶路撒冷的沦陷

Sense.DEF: a place where a river suddenly goes straight down over a cliff
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spray from the falls is so dense that you can hardly see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瀑布溅起的水雾密得让人看不清东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Niagara Falls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼亚加拉大瀑布

Sense.DEF:
an act of forcing your opponent onto the ground in
wrestling
or
judo
an amount of snow, rocks etc that falls onto the ground

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fresh falls of snow were forecast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预报还有几次降雪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The road is blocked by a rock fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路被落下的岩石堵住了。

Sense.DEF: the occasion in the Bible when God punished Adam and Eve by making them leave the Garden of Eden
Sense.TRAN: 人类堕落〔指《圣经》中上帝惩罚亚当与夏娃﹐把他们赶出伊甸园〕

Sense.DEF: containing or based on false ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such an argument is misleading, if not wholly fallacious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种论点即使不完全是谬误﹐也是误导人的。

Sense.DEF: a false idea or belief, especially one that a lot of people believe is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a common fallacy that a neutered dog will become fat and lazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说阉割过的狗会变得又胖又懒﹐这是普遍的谬见。

Sense.DEF: a weakness in someone’s argument or ideas which is caused by a mistake in their thinking
something that can be used or done if a supply, method etc fails
Sense.TRAN: 储备物﹐备用物﹔退路﹔可依靠之物
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s wise to have an extra video player as a fallback.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好有一台录像播放机备用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have a fallback option?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有备选方案吗？

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
fall
on the ground after falling down
Sense.TRAN: 倒下的﹐落下的﹐倒在地上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road was blocked by a fallen tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马路被倒下的一棵树堵住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fallen leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落叶

Sense.DEF: a woman who has had a sexual relationship with someone she is not married to
Sense.TRAN: 失身的女子﹐堕落的妇女

Sense.DEF: soldiers who have been killed in a war
someone who is punished for someone else’s crime or mistake
Sense.TRAN: 替罪羊﹐替死鬼﹐代罪羔羊﹐代人受过者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Browne claims that the company was simply looking for a fall guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗称公司只是在找替死鬼。

Sense.DEF: someone who is easily tricked or made to seem stupid
Sense.TRAN: 易受骗上当的人﹐易被愚弄的人

Sense.DEF: able to make mistakes or be wrong
Sense.TRAN: 会犯错误的﹔会做错事的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Humans are fallible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人孰无过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These surveys are often a rather fallible guide to public opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些调查往往会对舆论产生误导。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad quarrel with someone

a
shooting star
a decrease in the level, amount, or number of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔水平﹑数量或数字的〕减少﹐降低

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fall-off in profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润的减少

Sense.DEF:
one of the two tubes in a female through which eggs move to the
uterus

the dangerous
radioactive
dust which is left in the air after a
nuclear
explosion and which slowly falls to earth
Sense.TRAN: 〔核爆炸后的〕放射性坠尘﹐辐射性尘埃
Sense.EXAMPLE: protection against radioactive fallout
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放射性坠尘的防护

Sense.DEF: the results of a particular event, especially when they are unexpected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The political fallout of the affair cost him his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件的政治影响使他丢了工作。

Sense.DEF:
a building under the ground in which people can shelter from a
nuclear
attack

fallow land is dug or
ploughed
but is not used for growing crops
Sense.EXAMPLE: They let the land lie fallow for a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让土地休耕一年。

Sense.DEF: a time when nothing is done or achieved
Sense.TRAN: 空闲期﹔没有任何成绩的一段时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band went through a fallow period in the late 90s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 90年代后期﹐该乐队销声匿迹了一段时间。

Sense.DEF:
a small European
deer
which is yellowish brown with white spots
Sense.TRAN: 黇鹿〔产于欧洲的一种小鹿﹐毛皮浅黄棕色﹐带有白色斑点〕

Sense.DEF: a statement, story etc that is false is completely untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please decide whether the following statements are true or false .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请判断以下说法的对错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: false accusations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不实的指责

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say not true rather than false , apart from in the fixed expression true or false .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说not true﹐不说false﹐固定表达方式true or false除外
F2NBox.GOODEXA: What he said was not true .

Sense.DEF: based on incorrect information or ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to give you any false hopes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让你有任何虚假的希望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The statement gives us a false impression that we understand something when we do not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这句话使我们产生错觉﹐以为自己懂了﹐但其实并没懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: false assumptions about people of other cultures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对来自其他文化的人的错误假设

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: a feeling of being safe when you are not really safe

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚假的安全感

Subsense.DEF: not real, but intended to seem real and deceive people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The drugs were hidden in a suitcase with a false bottom.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品藏在一个有暗底的手提箱里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The man had given a false name and address.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男子报了个假名和假地址。

Subsense.DEF: artificial

Sense.DEF: not sincere or honest, and pretending to have feelings that you do not really have
Sense.TRAN: 不真诚的﹔不诚实的﹔假装的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s so false.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很假。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a false laugh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You played brilliantly.’ ‘Not really,’ Ian replied with false modesty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你弹得真好。”“哪里。”伊恩故作谦虚地答道。

Sense.DEF: something that you think will save you money but which will really cost you more
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a false economy not to have travel insurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不买旅游保险看起来省钱了﹐其实并不划算。

Sense.DEF: if you get something under false pretences, you get it by deceiving people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of obtaining money under false pretences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控诈取钱财。

Sense.DEF: a small movement or action that will result in harm
Sense.EXAMPLE: One false move and you’re dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走错一步你就完了。

Sense.DEF:
the illegal act of putting someone in prison or
arresting
them for a crime they have not committed

Exponent.DEF: not real, but intended to seem real and deceive people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He uses a false name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用假名。

Exponent.DEF: made to look or seem like something else, especially something worth a lot more money
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指很值钱的东西〕伪造的﹐假冒的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: fake fur
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造毛皮
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fake Rolex watch
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假冒的劳力士手表
Exponent.EXAMPLE: fake designer goods
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假名牌商品

Exponent.DEF: a forged official document or bank note has been illegally made to look like a real one
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a forged passport
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伪造的护照
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a forged £50 note
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 50英镑假钞

Exponent.DEF: counterfeit money or goods have been illegally made to look exactly like something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How do you detect counterfeit currency?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如何识别假币？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: counterfeit drugs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假药

Exponent.DEF: made to look real – used especially about guns, bombs etc or about materials
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指枪﹑炸弹等或材料〕仿制的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two men used an imitation firearm to carry out the robbery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子手持仿真枪实施抢劫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: imitation leather/silk/silver
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿皮革/仿真丝/仿银

Exponent.DEF: false – used when you think someone is deliberately trying to deceive people
Exponent.TRAN: 虚假的〔用于认为某人故意欺骗时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She put on a phoney New York accent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她装出一口纽约腔。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctors were accused of supplying phoney medical certificates.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些医生被控提供虚假的医疗证明。

Exponent.DEF: false and giving a wrong impression about someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: spurious claims
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 貌似真实的断言
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That’s a spurious argument.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个站不住脚的论点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company was trying to get some spurious respectability by using our name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司正试图利用我们的声誉骗取些许假名声。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people wrongly think that something bad is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fire fighters responded to a false alarm at one of the college dormitories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员因学院一间宿舍谎报的火警而出动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient was okay – it was a false alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人没问题——是虚惊一场。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something good seems likely to happen, but it does not
Sense.TRAN: 假曙光﹐虚幻的希望﹔令人空欢喜的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ceasefire turned out to be another false dawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次停战最后又是一场空欢喜。

Sense.DEF: a word in a foreign language that is similar to one in your own, so that you wrongly think they both mean the same thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔外语中与母语相似的〕同形异义词

Sense.DEF: someone who seems to be your friend but is not
a statement that is untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saunders is deliberately telling a falsehood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德斯在故意说假话。

Sense.DEF: the practice of telling lies
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one had accused me of falsehood before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前从没有人指责过我说谎。

Sense.DEF: the state of not being true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people believe in right and wrong, truth and falsehood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人相信有是非曲直。

Sense.DEF:
something that is wrongly thought or shown to be a particular thing, especially after a scientific test or
research
Sense.TRAN: 假阳性﹔错误判断〔尤指科学试验或研究结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 50% of the 170 compounds were judged to be carcinogenic, but some of these might be false positives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这170种化合物中有50%被断定致癌﹐但有些可能是判断错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many substances give false positive reactions in allergy skin testing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多物质在皮肤过敏试验中出现假阳性反应。

Sense.DEF: an unsuccessful attempt to begin a process or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: After several false starts, the concert finally began.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会几次耽误以后﹐终于开始了。

Sense.DEF: a situation at the beginning of a race when one competitor starts too soon and the race has to start again
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛跑开始时的〕抢跑﹐起跑犯规

Sense.DEF: a set of artificial teeth worn by someone who has lost their natural teeth
a very high male voice

pieces of material inside a
bra
used to make a woman’s breasts look larger
Sense.TRAN: 〔使乳房显得丰满的〕胸罩衬垫﹐衬胸﹐假乳房

Sense.DEF: to change figures, records etc so that they contain false information
Sense.EXAMPLE: The file was altered to falsify the evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件被动了手脚﹐以此伪造证据。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being false or not true
a Falstaffian person is fat, friendly, enjoys having fun, and drinks too much. This word comes from Falstaff, a character in some of Shakespeare’s plays.
Sense.TRAN: 福斯塔夫似的〔形容肥胖﹑和善﹑喜欢玩乐且酗酒的人﹔源自莎士比亚戏剧人物福斯塔夫〕

Sense.DEF: to become weaker and unable to continue in an effective way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy is showing signs of faltering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济出现衰退迹象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother’s grip upon the household never faltered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲对全家人的管束从没放松过。

Sense.DEF: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping
Sense.TRAN: 结巴地说﹐支支吾吾地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laurie’s voice faltered as she tried to thank him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳丽想谢谢他﹐却说得结结巴巴的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I can’t,’ she faltered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我做不到。”她支支吾吾地说道。

Sense.DEF: to become less certain and determined that you want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must not falter in our resolve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决不能动摇决心。

Sense.DEF: to stop walking or to walk in an unsteady way because you suddenly feel weak or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 〔因突然感觉虚弱或害怕而〕蹒跚﹐踉跄﹐摇晃
Sense.EXAMPLE: She faltered for a moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一时踉跄了几步。

Sense.DEF: nervous and uncertain or unsteady
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby’s first faltering steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝学步时的蹒跚脚步

Sense.DEF: becoming less effective or successful
Sense.TRAN: 不太有效的﹔不太成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the faltering Mideast peace talks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无甚成效的中东和平谈判

Sense.DEF: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to show what someone is famous for
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Muhammad Ali, of boxing fame
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆罕默德•阿里﹐著名拳击手

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He won fame when he appeared in the film ‘The Graduate’.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因出演《毕业生》而成名。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Amy Johnson found fame as a pilot.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米•约翰逊作为一个飞行员而出名。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 给某人/某物带来/赢得名声
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Chomsky’s theories about language brought him fame.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔姆斯基因其语言学理论而闻名。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become famous
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She rose to fame during the early Sixties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她成名于六十年代早期。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become famous very suddenly
try to become famous

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Edinburgh achieved international fame as a centre of medical education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡作为医学教育中心蜚声国际。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: being famous for a long time
being famous for a short time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her rise to fame has been astonishingly rapid.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的成名速度快得惊人。

Collocate.COLLOC: at the height of sb’s/sth’s fame
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone was most famous
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 在某人/某物最出名的时候
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At the height of his fame, he could earn $5,000 a day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 名声最盛时﹐他一天能挣5,000美元。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: reason for being famous
Collocate.EXAMPLE: One of his main claims to fame is having invented the electric light bulb.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成名的主要原因之一是发明了电灯泡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: being rich and famous

Sense.DEF: well-known
Sense.EXAMPLE: the famed literary critic Nathan Hall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的文学评论家内森•霍尔

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the island of Lontar, famed for its nutmeg and cloves
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以肉豆蔻和丁香闻名的隆塔尔岛

Sense.DEF: connected with a family or typical of a family
Sense.EXAMPLE: familial obligations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭责任
Sense.EXAMPLE: familial relationships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭关系

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is familiar is well-known to you and easy to recognize
Sense.EXAMPLE: a familiar tune
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟悉的曲调

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The voice on the phone sounded familiar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话里的声音很耳熟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The signs of drug addiction are familiar to most doctors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒瘾的症状大多数医生都熟悉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a relief to be back in familiar surroundings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到熟悉的环境里让人松了一口气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beggars on the street are becoming a familiar sight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上出现乞丐的情况逐渐变得屡见不鲜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This kind of situation was all too familiar very familiar to John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种情形对约翰来说太熟悉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face seems vaguely familiar , but I can’t quite place her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看起来有点面熟﹐但我还是认不出她来。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that they know something rather than saying it is familiar .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说know something﹐不说it is familiar
F2NBox.BADEXA: The name of the restaurant was not familiar to me.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔I didn’t know the name of the restaurant.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道那家餐厅的名字。

Sense.DEF: to have a good knowledge or understanding of something
Sense.TRAN: 通晓某事物﹐熟悉某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you familiar with this type of machine?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你熟悉这种机器吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not familiar with her poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不熟悉她的诗作。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on familiar terms with sb
Sense.DEF: to know someone well and be able to talk to them in an informal way
Sense.TRAN: 与某人交情很好﹐和某人关系友好
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s on familiar terms with all the teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和所有的老师都很熟。

Sense.DEF: talking to someone as if you know them well although you do not

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought he was being a bit familiar with my wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他对我妻子有点过分亲昵。

Sense.DEF: informal and friendly in speech, writing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel is written in an easy familiar style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说的笔调轻松随意。

Sense.DEF:
a cat or other animal that lives with a
witch
and has magical powers

a British spelling of
familiarize
a good knowledge of a particular subject or place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In fact his familiarity with the Bronx was pretty limited.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实上他对布朗克斯区的了解相当有限。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being well-known to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I miss the familiarity of home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀念家的那种亲切感。

Sense.DEF: a relaxed way of speaking to someone or behaving with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He treated her with the easy familiarity of an equal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她亲切随和﹑平等相待。

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning that if you know someone too well, you find out their faults and respect them less
Sense.TRAN: 亲密生嫌隙﹐亲昵生狎侮﹔亲不敬﹐熟生蔑

Sense.DEF: to learn about something so that you understand it, or to teach someone else about something so that they understand it
Sense.TRAN: 使自己/某人熟悉某事物﹐使自己/某人通晓某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees must familiarize themselves with the health and safety manual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员必须熟悉健康和安全手册。

Sense.DEF: in an informal or friendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles, familiarly known as Charlie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯﹐昵称查利

Sense.DEF: a group of people who are related to each other, especially a mother, a father, and their children
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指由父母和孩子组成的〕家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know the family next door?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认识隔壁那家人吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Webb family still has its farm over there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦伯家依然保留着那里的农场。
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family now live in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家人现居伦敦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This house isn’t big enough for a family of seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子住不下七口之家。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 所有和你有亲属关系的人
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: all the people you are related to, including those who are now dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m moving to Detroit because I have some family there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要搬到底特律﹐因为我有家人住在那儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My family come from Scotland originally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖籍是苏格兰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That painting has been in our family been owned by our family for 200 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅油画属于我们家族已有200年了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Asthma runs in the family is common in the family .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家族有哮喘病史。

Sense.DEF: children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Couples with young families wouldn’t want to live here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子女年幼的夫妻不会愿意住在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re getting married next year, and hope to start a family have children straight away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们准备明年结婚﹐并希望马上要孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the problems of bringing up a family on a very low income
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠微薄收入养家糊口的各种问题

Sense.DEF: a container or package containing a large amount of a product
Sense.TRAN: 家庭装〔供全家人用的大包装商品〕

Sense.DEF: a group of related animals, plants, languages etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物﹑植物等的〕科﹔〔语言的〕语族﹐语系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cat family includes lions and tigers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫科动物包括狮和虎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Spanish and Italian are part of the Romance language family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙语和意大利语属于罗曼语系。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize your connection with someone who is related to you
Sense.TRAN: 她/他是我的家人[自己人]

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We invited the whole family round.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把一家人都请了过来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a game which all the family can enjoy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏全家人都能玩。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: closest relations
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What if one of your immediate family were disabled?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你的某位直系亲属残疾了怎么办？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: including not only parents and children, but also grandparents, aunts etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She gets a lot of help from her extended family.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从大家庭里获得了许多帮助。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She came from a large family of seven children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来自一个有七个孩子的大家庭。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a family consisting of a mother, a father, and their children
spending a lot of time together and supporting each other

Collocate.COLLOC: a family member/a member of the family
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The event was attended by many of his family members, including his children and grandchildren.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次活动他家里许多人都参加了﹐包括他的子女和孙辈。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He comes from a stable family background.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家世雄厚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Is there a family history of heart disease?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有心脏病家族史吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some people believe that television is destroying family life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人认为电视正在破坏家庭生活。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: where someone’s family live and where they lived as a child
one run by members of a family
one designed for families with children
when members of the same family look like each other

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘my family is five’, ‘my family is five members/people’, or 或 ‘my family is of five members/people’. Say 而要说 there are five people in my family .

Sense.DEF: a group of people who are closely related to each other – used especially when emphasizing that someone does or does not belong to this group
Sense.TRAN: 家庭圈子〔尤用于强调某人是否属于这个圈子〕

Sense.DEF: money given by the government in Britain to parents who do not earn much money
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国政府发放的〕贫困家庭救济金﹐低收入家庭津贴

Sense.DEF: a doctor trained to treat the general health problems of people of all ages
a man who enjoys being at home with his wife or partner and children
a man with a wife or partner and children
the name someone shares with all the members of their family

the practice of controlling the number of children that are born by using
contraception
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family planning clinic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划生育门诊部

Sense.DEF: a part of medical practice in the US in which doctors learn to treat general health problems of people of all ages
Sense.TRAN: 家庭保健﹐普通医疗﹐大众医疗

Sense.DEF:
a
gp
a room in a house where the family can play games, watch television etc
a hotel room which has enough space for several people, especially parents and children, to sleep

a room in a
pub
in Britain where children are allowed to sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国酒馆里允许儿童就座的〕家庭间

Sense.DEF: a drawing that gives the names of all the members of a family over a long period of time, and shows how they are related to each other
traditional ideas about what a family should be like, which emphasize the importance of marriage – used especially when talking about politics
Sense.TRAN: 家庭价值观〔尤在谈论政治时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party places great emphasis on family values.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党很注重家庭价值观。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die
Sense.EXAMPLE: the great potato famine in Ireland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰严重的土豆荒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Widespread famine had triggered a number of violent protests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大面积饥荒已引发数起暴力抗议事件。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A million people are facing famine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一百万人正面临饥荒。

Sense.DEF: extremely hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s for supper? I’m famished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭吃什么？我饿死了。

Subsense.DEF: known about by many people in many places
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a famous actor
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名演员
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark a famous place or building that is easy to recognize .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: France is famous for its wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国以其葡萄酒闻名。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Virginia is famous as the birthplace of several US presidents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗吉尼亚因其为数位美国总统的出生地而出名。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

Subsense.DEF: people who are famous
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a nightclub used by the rich and famous
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富人名流光顾的夜总会

Sense.DEF: used when someone has said too confidently that they can do something or that something will happen
Sense.TRAN: 讲得可真好听〔用于讽刺某人过分自信的话〕

Exponent.DEF: known about by a lot of people in many places, often all over the world
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always wanted to be famous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直想出名。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Mona Lisa is Da Vinci’s most famous painting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《蒙娜丽莎》是达•芬奇最著名的画作。

Exponent.DEF: known about by a lot of people, especially in a particular place
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在某一特定地方〕著名的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shilpa Shetty was well-known in India, but few people in the UK had heard of her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希尔帕•谢蒂在印度很有名﹐但在英国却鲜为人知。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a well-known brand of cat food
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个著名的猫粮品牌

Exponent.DEF: very well-known and admired
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dalí is one of Spain’s most celebrated artists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 达利是西班牙最著名的艺术家之一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Martin Luther King’s celebrated speech
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁•路德•金的著名演说

Exponent.DEF: famous, especially for a particular thing or activity. Noted is more formal than renowned .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因某物或某种行为而〕著名的〔noted比renowned正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The British are renowned for their love of animals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国人以爱动物闻名。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The area is noted for its wines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区以产葡萄酒闻名。

Exponent.DEF: very famous and greatly admired – used especially about people who have been doing something for a long time or who have died
Exponent.TRAN: 大名鼎鼎的﹐传奇式的〔尤指某人长期做某事或已去世〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the legendary blues guitarist, BB King
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 传奇布鲁斯吉他手比比金
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her stage performances were legendary.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的舞台表演声名远播。

Exponent.DEF: someone who often appears in newspapers, on television etc and is well-known to the public
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The magazine is full of gossip about celebrities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份杂志里全是名人的八卦。

Section.SECHEADING: FAMOUS BECAUSE OF SOMETHING BAD 有恶名的

Exponent.DEF: famous because of doing something bad
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a notorious criminal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶名昭彰的罪犯
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a notorious legal case
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场众所周知的官司

Exponent.DEF: famous because of doing something very bad, which seems immoral or evil
Exponent.TRAN: 臭名昭著的〔指显得无耻或邪恶〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the infamous attack on the World Trade Center
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对世贸中心无耻的攻击
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the infamous Jack the Ripper
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭名昭著的“开膛手杰克”

Sense.DEF: to have a friendly relationship with someone
in a way that is famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trouble with common sense, as Voltaire famously observed, is that it is not very common.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如伏尔泰有句名言说的﹐常识的问题在于它并非那么平常。

Sense.DEF: someone who likes a particular sport or performing art very much, or who admires a famous person
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动﹑表演艺术或名人的〕狂热崇拜者﹐…迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: Groups of football fans began heading towards the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成群结队的球迷开始向球场走去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s a big fan of Elvis Presley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是埃尔维斯•普雷斯利的狂热粉丝。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: letters sent to famous people by their fans

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 崇拜者的来信

Subsense.DEF: a machine with turning blades that is used to cool the air in a room by moving it around
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a ceiling fan
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吊扇

Subsense.DEF: a flat object that you wave with your hand which makes the air cooler

PIC.HEADING: FANS 扇
PIC.PICCONTENT: fan 扇子；electric fan 电扇

Sense.DEF: to make air move around by waving a fan, piece of paper etc so that you feel cooler

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People in the audience were fanning themselves with their programmes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众中有人在用节目单给自己扇凉。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel an emotion more strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her resistance only fanned his desire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的反抗反而激起了他的欲望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book will serve to fan the flames of debate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书将会使辩论更趋激烈。

Sense.DEF: to make a fire burn more strongly by blowing or moving the air near it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind rose, fanning a few sparks in the brush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风刮起来了﹐扇起了灌木丛中的几点火星。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people fan out, they walk forwards while spreading over a wide area
to spread out a group of things that you are holding so that they make a half-circle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fan the cards out, then pick one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将纸牌展成扇形﹐然后抽出一张。

Sense.DEF: if something such as hair or clothing fans out, it spreads out in many directions
someone who has extreme political or religious ideas and is often dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治或宗教思想的〕狂热者﹐盲信者
Sense.EXAMPLE: fanatics who represent a real danger to democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对民主构成很大威胁的狂热分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a religious fanatic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教狂热分子

Sense.DEF: someone who likes a particular thing or activity very much
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某种事物或活动〕入迷的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a health food fanatic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其推崇绿色食品的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fitness fanatic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热衷于健美的人

Sense.DEF: extreme political or religious beliefs – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔对政治或宗教的〕狂热﹐盲信〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bombing symbolizes the worst of religious fanaticism .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次爆炸事件体现了最极端的宗教狂热。

Sense.DEF:
the belt that operates a
fan
which keeps a car engine cool
Sense.TRAN: 〔冷却汽车发动机的〕风扇皮带

Sense.DEF:
a boy or young man who is very interested in a particular video game,
comic
, television programme etc and spends a lot of time discussing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一视频游戏﹑漫画﹑电视节目等的〕狂热男粉丝

Sense.DEF: sexually attractive
someone who breeds or is interested in a particular kind of animal or plant
Sense.TRAN: 饲养[喜欢]鸽子/马等的人

Sense.DEF: imagined rather than based on facts – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 想象的﹐空想的﹐幻想的〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fanciful story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象出来的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The suggestion that there was a conspiracy is not entirely fanciful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说有人在搞阴谋﹐这并不完全是臆想。

Sense.DEF: full of unusual and very detailed shapes or complicated designs
Sense.EXAMPLE: fanciful decorations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花哨的装饰

Sense.DEF:
an organization for
fans
of a particular team, famous person etc
to like or want something, or want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fancy a quick drink, Emma?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想喝点什么吗﹐埃玛？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sorry, but I don’t fancy going out tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐今晚我不想出去。

Sense.DEF: to feel sexually attracted to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the girls fancied him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的女孩子都迷恋他。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that shows you think you are very attractive or clever
Sense.EXAMPLE: That bloke on the dance floor really fancies himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞池里那家伙真是自命不凡。

Sense.DEF: to believe, usually wrongly, that you have particular skills or are a particular type of person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fancies himself an artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自诩为艺术家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fancies herself as another Madonna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自认为是麦当娜第二。

Sense.DEF: to think someone or something is likely to be successful in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which team do you fancy this year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为今年哪个队会赢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t fancy our chances of getting a ticket this late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不相信这么迟我们还能弄到票。

Sense.DEF: used to express your surprise or shock about something
Sense.TRAN: 真想不到！/难以想象会有那种事！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The Petersons are getting divorced.’ ‘Fancy that!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “彼得森夫妇要离婚了。”“这真不可思议！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fancy seeing you here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真没想到在这里见到你！

Sense.DEF: to think or believe something without being certain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fancied she heard a noise downstairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得好像听到楼下有声音。

Subsense.DEF: a feeling, especially one that is not particularly strong or urgent, that you like someone or want to have something

GramExa.GLOSS: decide that you like someone or want to have something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Hill took a real fancy to Clara.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希尔先生深深地爱上了克拉拉。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wanting to go to Mexico was just a passing fancy the feeling did not last long .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想去墨西哥只不过是一时的兴致。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Because of its high cost, a carpet is not an item that you change as the fancy takes you whenever you want .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为价格昂贵﹐所以地毯不是一件想换就换的物品。

Subsense.DEF: if something takes or catches your fancy, you like it or want to have it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did you see anything that took your fancy?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看中了什么吗？

Sense.DEF: to seem attractive or amusing to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea of playing a joke on her tickled his fancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟她开个玩笑的想法引起了他的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: an idea or opinion that is not based on fact
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, that was just a fancy of his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐那只是他的异想天开。

Sense.DEF: imagination or something that you imagine
fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑餐厅﹑汽车等〕昂贵的﹐豪华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry took me to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里带我去了一家豪华餐厅﹐庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

GramExa.GLOSS: very high and often unreasonable prices

Sense.DEF: having a lot of decoration or bright colours, or made in a complicated way
Sense.EXAMPLE: fancy soaps in seashell shapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别致的海贝形肥皂
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want a basic sports coat - nothing fancy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只要一件简单的便服外套——别花里胡哨的。

Sense.DEF: complicated and needing a lot of skill
Sense.TRAN: 复杂的﹔需要高度技巧的﹐高难度的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t do all that fancy stuff on the computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会在电脑上做那些复杂的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Negotiating a deal can take some fancy footwork skill at making deals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做生意谈判有时需要点高明的手段。

Sense.DEF: fancy food is of a high quality
clothes that you wear, especially to parties, that make you look like a famous person, a character from a story etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an invitation to a fancy-dress party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化装舞会邀请函

Sense.DEF: able to do anything you like because you do not have a family or other responsibilities
Sense.TRAN: 〔因无家室或其他责任而〕没有牵挂的﹐无拘束的﹐无忧无虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten years ago I was footloose and fancy-free .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十年前我毫无牵累﹐自由自在。

Sense.DEF: a man that a married woman has a sexual relationship with, who is not her husband
a woman that a married man has a sexual relationship with, who is not his wife
decorative sewing
a fast Spanish or South American dance, or the music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 方丹戈舞〔一种西班牙或南美的快舞〕﹔方丹戈舞曲

Sense.DEF:
a short loud piece of music played on a
trumpet
to introduce an important person or event
Sense.TRAN: 〔大人物进场或宣布重要事件时用小号吹奏的〕响亮短曲﹐号角花彩

Sense.DEF: a lot of activity, advertising, or discussion relating to an event
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某一事件有关的〕喧闹﹐广告﹐热议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deal was announced with much fanfare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热热闹闹地宣布成交。

Sense.DEF:
stories that use characters or events from famous books, television programmes, or films, but which are written by a
fan
of the original book etc someone who likes it very much , not the book’s real writer
Sense.TRAN: 同人小说〔由爱好者撰写﹐人物或题材取自著名书籍﹑电视节目﹑电影等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most fan fiction websites acknowledge that their authors do not own the characters involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数同人小说网站都承认﹐作者笔下的人物并非原创。

Sense.DEF: a long sharp tooth of an animal such as a snake or wild dog

a girl or young woman who is very interested in a particular video game,
comic
, television programme etc and spends a lot of time discussing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一视频游戏﹑漫画﹑电视节目等的〕狂热女粉丝

Sense.DEF: a small window above a door or a larger window
a window shaped like a half-circle
the part of your body that you sit on
a very offensive word for a woman’s outer sex organs. Do not use this word.
a piece of music that does not have a regular form or style
to imagine that you are doing something which is very pleasant or exciting, but which is very unlikely to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes she fantasized about buying a boat and sailing around the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候﹐她幻想着买艘船周游世界。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I used to fantasize that my real parents were famous movie stars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过去常幻想我的亲生父母是著名影星。

Sense.DEF: extremely good, attractive, enjoyable etc
Sense.TRAN: 极好的﹐吸引人的﹐有趣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look fantastic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去棒极了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a fantastic place, really beautiful!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这真是个好地方﹐漂亮极了！

Sense.DEF: used when someone has just told you something good
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve passed my driving test.’ ‘Fantastic!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我通过驾照考试了。”“太好了！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s fantastic news!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那真是个好消息！

Sense.DEF: a fantastic amount is extremely large
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids spend fantastic amounts of money on CDs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们花了好多钱买激光唱片。

Sense.DEF: a fantastic plan, suggestion etc is not likely to be possible
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑建议等〕不现实的﹐异想天开的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fantastic scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异想天开的计划

Sense.DEF: a fantastic story, creature, or place is imaginary and is very strange and magical
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑生物或场所〕幻想的﹐奇异的﹐古怪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: fantastic tales of dragons and fairy queens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙和仙后的奇幻故事

Sense.DEF: strange, unreal, and magical
Sense.EXAMPLE: fantastical creatures with golden wings and lions’ faces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金翅狮面的怪兽

Sense.DEF: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sexual fantasies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性幻想
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候﹐他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

Sense.DEF: an idea or belief that is based only on imagination, not on real facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Memories can sometimes be pure fantasy, rather than actual recollections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记忆有时纯粹是幻想﹐而不是真实的往事。

Sense.DEF: a story, film etc that is based on imagination and not facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surrealist fantasy set in a South American village
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部以南美某村庄为背景的超现实主义幻想作品

Sense.DEF: a game in which lots of people make imaginary football teams by choosing real players. They get points according to how well the players do in real games, and the winner is the person whose team gets the most points.
a magazine written by and for people who admire and support a popular musician, a sports team etc

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= frequently asked question 常见问题

Subsense.DEF: a long distance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Have you driven far?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开了很远了吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Since I changed jobs, I have to travel further to get to work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我换了工作﹐上班更远了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s see who can jump the furthest!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们来比比谁跳得最远！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children don’t go far from home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不会离家很远。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wants to move as far away from here as possible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想尽量搬得离这儿远些。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They could hear the sound of water not far away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听见不远处有水声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lives further down the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿这条街再往前走一点就是他的住处。

GramExa.GLOSS: further away from where you are now
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you want to go further afield, there are bicycles for hire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你想去更远的地方﹐有自行车可以租。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many birds fly further south in the autumn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天﹐许多鸟类飞往更南的地方。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The plains stretched for as far as the eye could see all the distance you could see .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平原一望无际。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The lake is about 4 miles away, but we probably won’t get that far won’t go as far as that place .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座湖大概在四英里之外﹐但我们可能不会去那么远。

Subsense.DEF: used when asking the distance between two places, or when talking about the distance between two places
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How far is it to the station?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离车站多远？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The man didn’t say how far it was to the next town.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名男子没说下一个镇有多远。

Subsense.DEF: to a place or point, but not beyond it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They managed to get as far as the Spanish border.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直跑到西班牙边境。

Sense.DEF: very much, or to a great degree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new system is far better than the old one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新系统比旧系统好许多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are a far greater number of women working in television than twenty years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事电视工作的女性远比20年前多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I enjoyed it far more than I expected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我远比预想的更喜欢它。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s far too much to pay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个价钱太高了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would take me far too long to explain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得花很长时间来解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He bought it for a price that was far beyond much more than its real value.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出的价钱远远高于实际价值。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher said that her writing skills were far below average.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师说她的写作能力远低于平均水平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve kept the original features of the house as far as possible as much as possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量保留了房子的原貌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How far do those old, outdated laws affect today’s legislation?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些陈旧过时的法律对今天的立法有多少影响？
Sense.EXAMPLE: His style was far removed very different from that of Picasso.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的风格与毕加索有天壤之别。

GramExa.GLOSS: close to being correct
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎正确
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I guessed it would cost $100 and it was $110, so I was not far out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜这东西要100美元﹐其实是110美元﹐所以我基本猜对。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about how much progress someone makes, or how much effect something has
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示进展情况或影响程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started to explain, but he didn’t get far he did not succeed in saying very much before Mary interrupted him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始解释起来﹐但没说几句就被玛丽打断了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: get as far as doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had got as far as painting the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经开始粉刷厨房了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people felt that the new law did not go far enough did not have a big enough effect, so that more needed to be done .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认为新的法律力度不够。

Sense.DEF: a long time in the past or the future, or a long time into a particular period

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We talked far into the night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈到深夜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want to plan much further ahead than the next few years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想计划得更长远﹐而不光是接下来的几年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The first petrol-driven car was produced as far back as 1883.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一辆汽油动力车的生产要回溯到1883年。

Sense.DEF: to do something too extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: One day she will go too far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总有一天会做得太过分的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people thought he had gone too far in his criticism of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人觉得他对警方的批评太过分了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go so far/as far as to do sth
Sense.DEF: to do or say something extreme
Sense.TRAN: 竟然做某事﹐甚至做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government went so far as to try to arrest opposition leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府竟然企图逮捕反对党领导人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t go so far as to say that we agreed on the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才不会说我们在这个问题上意见是一致的。

Sense.DEF: until now
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far we have not had to borrow any money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐我们还不必借钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re delighted with the replies they’ve received from the public thus far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐他们还满意公众的反应。

Sense.DEF: used to say that things have been happening successfully until now
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve reached the semi-finals. So far so good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进入了半决赛﹐到目前为止一切顺利。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something very different is true or happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conditions are still far from ideal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条件仍很不理想。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Far from helping the situation, you’ve just made it worse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那样非但于事无补﹐反而把事情弄得更糟了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the opposite of what has just been said is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you bored?’ ‘Far from it. I could listen all night.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你厌烦了吗？”“才没呢﹐我听一晚上都行。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people aren’t objecting - far from it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人不反对——完全不反对。

Sense.DEF: over a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: His fame spread far and wide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声名远扬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People came from far and wide came from many places to see the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们从各地赶来听音乐会。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is much better, worse etc than anything else …
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watching sport was by far the most popular activity on Saturday afternoons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周六下午看体育比赛是最受欢迎的活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spring is far and away the best time to visit the islands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天是去这些岛屿旅游的最佳季节。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think someone will be successful in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the best student in his year, and everyone was sure he would go far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是同年级最好的学生﹐每个人都确信他将大有作为。

Sense.DEF: used when giving your opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as I’m concerned she can come home whenever she likes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就我而言﹐只要她愿意﹐随时可以回家。

Sense.LEXUNIT: as/so far as sth is concerned
Sense.DEF: used when you want to talk about a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as money’s concerned, there shouldn’t be a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至于钱﹐应该没有问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: as/so far as I know/l can remember/I can tell/I can see etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you think that something is true, although it is possible that you do not know all the facts or cannot remember completely
Sense.TRAN: 据我所知/据我所记得的/依我看
Sense.EXAMPLE: There weren’t any buildings there at all, as far as I can remember.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所记得的﹐那里没有任何建筑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as I can see, there’s nothing else to discuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐没有别的什么可以讨论了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: far be it from me to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you do not want to criticize someone or say what they should do, especially when this is what you are really about to do
Sense.TRAN: 不是我想做某事〔用于批评或告诫某人但又表示自己并非想这么做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Far be it from me to teach you your job, but don’t you think you should have been more careful?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是我想教你怎么工作﹐只是你难道不认为应该更加仔细些吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that an idea, suggestion, plan etc is satisfactory, but only to a limited degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: His theories are fine, as far as they go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论大致上还算不错。

Subsense.DEF: if money does not go far, you cannot buy very much with it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My salary doesn’t go very far these days.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐我的薪水买不了多少东西。

Subsense.DEF: if a supply of something does not go far, it is not enough
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The coffee won’t go far if everyone wants a cup.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果每个人都要一杯﹐那咖啡就不够了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in so far as/insofar as/in as far as
Sense.DEF: to the degree that
Sense.EXAMPLE: The research suggests that the drug will be successful, in so far as one can draw conclusions from such a small sample size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究表明﹐就目前这么小规模试用所得出的结论来看﹐这种药是会成功的。

Exponent.DEF: a long distance – used mainly in negatives and questions, or after ‘too’, ‘so’, and ‘as’
Exponent.TRAN: 远〔主要用于否定句﹑疑问句或用于 too﹑so 和 as 之后〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s not far to the airport from here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里离机场不远。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you driven far?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开车跑了很远吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ship was so far away we could hardly see it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船离得很远﹐我们几乎都看不见。

Exponent.DEF: a long distance from somewhere. This is the most common way of talking about long distances, except in negatives and questions when far is also common.
Exponent.TRAN: 远〔表示距离远最常用的说法﹐而在否定句和疑问句里far也常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must be tired – you’ve come a long way.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定累了——跑了那么远的路。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a long way down from the top of the cliff.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从悬崖顶下来有很长一段路。

Exponent.DEF: a very long way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We hiked miles.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们徒步走了很远。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school is miles away from where I live.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校离我住的地方很远。

Exponent.DEF: a long way from where you are now – used when talking about things that seem small or sounds that seem quiet because they are a long way away
Exponent.TRAN: 远处〔用于表示某物因距离远而看上去小或声音因距离远而听不清〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dogs were barking somewhere in the distance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 远远地有狗在吠。

Exponent.DEF: used about something that is a long distance from where you are now, and looks small or sounds quiet
Exponent.TRAN: 远处的〔用于表示某物距离远﹐看上去小或声音轻〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: By now, the plane was just a distant speck in the sky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在﹐那架飞机只是天空中远远的一个小点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rumble of distant thunder
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处隆隆的雷声

Exponent.DEF: a very long distance from where you are now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a traveller from a faraway land
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自遥远国度的游客
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His voice sounded faraway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音似乎很遥远。

Exponent.DEF: a remote place is a long distance from other places, and few people go there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The helicopter crashed in a remote part of the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架直升机在该国的偏远地区坠毁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: remote holiday destinations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏远的度假目的地

Exponent.DEF: an isolated place is a long distance from other towns, buildings, or people, and there is very little communication with surrounding places
Exponent.EXAMPLE: isolated rural areas of Nepal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼泊尔偏僻的农村地区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Occasionally we passed through a small isolated village.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔我们会经过一个偏僻的小村庄。

Exponent.DEF: a place that is off the beaten track is a long distance from the places where people usually go, and often seems interesting and different because of this
Exponent.TRAN: 〔地方〕偏远﹐僻静〔因此显得有趣﹑与众不同〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She likes to go to places that are a bit off the beaten track.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢去一些人迹罕至的地方。

Sense.DEF: a long distance away
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can walk to my house from here. It isn’t far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以从这里步行去我家﹐不远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could see the mountains in the far distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以看到远处的群山。

Sense.DEF: the side, end etc that is furthest from you
Sense.TRAN: 更远的一端/一边/一个角落等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They crossed the bridge and walked along the far side of the stream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们过了桥﹐在对岸沿着小溪一路前行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a piano in the far corner of the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间的对面角落里有一架钢琴。

Sense.DEF: the part of a country or area that is furthest in the direction of north, south etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will become windy in the far north and west.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最北部和最西部有大风。

Sense.DEF:
people who have extreme
left-wing
or
right-wing
political opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The candidate for the far right got ten percent of the vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极右派候选人获得了百分之十的选票。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a far cry from sth
Sense.DEF: to be very different from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company lost £3 million, which is a far cry from last year’s £60 million profit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司亏损了300万英镑﹐这与去年赢利6,000万英镑相去甚远。

Sense.DEF: a long distance away
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dreamed of flying away to exotic faraway places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梦想着飞到遥远的异国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: faraway noises
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处的喧嚣声

Sense.DEF: an expression on your face which shows that you are not paying attention but thinking about something very different
Sense.TRAN: 心不在焉的神情﹔若有所思的神情
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes had a distant faraway look, like a sailor staring out to sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼神若有所思﹐就像水手在眺望大海。

Sense.DEF: an event or a situation that is very badly organized or does not happen properly, in a way that is silly and unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 闹剧场面﹐一团糟的场面
Sense.EXAMPLE: She admitted that the interview had been a complete farce from start to finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她承认﹐采访从头到尾完全是一场闹剧。

Sense.DEF: a humorous play or film in which the characters are involved in complicated and silly situations, or the style of writing or acting that is used
a situation or event that is farcical is very silly and badly organized
Sense.TRAN: 闹剧似的﹐滑稽的﹐荒唐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opposition leaders described the government’s plans as ‘farcical’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党领导人说政府的计划就像“一场闹剧”。

Sense.DEF: a farcical play or film is a humorous one in which the characters become involved in silly and complicated situations
the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共汽车﹑火车﹑飞机等的〕票价

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Air fares have shot up by 20%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机票价已猛涨20%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children under 14 travel half-fare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 14岁以下儿童半票。

Sense.DEF: food, especially food served in a restaurant or eaten on a special occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指餐厅或特殊场合吃的〕饭菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional Christmas fare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的圣诞节食物

Sense.DEF: a passenger in a taxi
something that is offered to the public, especially as entertainment
Sense.TRAN: 供大众使用的东西〔尤指作娱乐之用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie is suitable family fare .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影适合全家人一起观看。

Sense.DEF: to be successful, unsuccessful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although Chicago has fared better than some cities, unemployment remains a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽说芝加哥比其他一些城市情况好些﹐但失业仍是个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wondered how Ed had fared in the interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想知道埃德面试情况如何。

Sense.DEF: the countries in the east of Asia, such as China, Japan etc
the action of saying goodbye
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mourners gathered to bid farewell to the victims of the plane tragedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哀悼者来向空难受害者告别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a farewell speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告别演说

Sense.DEF: a party or dinner that you have because someone is leaving a job, city etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: 40 of her colleagues gathered for her farewell presentation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40位同事来参加了她的欢送会。

Sense.DEF: goodbye
extremely unlikely to be true or to happen
Sense.TRAN: 牵强的﹔不可信的﹔靠不住的
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this may sound a bit far-fetched, but companies are already developing ‘intelligent’ homes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切听起来也许有点难以置信﹐但的确有一些公司已经在开发“智能”房屋了。

Sense.DEF: very distant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: expeditions to far-flung corners of the globe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往世界边隅的探险
GramExa.EXAMPLE: people flying to far-flung destinations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远途飞行的人们

Sense.DEF: spread out over a very large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Email enables far-flung friends to keep in touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子邮件让天各一方的朋友保持联络。

Sense.DEF: very sick, drunk, crazy etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔生病﹑醉酒﹑疯狂等〕（程度）严重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s pretty far gone - can you drive her home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醉得不行了﹐你能开车送她回家吗？

Sense.DEF: an area of land used for growing crops or keeping animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 300-hectare farm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座300公顷的农场
Sense.EXAMPLE: farm workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场工人
Sense.EXAMPLE: farm animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场牲畜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe had worked on the farm all his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔在农场干了一辈子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He runs a pig farm in Lincolnshire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在林肯郡经营一个养猪场。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Say 说 on a farm﹐ not 而不说 ‘in a farm’.

Sense.DEF: the main house on a farm where the farmer lives
to use land for growing crops or keeping animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family has farmed here for generations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人世代在此务农。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land has been farmed organically since 1995.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自1995年以来﹐这块土地一直进行有机耕种。

Sense.DEF: fish and animals that have been raised on farms, and not caught from the wild
to send work to other people instead of doing it yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The processing will be farmed out to people in local villages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加工活将外包给当地的村民。

Sense.DEF: to send someone to a different place where they will be looked after – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人〕寄养在外〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the age of 16 she was farmed out to family friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 16岁时﹐她被委托给她家的朋友照看。

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or manages a farm
a place where farmers bring their fruit, vegetables, meat, and other products to sell directly to people in a town or city
someone who works on a farm
the main house on a farm, where the farmer lives
the practice or business of growing crops or keeping animals on a farm
Sense.TRAN: 农场经营﹔农场业﹔耕种﹔养殖（业）﹔畜牧（业）

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 牧羊/饲养乳牛/饲养牲畜等

Sense.EXAMPLE: the farming industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农[畜牧]业

Sense.DEF: land used for farming
a farmhouse and the buildings around it
an area surrounded by farm buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔四周是农场建筑物的〕农家宅院

Sense.DEF: a long way from where you are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: visit-ors from a far-off land
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远方来客

Sense.EXAMPLE: far-off galaxies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遥远的星系

Sense.DEF: a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: in those far-off days when we were young
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们那远去的青春岁月里

Sense.DEF: very strange or unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s designs were just far-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆的设计就是怪。

Sense.DEF: having a great influence or effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country carried out far-reaching reforms to modernize its economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国实行了意义深远的改革以实现经济现代化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tourism has had far-reaching effects on the island’s culture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业对该岛文化产生了深远的影响。

Sense.DEF: someone who makes shoes for horses’ feet
Sense.TRAN: 蹄铁工﹐锻制马蹄铁的铁匠

Sense.DEF: the language of Iran
Sense.TRAN: 现代伊朗语﹐现代波斯语﹐法尔西语

Sense.DEF: far-sighted people, ideas, or plans are wise because they show an understanding of what will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: far-sighted investments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有远见的投资
Sense.EXAMPLE: a far-sighted politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卓有远见的政治家

Sense.DEF: able to see or read things clearly only when they are far away from you

to make air come out of your
bowels
to waste time not doing very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop farting around and get on with your work!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别瞎混了﹐干你的活去！

Sense.DEF:
an act of making air come out of your
bowels
a stupid and uninteresting older person
Sense.TRAN: 老东西〔指愚蠢无趣的年长者〕

Sense.DEF:
a greater distance than before or than something else; a
comparative
form of ‘far’
Sense.TRAN: 更远地〔far的一种比较级形式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided not to go any farther.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定不再往前走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boats were drifting farther and farther apart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些小船顺水漂流﹐彼此距离越来越远。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a resort town farther up the coast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿海岸更远处的一个度假小镇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two miles farther south is the village of Santa Catarina.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再往南两英里就是圣卡塔里娜村。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of them were locals, but some had come from farther afield a greater distance away .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们大部分是当地人﹐但也有一些来自较远的地方。

Sense.DEF: if you do something farther, you do it more or to a greater degree
Sense.TRAN: 在更大程度上﹐更进一步
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better investigate farther.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好作进一步的调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police decided not to take the matter any farther do more about it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方决定不再追查此事。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say further rather than farther , and furthest rather than farthest .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般用further﹑furthest﹐而不用farther﹑farthest
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We decided not to take it any further .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定不再追究此事。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This was the furthest away from home I’d ever been.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我到过的离家最远的地方。

Sense.DEF:
more distant; a
comparative
form of ‘far’
Sense.TRAN: 更远的〔far的一种比较级形式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A table stood at the farther end of the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房的那一头放着一张桌子。

Sense.DEF:
at or to the greatest distance away; a
superlative
form of ‘far’
Sense.TRAN: 最远〔far的一种最高级形式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My sister was the one who travelled farthest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姐姐去过的地方最远。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lived farthest away from school of all of us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有人里﹐她住得离学校最远。

Sense.DEF:
the most distant; a
superlative
form of ‘far’
Sense.TRAN: 最远的〔far的一种最高级形式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the farthest corners of the globe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球最偏远的角落

Sense.DEF:
an old British coin that was worth one quarter of a
penny
Sense.TRAN: 法寻〔英国旧时硬币﹐值1/4便士〕

Sense.DEF:
a
dashboard
a long board above a shop with the shop’s name on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔挂在店门上的〕招牌﹐店门匾额

Sense.DEF: if someone or something fascinates you, you are attracted to them and think they are extremely interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea of travelling through time fascinates me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越时光的想法深深吸引着我。

Sense.DEF: extremely interested by something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 被迷住的﹐被吸引住的﹔极感兴趣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was fascinated by her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被她的嗓音迷住了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ed was fascinated to see gorillas in the wild.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到野外的大猩猩﹐埃德兴趣盎然。

Sense.DEF: extremely interesting
Sense.TRAN: 有极大吸引力的﹐迷人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fascinating book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本引人入胜的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: That sounds absolutely fascinating .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那听起来极具吸引力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found him quite fascinating.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他很有魅力。

Sense.DEF: the state of being very interested in something, so that you want to look at it, learn about it etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police knew of his fascination with guns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方知道他对枪着迷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children watched in fascination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们看得津津有味。

Sense.DEF: something that interests you very much, or the quality of being very interesting
Sense.TRAN: 令人着迷的事物﹔吸引力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: India will always hold a great fascination for me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度对我始终有着巨大的吸引力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The fascination lay in the mystery of what was inside the box.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

Sense.DEF:
a
right-wing
political system in which people’s lives are completely controlled by the state and no political opposition is allowed
someone who supports fascism
Sense.TRAN: 法西斯主义支持者﹐法西斯分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fascists came to power in 1933.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法西斯分子于1933年上台。

Sense.DEF: someone who is cruel and unfair and does not like people to argue with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: My last boss was a real fascist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的上一个老板是个十足的法西斯。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has extreme
right-wing
opinions

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨索里尼的法西斯政权

Sense.DEF: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fashion for ‘discovery methods’ of learning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风靡一时的“探索”学习法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The emerging science of photography was already changing fashions in art.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影科学的兴起已在改变艺术的潮流。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eastern religions used to be the fashion in the 60s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 东方宗教曾在60年代很流行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His ideas are coming back into fashion they are becoming popular again .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点又流行起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their music will never go out of fashion stop being fashionable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的音乐永不过时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Self-help books are all the fashion they are very fashionable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自助类的书籍很流行。

Sense.DEF: a style of clothes, hair etc that is popular at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 〔服装﹑发型等的〕流行款式﹐时新式样
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people are very concerned with fashion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人很关注时尚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hats like that just aren’t the fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样的帽子不流行。

Sense.DEF: the business or study of making and selling clothes, shoes etc in new and changing styles
Sense.EXAMPLE: magazines about fashion and beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚与美容杂志
Sense.EXAMPLE: the London College of Fashion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦时装学院

Sense.DEF: in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion in the way that she usually does this .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

Sense.DEF: not very much, not very well, or not very effectively
Sense.TRAN: 不很好﹐马马虎虎﹐勉强凑合
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you speak Russian?’ ‘After a fashion.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你会说俄语吗？”“勉强会一点。”

Sense.DEF: in a style that is typical of a particular person
Sense.TRAN: 像某人的风格﹐模仿某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her early work is very much after the fashion of Picasso and Braque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的早期作品颇具毕加索和布拉克的风格。

Sense.LEXUNIT: like it’s going out of fashion
Sense.DEF: use this to emphasize that someone does something a lot or uses a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danny’s been spending money like it’s going out of fashion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼花钱一直大手大脚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Belted jackets are in fashion this winter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今冬流行束腰短外套。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Flared trousers were out of fashion in the 1980s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代﹐喇叭裤不再流行了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop being fashionable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Long evening dresses are going out of fashion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 长晚礼服过时了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become fashionable again
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Short skirts are coming back into fashion this year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年﹐短裙又重新流行起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be very fashionable
make sure that you know about the most recent fashions
very interested in the latest fashions, and always wanting to wear fashionable clothes

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They sell all the latest fashions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出售各种最新的流行服饰。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Men’s fashions have not changed much in 50 years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 50年来﹐男式时装一直没有多大变化。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: London is the centre of the British fashion industry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦是英国时装业中心。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Small women are often overlooked by the fashion world.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 身材娇小的女性常常被时装界忽视。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a company that produces new and expensive styles of clothes
an occasion when photographs are taken of fashion models

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the last fashion’. Say 而要说 the latest fashion .

Sense.DEF: to shape or make something, using your hands or only a few tools
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手或几件工具〕使成形﹐制作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fashioned a box from a few old pieces of wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用几块旧木板做了一个箱子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jamie could take a piece of wood and fashion it into a wonderful work of art.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰米可以把一块木头做成漂亮的艺术品。

Sense.DEF: to influence and form someone’s ideas and opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are all unique human beings, fashioned by life experiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都是由各自生活经历塑造而成的独特个体。

Sense.DEF: like something, or in the way that a particular group of people does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ate Indian-fashion, using their fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们照印度人的样子﹐用手抓着吃。

Sense.DEF: popular, especially for a short period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指短时期内〕时髦的﹐流行的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strong colours are very fashionable at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下流行艳丽的色彩。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is fashionable (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It suddenly became fashionable for politicians to talk about green issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们大谈环保问题突然变成了一种时尚。

Sense.DEF: popular with, or used by, rich people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He runs a fashionable restaurant near the Harbor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在港口附近经营一家高级餐厅。

Exponent.DEF: popular at a particular time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: fashionable clothes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 时髦的衣服
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was fashionable to have red hair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 染红头发很时髦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His theories were fashionable in the 1980s.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论在20世纪80年代风靡一时。

Exponent.DEF: modern and fashionable – often used in a slightly disapproving or joking way
Exponent.TRAN: 时尚的〔略带贬义或玩笑意味〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a trendy tie
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条时髦的领带
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a trendy restaurant
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家时尚餐厅
