Exponent.EXAMPLE: The area has become very trendy and a lot of artists live there.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区变得很时尚﹐住了许多艺术家。

Exponent.DEF: fashionable and well-designed in an attractive way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a stylish two-piece suit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着时髦的两件式套装。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The furniture looked very stylish and modern.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家具看上去相当时髦而现代。

Exponent.DEF: fashionable – used especially when you think someone or something looks good
Exponent.TRAN: 时髦的〔尤用于表示某人或某物看上去很好〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Michael looked very cool in his dark jacket and sunglasses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔穿黑西装戴墨镜看上去很酷。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cool shirt
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件时髦的衬衫

Exponent.DEF: a happening place is fashionable and lively
Exponent.EXAMPLE: London has always been a happening place.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦一直是个时尚之地。

Exponent.DEF: to be fashionable at a particular time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Sixties look is back in fashion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代的风格重新流行起来。

Exponent.DEF: fashionable at a particular time. In is not used before a noun, except in the phrases below.
Exponent.TRAN: 流行的〔不用于名词前,以下短语除外〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pale colours are in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在流行浅色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New York was the in place to be .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约曾是个时髦之地。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Yoga has become the in thing to do .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 练瑜伽已成了时髦之事。

Sense.DEF: wearing or having the newest styles of clothes – used especially in magazines
Sense.TRAN: 时尚前沿的〔尤为杂志用语〕

Sense.DEF: a company that produces new and expensive styles of clothes
someone who is very interested in fashion and who likes the very newest styles
someone who likes to wear very fashionable clothes
an event at which new styles of clothes are shown to the public
something that you own or wear that is considered new or different, and that is intended to make other people notice you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mobile phones make a big fashion statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手机成了时尚的一大代言物。

Sense.DEF: someone who always wears what is fashionable, even if it makes them look bad
Sense.TRAN: 时尚的牺牲品﹐潮流受害者〔常穿戴时髦物品而不论合适与否的人〕

Sense.DEF: moving quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢点——你开得太快了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fast-moving river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湍急的河流
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnny ran off as fast as his legs could carry him running as quickly as he could .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰尼飞也似的跑开了。

Sense.DEF: happening in a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids grow up fast these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今小孩子长得很快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The survivors needed help fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生还者急需帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How fast can you get the job done?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你多快能把工作做完？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Access to the Internet is fast becoming a necessity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够上网不久将变成必需。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It all happened so fast I didn’t even notice I was bleeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切发生得太快﹐我甚至还没发觉自己在流血。

Sense.DEF: sleeping very deeply
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick was lying on the sofa, fast asleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克躺在沙发上睡得很香。

Sense.DEF: to become or be firmly fixed and unable to move
Sense.TRAN: 被紧紧夹住﹐被紧紧粘住
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat was stuck fast in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船死死地陷在淤泥里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to pull her hand free, but it was held fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想把手抽出来﹐但是被紧紧地夹住了。

Sense.DEF: to not succeed in making progress or achieving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept asking her the same question, but I was getting nowhere fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直追问那个问题﹐但是一无所获。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to be too eager to do or believe something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not so fast. We’ve got to prove it first, haven’t we?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢点﹐我们得先证实一下﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: to tie something such as a boat or tent firmly to something else
very close to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: fast by the river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧挨着河

Crossrefto.REFLEX: play fast and loose with sth

Sense.DEF: moving or able to move quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fast car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速度很快的汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the fastest runners in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是世界上跑得最快的人之一。

Sense.DEF: doing something or happening in a short time
Sense.TRAN: 迅速做到的﹐立即发生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The subway is the fastest way to get downtown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去市中心坐地铁最快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company must give a faster response to clients’ requests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司必须更迅速地回应客户要求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain forests are being chopped down at an alarmingly fast rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨林正以惊人的速度遭砍伐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a fast learner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一学就会。

Sense.DEF: a clock that is fast shows a later time than the real time
Sense.EXAMPLE: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I always keep my watch 15 minutes fast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是把表拨快15分钟。

Sense.DEF: a way of achieving something more quickly than is normally done
Sense.TRAN: 通往成功的快车道﹐快速成功之路

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a young actress on the fast track to fame and success
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾驰在快速收获名利之路上的一名年轻女演员

Sense.DEF: a road on which vehicles can travel very quickly

a film or
lens2
that can be used when there is little light, or when photographing something that is moving very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速感光胶卷/快速镜头

Sense.DEF: a colour that is fast will not change when clothes are washed
a fast surface is one on which a ball moves very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔球场场地〕利于球快速滚动的

Sense.DEF: done very quickly with a lot of effort and energy, or happening very quickly with a lot of sudden changes
Sense.TRAN: 迅猛的﹐迅速而剧烈的﹐迅速多变的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arsenal’s opening attack was fast and furious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队的开场进攻很迅猛。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone can get what they want very quickly, especially in starting a sexual relationship with another person
Sense.TRAN: 某人是个快手〔指能很快达到目的的人﹐尤指在确立两性关系时〕

Sense.DEF: someone who talks quickly and easily but is often not honest or sincere
Sense.TRAN: 口齿伶俐但不一定可靠的人

Sense.DEF: becoming involved quickly in sexual relationships with men
Sense.EXAMPLE: fast cars and fast women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速汽车和放荡的女人

Sense.DEF: two people who are very friendly for a long time

Exponent.DEF: moving or able to move quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cheetah is the fastest animal in the world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 猎豹是世界上跑得最快的动物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fast car
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速汽车

Exponent.DEF: moving fast or doing something in a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was much quicker than I was over the first 100 metres.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚开始的100米﹐他比我快得多。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do I have time for a quick shower?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有时间快速冲个澡吗？

Exponent.DEF: designed to travel or operate very quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a high-speed train
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速火车
Exponent.EXAMPLE: high-speed Internet access
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速因特网接入

Exponent.DEF: happening in a short period of time – used about changes, increases, improvements etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rapid increase in the population
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口的迅速增长
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rapid expansion of the firm’s business in the Middle East
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司业务在中东的迅速扩张

Exponent.DEF: moving quickly or happening after only a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The horses ran along the track at a swift trot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马匹沿着赛道飞奔。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He received a swift response to his letter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的信很快就有了回音。

Exponent.DEF: quick and energetic
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a brisk walk in the countryside
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻快的乡间漫步
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His manner was very brisk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的举止很活泼。

Exponent.DEF: happening after only a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone wishes you a speedy recovery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都祝你早日康复。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a speedy resolution to the problem
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迅速解决该问题的方案

Exponent.DEF: done more quickly that usual, because you do not have much time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She ate a hurried breakfast in the cafe before catching her train.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在咖啡馆匆匆吃了早餐去赶火车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We made a hurried departure.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们匆匆出发了。

Exponent.DEF: deciding or doing something very quickly, especially when this has bad results
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a hasty decision, which he later regretted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个仓促的决定﹐他过后很懊悔。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let’s not be too hasty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不要过于仓促。

Sense.DEF: to eat little or no food for a period of time, especially for religious reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: Muslims fast during Ramadan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆斯林在斋月里禁食。

Sense.DEF: a period during which someone does not eat, especially for religious reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gandhi drank some orange juice to break end his three-week fast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甘地喝了些橙汁﹐结束了为期三周的禁食。

Sense.DEF:
a ball that is thrown very hard and quickly towards the
batter
in a game of
baseball
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球赛中投向击球手的〕快球

Sense.DEF:
a
nuclear reactor large machine that produces nuclear energy
which turns some of the
uranium
used in the process into
plutonium
a day when you do not eat any food, especially for religious reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因宗教原因而不吃东西的〕禁食日﹐斋戒日

Subsense.DEF: to join together the two sides of a coat, shirt, bag etc so that it is closed
Subsense.TRAN: 扣牢﹔系牢﹐缚紧﹔把〔拉链〕拉好
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m going now,’ she said, fastening her coat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在我要走了。”她一边说﹐一边扣上大衣。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fasten your seat belt.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请系好安全带。

Subsense.DEF: to become joined together with buttons, hooks etc
Subsense.TRAN: 被扣牢﹔被钩住﹔被系牢﹔被钉牢
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was so fat that my skirt wouldn’t fasten.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我胖得裙子都扣不上了。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say do up rather than fasten .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐人们一般说do up﹐而不说fasten
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Do up your jacket – it’s cold.

Sense.DEF: to firmly close a window, gate etc so that it will not open, or to become firmly closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure all the windows are securely fastened before you leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开前要确保所有的窗子都已关严。

Sense.DEF: to attach something firmly to another object or surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fasten the edges of the cloth together with pins.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大头针把布料的边角固定住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They fastened the rope to a tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把绳子绑在树上。

Sense.DEF: to hold something firmly with your hands, legs, arms, or teeth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fastened her arms around his neck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧紧搂住他的脖子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A strong hand fastened round her wrist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只有力的手牢牢抓住了她的手腕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their long claws allow them to fasten onto the rocks and hold firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们可以凭借长长的爪子牢牢地抓住岩石。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rose, his eyes still fastened on the piece of paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起身﹐眼睛仍盯着那张纸。

Sense.DEF: to think a lot about one particular thing or person
Sense.TRAN: 集中注意力于某人/某物﹔认真地考虑某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was working quietly, all his attention fastened on the task.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他静静地干着活﹐注意力全都集中在工作上。

Sense.DEF: to give particular attention to something because you think it is important or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 盯住〔某物〕不放﹐把注意力放在〔某物〕上
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother fastened on the word ‘unsafe’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲就盯着“不安全”这几个字。

Sense.DEF: to give particular attention to something because you think it is important or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 盯住〔某人/某物〕不放﹐把注意力放在〔某人/某物〕上

Sense.DEF: to follow someone and stay with them, especially when they do not want you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog seemed lost and fastened onto us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗似乎迷了路﹐老跟着我们。

PIC.HEADING: FASTEN 扣牢；使固定；关住
PIC.PICCONTENT: buckle 扣腰带；tie 系牢；zip 拉拉链；pin 钉住；lock 上锁；bolt 插插销

Sense.DEF: something that you use to join something together, such as a button on a piece of clothing
Sense.TRAN: 扣件﹐扣紧物〔如衣服上的纽扣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: shoes with velcro fasteners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带维可牢搭链的鞋

Sense.DEF: something that is used to keep a door, window etc firmly shut
Sense.TRAN: 〔门﹑窗等的〕紧固件﹐扣件﹐扣拴物﹐插销

Sense.DEF:
food such as
hamburgers
which is prepared quickly and that you can take away with you
to wind a tape or video forwards quickly without playing it
to move quickly to a later point in a story

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fast-forward to York at the turn of the century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直接跳到后面﹐讲讲世纪之交的约克吧。

Sense.DEF: very careful about small details in your appearance, work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who are fastidious about personal hygiene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分讲究个人卫生的人

Sense.DEF: an exciting way of life that involves dangerous and expensive activities
Sense.TRAN: 刺激的生活（方式）〔指涉及危险且代价昂贵的活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brenda is a lady who loves life in the fast lane .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦达是个喜欢刺激生活的女性。

Sense.DEF: the part of a big road where people drive fastest
Sense.EXAMPLE: I broke down in the fast lane of the M6.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的车在6号高速公路的快车道上抛锚了。

Sense.DEF: a place that is safe because it is difficult to reach
Sense.EXAMPLE: mountain fastnesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山间要塞

Sense.DEF: the fast track to something is the fastest way of achieving it
Sense.TRAN: 通往成功的快车道﹐迅速成功之路
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many saw independence as the fast track to democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人将独立视为通往民主的快车道。

Sense.DEF: happening or making progress more quickly than is usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fast-track procedure for adoption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速收养程序

Sense.DEF: weighing too much because you have too much flesh on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you suggesting I’m too fat?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是在说我太胖了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short fat man in his early fifties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个五十岁出头的矮胖男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll get fat if you eat all that chocolate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你把那些巧克力都吃了﹐就会变胖的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looks much fatter than in his photo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去比相片上胖多了。

Sense.DEF: thick or wide
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dobbs was smoking a fat cigar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多布斯正抽着一支粗大的雪茄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big fat book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本又大又厚的书

Sense.DEF: containing or worth a large amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fat cheque
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨额支票
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course the supermarkets’ aim is to make fat profits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐超市的目的是要获取丰厚的利润。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very unlikely to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘You can go to bed now and sleep easy.’ ‘Fat chance of that!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在你可以上床去安心睡觉了。”“怎么可能啊！”

Sense.DEF: not at all useful or helpful
Sense.TRAN: 一点用处也没有的﹐全然没有帮助的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fat lot of use you are in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在厨房一点忙都帮不上。

Sense.DEF: someone who has too much money, especially someone who is paid too much for their job – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 阔佬〔尤指薪酬过高的人﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fat cats at the top who have recently been given obscene pay increases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新近无耻地大涨薪水的上层阔佬们

Sense.DEF: having plenty of money
to become rich because of something – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 靠某物致富﹐因某事发财〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finance men had grown fat on managing other people’s money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金融界人士为别人打理钱财﹐养肥了自己。

Sense.DEF: a lip that is swollen because it has been hit
Sense.EXAMPLE: My friend was badly injured with bruised ribs and a fat lip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的朋友受伤严重﹐肋骨挫伤﹐嘴唇发肿。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
phat
– used to show approval, especially of someone or something that is fashionable, interesting, or attractive

GramExa.GLOSS: music that sounds good
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Check out these fat beats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来听听这些美妙的节奏。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a rise in fatness in children

Exponent.DEF: having too much flesh on your body. It is rude to tell someone that they are fat. It is also better not to use any of these words when talking directly to someone about their body.
Exponent.TRAN: 肥胖的〔说别人fat显得无礼﹐直接谈论他人身体时最好不要用此类词语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She thinks she’s fat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己胖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looks the same, just a little fatter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去老样子﹐只是稍微胖了些。

Exponent.DEF: weighing more than you should
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many medical conditions are caused by being overweight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多病都是超重引起的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was several kilos overweight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她超重几公斤。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that someone has a big body. Large is more common than big in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔体型〕大的〔英语书面语中large比big更常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My father was a big man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸块头很大。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: two large ladies
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名高大的女子

Exponent.DEF: extremely fat in a way that is dangerous to your health
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He went to a summer camp for obese teenagers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参加了专为肥胖青少年组织的夏令营。

Exponent.DEF: slightly fat in a nice-looking way – used especially about babies and children
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A chubby little baby was playing on the rug.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个胖嘟嘟的婴孩在地毯上玩耍。

Exponent.DEF: a woman or child who is plump is slightly fat, especially in a pleasant way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her mother was a plump cheerful woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈是个身材丰满﹑精神奕奕的女人。

Exponent.DEF: having soft loose skin that looks unattractive
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a flabby stomach
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 松弛的腹部
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her body was getting old and flabby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她日渐衰老﹐皮肤松弛。

Exponent.DEF: fat and round – used especially about fairly old men
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bishop was a portly middle-aged gentleman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 主教是个胖胖的中年绅士。

Sense.DEF: a substance that is stored under the skin of people and animals, that helps to keep them warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rolls of fat bulged over his collar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一圈圈的赘肉从他领口溢出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t like the meat - there was too much fat on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢那肉——太肥了。

Sense.DEF: an oily substance contained in certain foods
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cream has a high fat content .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶油中脂肪含量高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This cheese is relatively low in fat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种奶酪脂肪含量相对较低。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You should think about reducing your fat intake the amount of fat you eat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应当考虑减少脂肪摄入量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a low-fat diet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低脂饮食

Sense.DEF: an oily substance taken from animals or plants and used in cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Place the chicken in the hot fat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将鸡肉放进热油中。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the fat is in the fire
Sense.DEF: used to say that there will be trouble because of something that has happened

Sense.LEXUNIT: live off the fat of the land
Sense.DEF: to get enough money to live comfortably without doing much work
to start to become fat, especially because you are getting older or do not do much exercise
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因上年纪或不常运动而〕开始发胖

Sense.DEF: resulting in someone’s death
Sense.EXAMPLE: potentially fatal diseases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜在致命的疾病

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fatal climbing accident
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命的登山事故

Sense.EXAMPLE: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal be fatal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果治疗不当﹐这种病可能会致命。

Sense.DEF: having a very bad effect, especially making someone fail or stop what they are doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Disunity finally proved fatal to the rebels’ cause.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内部失和最终成为叛乱分子此番举事的致命弱点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was one fatal flaw serious weakness in his argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的论据中有个致命的缺陷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His presidential hopes suffered a fatal blow in New Hampshire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的总统梦在新罕布什尔州遭受致命打击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Telling your employees they’re unimportant is a fatal error.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当面说员工无足轻重是个灾难性的错误。

Sense.DEF: the belief that there is nothing you can do to prevent events from happening
believing that there is nothing you can do to prevent events from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fatalistic approach to life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宿命论的人生观

Sense.DEF: a death in an accident or a violent attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 50% increase in the number of traffic fatalities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通事故死亡人数50%的增长

Sense.DEF: the fact that a disease is certain to cause death
Sense.EXAMPLE: The most serious form of skin cancer has a 30 percent fatality rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最严重的皮肤癌致死率可达30%。

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you cannot control what happens to you
in a way that causes death

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two officers were fatally injured in the explosion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名警察在爆炸中受了致命伤。

Sense.DEF: in a way that will make something fail or be unable to continue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bolton’s idea was fatally flawed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 博尔顿的观点存在致命漏洞。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has been fatally undermined by his own finance minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被自己的财政部长挖了墙脚﹐处境岌岌可危。

Sense.DEF: a place where children who are fat go to lose weight and to exercise, especially in the summer
the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period
Sense.TRAN: 命中注定的事﹐命运的安排〔尤指不好的结局〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌﹐我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one knows what the fate of the hostages will be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人知道这些人质的命运将会如何。

Sense.DEF: a power that is believed to control what happens in people’s lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fate plays cruel tricks sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时命运的捉弄很残酷。

GramExa.GLOSS: something unexpected that happens
GramExa.EXAMPLE: By a strange twist of fate Smith’s first match is against the team that gave him the sack last season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于命运的奇特安排﹐史密斯首场比赛的对手正是上个赛季将他除名的那个队。

Sense.DEF: something terrible that might happen to you – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 比死还糟糕的事情﹐极可怕的事〔常作幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had rescued an innocent girl from a fate worse than death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将一个无辜的女孩子救出苦海。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We must prevent other children from suffering the same fate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定不能让其他孩子遭受相同的命运。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The beautiful old building met a sad fate when it was sold off to property developers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢漂亮的老房子被卖给房地产开发商﹐真是命运悲惨。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 决定某人/某事物的命运
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The meeting will decide the fate of the factory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议将决定工厂的命运。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it certain that something bad will happen to someone, especially that they will die
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 决定某人的命运〔尤指死亡的厄运〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Engine failure sealed the pilot’s fate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎故障决定了飞行员的命运。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: leave someone in a bad situation
a fate will happen to someone
someone suffers a particular fate
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某种命运降临到某人身上

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He did not intend to meet the same fate as his companion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想经历和同伴一样的命运。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The project suffered a similar fate to many of its predecessors.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目遭遇了与之前诸多项目相似的命运。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what finally happens to someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The ultimate fate of the refugees is in our hands.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民的最终命运在我们手里。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 可怕的/恐怖的/严酷的命运
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The crew of the ship met a terrible fate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该船的全体船员遭遇了可怕的命运。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not clear, definite, or decided

Collocate.COLLOC: your fate is in sb’s hands
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone will decide what happens to you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His fate is now in the hands of the judge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的命运目前在法官手里。

Sense.DEF: certain to happen or to do something because a mysterious force is controlling events
Sense.TRAN: 命运决定的﹐命中注定的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m fated to spend my last years in an old folks’ home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我注定要在养老院里度过晚年。

Sense.DEF: having an important, especially bad, effect on future events
Sense.TRAN: 〔对未来的发展〕有重大（负面）影响的﹐灾难性的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper on that fateful day in 1954 was Fred Martin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1954年那灾难性的一天﹐门将是弗雷德•马丁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When his rent was raised, he made the fateful decision to move north.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房租上涨﹐他作出重大决定﹐搬到北方去住。

Sense.DEF:
in Greek and Roman
mythology
, the three goddesses who decided what should happen in each person’s life. People sometimes say the Fates are for or against them when things are going well or badly.
Sense.TRAN: 命运三女神〔古希腊﹑古罗马神话中决定每个人命运的三位女神﹔人们常将事情顺利与否说成是命运三女神的帮助或阻挠〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Fates were conspiring to make it impossible for him to win the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 命运三女神共谋﹐使他没能赢得比赛。

Sense.DEF: a place where people who are fat can go to lose weight and improve their health
containing no fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: fat-free yoghurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱脂酸奶

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
a male parent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ask your father to help you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫你父亲帮你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andrew was very excited about becoming a father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁初为人父﹐非常激动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been like a father to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐他就像父亲一样。

GramExa.GLOSS: a man with two, three etc children
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 两个/三个/四个等孩子的父亲
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver, a father of four, escaped uninjured.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机是位有4个孩子的父亲﹐他安然逃脱﹐没有受伤。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve recently became the proud father of a 7lb 12oz baby girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫最近自豪地当上了爸爸﹐有了一个7磅12盎司的女儿。

Sense.DEF: a priest, especially in the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have sinned, Father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有罪﹐神父。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Father Devlin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德夫林神父

Sense.DEF: people related to you who lived a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our fathers were exiles from their natise land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的祖先被迫流落他乡。

Sense.DEF: a way of talking to or talking about God, used in the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 天父〔基督教里用于称呼上帝〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: our Heavenly Father
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的天父

Sense.DEF: the man who was responsible for starting something
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的创始人﹐某事物之父
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freud is the father of psychoanalysis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛伊德是精神分析之父。

Sense.DEF: if property or skill passes from father to son, children receive it or learn it from their parents
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a district where old crafts are handed down from father to son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一地区﹐古老的手艺父子相传。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a boy behaves like his father, especially when this behaviour is bad

Sense.LEXUNIT: a bit of how’s your father
Sense.DEF: the act of having sex – used humorously

to become the father of a child by making a woman
pregnant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hodgkins fathered seven children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍奇金斯育有七个子女。

Sense.DEF: to start an important new idea or system
Sense.TRAN: 首先提出﹐创立〔新思想或新体系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bevan fathered the concept of the National Health Service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比万首先提出了国民医疗服务体系的概念。

Sense.DEF: to claim that someone is responsible for something when they are not
Sense.TRAN: 把〔责任﹑某物的来源等〕误加于某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: A collection of Irish stories was fathered on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被误传为一本爱尔兰故事集的作者。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary man who wears red clothes, has a long white beard, and is said to bring presents to children at Christmas
an older man who you trust and respect
Sense.TRAN: 父亲般的人﹐受尊敬的人﹐长者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ken was a father figure to all of us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我们大家而言﹐肯就像是父亲。

Sense.DEF: the state of being a father
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea of fatherhood frightens me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到当父亲﹐我就害怕。

Sense.DEF: the skills and activities involved in being a father
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get me wrong, fathering certainly has changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别误解我的意思﹐为父之道肯定不同以前。

Sense.DEF: the father of your husband or wife
the place where someone or their family was born
kind and gentle in a way that is considered typical of a good father
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took my arm in a fatherly way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他像父亲一般挽住我的胳膊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fatherly advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈父般的忠告

Sense.DEF: a day on which people give cards and presents to their father
a unit for measuring the depth of water, equal to six feet or about 1.8 metres
Sense.TRAN: 英寻〔测量水深的单位﹐合6英尺或约1.8米〕

Sense.DEF: to understand what something means after thinking about it carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still can’t fathom out what she meant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是弄不清她的意思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark couldn’t fathom why she resented him so much.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克不明白她为什么那么恨他。

Sense.DEF: impossible to measure or understand
Sense.TRAN: 深不可测的﹔无法理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fathomless depths of the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洋深不可测之处

Sense.DEF: very great tiredness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam’s face was grey with fatigue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆累得脸色灰白。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s suffering from physical and mental fatigue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身心交瘁。

Sense.DEF: a weakness in metal or wood, caused when it is bent or stretched many times, which is likely to make it break
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属疲劳

Sense.DEF: loose-fitting army clothes
extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sara looked white and fatigued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉看上去脸色苍白﹐精疲力竭。

Sense.DEF: extremely tiring
an insulting word for someone who is fat
to make an animal become fatter so that it is ready to eat, or to become fat and ready to eat
Sense.TRAN: 育肥﹐催肥﹔（使）变肥﹔（使）长肥

Sense.DEF: to make an amount larger
Sense.EXAMPLE: These projects simply serve to fatten the pockets of developers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些项目只会肥了开发商的腰包。

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal fatter
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents are always trying to fatten me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母老是想把我喂得胖胖的。

Sense.DEF: likely to make you fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fats are the most fattening foods of all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脂肪是最能使人发胖的食物。

Sense.DEF: having or showing unkind attitudes towards people who are fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: fattist jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歧视胖人的笑话

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: fatty foods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高脂食品

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone who is fat
an acid that the cells in your body need to use food effectively
very silly or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: fatuous questions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚昧的问题

Sense.DEF: an official order made by an important Islamic religious leader
Sense.TRAN: 法特瓦〔伊斯兰宗教领袖发出的正式指令〕

Sense.DEF: the thing that you turn on and off to control the flow of water from a pipe
if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s your fault we’re late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们迟到都怪你。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上我没有睡好﹐但这是我自己的问题。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be sb’s fault for doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s my fault for not making your new job clearer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没把你的新工作解释清楚是我的责任。

Sense.DEF: if someone is at fault, they are responsible for something bad that has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police said that the other driver was at fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说是另一名司机的责任 。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people claim that it is the UN that is at fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人说联合国负有责任。

Subsense.DEF: something that is wrong with a machine, system, design etc, which prevents it from working properly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a design fault
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计失误

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It sounds as if there’s a fault in one of the loudspeakers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听起来好像其中一个扩音器有毛病。

Subsense.DEF: something that is wrong with something, which could be improved
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are two serious faults in Hobsbawm’s discussion of nationalism.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍布斯鲍姆关于民族主义的论述中有两个严重缺陷。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For all its faults in spite of its faults we love this city.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管这座城市有各种缺点﹐我们还是热爱它。

Subsense.DEF: a mistake in the way that something was made, which spoils its appearance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sweater had a fault in it and I had to take it back to the shop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件毛衣有瑕疵﹐我只好去商店退货。

Sense.DEF: a bad or weak part of someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: His worst fault is his arrogance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最大的缺点是傲慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I may have my faults , but ingratitude is not one of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能有我的缺点﹐但我决不会忘恩负义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For all his faults in spite of his faults he was a good father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管他有缺点﹐但还是个好父亲。

Sense.LEXUNIT: through no fault of her/my etc own
Sense.DEF: used to say that something bad that happened to someone was not caused by them
Sense.TRAN: 不是由于她/我等自己的错
Sense.EXAMPLE: Through no fault of our own we are currently two players short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们眼下缺两名队员﹐可这并非我们的错。

Sense.DEF: a large crack in the rocks that form the Earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: the San Andreas fault
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣安德烈亚斯断层

Sense.DEF: extremely generous, kind etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barry’s kind, caring and generous to a fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴里友善﹑体贴﹑大方过了头。

Sense.DEF:
a mistake made when a player is
serving
the ball in tennis

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 – Meaning 义项 3

Exponent.DEF: a problem in a machine, system, design etc that causes damage or makes it not work properly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火灾是由电气故障引起的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fault in the engine
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎故障

Exponent.DEF: a fault in something such as a product or machine, resulting from the way it was made or designed
Exponent.TRAN: 〔产品﹑机器等制造或设计上的〕缺陷
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车出厂前要检查是否有缺陷。

Exponent.DEF: a part of a plan, system, or argument that is not as good as the other parts, and makes it likely to fail
Exponent.TRAN: 〔计划﹑体系或论点的〕缺点﹐不足
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What are the strengths and weaknesses of each method?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一种方法分别有哪些优缺点？

Exponent.DEF: a fault in a plan, system, argument etc, especially one that makes it useless or not effective
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your argument has a fundamental flaw.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的论点有一个根本性的错误。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was one major flaw in his suggestion – we didn’t have enough money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的建议有个重大漏洞——我们钱不够。

Exponent.DEF: a fault in a computer program
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A bug in the system was quickly fixed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统中的一个错误很快就被修复。

Exponent.DEF: a small fault in the way something works, that can usually be easily corrected
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I noticed a small glitch when installing the software.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在安装软件的时候注意到一个小问题。

Exponent.DEF: something that is wrong in someone’s spelling, grammar, calculations etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The article was full of spelling mistakes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇文章里拼写错误到处都是。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that there is a problem in a machine, car etc, but you do not know what it is
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s something wrong with the computer – it won’t close down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑出了问题——没法关机了。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something for a mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge cannot be faulted on his decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位法官的判决无可指责。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is hard/difficult to fault sb/sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You might not like O’Donnel’s arrogance, but it’s hard to fault what he does on the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许不喜欢奥唐奈的傲慢﹐但是他在球场上的表现无可挑剔。

Sense.DEF: having no mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faultless performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完美的表现

Sense.DEF: a computer or machine that continues working even if it has a fault or when there is a fault in a program
not working properly, or not made correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers may ask for a refund if the goods are faulty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商品有问题的话﹐顾客可以要求退货。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a faulty gene that causes breast cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引起乳腺癌的一种缺陷基因

Sense.DEF: a faulty way of thinking about something contains a mistake, so that you make a wrong decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: an idea based on a faulty understanding of biology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建立在对生物学错误认识之上的一个观点

Sense.DEF: an ancient Roman god with the body of a man and the legs and horns of a goat
Sense.TRAN: 农牧神〔古罗马神话中长有人身﹑羊角和羊腿的神〕

Sense.DEF: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history
a style of painting that uses pure bright colours, which was developed in the early 20th century
Sense.TRAN: 野兽派﹐野兽主义〔20世纪初出现的一种画派﹐使用鲜艳的色彩〕

Sense.DEF: artificial, but made to look real
Sense.EXAMPLE: faux pearls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造珍珠

Sense.DEF: an embarrassing mistake in a social situation
a large flat pale green bean
a favourite person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a band that’s a college fave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受大学生喜爱的一支乐队

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
favour

the American spelling of
favourable

the American spelling of
favoured

the American spelling of
favourite

the American spelling of
favouritism
something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you do me a favour and tell Kelly I can’t make it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮个忙告诉凯莉说我来不了好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hired John as a favour to his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他雇约翰是给他父亲一个面子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul, can I ask you a favor ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗﹐能帮我一下吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I owed him a favour so I couldn’t say no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我欠他一个人情﹐所以无法拒绝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She helps me out when I have too much to do, and I return the favour when I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忙的时候她来帮忙﹐我能帮她的时候就还她人情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do yourself a favour and make sure you get some time to yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对自己好些﹐一定要留点时间给自己。

Sense.DEF: support, approval, or agreement for something such as a plan, idea, or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Senior ministers spoke in favour of the proposal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级部长们都表示支持这项提议。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I talked to Susie about it, and she’s all in favor completely approves of going.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟苏茜谈了此事﹐她完全赞成去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea may find favor with older people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法也许会得到年长者的支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vote was 60-59 in the government’s favor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 票数60比59﹐政府胜出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In Sweden and other countries, nuclear power has lost favor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在瑞典等国家﹐核能已不受欢迎。

GramExa.GLOSS: support something, and want to help it succeed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employers are more likely to look with favour on experienced candidates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主可能更加青睐有经验的求职者。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All in favour used when asking people to vote on something by raising a hand?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都同意吗？〔用于要求人们对某事举手表决时〕

GramExa.GLOSS: vote or decide to support something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对某事投赞成票/决定支持某事
GramExa.EXAMPLE: 288 members voted in favor of the ban.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 288名成员投票赞成这项禁令。

GramExa.GLOSS: make a legal decision that supports someone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 作出对某人有利的裁决

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is liked or approved of by people, or not liked or approved of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The island is very much in favour as a holiday destination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该岛作为度假地极受欢迎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stock is currently out of favor with investors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只股票现在已不受投资者追捧了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Radcliffe’s books began to find favour with the reading public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉德克利夫的书开始受到读者的青睐。

GramExa.GLOSS: become popular again
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fountain pens have come back in favour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自来水笔又受人欢迎了。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop being approved of
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Grammar-based teaching methods went out of favour in the 60s and 70s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在60及70年代﹐以语法为基础的教学法失宠了。

Sense.DEF: if something is in someone’s favour, it gives them an advantage over someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conditions on court are very much in Williams’ favour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭上的情形对威廉斯非常有利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new rules should actually work in your favor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新规定实际上应该对你们有利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Duncan had his height and weight in his favour during the fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拳击赛中﹐邓肯的身高和体重对他有利。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the odds are (stacked) in sb’s favour
GramExa.GLOSS: someone has a big advantage

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth in favour of sth
Sense.DEF: if you decide not to use one thing in favour of another, you choose the other one because you think it is better
Sense.TRAN: 决定选择某物而不选某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans for a tunnel were rejected in favour of a bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修建隧道的计划被否决﹐转而选择修建桥梁。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sb/sth no favours,not do sb/sth any favours
Sense.DEF: to do something that makes someone or something look worse than they are, or that does not help at all
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事没有一点好处/用处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Low interest rates don’t do savers any favours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低利率对于储户没有一点好处。

Sense.DEF: support that is given to one person or group and not to others, in a way that does not seem fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers should not show favour to any pupil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师不该偏袒任何学生。

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed because someone has asked a silly question or done something to upset people
Sense.TRAN: 拜托！得了吧！〔因某人提了愚蠢问题或惹人不快时说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do us a favour, Mike, and shut up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拜托﹐迈克﹐别再说了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you like it?’ ‘Do me a favour!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你喜欢吗？”“饶了我吧！”

Sense.DEF:
a
party favor
Sense.TRAN: 〔聚会上分发给宾客的〕小礼物

Sense.DEF: when you allow someone to have sex with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shared her sexual favors with many men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她同许多男人有性关系。

Sense.DEF: to prefer someone or something to other things or people, especially when there are several to choose from
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both countries seem to favour the agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个国家似乎都更倾向于这份协议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: loose clothing of the type favoured in Arab countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉伯国家的人喜欢穿的那种宽松服装

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Florida voters favored Bush over Gore by a very small margin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗里达州选民支持布什的略多于支持戈尔的。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone much better than someone else, in a way that is not fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tax cut that favours rich people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏向有钱人的减税

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a judicial system that favours men over women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏护男性的司法制度

Sense.DEF: to provide suitable conditions for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The current economy does not favour the development of small businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前的经济对小企业的发展不利。

Sense.DEF: to be expected to win or be the one that is successful
Sense.TRAN: 有望做某事〔指获胜或成功〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silva is favoured to win a medal in the marathon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 席尔瓦有望在马拉松比赛中获得奖牌。

Sense.DEF: to look like one of your parents or grandparents
Sense.TRAN: 容貌像﹐长得像〔父母或（外）祖父母中的某一人〕

Sense.DEF: to give someone something such as a look or reply
Sense.EXAMPLE: McIntosh favoured her with a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦金托什给了她一个微笑。

Sense.DEF: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: favourable film reviews
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正面的影评
Sense.EXAMPLE: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

Sense.DEF: suitable and likely to make something happen or succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病在合适的条件下会传播得很快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a financial environment that is favorable to job creation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有利于创造就业机会的金融环境

Sense.DEF:
if a
loan
, agreement, rate etc is favourable, the conditions of it are reasonable and not too expensive or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: a favourable interest rate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优惠利率
Sense.EXAMPLE: the favorable terms of the settlement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议上的优惠条款

Sense.DEF: making people like or approve of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 讨人喜欢的﹔赢得赞许的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A smart appearance makes a favourable impression at an interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整洁得体的外表在面试时会给人留下好印象。

Sense.DEF: receiving special attention, help, or treatment, sometimes in an unfair way
Sense.TRAN: 受到优待的﹔受宠的﹐得到偏爱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: favoured customers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到优待的客户
Sense.EXAMPLE: China’s most-favored-nation trading status with the US
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国给予中国的最惠国贸易地位

Sense.DEF: chosen or preferred by many people
Sense.TRAN: 由许多人选中的﹔受众人喜爱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brittany is a favoured holiday destination for families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布列塔尼是一个备受喜爱的家庭度假胜地。

Sense.DEF: a favoured team, player etc is one that is expected to win
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动队﹑运动员等〕被看好的﹐有望获胜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They went into the tournament as the favoured team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们作为热门球队进入锦标赛。

Sense.DEF: having desirable qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house in a favoured position on a hill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于山上好地段的房子

Sense.DEF: your favourite person or thing is the one that you like the most
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child’s favourite toy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子最喜欢的玩具
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite colour?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢什么颜色？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a favorite spot for picnickers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐者最喜欢的地方

Sense.DEF: a politician, sports player etc who is popular with people in the place that they come from
Sense.TRAN: 故乡骄子〔指受家乡人欢迎的政治家﹑运动员等〕

Sense.DEF: something that you like more than other things of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we have strawberries? They’re my favourite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我们来点草莓好吗？我最爱吃了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sweater that’s an old favorite
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直最喜欢的一件毛衣

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dahl’s books are firm favourites with children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔的书一向是儿童的最爱。

Sense.DEF: someone who is liked and treated better than others by a teacher or parent
Sense.EXAMPLE: You always were Dad’s favourite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一直是爸爸的宠儿。

GramExa.GLOSS: treat one person better than others
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The manager insisted he doesn’t play favorites.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位经理坚持说自己没有偏心。

Sense.DEF: the team, player etc that is expected to win a race or competition
Sense.TRAN: 最有希望获胜者﹔最被看好的参赛者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Italy were the favourites to win the World Cup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利队赢得世界杯的呼声最高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the hot favourite for the Booker Prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是布克奖最热门的人选。

Sense.DEF: when you treat one person or group better than others, in an unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: their favouritism towards their first son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对长子的偏爱

Sense.DEF:
a young
deer
a pale yellow-brown colour
having a pale yellow-brown colour
to praise someone and be friendly to them in an insincere way, because you want them to like you or give you something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I refused to fawn over her or flatter her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿意讨好她或恭维她。

Sense.DEF: a letter or message that is sent in electronic form down a telephone line and then printed using a special machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you get my fax?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你收到我的传真了吗？

Sense.DEF: a machine used for sending and receiving faxes
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your fax number?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的传真号码是多少？

Sense.DEF: the system of sending letters and messages using a fax machine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can book tickets by fax or on-line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以通过传真或网络订票。

Sense.DEF: to send someone a letter or message using a fax machine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She asked me to fax her the details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要我把详细情况传真给她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The contract should be faxed to him today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天应该把合同传真给他。

Sense.DEF:
a
fairy1
– used especially in poetry
Sense.TRAN: 仙子﹐小精灵〔尤用于诗歌中〕

Sense.DEF: if a new or difficult situation fazes you, it makes you feel confused or shocked, so that you do not know what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was embarrassed, but it didn’t faze Mike a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰很尴尬﹐但迈克并没有觉得困窘。

Sense.DEF: the police department in the US that is controlled by the central government, and that deals with crimes that break national laws rather than state laws

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= football club, used in the names of teams 足球俱乐部〔用于球队名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool FC
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦足球俱乐部

Sense.DEF: the official name of the British Foreign Office

a US government organization which makes sure that foods and drugs are safe enough to be sold. It decides which chemicals can legally be added to food, which medical drugs are safe, and how information about food and drugs should be shown on containers.

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= further education 继续教育

Sense.DEF: loyalty to a king, queen etc
the feeling you get when you are afraid or worried that something bad is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fear of flying
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 害怕坐飞机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are fears that share prices could decrease still further.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心股价会继续下滑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl’s parents expressed fears for her safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩的父母对她的安全表示担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children looked at her in fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们担心地看着她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People must be able to express their views without fear of criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众一定要能够表达出自己的观点﹐不用害怕受批评。

Sense.DEF: because you are worried that you will make something happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She finally ran away for fear that he would kill her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最后逃走了﹐唯恐他会杀她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got to the station early, for fear of missing her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早早到了车站﹐生怕接不到她。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that you are definitely not going to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you going to Bill’s party tonight?’ ‘No fear!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你今晚去参加比尔的聚会吗？”“当然不去！”

Sense.DEF: the possibility or danger that something bad might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no fear of revolt now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在不可能有人造反了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put the fear of God into sb
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that they must do something, by making sure they know what will happen if they do not do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Italian manager must have put the fear of God into his team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位意大利主教练一定是威胁过他的队员。

Sense.DEF: in a fair way
Sense.TRAN: 公平的[地]﹐公正的[地]﹐不偏袒的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law must be enforced without fear or favour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执法必须不偏不倚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her worst fear was never seeing her children again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最担心的是再也见不到自己的孩子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is not reasonable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He grew up with an irrational fear of insects.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从小到大都莫名其妙地怕虫子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very strong and difficult to change
without any reason
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As it turned out, these fears were groundless.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果﹐这些担心毫无根据。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop being afraid
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She managed to conquer her fear of flying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她克服了坐飞机的恐惧。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was shaking with fear after being held at gunpoint.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被枪口指着﹐吓得浑身发抖。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be very afraid
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We were gripped by fear as the boat was tossed around by the waves.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 船被波涛抛来抛去﹐我们害怕极了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be so afraid that you cannot move
show that what you were afraid of has actually happened
help someone stop being afraid

Collocate.COLLOC: be in fear of/for your life
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be afraid that you may be killed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Celia was in fear of her life when she saw the truck coming toward her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 西莉亚看到卡车向她驶来﹐担心自己有性命之虞。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The residents are too full of fear to leave their houses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民们恐惧万分﹐不敢踏出家门一步。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be always afraid of something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 生活在对某事物的恐惧之中

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had no fear of death.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不怕死。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 someone ‘has fear’. Say that 而要说 someone is frightened or 或 is afraid .

Exponent.DEF: a feeling of being frightened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was trembling with fear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吓得发抖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fear of failure should not stop you trying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该因为害怕失败而不再尝试。

Exponent.DEF: a feeling of great fear, because you think that something terrible is about to happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She let out a scream of pure terror.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发出了惊恐的尖叫声。

Exponent.DEF: a sudden feeling of fear, or a situation that makes you feel this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My body was shaking with fright.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吓得浑身发抖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You gave me a fright!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你吓了我一跳！

Exponent.DEF: a sudden feeling of fear or nervousness that makes you unable to think clearly or behave sensibly
Exponent.TRAN: 恐慌〔因而无法正常思考或行动〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was in such a panic that she hardly knew what she was doing!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊慌失措﹐几乎不知道自己在做什么！

Exponent.DEF: a feeling of fear or worry which shows in your voice or behaviour, because you think something bad might happen
Exponent.TRAN: 〔预料坏事即将发生而引起的〕恐慌
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I mentioned her name, he looked up at me in alarm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一提到她的名字﹐他便惊恐地看着我。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The streets were calm and there was no sign of alarm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街道上安安静静的,没有丝毫恐慌的迹象。

Exponent.DEF: a feeling that something bad or unpleasant might happen although there is no obvious reason why it should
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She felt the same sense of foreboding she had before her father died.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一种不祥之感﹐这与她在父亲去世前的感觉完全一样。

Exponent.DEF: a permanent strong unreasonable fear of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had a phobia about going to the dentist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有看牙医恐惧症。

Sense.DEF: to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fearing violence, the group asked for police protection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体担心发生暴力事件﹐所以请求警方保护。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police fear that there may be further terrorist attacks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方担心可能会有进一步的恐怖袭击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women feared to go out at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性晚上不敢外出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wife seemed depressed, and he feared for his children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子似乎患了忧郁症﹐他很担心自己的孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a terrifying ordeal in which she feared for her life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的一次有性命之虞的可怕磨难

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of people are feared dead in the ferry disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕已有数百人在这次渡船失事中丧生。

Sense.DEF: to think that the worst possible thing has happened or might happen
Sense.TRAN: 担心（会）发生最坏的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Tom heard about the accident he immediately feared the worst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆一听说出事﹐就担心会发生最坏的情况。

Sense.DEF: to be afraid of someone and what they might do
Sense.TRAN: 畏惧﹐害怕〔某人及其可能会做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a leader, he was distrusted and even feared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一个领导﹐他不被人信任﹐甚至让人畏惧。

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone that you think that something bad has happened or is true
Sense.TRAN: 恐怕〔用于告知某人不好的事已发生或属实〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I fear that there is little more we can do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我们无能为力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Were they satisfied?’ ‘I fear not.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们满意了吗？”“恐怕不满意。”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never fear, he’ll be with us soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐他很快就会和我们在一起。

Sense.DEF: frightened that something bad might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy and fearful child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个羞涩﹑胆怯的小孩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are fearful of rising crime in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们担心这个地区犯罪率上升。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officials are fearful that the demonstrations will cause new violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们担心示威游行会引发新的暴力事件。

Sense.DEF: extremely bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was in a fearful mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里一片狼藉。

Sense.DEF: very frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fearful creature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种骇人的生物

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you are afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: She glanced fearfully over her shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提心吊胆地回头看了一眼。

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s fearfully clever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常聪明。

Sense.DEF: not afraid of anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: These dogs are absolutely fearless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些狗什么都不怕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fearless explorer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个无畏的探险者

Sense.DEF: very frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fearsome weapon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的武器

Sense.DEF: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑想法或方法〕可行的﹐可实行的﹐行得通的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feasible solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可行的解决方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was no longer financially feasible to keep the community centre open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区中心再开下去经济上无法承受。

Sense.DEF: a large meal where a lot of people celebrate a special occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wedding feast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚筵
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king promised to hold a great feast for all his people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王允诺为全体子民举行盛宴。

Sense.DEF: a very good large meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the ingredients for a spaghetti feast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意粉大餐所需的全部原料

GramExa.GLOSS: a meal eaten secretly at night by children
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 午夜盛宴〔指小孩子在夜里偷偷吃东西〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when there are a lot of enjoyable things to see or do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Next week’s film festival should be a real feast for cinema-goers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期的电影节应该能让影迷大饱眼福。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The play is also a visual feast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏也是一场视觉盛宴。

Sense.DEF: a day or period when there is a religious celebration
Sense.EXAMPLE: the feast day of St. Francis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣方济各纪念日

Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of a particular food with great enjoyment
Sense.TRAN: 尽情享用某物﹐饱餐某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We feasted on chicken and roast potatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们饱餐了一顿鸡肉和烤土豆。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something with great pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 尽情欣赏某人/某物﹔大饱眼福
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you like luxury cars, feast your eyes on these.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你喜欢豪华轿车的话﹐就好好欣赏这些吧。

Sense.DEF: to eat and drink a lot to celebrate something
something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They climbed the mountain in 28 days, a remarkable feat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们历时28天登上那座高山﹐真是了不起的壮举。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an incredible feat of engineering
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项了不起的工程技术成就

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the woman who performed the feat of sailing around the world alone
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实现独自环球航行壮举的女性

GramExa.GLOSS: something that is difficult to do
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is no mean feat to perform such a difficult piece.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 演奏这么难的乐章可不是一般的成就。

Sense.DEF: one of the light soft things that cover a bird’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ostrich feather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根鸵鸟羽毛

GramExa.GLOSS: a bed etc that is filled with feathers

Sense.DEF: something you have done that you should be proud of
Sense.TRAN: 值得自豪的成就﹐卓越的成就

Sense.DEF: to get money by dishonest methods

to put feathers on an
arrow
the practice of letting workers keep their jobs even if they are not needed or do not work well
Sense.TRAN: 超额雇工〔指保留多余的或工作表现不好的工人的做法〕

Sense.DEF:
a long
scarf
made of feathers and worn around a woman’s neck
extremely silly
a stick with feathers on the end that you use to remove dust
having feathers, or made from feathers
a bird – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 长羽毛的朋友﹐鸟〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
a
boxer
who weighs less than 57.15 kilograms, and who is heavier than a
bantamweight
but lighter than a
lightweight
Sense.TRAN: 羽量级拳击手﹝体重在57.15公斤以下﹐级别在最轻量级和轻量级之间﹞

Sense.DEF: looking or feeling light and soft, like a feather
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant has feathery leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物长着羽状叶片。

Sense.DEF: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
Sense.EXAMPLE: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An important feature of Van Gogh’s paintings is their bright colours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡•高画作的一个重要特点是色彩鲜亮。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel’s only redeeming features things that make it acceptable were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The most distinctive feature of the dinosaurs was their size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐龙最明显的特点就是它们的巨大体型。

Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the distinguishing features features that are different from other things of the same sort of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing about a subject in a newspaper or a magazine, or a special report on television or on the radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或杂志的〕特写﹔〔电视或广播的〕专题节目

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a feature on holidaying with your dog
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一档带上狗去度假的专题节目

Sense.DEF: a part of someone’s face, such as their eyes, nose etc
Sense.TRAN: 面貌的一部分〔如眼﹑鼻等〕﹔面貌 （特征）﹔五官
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had fine delicate features.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眉清目秀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were her best feature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的五官中眼睛长得最好。

Sense.DEF: a part of the land, especially a part that you can see
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hedges are an important feature of the landscape in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树篱是英国一大景观特征。

Sense.DEF: a film being shown at a cinema
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a couple of short cartoons before the main feature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正片放映前有一些卡通短片。

GramExa.GLOSS: when two films are shown together

Sense.DEF: to include or show something as a special or important part of something, or to be included as an important part
Sense.TRAN: 以…为特色﹐是…的特征﹔是…的重要组成
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibition features paintings by Picasso.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次展览重点展出毕加索的画作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cruise ship featuring extensive spa facilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以大量水疗设施为特色的邮轮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A study of language should feature in an English literature course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学习应当成为英语文学课的重要组成部分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pupils visited some of the websites featured in the article.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学生们访问了文章中专题介绍的一些网站。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Violence seems to feature heavily in all of his books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力似乎在他所有作品中都占有相当比重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film featured Brando as the Godfather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片由白兰度主演教父。

Sense.DEF: to show a film, play etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Retro Theatre is featuring films by Frank Capra this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经典剧场本周上映弗兰克•卡普拉导演的影片。

Sense.DEF: the tendency to keep adding extra features onto a piece of electronic equipment, so that the original product gets more complicated and more difficult to use rather than better – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 功能蔓延〔指在电子设备上增加过多功能的倾向﹐此做法使原来的产品不是变得更好而是更加复杂且难以使用﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a full-length film that has a story and is acted by professional actors, and which is usually shown in a cinema
a featureless place has no interesting parts to notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: featureless plains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无特色的平原

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= February 二月

Sense.DEF: full of nervous excitement or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a febrile imagination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂想

Sense.DEF: relating to or caused by a fever
the second month of the year, between January and March

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum died last February.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈去年二月份过世了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can do it in February.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在二月份做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was allowed home on February 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在2月6日获准回家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Francis was born on 6th February 1928.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西斯出生于1928年2月6日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finally arrived February 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最终在2月6日抵达。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
faeces
lacking determination, and not achieving anything in your life
Sense.TRAN: 软弱的﹐窝囊的﹐没出息的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alice’s feckless younger brother
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯那个没出息的弟弟

Sense.DEF: able to produce many children, young animals, or crops

the past tense and past participle of
feed

a police officer in the
fbi
Sense.TRAN: 联邦调查局探员[调查员]

Sense.DEF: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Switzerland is a federal republic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

Sense.DEF: relating to the central government of a country such as the US, rather than the government of one of its states
Sense.EXAMPLE: federal law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦法
Sense.EXAMPLE: federal taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦税

Sense.DEF:
the
fbi
belief in or support for a federal system of government
if a group of states federate, they join together to form a federation
a group of organizations, clubs, or people that have joined together to form a single group
Sense.EXAMPLE: the National Federation of Women’s Institutes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔英国及英联邦国家〕妇女协会全国联合会

Sense.DEF: a group of states that have joined together to form a single group
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Russian Federation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯联邦

Sense.DEF: when groups of people, states etc join together to form a larger group

a soft hat with a
brim
that curls upwards slightly
annoyed or bored, and wanting something to change
Sense.TRAN: 厌烦的﹐不满的﹐无法再忍受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt tired and a bit fed up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到疲倦﹐还有点不耐烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m really fed up with this constant rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 连着下雨我都烦死了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna got fed up with waiting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜都等烦了。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work
Sense.TRAN: 〔付给专业人员的〕工作酬金﹐服务费
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月付35英镑﹐即可使用健身房和游泳池。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some companies will sell the items for you, for a small fee.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些公司可代你出售这些物品﹐只收取少量费用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The school fees are extremely high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学校学费极高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very large fee
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Customers are being charged a hefty fee for their telephone service.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 客户被收取巨额电话费。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a fee to enter a place
a fee to become a member of a club or organization
money paid for being taught

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 诊疗费/律师费/会计师费等

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a charge you pay when buying a ticket
the money a television licence costs

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The accountant charged a big fee for his services.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会计师收取了一大笔服务费。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You have to pay a small fee to rent a locker.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 租用储物柜须支付少量费用。

Sense.DEF: extremely weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was too feeble to leave her room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身体虚弱﹐无法走出自己的房间。

Sense.DEF: not very good or effective
Sense.TRAN: 蹩脚的﹔无效的﹐站不住脚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeble excuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牵强的借口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rather feeble committee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个相当软弱的委员会

Sense.DEF: stupid or not sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeble-minded policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的政策

Sense.DEF: having much less than average intelligence

Subsense.DEF: to give food to a person or animal
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Have you fed the cat?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喂猫了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was too weak to feed herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虚弱极了﹐无法自己进食。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several children were feeding bread to the ducks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个小孩子在拿面包喂鸭子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were fed well on her mother’s home cooking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈做的家常菜他们吃着很好。

Subsense.DEF: to provide enough food for a group of people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: groceries to feed a family of five
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养活一家五口人的食品
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The prison is required to feed and clothe the prisoners.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱按规定需要为犯人提供衣食。

Sense.DEF: to give a special substance to a plant, which helps it grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feed the tomatoes once a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周给番茄施一次肥。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Feed houseplants with a liquid fertilizer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给室内盆栽植物施液肥。

Sense.DEF: if a baby or an animal feeds, they eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frogs generally feed at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青蛙一般在夜间进食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let your baby feed as long as she wants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让小宝宝想吃就吃。

Sense.DEF: having plenty of food or not enough food
Sense.TRAN: 吃得好的/吃不饱的/吃得不好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-dressed, well-fed woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个衣着考究﹑营养充足的女子

Sense.DEF: to put information into a computer over a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Figures are fed into the computer, which then predicts the likely profit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据输入电脑后﹐由电脑来预测可能的利润。

Sense.DEF: to supply something, especially a liquid, gas, or electricity
Sense.TRAN: 供给﹐供应〔尤指液体﹑气体或电〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public baths are fed by natural springs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共浴池的水引自天然泉水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sound is fed directly to the headphones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 声音直接进入耳机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laura crouched by the fire, feeding it with dry sticks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉蹲在火堆旁添加干柴。

Sense.DEF: to put something into something else, especially gradually and through a small hole
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过一个小孔慢慢地〕把…放进[塞进]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A tube was fed down the patient’s throat into her stomach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根管子从病人的喉管插入胃部。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fed her last two coins into the machine for a cup of coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将最后两枚硬币塞进机器里﹐买了一杯咖啡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Shelton fed the electricity meter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢尔顿往预付费电度表里投币。

Sense.DEF: to increase the strength of an emotion, desire etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her depression grew, fed by her bitter experiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛苦的经历令她更加忧郁了。

Sense.DEF: to satisfy a strong need, such as a need for a drug
Sense.EXAMPLE: He committed both crimes to feed his addiction to heroin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他犯这两桩罪都是为了满足他的海洛因瘾。

Sense.DEF: to give someone information or ideas over a period time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She feeds the media with stories, which is a way of getting free advertising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是有故事让媒体报道﹐这相当于免费广告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: US intelligence had been feeding false information to a KGB agent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国情报人员一直向克格勃间谍提供假情报。

Sense.DEF: to throw or hit a ball to someone else on your team, especially so that they can make a point

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fed the ball to Jol, who scored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把球传给乔尔﹐乔尔射门得分。

Sense.DEF: to say things to another performer so that they can make jokes
Sense.TRAN: 为某人捧哏﹐为某人提供笑料

Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of food
to send a television or radio programme somewhere so that it can be broadcast
Sense.TRAN: 向电视台[电台]传送…以供播出

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something which is not true, so that they will do what you want
to give advice or criticism to someone about something they have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re just waiting for the manager to feed back on it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就是在等经理对此作出反馈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am grateful to all those who fed back their comments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对所有提出意见的人表示感谢。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They feed back to the government the reactions of the people affected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将有关民众的反应反馈给政府。

Sense.DEF: to have an effect on something or help to make it happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The influence of Italian designer fashion feeds into sports fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利名师设计的时装潮流影响了运动时装。

Sense.DEF: if an animal feeds off something, it gets food from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: birds that feed off the seeds from trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以树籽为食的鸟

Sense.DEF: to use something to increase, become stronger, or succeed – sometimes used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 因…而壮大[成功]〔有时含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: fad diets that feed off our desire to be thin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因我们的瘦身愿望而风靡一时的节食法

Sense.DEF: if an animal feeds on a particular food, it usually eats that food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Owls feed on mice and other small animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫头鹰以老鼠和其他小动物为食。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or process feeds on something, it becomes stronger because of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种感觉或过程〕因…变得更强烈
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prejudice feeds on ignorance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无知助长偏见。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a lot of food to make them more healthy
one of the times when you give milk to a small baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: the two a.m. feed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨两点的一次喂奶

Sense.DEF: food for animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: fish feed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼食

Sense.DEF:
a tube or piece of equipment which supplies a machine with something, especially
fuel
Sense.TRAN: 输油管[装置]﹔进料管[装置]

Sense.DEF: when a television or radio signal, computer information etc is sent somewhere, or the connection that is used to do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播信号﹑计算机信息等的〕传送﹐传输
Sense.EXAMPLE: a live satellite feed from the space station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自空间站的实时卫星传输

Sense.DEF: a big meal
advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to give each student some feedback on the task.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量对每个学生的作业都提点意见。

Sense.DEF:
a very unpleasant high noise, caused when a
microphone
is too close to an
amplifier
Sense.TRAN: 〔话筒太靠近放大器而产生的〕反馈噪音

Sense.DEF: a bag put around a horse’s head containing food
a container with food for animals or birds
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bird feeder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟食罐

Sense.DEF: something that provides supplies for something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Shyok River is a major feeder of the Indus River.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什约克河是印度河的主要支流。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The length of the feeder pipe is 50m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 输送管长50米。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that supplies something to a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: the printer’s paper feeder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印机的进纸装置

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that eats in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Catfish are bottom feeders they feed at the bottom of rivers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲶鱼以河底生物为食。

Sense.DEF:
a small road, railway line, or
airline
service that takes traffic to a main road, line, or service
Sense.TRAN: 〔汇入主干车道的〕支路﹔公路[铁路]支线﹔〔航线的〕支线

Sense.DEF:
a school from which many students go to a
secondary school
in the same area
a plastic bottle used for giving milk to a baby or young animal
a place where a group of animals or birds find food to eat
to experience a particular physical feeling or emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you still feel hungry?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还觉得饿吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can never tell what he’s feeling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的感受你永远说不准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop exercising if you feel any pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是感到疼痛就停止练习。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling a little better today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天觉得好一些了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marie immediately felt guilty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽当即感觉内疚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When his dad left, he felt as though his world had turned upside-down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸离开后﹐他觉得自己的世界完全乱了套。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt like I’d really achieved something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉自己真的有所成就了。

Sense.DEF: to notice something that is happening to you, especially something that is touching you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt his warm breath on her cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉到他温暖的气息拂在脸颊上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthquake was felt as far south as San Diego.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向南直到圣迭戈都有震感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt his arms go round her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到他搂住了自己。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt myself blushing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己脸红了。

Sense.DEF: to give you a particular physical feeling, especially when you touch or hold something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her hands felt rough.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双手粗糙。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house felt hot and stuffy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里又热又闷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My leg feels as if it’s broken.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一条腿好像断了似的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s nice fabric - it feels like velvet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面料不错——摸上去像丝绒。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, event etc feels good, strange etc, that is the emotion or feeling that it gives you
Sense.EXAMPLE: After twenty years, seeing him again felt very strange.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20年后再见到他﹐我感觉很不自在。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It felt wonderful to be wearing clean clothes again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 又能穿上干净衣服﹐这感觉真好。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How does it feel to be 40?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 40岁是什么感觉？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a year since her daughter died, but to her, it still feels like yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她女儿去世有一年了﹐但是对她来说﹐感觉还像是昨天。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular opinion, especially one that is based on your feelings, not on facts
Sense.TRAN: 以为﹐认为〔尤指根据感觉而不是事实〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the parents felt the school wasn’t doing enough about bullying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些家长认为学校在解决校园欺凌的问题上做得不够。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How would you feel about working with Nicole for a while?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与妮科尔共事一段时间你觉得怎么样？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The experience of rape can change how a woman feels about her body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被强奸的经历会改变一个女性对自己身体的看法。

GramExa.GLOSS: think that something is definitely true
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt sure she’d made the right decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确信自己作了正确的决定。

Sense.DEF: to want to have something or do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t feel like going to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想去上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you feel like another drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想再喝一杯吗？

Sense.DEF: to touch something with your fingers to find out about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt his forehead. Perhaps he had a temperature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摸了摸他的额头﹐他可能发烧了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum, feel this stone. Isn’t it smooth?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐摸摸这块石头﹐是不是很光滑？

GramExa.PROPFORM: feel how hard/soft/rough etc sth is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He could feel how damp his shirt was against his chest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉到潮乎乎的衬衫贴在胸前。

Sense.DEF: to search for something with your fingers
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt in her bag for a pencil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在袋子里摸索着找铅笔。

Sense.LEXUNIT: feel the force/effects/benefits etc of sth
Sense.DEF: to experience the good or bad results of something
Sense.TRAN: 感受到某事物的力量/影响/好处等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local economy is beginning to feel the effects of the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地经济开始感受到经济萎缩带来的影响。

Sense.LEXUNIT: feel the need to do sth
Sense.DEF: to believe that you need to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children who can talk to their parents feel less need to try drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够与父母交谈的孩子不大会起吸毒的念头。

Subsense.DEF: to move carefully, with your hands out in front of you, because you cannot see properly
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因看不清楚而伸出手来〕摸索前进
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Silently, she felt her way across the room.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一言不发地摸索着走到房间的另一头。

Subsense.DEF: to do things slowly and carefully, because you are not completely sure about a new situation
Subsense.TRAN: 〔由于对新情况完全无把握而〕谨慎行事﹐摸索

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The European Union is still feeling its way towards common policies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟还在摸索着寻求共同政策。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they can do something if they want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Could I use your phone for a minute?’ ‘Feel free.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能用一下你的电话吗？”“请便。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please feel free to make suggestions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有建议请尽管提。

Sense.DEF: used to express sympathy with someone or with a remark they have just made
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know how you feel, Mark, but maybe it’s better not to confront him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我理解你的心情﹐马克﹐但是不跟他硬碰硬可能会更好。

Sense.DEF: to not feel as healthy or happy as usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what’s wrong. I just don’t feel quite myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道怎么回事﹐就是觉得身体不是很舒服。

Sense.DEF: to realize that you are not as young or active as you used to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Looking at his grandson made him really feel his age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看着孙子﹐他感觉自己真的老了。

Sense.DEF: to suffer because of cold or hot weather
Sense.EXAMPLE: Old people tend to feel the cold more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人往往更怕冷。

Sense.DEF: to react very strongly to a bad event, especially someone’s death
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人的〕死感到悲痛/对损失感到难过等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan felt her grandmother’s death more than the others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于祖母的去世﹐苏珊比谁都悲痛。

Sense.DEF: to feel sympathy for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the Center, the other mothers know what it’s like, and they really feel for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在中心里﹐其他母亲都了解这种情况﹐她们非常同情你。

Sense.DEF: to find out what someone’s opinions or feelings are, without asking them directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought I’d feel out some of my colleagues before the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在开会之前探听一下一些同事的意见。

Sense.DEF: to touch someone sexually, without their permission

Head.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句

Sense.DEF: to have the strength, energy etc to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just didn’t feel up to going.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是没力气去。

Sense.DEF: a quality that something has that makes you feel or think a particular way about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite their age, the photographs have a modern feel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管年代久远﹐这些照片还是有一种现代的感觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The restaurant has a nice relaxed feel about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅令人感到轻松自在。

Sense.DEF: the way that something feels when you touch it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like the feel of this cloth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢这块布料的手感。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft feathery feel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羽毛般柔软的感觉
