Sense.DEF: to have or develop an understanding of something and skill in doing it
Sense.TRAN: 对某事有天赋/培养做某事的技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: exercises that give a child a feel for numbers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 培养孩子数字感的练习

Sense.DEF: when you use your hands, body etc to feel something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She found the light switch by feel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摸到了电灯开关。

Sense.DEF: one of the two long things on an insect’s head that it uses to feel or touch things. Some sea animals also have feelers.
Sense.TRAN: 〔昆虫或某些海洋动物的〕触角﹐触须

Sense.DEF: to carefully try to discover what people think about something that you want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: They seem interested in a peace settlement and have begun putting out feelers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们似乎有意达成和平协议﹐并且已经开始在探风了。

Sense.DEF: a film etc whose main purpose is to make you feel happy
Sense.TRAN: 让人愉悦的影片/节目/音乐等

Sense.DEF: a feeling among ordinary people that everything is going well, and that they do not need to worry about losing their jobs or spending money
an emotion that you feel, such as anger, sadness, or happiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knowing we’d won was a wonderful feeling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知我们赢了﹐感觉真好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a terrible feeling of guilt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 深深的负罪感

Sense.DEF: someone’s feelings are their thoughts, emotions, and attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s considerate of other people’s feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很顾及他人的感情。

Sense.DEF: a belief or opinion about something, especially one that is influenced by your emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: My personal feeling is that not enough has been done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我个人的意见是做得不够。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has strong feelings on the issue of abortion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对于堕胎问题的意见很强烈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a survey on people’s feelings about the candidates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于民众对于候选人态度的调查

Sense.EXAMPLE: His gut feeling opinion based on emotion was that Burns was probably guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凭直觉感到伯恩斯可能有罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had this funny feeling not easily explained that something was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我莫名地感到有些不对劲。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is probably true, or will probably happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leslie suddenly got the feeling that somebody was watching her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯莉突然感觉到有人在监视她。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a sneaking feeling a slight feeling that something is true, without being sure that they were laughing at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他隐隐觉得他们在嘲笑他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gary had a sinking feeling had a sudden bad feeling that something was true that he was making a mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里突然心情一沉﹐觉得自己弄错了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a good feeling about this. I think it’s going to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对此很乐观﹐我觉得会奏效的。

Sense.DEF: a general attitude among a group of people about a subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔一群人对某一问题的〕普遍情绪
Sense.EXAMPLE: the anti-American feeling in the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的反美情绪

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Johnson underestimated the strength of public feeling against the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊低估了公众反战情绪的强烈程度。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the depth of feeling against nuclear weapons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对核武器的强烈情绪

Sense.DEF: something that you feel in your body, such as heat, cold, tiredness etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I keep getting this funny feeling a strange feeling in my neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脖子一直有这种奇怪的感觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: feelings of dizziness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 眩晕感

Sense.DEF: the ability to feel pain, heat etc in part of your body
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体部位疼痛﹑发热等的〕感觉﹐知觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry had lost all feeling in his toes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里的脚趾已经完全没感觉了。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 地方/书籍等给人的影响
Sense.DEF: the effect that a place, book, film etc has on people and the way it makes them feel
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方﹑书籍﹑电影等给人的〕感觉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the town’s strong feeling of history
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇厚重的历史感

Sense.EXAMPLE: It gives a feeling of eating outdoors, without having to worry about being rained on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它让人感觉是在户外进餐﹐又不必担心被雨淋。

Sense.DEF: said when you understand how someone feels because you have had the same experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s so embarrassing when you can’t remember someone’s name.’ ‘I know the feeling.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “记不起别人的名字真是尴尬。”“我理解那种感受。”

Sense.DEF: said when you have the same feeling about someone as they have towards you
Sense.EXAMPLE: My dad hated my boyfriend, and the feeling was mutual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸反感我男朋友﹐我男朋友也讨厌我爸爸。

Sense.DEF: anger, lack of trust etc between people, especially after an argument or unfair decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因争论或不公正的决定产生的〕反感﹐恶感﹐不满
Sense.EXAMPLE: The changes have caused a lot of ill feeling among the workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变革引起了职工的强烈不满。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you feel very angry, happy etc
Sense.TRAN: 情绪激动地﹔充满感情地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chang spoke with great feeling about the injustices of the regime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 张情绪激动地讲述该政权的种种不公。

Subsense.DEF: an ability to do something or understand a subject, which you get from experience
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an orchestra that has always shown a special feeling for Brahms’ music
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对勃拉姆斯的音乐素来有独到领悟的一支管弦乐队

Subsense.DEF: a natural ability to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He has a natural feeling for mathematical ideas.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对数学概念有天生的感觉。

Sense.DEF: a way of reacting to things using your emotions, instead of thinking about them carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Romantic writers valued feeling above all else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浪漫派作家注重感觉超过其他一切。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 好的/很好的/美妙的等感觉
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a great feeling when you try something new and it works.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尝试新事物并获得成功﹐这感觉特棒。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A deep feeling of sadness came over her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 深深的悲伤袭上她的心头。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a strong feeling of anger among the workers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们群情激愤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I remember experiencing a feeling of tremendous excitement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得有过一种极其兴奋的感觉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My work gives me a feeling of achievement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作给我一种成就感。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause it
make someone feel upset
tell other people what you are feeling or thinking
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 表达感情, 透露想法

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have both positive and negative feelings
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her parents had mixed feelings about the marriage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母对这桩婚姻喜忧参半。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: people have strong feelings, especially of anger

Sense.DEF: showing strong feelings
Sense.TRAN: 动人的﹐多情的﹔表现强烈感情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeling look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满感情的眼神

Sense.DEF: a school which you have to pay to go to

a student or
patient
who pays for their education or medical treatment

the plural of
foot
to pretend to have a particular feeling or to be ill, asleep etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: Feigning a headache, I went upstairs to my room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我假装头痛﹐上楼到自己房间去了。

Sense.DEF:
a movement or an attack that is intended to deceive an opponent, especially in
boxing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指拳击中的〕佯攻﹐虚晃一拳

Sense.DEF:
to pretend to hit someone in
boxing
having a strong determined character and being willing to argue with people – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 顽强自信的﹔坚决而据理力争的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: DiFranco charmed the audience with her feisty spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪芙兰蔻以其顽强的精神倾倒了观众。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
falafel
a type of grey or white mineral
Sense.TRAN: 长石〔一种灰色或白色的矿物〕

Sense.DEF: said to wish someone happiness
well-chosen and suitable
Sense.TRAN: 恰当的﹐贴切的﹐选得好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a felicitous choice of candidate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最佳候选人

Sense.DEF: happiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: domestic felicity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭幸福

Sense.DEF: the quality of being well-chosen or suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a felicity of language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言的贴切

Sense.DEF: suitable or well-chosen remarks or details
relating to cats or other members of the cat family, such as lions
looking like or moving like a cat
Sense.EXAMPLE: She moves with feline grace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她步履轻盈。

Sense.DEF: a cat or a member of the cat family, such as a tiger

the past tense of
fall
a mountain or hill in the north of England
to cut down a tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: More than 100 trees were felled in just over an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短短一个多小时100多棵树就被砍倒了。

Sense.DEF: to knock someone down with great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper was felled by a coin thrown from the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员被观众扔出的一枚硬币击倒。

Sense.DEF: doing a lot of things at the same time, using only one action
Sense.EXAMPLE: A single company can close a factory, eliminating 74,000 jobs in one fell swoop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单单一个公司就能让一家工厂关闭﹐一下子74,000个工作岗位就没了。

Sense.DEF: a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a fella outside who wants to see you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门口有个家伙想见你。

Sense.DEF:
a
boyfriend
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think of Janet’s new fella?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得珍妮特的新男友怎么样？

Sense.DEF:
the practice of touching a man’s
penis
with the lips and tongue to give sexual pleasure
a man
a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗人很随和。

Sense.DEF: people that you work with, study with, or who are in the same situation as you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wooderson’s courage earned him the respect of his fellows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍德森的勇气赢得了同事的尊敬。

Sense.DEF:
a
graduate
student who has a fellowship in a university
a member of an important society or a college
Sense.TRAN: 〔权威学会的〕会员﹔〔学院的〕董事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is a Fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是皇家外科医生学会会员。

Sense.DEF: people that you work with, study with, or who are in the same situation as you
other people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all have obligations to our fellow men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都对人类负有责任。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of sympathy and friendship towards someone because they are like you
Sense.EXAMPLE: As an only child myself, I had a fellow feeling for Laura.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己也是个独生子﹐所以和劳拉有同感。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of friendship resulting from shared interests or experiences
Sense.TRAN: 〔因共同的兴趣或经历而产生的〕友情﹐友谊
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular outings contribute to a sense of fellowship among co-workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常外出游玩可以增进同事之间的友谊。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who share an interest or belief, especially Christians who have religious ceremonies together
Sense.TRAN: 〔具有共同兴趣或信念的〕团体﹔〔基督教的〕团契

Sense.DEF: a job at a university which involves making a detailed study of a particular subject

Subsense.DEF: money given to a student to allow them to continue their studies at an advanced level
Subsense.TRAN: 〔为让学生深造而授予的〕奖学金
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Florian came to the United States on a Fulbright fellowship.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛里安因获得富布赖特奖学金而得以来到美国。

Subsense.DEF: a group of officials who decide which students will receive this money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He received a gold medal from the Artists’ Fellowship in New York.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得纽约艺术家奖学金评选组颁发的一枚金牌。

Sense.DEF: someone who supports and agrees with the beliefs of an organization, but does not belong to it - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 同路人﹐同情者〔赞成某组织宗旨的人﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is guilty of a serious crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: By law, convicted felons criminals who are sent to prison may not own or use guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照法律﹐已判刑的重罪犯不能持有或使用枪支。

Sense.DEF: a serious crime such as murder

the past tense and past participle of
feel
a thick soft material made of wool, hair, or fur that has been pressed flat
a pen that has a hard piece of felt at the end that the ink comes through

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= female 女性﹔雌性动物
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= feminine 女性的

Sense.DEF: relating to women or girls

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性选民

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半数以上的员工是女性。

Sense.DEF: belonging to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs

Sense.DEF: a female plant or flower produces fruit
a female part of a piece of equipment has holes into which the male part can be fitted
an animal that belongs to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs
a woman or girl
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a group, females performed better on the test than males.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整体来说﹐女性在这次测试中胜过男性。

Sense.DEF: a plant that produces flowers or fruit

vagina
when she is having sex, so that she will not have a baby
having qualities that are considered to be typical of women, especially by being gentle, delicate, and pretty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dianne loved pretty feminine things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜喜爱漂亮有女人味的东西。

Sense.DEF: relating to being female
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional feminine roles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的女性角色
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amelia’s report describes the experience from a feminine point of view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿梅莉亚的报道从女性角度描写了这种经历。

Sense.DEF:
a feminine noun,
pronoun
etc belongs to a class of words that have different
inflections
from
masculine
or
neuter
words
qualities that are considered to be typical of women, especially qualities that are gentle, delicate, and pretty
Sense.TRAN: 女子气质〔尤指温柔﹑娇小和美丽〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to lose your femininity to be an independent, successful woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为独立成功的女性并非就会失去女人味。

Sense.DEF: the belief that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
someone who supports the idea that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been an outspoken feminist for over twenty years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20多年来﹐她一直是个直言不讳的女权主义者。

Sense.DEF: to change something so that it includes women, is suitable for women, or is considered typical of women
Sense.TRAN: 使女性化﹔使带上女子气
Sense.EXAMPLE: women who resist cultural attempts to feminize them
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对文化上要求其具有女性气质的女人

Sense.DEF: a beautiful woman who men find very attractive, even though she may make them unhappy

the
thigh
bone
an area of low flat wet land, especially in eastern England
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指英格兰东部的〕沼泽地带﹔湿地

Sense.DEF: a structure made of wood, metal etc that surrounds a piece of land
Sense.TRAN: 〔木头﹑金属等做的〕栅栏﹐围栏﹐篱笆

Sense.DEF: a wall or other structure that horses jump over in a race or competition
someone who buys and sells stolen goods
to avoid saying which side of an argument you support

PIC.HEADING: FENCES 栅栏﹔障碍物
PIC.PICCONTENT: barbed wire fence 带刺铁丝网；electric fence 电围栏；fence/picket fence AmE 【美】尖桩篱栅；show jumping fence 马术赛障碍物；railings 栏杆

Sense.DEF: to put a fence around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: old farmhouses and fenced gardens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧农舍和带围栏的花园

Sense.DEF: to fight with a long thin sword as a sport
to answer someone’s questions in a clever way in order to get an advantage in an argument
to surround a place with a fence
Sense.EXAMPLE: The yard was fenced in to keep out wolves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 院子用篱笆围起防止狼进来。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that they cannot leave a place or do what they want
Sense.TRAN: 限制〔某人〕的自由﹐束缚〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young mothers often feel fenced in at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻母亲往往感觉自己被束缚在家里。

Sense.DEF: to separate one area from another area with a fence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a planting area fenced off from the main garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用栅栏与主花园隔开的种植区

Sense.DEF: fence-mending trips, talks etc are between countries who have a disagreement about something, and are meant to try to improve relations between them
someone who fights with a long thin sword as a sport
the sport of fighting with a long thin sword
fences or the pieces of wood, metal etc used to make them
Sense.TRAN: 栅栏﹔篱笆﹔筑栅栏[篱笆]的材料

Sense.DEF: to look after yourself without needing help from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids had to fend for themselves while their parents were away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母不在家时﹐孩子们只好自己照料自己。

Sense.DEF: to defend yourself against someone who is attacking you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tabitha threw up an arm to fend her attacker off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔比莎挥臂挡开行凶者。

Sense.DEF: to defend yourself from something such as difficult questions, competition, or a situation you do not want to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: She uses her secretary to fend off unwanted phone calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让秘书挡掉不想接的电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company managed to fend off the hostile takeover bid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司设法避开了恶意收购。

Sense.DEF: the side part of a car that covers the wheels

a low metal wall around a
fireplace
that prevents burning wood or coal from falling out

a car accident in which little damage is done
a Chinese system of organizing the furniture and other things in a house or building in a way that people believe will bring good luck and happiness
to place the furniture and other things in a room or house in a particular position so that it is arranged according to the feng shui system

Sense.DEF:
a
fen

Sense.DEF: a pale green plant whose seeds are used to give a special taste to food and which is also used as a vegetable
feral animals used to live with humans but have become wild

Sense.DEF: if fruit, beer, wine etc ferments, or if it is fermented, the sugar in it changes to alcohol

Sense.DEF: a situation of great excitement or trouble in a country, especially caused by political change

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代﹐美国社会动荡不安。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the artistic ferment of the late sixth century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六世纪后期的艺术骚动

Sense.DEF: a type of plant with green leaves shaped like large feathers, but no flowers
violent, dangerous, and frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ferocious, hungry lion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头凶猛的饿狮
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ferocious battle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残酷的战役
Sense.EXAMPLE: The storm grew more and more ferocious with each second.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风暴每一秒钟都在加剧。

Sense.DEF: very strong, severe, and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 狂暴的﹔猛烈的﹔使人不舒服的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The congressman is one of the President’s most ferocious critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位众议员是批评总统最激烈的人之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat was ferocious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热浪逼人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is famous for his ferocious temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脾气暴躁是出了名的。

Sense.DEF: relating to an emotion that is felt very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parker was driven by a ferocious determination to succeed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕克被一种必胜的信念驱动着。

Sense.DEF: the state of being extremely violent and severe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Detectives were shocked by the ferocity of the attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 探员们对袭击的残暴程度感到震惊。

Sense.DEF: a small animal with a pointed nose, used to hunt rats and rabbits
to search for something that is lost or hidden among a lot of things or inside a drawer, box etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started ferreting around in his desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始在自己的书桌里翻找起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ferreted in her bag for a pen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在包里翻找钢笔。

Sense.DEF: to hunt rats and rabbits using a ferret
to succeed in finding something such as a piece of information, that is difficult to find
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been difficult for reporters to ferret out the facts in this case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者很难查出这件事的真相。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Uncle Vernon ferreted out the laundry box from under the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗农叔叔在楼梯下面找到了洗衣筐。

Sense.DEF: to find and usually get rid of someone who is causing a problem
Sense.TRAN: 查出并除去〔惹出麻烦的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new program is meant to ferret out problem cops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新计划旨在清除问题警员。

Sense.DEF:
a very large upright wheel with seats on it for people to ride on in an
amusement park
containing or relating to iron
Sense.EXAMPLE: ferrous metals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含铁[黑色]金属

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal or rubber put on the end of a stick to make it stronger
Sense.TRAN: 〔杖﹑杆等末端的〕金属包箍﹐橡皮包头

Sense.DEF: a boat that carries people or goods across a river or a narrow area of water
to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship was used to ferry supplies to Russia during the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船在战时被用来往俄罗斯 运送补给。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ferrying passengers across the Channel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆渡乘客过英吉利海峡

Sense.DEF: a ferry
fertile land or soil is able to produce good crops
Sense.EXAMPLE: 800 acres of fertile cropland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 800英亩的肥沃耕地

Sense.DEF: able to produce babies, young animals, or new plants
Sense.TRAN: 可繁殖的﹐能生育的﹔能结果的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most men remain fertile into old age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数男子直到老年还有生育能力。

Sense.DEF: an imagination, mind etc that is able to produce a lot of interesting and unusual ideas
Sense.TRAN: 丰富的想象力/主意多[有创造性]的头脑

Sense.DEF: a fertile situation is one in which something can easily develop and succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fertile Philadelphia music scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费城这片音乐沃土

Sense.DEF: the ability of the land or soil to produce good crops
the ability of a person, animal, or plant to produce babies, young animals, or seeds
a drug given to a woman to help her have a baby
to make new animal or plant life develop
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the egg has been fertilized, it will hatch in about six weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋受精后六周左右孵化。

Sense.DEF: to put fertilizer on the soil to make plants grow
a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow
believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely
Sense.TRAN: 热情的﹔炽热的﹔热烈的﹔强烈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fervent appeal for peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对和平的强烈呼吁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fervent supporter of human rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 热情的人权支持者

Sense.DEF: believing or feeling something too strongly
Sense.TRAN: 过分热烈的﹔过度激烈的﹔太热情的

Sense.DEF: very strong belief or feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious fervour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教热忱
Sense.EXAMPLE: revolutionary fervour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 革命热情
Sense.EXAMPLE: patriotic fervor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱国热情

Sense.DEF: to admit that you have done something wrong, although it is not very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, fess up! Who ate that last cookie?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐从实招来！最后那块甜饼谁吃了？

Sense.DEF: an informal occasion when a lot of people do a fun activity together, such as drinking beer, singing songs, or eating food
Sense.TRAN: 啤酒节/音乐节/食品节等

Sense.DEF: used to form nouns referring to events that have a lot of a particular thing or have a very great effect of a particular kind
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于构成名词﹐指某一类活动或某种极强的效果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talkfest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间讨论
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snoozefest a very boring event
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无聊至极的事

Sense.DEF: if an unpleasant feeling or problem festers, it gets worse because it has not been dealt with
Sense.TRAN: 〔不快的感觉或问题〕加剧﹐恶化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dispute can be traced back to resentments which have festered for centuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一争端可以追溯到积累了好几个世纪的仇怨。

Sense.DEF: if a wound festers, it becomes infected
Sense.EXAMPLE: festering sores
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 溃烂的疮

Sense.DEF: if rubbish or dirty objects fester, they decay and smell bad
an occasion when there are performances of many films, plays, pieces of music etc, usually happening in the same place every year
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧﹑音乐等的〕节﹐节庆﹐会演

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Swansea Festival of Music and the Arts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯旺西音乐艺术节

Sense.DEF: a special occasion when people celebrate something such as a religious event, and there is often a public holiday
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas is one of the main festivals in the Christian Calendar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节是基督教历的重大节日之一。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tucson had a film festival last month.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月图森举办了电影节。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The festival is celebrated each July.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年七月庆祝这个节日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: perform at a festival
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 在会演中露面/演出/讲话

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: perform there

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 电影节/音乐节/舞蹈节/艺术节
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The movie won an award at the Cannes Film Festival.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该影片在戛纳电影节上获奖。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 摇滚音乐节/流行音乐节/爵士音乐节/民间音乐节

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many of the festival events are already sold out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多节庆活动的门票已销售一空。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a series of events at a festival

Sense.DEF: looking or feeling bright and cheerful in a way that seems suitable for celebrating something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The atmosphere was festive and jolly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气氛喜庆欢乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was obviously in a festive mood .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰显然喜气洋洋的。

Sense.DEF: a day when you celebrate something special such as a birthday

the period around
christmas
relating to Christmas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节的欢乐气氛
Sense.EXAMPLE: festive gifts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节礼物

Sense.DEF: things such as drinking, eating, or dancing that are done to celebrate a special occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The festivities started with a procession through the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆祝活动以全城巡游开场。

Sense.DEF: a happy feeling that exists when people celebrate something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an air of festivity in the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里一片欢庆气氛。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with flowers, long pieces of material etc, especially for decoration

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Malaga was festooned with banners and flags in honour of the king’s visit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马拉加彩旗飘扬﹐欢迎国王到访。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of material, flowers etc, used especially for decoration

a white cheese from Greece made from
sheep’s
milk or
goat’s
milk

the usual American spelling of
foetal
to go and get something or someone and bring them back
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick! Go and fetch a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快！去请医生来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shannon went upstairs to fetch some blankets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香农上楼去拿些毯子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind going to fetch the kids from school?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去接孩子们放学好吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: fetch sb sth/fetch sth for sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fetch me some coffee while you’re up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反正你已经起来了﹐就给我弄些咖啡来吧。

Sense.DEF: to be sold for a particular amount of money, especially at a public sale – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 卖得﹐售得〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting is expected to fetch at least $20 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画预计至少能卖两千万美元。

Sense.DEF: to do simple and boring jobs for someone as if you were their servant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Am I supposed to fetch and carry for him all day?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难道要我整天替他打杂吗？

Sense.DEF: to make people react in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 使作出〔某种反应〕﹔吸引来﹔引起
Sense.EXAMPLE: This announcement fetched a huge cheer from the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一宣告博得听众极其热烈的欢呼声。

Sense.DEF: to arrive somewhere without intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell asleep on the train and fetched up in Glasgow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在火车上睡着了﹐竟然到了格拉斯哥。

Sense.DEF: if you play fetch with a dog, you throw something for the dog to bring back to you
attractive, especially because the clothes you are wearing suit you
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因衣着得体而〕动人的﹐迷人的﹐吸引人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your sister looks very fetching in that dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你妹妹穿那身衣服显得格外动人。

Sense.DEF: an outdoor event where there are competitions and things to eat and drink, usually organized to get money
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般为募捐而组织的〕游乐会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the church fête
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的游乐会

Sense.DEF: a special occasion to celebrate something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a farewell fête in honor of the mayor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为市长举行的欢送会

Sense.DEF: to honour someone by holding public celebrations for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过举行公众庆祝活动来〕款待﹐向…致敬
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team was fêted from coast to coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队在全国各地都受到热情欢迎。

Sense.DEF: having a strong bad smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: the black fetid water of the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又黑又臭的湖水
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dog’s fetid breath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗呼出的臭气

Sense.DEF: a desire for sex that comes from seeing a particular type of object or doing a particular activity, especially when the object or activity is considered unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔看见某物品或做某事引起性欲的〕恋物〔尤为不寻常之物或事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leather fetish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恋皮革癖

Sense.DEF: something you are always thinking about or spending too much time doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sue has a real fetish about keeping everything tidy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 休有把一切保持整洁的癖好。

Sense.DEF: someone who gets sexual pleasure from unusual objects or activities

the back part of a horse’s leg, just above the
hoof
to restrict someone’s freedom and prevent them from doing what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: fettered by family responsibilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受家庭责任的束缚

Sense.DEF: to put chains around a prisoner’s hands or feet
the things that prevent someone from being free

GramExa.EXAMPLE: breaking the fetters of convention
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打破传统的束缚

Sense.DEF: chains that were put around a prisoner’s feet in past times
healthy or working properly
Sense.TRAN: 健康的﹐强健的﹔状况良好的

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
foetus
an angry and often violent quarrel between two people or groups that continues for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔个人间或群体间的〕长期不和﹐长期争斗﹐世仇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bitter feud over territory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 领土问题上的长期激烈争执

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a feud between rival drug organizations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌对的贩毒团伙间的宿怨

Sense.DEF: to continue quarrelling for a long time, often in a violent way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The neighboring states are feuding over the rights to the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相邻各国在这条河的归属问题上结怨多年。

Sense.DEF: relating to feudalism
Sense.EXAMPLE: the feudal system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 封建制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: feudal society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 封建社会

Sense.DEF: a system which existed in the Middle Ages, in which people received land and protection from a lord when they worked and fought for him
based on a system in which only a few people have all the power in a way that seems very old-fashioned
Sense.TRAN: 封建制度的﹔封建主义的

Sense.DEF: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy has a fever and won’t be coming into work today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪发烧了﹐今天不来上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I woke up this morning with a fever and an upset stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上醒来时我发烧了﹐胃也不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s running a fever has a fever .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在发烧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The usual symptoms are a pink rash with a slight fever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般症状为出粉红色疹子并伴有低烧。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use fever to talk about a very high temperature. If someone’s temperature is just high, they say that someone has a temperature rather than has a fever .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们说高烧时用fever。要是某人体温只是略高﹐人们会说someone has a temperature﹐而不说has a fever
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He stayed home from school because he had a temperature .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为发烧﹐他待在家里没去上学。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which many people feel very excited or feel very strongly about something
Sense.TRAN: 高度兴奋﹐狂热﹐极端活跃

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fever of excitement on Wall Street
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华尔街的疯狂

GramExa.GLOSS: great interest or excitement about a particular activity or event
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soccer fever has been sweeping the nation as they prepare for the World Cup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界杯筹备期间﹐足球狂潮席卷全国。

Sense.DEF: if people’s feelings are at fever pitch, they are extremely excited
Sense.TRAN: 狂热﹐异常激动﹐高度活跃
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nation was at fever pitch in the days leading up to the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选前几天﹐全国处于狂热的兴奋之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a night of rioting, tensions in the city reached fever pitch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一夜骚乱之后﹐该市的紧张气氛达到了顶点。

Sense.DEF:
a
cold sore
extremely excited or worried
Sense.TRAN: 高度兴奋的﹔十分焦虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the child’s fevered cries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子焦虑的哭声

Sense.DEF: suffering from a fever
Sense.EXAMPLE: his fevered brow a hot forehead caused by a fever
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他滚烫的前额

Sense.DEF: a mind that imagines strange things that are not real
Sense.EXAMPLE: These stories are merely a product of her fevered imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些故事只不过是她凭空臆想的产物。

Sense.DEF: suffering from a fever
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lay in bed, too feverish to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她躺在床上﹐烧得太厉害难以入睡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a feverish blush to his cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他两颊烧得通红。

Sense.DEF: very excited or worried about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They waited in a state of feverish anxiety for their mother to come home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们焦躁不安地等着母亲回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was about to begin and backstage there were signs of feverish activity activity that is done very quickly because there is not much time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表演快要开始了﹐后台一片紧张忙乱。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Congress is working feverishly to pass the bill.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会正在努力促使这项议案通过。

Sense.DEF: a small number of things or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have to buy a few things at the supermarket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得到超级市场买些东西。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pam called to say she’s going to be a few minutes late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕姆打电话来说她要晚几分钟到。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were a few people sitting at the back of the hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大厅后面坐着几个人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are a few more things I’d like to discuss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有一些事我想讨论一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve read a few of her books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我读过她的几部作品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I could suggest many different methods, but anyway, here are just a few .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以推荐许多不同的方法﹐不过这里就只说几个。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are only a very few not many exceptions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数例外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The office has been closed for the last few days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几天那家办事处没有开门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plants need to be watered every few days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物隔几天就得浇次水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had enjoyed her few days in Monaco.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在摩纳哥的那几天玩得很开心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: quite a few/a good few/not a few
Sense.DEF: a fairly large number of things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She must have cooked a good few dinners over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年她一定做过不少次晚餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were hundreds of protesters, not a few of whom were women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几百名示威者﹐其中不少是女性。

Sense.DEF: not many or hardly any people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: low-paid jobs that few people want
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有几个人想要的低薪工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people expressed concern, but few were willing to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人表示关心﹐但是愿意帮忙的几乎没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team that makes the fewest mistakes usually wins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常失误最少的队会赢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Very few of the staff come from the local area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工中几乎没有当地人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Wingate was full of explanations, but precious few hardly any of them made sense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 温盖特先生一大堆解释﹐但是言之成理的少之又少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cathedral was one of the few buildings not destroyed in the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座大教堂是少数未被毁于战火的建筑物之一。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This hospital is one of the few that are equipped to provide transplant surgery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是少数拥有外科移植手术设备的医院之一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gathered together my few possessions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我收拾了仅有的几样东西。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a number is large
Sense.TRAN: 至少﹐不少于〔用于强调数目很大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to contact him no fewer than ten times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图联系他不下十次。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how surprisingly small a number is
Sense.TRAN: 只有5/10等〔用于强调数量出乎意料地小〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes as few as 20 out of 500 or more candidates succeed in passing all the tests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时﹐500名甚至更多的候选人中只有20名能通过所有测试。

Sense.DEF: used when you are mentioning only a small number of people or things as examples of a large group
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a feature of languages such as Arabic, Spanish and Portuguese, to name but a few.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一特征见于多种语言﹐略举几个例子来说﹐如阿拉伯语﹑西班牙语﹑葡萄牙语。

Sense.DEF: the small number of people who are treated better than others and have special advantages
Sense.TRAN: 少数（特殊的/挑选出来的）几个人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such information is made available only to the chosen few.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此类信息只有少数几个人才可以知道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The needs of the many have been ignored - instead, the priority has been to bring benefits only to the few.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多数人的需要被忽视了——相反﹐只优先惠及了少数人。

Sense.DEF: to be rare
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jobs are few and far between at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下工作机会很少。

Sense.DEF: to have drunk too much alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looks as if he’s had a few!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去像是喝多了！

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: A few and few are used before plural nouns.
F2NBox.TRAN: a few和few 用于可数名词之前。
F2NBox.EXPL: A few means ‘a small number’.
F2NBox.TRAN: a few 指“一些”
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It will take a few minutes.
F2NBox.EXPL: Few means ‘not many’. It emphasizes how small the number is. It is mainly used in writing or formal speech.
F2NBox.TRAN: few 指“不多”﹐强调少,主要用于书面语或正式讲话
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Few people knew he was ill.
F2NBox.EXPL: In conversation or informal writing, it is more usual to say not many .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在对话或非正式书面语中﹐not many更为常用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Not many people saw what happened.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有多少人看到发生的事。

Sense.DEF: very sensitive and behaving or talking in a strange way
Sense.TRAN: 疯疯癫癫的﹐古怪的﹐神经兮兮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fey and delicate child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个古怪娇弱的孩子

Sense.DEF:
a round red hat with a flat top and no
brim
Sense.TRAN: 非斯帽﹐红色无边圆筒帽

Sense.DEF: used in writing to refer to the pages after the one you have mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 及以后各页〔用于文章中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: pages 17ff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17页及以后各页

Sense.DEF: the man whom a woman is going to marry
the woman whom a man is going to marry
an event that is completely unsuccessful, in a way that is very embarrassing or disappointing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first lecture I ever gave was a complete fiasco .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次讲课糟得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: an official order given by someone in a position of authority, without considering what other people want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The matter was settled by presidential fiat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事是总统下令解决的。

Sense.DEF: a small unimportant lie
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been known to tell fibs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爱撒谎是出了名的。

Sense.DEF: to tell a small unimportant lie
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’re fibbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你在撒谎。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
fibre

the American spelling of
fibreboard

the American spelling of
fibreglass

the parts of plants that you eat but cannot
digest
. Fibre helps to keep you healthy by moving food quickly through your body.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fruit and vegetables are high in fibre content .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水果和蔬菜的纤维素含量很高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: food that is high in dietary fibre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富含膳食纤维的食物

Sense.DEF: a mass of threads used to make rope, cloth etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nylon is a man-made fibre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼龙是一种人造纤维。

Sense.DEF:
a thin thread, or one of the thin parts like threads that form natural materials such as wood or
carbon
the thin pieces of flesh that form the nerves or muscles in your body

Sense.LEXUNIT: with every fibre of your being
Sense.DEF: if you feel something with every fibre of your being, you feel it very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted her with every fibre of his being.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一心一意地想要她。

Sense.DEF: board made from wood fibres pressed together
a light material made from small glass threads pressed together, used for making sports cars, small boats etc
the process of using very thin threads of glass or plastic to carry information in the form of light, especially on telephone lines
consisting of many fibres or looking like fibres
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coconut has a fibrous outer covering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 椰子有一个纤维质的外壳。

Sense.DEF: the outer bone of the two bones in your leg below your knee
someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 三心二意的﹐靠不住的﹐变化无常的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpredictable and fickle lover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个捉摸不透﹑三心二意的情人

Sense.DEF: something such as weather that is fickle often changes suddenly
books and stories about imaginary people and events
Sense.EXAMPLE: romantic fiction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱情小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: historical fiction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史小说

Sense.DEF: something that people want you to believe is true but which is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: preserving the fiction of his happy childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持他那快乐童年的假象

Sense.DEF: fictional people, events etc are imaginary and from a book or story
Sense.TRAN: 虚构的﹐编造的﹐小说（中）的
Sense.EXAMPLE: fictional characters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚构的人物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel is set in the fictional German town of Kreiswald.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说以虚构的德国小镇克赖斯瓦尔德为背景。

Sense.DEF: to make a film or story about a real event, changing some details and adding some imaginary characters
Sense.TRAN: 把…改编成电影﹔把…编成小说﹐使小说化
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fictionalized account of his life in Berlin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他柏林生活的小说化描写

Sense.DEF: not true, or not real
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fictitious address
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜撰的地址
Sense.EXAMPLE: fictitious characters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚构的人物

Sense.DEF: imaginary and not real
Sense.TRAN: 想象的﹐虚构的﹐非真实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fictive world of James Bond
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯•邦德的虚构世界

Sense.DEF:
a
violin
a dishonest way of getting money
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insurance fiddle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险欺诈

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They suspected he was on the fiddle getting money dishonestly or illegally all along.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们怀疑他一直在搞欺诈勾当。

Sense.DEF: to be difficult to do and involve complicated movements of your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: This blouse is a bit of a fiddle to do up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件女衬衫扣起来有点费劲。

Sense.DEF: to keep moving and touching something, especially because you are bored or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 不停拨弄〔尤因厌烦或紧张〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop fiddling, will you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不要瞎拨弄了﹐好不好！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat and fiddled at the computer for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐下来摆弄了一会儿电脑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was at her desk in the living room, fiddling with a deck of cards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在起居室的书桌前﹐摆弄着一副纸牌。

Sense.DEF: to give false information about something, in order to avoid paying money or to get extra money
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了不付钱或多拿钱〕篡改﹐伪造〔信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bert had been fiddling his income tax for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯特多年来一直在虚报所得税。

GramExa.GLOSS: give false figures in a company’s financial records

Sense.DEF:
to play a
violin
to waste time doing unimportant things
to move the parts of a machine in order to try to make it work or repair it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been fiddling around with this old car for months but I still can’t get it to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆旧车我捣鼓了几个月﹐但还是开不了。

Sense.DEF: to make small unnecessary changes to something – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did you let her fiddle about with the remote control?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么让她乱动遥控器？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus company is always fiddling around with the schedules.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车公司老是乱改时间表。

Sense.DEF: to move part of a machine in order to make it work, without knowing exactly what you should do
Sense.TRAN: 〔在不知如何操作的情况下〕拨弄﹐瞎动
Sense.EXAMPLE: After fiddling with the tuning I finally got JFM.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我瞎调了一会儿﹐终于找到了JFM台。

Sense.DEF: to move or touch something that does not belong to you, in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him fiddle with my bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他乱动我的包。

Sense.DEF:
someone who plays the
violin
, especially if they play
folk music
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指演奏民间音乐的〕小提琴手

Sense.DEF: someone who gives false information, especially on official documents, in order to pay less money or get more than they should
Sense.TRAN: 骗子﹐诈骗者〔尤指在正式文件上弄虚作假〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: tax fiddlers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骗税者

Sense.DEF: said when you disagree with someone, or are slightly annoyed about something
Sense.TRAN: 胡扯﹐废话〔用于表示不同意或不满〕

Sense.DEF: unimportant, and annoying
Sense.TRAN: 无足轻重的﹐微不足道的﹔令人厌烦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: fiddling little jobs around the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里的琐碎事

Sense.DEF: difficult to do, especially because you have to deal with very small objects
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fixing the TV was a fiddly job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理这台电视机很费事。

Sense.DEF: when you are loyal to your husband, girlfriend etc, by not having sex with anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔对丈夫﹑女朋友等的〕忠诚﹐忠贞﹐忠实
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of marital fidelity in marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对婚姻忠贞的重要性

Sense.DEF: when you are loyal to a person, an organization, or something that you believe in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his fidelity to the company over 25 years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对公司超过25年的效忠

Sense.DEF: how much a film, a piece of written work etc remains unchanged from an earlier piece of work, or the facts that are known
Sense.TRAN: 〔影片﹑文字作品等对原作或事实的〕忠实性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the movie’s fidelity to the original book
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该影片的忠于原著

Sense.DEF: to keep moving your hands or feet, especially because you are bored or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因厌烦或紧张〕坐立不安﹐手足无措
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids had started to fidget.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们开始坐立不安起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop fidgeting with your pens!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别拿钢笔晃来晃去的！

Sense.DEF: someone who is unable to sit or stand still
unable to stay still, especially because of being bored or nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys get fidgety if they can’t play outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是不能出去玩﹐这些男孩子就会坐立不安。

Sense.DEF: used to express anger or disapproval towards someone
Sense.TRAN: 某人真可恶[可耻]〔表示生气或不赞同〕

Sense.DEF: an area, organization, or part of an organization that someone has complete control over
Sense.EXAMPLE: He regarded the company as his personal fiefdom .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把公司视为他的私人领地。

Sense.DEF: in history, a small area that was ruled by a king or lord
an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass
Sense.EXAMPLE: a view of green fields and rolling hills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田野青翠﹑丘陵起伏的景色

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a field of wheat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片麦地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: working in the cotton fields
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在棉花地里劳作

Sense.DEF: a subject that people study or an area of activity that they are involved in as part of their work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her work in the field of human rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在人权领域的工作

Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter’s an expert in his field .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得是他那个行业里的专家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the best-known American outside the field of not connected with politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是政治领域之外最出名的美国人。

Sense.DEF: an area of ground where sports are played

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the local soccer field
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的足球场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team have had a bad year, both on and off the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队这一年场内场外都不顺。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans cheered as the players took the field went onto the field .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

Sense.DEF:
work or study that is done in the field is done in the real world rather than in a class or
laboratory

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His theories have not yet been tested in the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论尚未经过实地检验。
现场试验/实地研究等

Subsense.DEF: all the people, companies, products etc that are competing against each other
Subsense.TRAN: 所有互相竞争的人[公司﹐产品等]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the field of candidates for the election
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选的全体候选人

GramExa.GLOSS: be doing better than the others
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Germany was leading the field with a figure of 53%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国以53%的数字领先于其他国家。

Subsense.DEF: all the horses or runners in a race
Subsense.TRAN: 所有参赛马匹﹔全体赛跑选手
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Prince led the field was ahead of the others as they came around the final bend.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑到最后一个弯道时“王子”领先。

Sense.DEF: the area in which a natural force is felt or has an effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Earth’s magnetic field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的磁场

Sense.DEF: a large area of land where coal, oil, or gas is found
Sense.EXAMPLE: North Sea oilfields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北海油田

Sense.DEF: the time or place where there is fighting in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new tank has yet to be tested in the field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新型坦克尚待实战检验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: medals won on the field of battle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在战场上赢得的奖章

Sense.DEF: the whole area that you are able to see without turning your head
a large area of land covered with snow or ice
the area that you can hit when you shoot from a particular position

Sense.LEXUNIT: leave the field clear for sb
Sense.DEF: to make it possible for someone to do something or to be successful at something, by not competing with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josh left the company, leaving the field clear for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔希为成全我离开了公司。

Sense.DEF: in a computer document, an amount of space made available for a particular type of information
Sense.EXAMPLE: an empty field not yet written in
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空白字段

Sense.DEF: if you field a team, an army etc, they represent you or fight for you in a competition, election, or war
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Ecology Party fielded 109 candidates .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生态党推举了109名候选人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We fielded a team of highly talented basketball players.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们派出一支由高水平篮球运动员组成的队伍。

Sense.DEF: to answer questions, telephone calls etc, especially when there are a lot of them or the questions are difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Minister fielded questions on the Middle East.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位部长回答了有关中东的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press office fielded numerous calls from the media.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻办公室接到了媒体打来的无数电话。

Sense.DEF:
the team that is fielding in a game of
cricket
or baseball is the one that is throwing and catching the ball, rather than the one hitting it
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球或棒球比赛中〕担任防守队

Sense.DEF:
if you field the ball in a game of
cricket
or baseball, you stop it after it has been hit
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球或棒球比赛中〕截住﹐接住〔对方击出的球〕

Sense.DEF: a type of corn grown to feed to animals, rather than to be eaten by people
to have a chance to do a lot of something you want, especially the chance to criticize someone
Sense.TRAN: 有机会大显身手〔尤指批评某人的机会〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspapers had a field day when the trial finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判结束﹐报社有机会大做文章了。

Sense.DEF: a day when students at a school have sports competitions and parents watch
Sense.TRAN: 〔有学生家长观看的〕体育比赛日﹐运动日

Sense.DEF:
one of the players who tries to catch the ball in a game of
cricket
or baseball
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球或棒球运动中的〕守场员﹐外场手﹐外野手

Sense.DEF:
a sport such as jumping or throwing the
javelin
in an outdoor competition

the act of kicking the ball over the
goal
in American football
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球中的〕射门〔踢球穿过对方球门上方〕

Sense.DEF:
the act of putting the ball through the net to get points in
basketball

hockey
played on grass
a temporary hospital for soldiers that is near where the fighting is
an officer of the highest rank in the British army
a mouse that has a long tail and lives in fields
someone who works for an organization whose job involves practical outdoor work, especially work connected with the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 户外工作人员〔尤指工作与乡村有关者〕

Sense.DEF: an officer of high rank in the British army

Sense.TRAN: 〔板球或棒球运动中的〕守场员﹐外场手﹐外野手

Sense.DEF: sports that happen in the countryside, such as hunting, shooting, and fishing
Sense.TRAN: 野外运动〔如打猎﹑射击和钓鱼〕

Sense.DEF:
a test of a new piece of equipment, done in the place where it will be used rather than in a
laboratory
Sense.TRAN: 〔新设备的〕现场试验﹐实地试验

Sense.DEF: an occasion when students go somewhere to learn about a particular subject, especially one connected with nature or science
Sense.TRAN: 〔学生的〕校外旅行考察﹐实地调查旅行
Sense.EXAMPLE: a geography field trip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野外地质考察

Sense.DEF:
the study of scientific or social subjects, done outside the class or
laboratory
Sense.TRAN: 〔科学或社会研究的〕实地考察﹐野外考察

Sense.DEF: a very cruel, evil, or violent person
Sense.TRAN: 残暴的人﹐恶人﹐恶魔般的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heartless fiend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狠心残暴的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both of them were fighting like fiends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两人在恶斗。

GramExa.GLOSS: one who commits very unpleasant sex attacks

Sense.DEF: someone who likes watching television, doing sports etc a lot, or more than is normal
Sense.TRAN: 电视迷/体育迷/爱新鲜空气成癖的人等

Sense.DEF: someone who takes a lot of illegal drugs
an evil spirit
cruel and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a particularly fiendish practical joke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残忍的恶作剧

Sense.DEF: very clever in an unpleasant way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fiendish plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刁钻的计划

Sense.DEF: extremely difficult or complicated
Sense.EXAMPLE: several fiendish exam questions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几道很难的试题

Sense.DEF: done with a lot of energy and strong feelings, and sometimes violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: fierce fighting in the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里的激烈战斗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government’s policies came under fierce attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的政策遭到猛烈抨击。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fierce debate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 激烈的辩论
GramExa.EXAMPLE: fierce competition between the companies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司之间的激烈竞争

Sense.DEF: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: fierce guard dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶猛的看门狗
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned round, looking fierce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过身﹐一副恶狠狠的样子。

Sense.DEF: fierce emotions are very strong and often angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: These people take fierce pride in their independence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人为他们的独立感到极其自豪。

Sense.DEF: fierce cold, heat, or weather is much colder, hotter etc than usual
Sense.TRAN: 〔冷﹑热或天气情况〕极度的﹐极端的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fierce wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵狂风

Sense.DEF: looking very good and fashionable
more loudly, strongly etc than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was snowing something fierce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪下得非常大。

Sense.DEF: very red or orange, and looking like fire
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fiery sunset
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火红的落日
Sense.EXAMPLE: leaves that turn fiery red in autumn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天变成火红色的叶子

Sense.DEF: becoming angry or excited very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a fiery temper .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脾气火爆。

Sense.DEF: showing or encouraging anger or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 怒气冲冲的﹔充满激情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fiery speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满激情的演讲

Sense.DEF: fiery food or drink tastes very strong, making part of your body feel hot
a religious holiday with dancing, music etc, especially in Spain and South America
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指西班牙和南美洲以舞蹈﹑音乐等来庆祝的〕宗教节日

Sense.DEF:
a musical instrument like a small
flute
, often played in military bands
the number 15
Sense.EXAMPLE: a coastal village fifteen miles south of Tourane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土伦以南15英里的一个滨海村落
Sense.EXAMPLE: They met when she was fifteen 15 years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们相遇那年她15岁。

Sense.DEF:
a team of 15 players in
rugby union

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the fifteenth the 15th day of the month .

Sense.DEF: coming after four other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the fifth century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在五世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her fifth birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的五岁生日

Sense.DEF: someone who is not wanted in a particular group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’d made her feel like a fifth wheel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让她感觉像个多余的人。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the fifth the fifth day of the month .

Sense.DEF: one of five equal parts of something

an amount of alcohol equal to 1/5 of an American
gallon1
, sold in bottles
Sense.TRAN: 〔瓶装销售的烈性酒〕五分之一加仑
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fifth of bourbon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五分之一加仑的波旁威士忌酒

Sense.DEF: a group of people who work secretly to help the enemies of the country where they live or the organization in which they work
Sense.TRAN: 第五纵队〔指从事秘密活动﹑协助敌军或对手的一群人〕

Sense.DEF: the number 50
the years between 1950 and 1959
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standards of living rose in the fifties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50年代生活水平提高了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The play was written in the late fifties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧创作于50年代后期。

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 50 and 59
Sense.TRAN: 在五十到五十九岁之间﹐是五十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He must he in his early fifties by now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在肯定50岁出头了。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the fifties, it is between 50 degrees and 59 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: sunny, with temperatures in the mid fifties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 晴﹐气温55度左右

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money that is worth 50 dollars or 50 pounds
Sense.TRAN: 五十美元[英镑]票面的纸币
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can give you five tens for that fifty if you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你愿意的话﹐我可以给你5张10美元来换那张50美元。

Sense.DEF: if you divide something fifty-fifty, you divide it equally between two people, companies etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The companies split the profits fifty-fifty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司平分利润。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll share it on a fifty-fifty basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以对半分。

GramExa.GLOSS: share the cost of something equally
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We went fifty-fifty on a new TV set.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们各出一半钱买了台新电视机。

Sense.DEF: if there is a fifty-fifty chance of something happening, it is equally likely to happen as not to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fifty-fifty chance of winning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分之五十的胜率

Sense.DEF: a soft sweet fruit with a lot of small seeds, often eaten dried, or the tree on which this fruit grows

Sense.LEXUNIT: not give a fig/not care a fig (about/for sth/sb)
Sense.DEF: to not be at all concerned about or interested in something or someone

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= figure〔书中有编号的〕图﹐图表
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= figurative 比喻的﹔形象的

Sense.DEF: to take part in a war or battle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the families of those who fought in the war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参战者的家人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rebel forces fighting against the Russians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对抗俄罗斯人的反政府军

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They fought for control of the islands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为争夺那些岛屿的控制权而战。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither country is capable of fighting a long war .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个国家都没有能力打持久战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Later the Indians fought the Anglo settlers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来﹐印第安人跟英国殖民者打起了仗。

Sense.DEF: if someone fights another person, or if two people fight, they hit and kick the other person in order to hurt them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two guys were fighting with each other in the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两个家伙在街上打架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were fighting over a girl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为了一个女孩子在打架。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She fought him desperately, kicking and biting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又踢又咬﹐与他拼命撕打。

Sense.DEF: to try hard to do or get something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men were fighting for higher wages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人在争取加薪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stockley is fighting for his life trying to stay alive , with serious head injuries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯托克利头部严重受伤﹐在与死神搏斗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She fought her way back into the first team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她奋力拼搏﹐又回到了第一团队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president was fighting to survive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在争取挺过难关。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to prevent something or to get rid of something unpleasant that already exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are fighting against repression and injustice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众在与压迫和不公平作斗争。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We will fight terrorism, wherever it exists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管哪里有恐怖主义﹐我们都要打击。

Sense.DEF: to take part in an election or compete strongly for something, especially a job or political position
Sense.TRAN: 参加（选举）；激烈争夺（职位或政治地位）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prime minister decided to fight an early general election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相决定提前打响大选之战。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had to fight several other applicants for the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得与其他几个申请人争夺该职位。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both men were used to fighting for power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个人都习惯了权力之争。

Sense.DEF: to argue about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I heard her fighting with the boss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见她在跟老板争论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re fighting about who should do the dishes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在为该谁洗碗碟而争吵。

Sense.DEF:
to take part in a
boxing
match
Sense.TRAN: 参加拳击赛﹐（与…）进行拳击比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ali fought Foreman for the heavyweight title.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里迎战福尔曼﹐争夺重量级拳击冠军。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard not to have or show a feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fought her fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她强忍着内心的恐惧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was clearly fighting with her emotions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她显然是在克制自己的感情。

Sense.DEF: to try to get something or prevent something in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The insurance company are fighting the claims in court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险公司在打索赔官司。

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere with difficulty, for example because there are so many people around you
Sense.TRAN: 奋力（从某人/某物中）开出一条路
Sense.EXAMPLE: We fought our way through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们奋力挤过人群。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something that you probably cannot succeed in doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m fighting a losing battle on this diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样节食我肯定坚持不下去。

Sense.DEF: to have a chance to do something or achieve something if you try very hard
Sense.TRAN: 经过很大努力有可能成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis has a fighting chance to win the gold medal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯如果努力拼搏﹐还是有机会得金牌的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fight tooth and nail (for sth)/fight sth tooth and nail
Sense.DEF: to try very hard to do or achieve something, or to prevent something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s rich now, but he had to fight tooth and nail for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在有钱了﹐但那是他奋斗出来的。

Sense.DEF: to fight until one person or group is dead or completely defeated
to fight for what you want, without needing help from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum, I can fight my own battles now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈﹐我现在可以独自应付了。

Sense.DEF: the desire to fight or win
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the second half the team showed their true fighting spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半场﹐该队显示出了真正的斗志。

Sense.DEF: something you say that shows that you want to fight hard for something
to use the same methods as your opponents in an argument, competition etc
Sense.TRAN: 以毒攻毒﹔以其人之道还治其人之身

Sense.DEF: if two people fight like cat and dog, they argue a lot because they dislike each other or disagree
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t get on with her at work either – we fought like cat and dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和她在工作上也合不来——我们吵个没完。

Sense.DEF: extremely fit and healthy
to try to persuade people that your ideas about something are right and should be accepted
Sense.TRAN: 劝说别人接受自己的观点
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister made it clear that Britain would fight its corner on Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相明确表示﹐英国将尽全力说服欧洲。

Sense.DEF: to try to avoid doing something or being involved in something
Sense.TRAN: 避免做某事﹔避免参与某事﹐回避某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women fight shy of motherhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女性不愿做母亲。

Sense.DEF: to work hard to achieve or oppose something, especially in a situation where you are losing
Sense.TRAN: 抗争﹐还击﹐斗争〔尤在失利的情况下〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: United fought back and scored a last-minute goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队奋起还击﹐在最后时刻破门得分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was fighting back against the cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在与癌症抗争。

Sense.DEF: to use violence or arguments against someone who has attacked you or argued with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels are fighting back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军正在反攻。

Sense.DEF: to try hard not to have or show a feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked away, fighting back her tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看向别处﹐强忍住泪水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fought back the impulse to slap her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽力忍住要扇她耳光的冲动。

Sense.DEF: to try hard not to have or show a feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doug fought down a feeling of panic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道格努力克制住心里的恐慌。

Sense.DEF: to keep someone away, or stop them doing something to you, by fighting or opposing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bodyguards had to fight off the crowds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保镖不得不挡住人群。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company managed to fight off a takeover attempt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司设法阻止了一次收购企图。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in stopping other people getting something, and to get it for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allan fought off stiff competition from throughout the UK to win one of only four places at the college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦在全英国的激烈竞争中胜出﹐在那所学院仅有的四个名额中赢得一席。

Sense.DEF: to try hard to get rid of something, especially an illness or a feeling
Sense.TRAN: 竭力摆脱〔尤指某种疾病或感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elaine’s fighting off a cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩正在和感冒斗争。

Sense.DEF: to argue or fight until a disagreement is settled
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过争论或争斗〕解决﹐消除〔不和〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We left them to fight it out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们让他们自己去解决。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people or groups hit, push etc each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her son was always getting into fights at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她儿子老是在学校打架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They ended up having a fight with each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最后打了一架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fight broke out between the fans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们打了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fights over territory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 领地之争

Sense.DEF: the process of trying to achieve something or prevent something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fight for justice and democracy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为正义和民主而奋斗
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The little girl lost her fight for life fight to stay alive last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚﹐那个小女孩未能战胜死神。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fight against crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打击犯罪

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fight to get financial aid
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取经济援助的努力

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have a fight on your hands it will be difficult to convince the committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要说服委员会﹐你可得费一番功夫。

Sense.DEF: an argument

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve had a fight with the neighbours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们和邻居吵了一架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fights over money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为钱争吵

Sense.DEF:
a
boxing
match
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you going to watch the big fight tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备看今晚的拳击大赛吗？

Sense.DEF: a battle between two armies

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fight for Bunker Hill
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 争夺邦克山的战斗

Sense.DEF: energy or the desire to keep fighting for something you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty of fight left in your grandmother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的祖母仍然斗志旺盛。

Sense.DEF: to work very hard to fight or compete in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔在困难情况下〕英勇地斗争﹐顽强地奋斗
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team put up a good fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队打得很顽强。

Sense.DEF: a fight that continues until one side is completely defeated

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to have a fight with him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想和他打架的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become involved in a fight
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The two men got into a fight over a girl.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个男人为一个女孩打了起来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They started a fight in the crowded bar.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在拥挤的酒吧里打了起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deliberately start a fight
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 找碴打架﹐故意寻衅打架
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The guy tried to pick a fight with Jack.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个家伙在找碴要跟杰克打架。

Collocate.COLLOC: stop a fight/break up a fight

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be very eager to fight with someone
suddenly starts
happens

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They ended up having a big fight in the pub.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最后在小酒馆里大打出手。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a fair fight, just two on two.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 二对二﹐这样打架很公平。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a fierce fight with rebel forces and several soldiers were killed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 与叛军发生激战﹐数名士兵阵亡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a fight in which people hit each other with their closed hands

Sense.DEF: an attempt by someone to get back to a position of strength after they have lost it, especially in sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育比赛中的〕回击﹐反攻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arsenal staged a spirited fightback in the second half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半场﹐阿森纳队发起顽强的反攻。

Sense.DEF: a small fast military plane that can destroy other planes
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was shot down by enemy fighters .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被敌军战斗机击落。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fighter pilot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗机驾驶员

Sense.DEF: someone who fights, especially as a sport
Sense.TRAN: 拳击手﹔战士﹐士兵﹐战斗者

Sense.DEF: someone who keeps trying to achieve something in difficult situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: James is a fighter - he never gives up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯是个顽强拼搏的人——他从不放弃。

Sense.DEF: when people or groups fight each other in a war, in the street etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: heavy fighting between government and rebel forces
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军和叛军之间的激烈战斗

Sense.EXAMPLE: Fighting broke out in the crowds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群中有人打了起来。

Sense.DEF: the large leaf of the fig tree, sometimes shown in paintings as covering people’s sex organs
Sense.TRAN: 无花果树叶〔绘画中常用以遮盖性器官〕

Sense.DEF: something that you imagine is real, but does not exist
Sense.TRAN: 某人凭空想象的事物﹐某人虚构的事物

Sense.DEF: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打个比方﹐他就像是我的儿子。

Sense.DEF: figurative art shows objects, people, or the countryside as they really look

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They have a taste - figuratively speaking - for excitement.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 用个形象的说法﹐刺激合他们的“口味”。

Subsense.DEF: a number representing an amount, especially an official number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ohio’s employment figures for December
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄亥俄州12月份的就业数字

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Government figures underestimate the problem.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的数据对这一问题反映不足。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s about 30,000 in round figures to the nearest 10, 20, 100 etc.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凑个整数大约是三万。

Subsense.DEF: a number from 0 to 9, written as a sign rather than a word
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the figure ‘2’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字2
Subsense.EXAMPLE: executives with salaries in six figures more than £99,999
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪资达六位数的管理人员

GramExa.GLOSS: a number in the thousands, ten thousands, hundred thousands etc

Sense.DEF: a particular amount of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an estimated figure of $200 million
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 估计为两亿美元的金额

Subsense.DEF: someone who is important or famous in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several leading figures resigned from the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数位重要人物退出了该党。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the outstanding political figure of his time
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那个时代杰出的政治人物

Subsense.DEF: someone with a particular type of appearance or character, especially when they are far away or difficult to see
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a tall figure in a hat
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个戴帽子的高个子身影
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Through the window I could see the commanding figure of Mrs Bradshaw.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 透过窗户﹐我看到了布拉德肖太太威严的身影。

Sense.DEF: the shape of a woman’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a good figure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身材很好。

GramExa.GLOSS: stay thin or become fat

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most women have to watch their figure be careful not to get fat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数女性不得不注意保持身材。

Sense.DEF: someone who is considered to be like a father etc, or to represent authority, because of their character or behaviour
the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a natural ability with figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 算术天赋

GramExa.GLOSS: be good at arithmetic

Sense.DEF:
a
geometric
shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: A hexagon is a six-sided figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六边形是一种有六条边的几何图形。

Sense.DEF: a person in a painting or a model of a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: the figure in the background
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背景中的人物

Sense.DEF:
a numbered drawing or a
diagram
in a book

Sense.LEXUNIT: put a figure on it/give an exact figure
Sense.DEF: to say exactly how much something is worth, or how much or how many of something you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s worth a lot but I couldn’t put a figure on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这东西值很多钱﹐但是我说不出具体数字。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a fine figure of a man/woman
Sense.DEF: someone who is tall and has a good body
someone who people laugh at

a pattern or movement in
figure skating
to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Social issues figured prominently in the talks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会问题是会谈的重点。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My wishes didn’t figure among his considerations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的愿望不在他的考虑之中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下﹐改革是当务之急。

Sense.DEF: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From the way he behaved, I figured that he was drunk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从他的行为来看﹐我认为他醉了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was worth the trouble, I figured.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这点麻烦值得。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something that happens is expected or typical, especially something bad
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指不好的事〕在意料之中﹐早就料到了
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘It rained the whole weekend.’ ‘Oh, that figures.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “整个周末都在下雨。”“噢﹐早料到了。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is reasonable or makes sense
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It figures that she’d be mad at you, after what you did.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那么做﹐她对你发火是在情理之中的。

Sense.DEF: said to show that you think something is strange or difficult to explain
Sense.TRAN: 这就怪了 〔表示认为某事奇怪或难以解释〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He didn’t even leave a message.’ ‘Go figure.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他甚至没有留个口信。”“这就怪了。”

Sense.DEF: to calculate an amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just figuring my expenses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在计算自己的开支。

Sense.DEF: to expect something or include it in your plans
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was younger than any of us had figured on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比我们大家想的都年轻。

Sense.DEF: to think about a problem or situation until you find the answer or understand what has happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you figure out how to do it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能想出来怎么做吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: If I have a map, I can figure it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我有地图的话就能弄明白了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, we’ll figure something out find a way to solve the problem .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我们会找到办法解决的。

Sense.DEF: to understand why someone behaves in the way they do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women. I just can’t figure them out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人﹐我就是弄不懂她们。

Sense.DEF: decorated with a small pattern
Sense.TRAN: 饰有小图案的﹐有花纹的

Sense.DEF: someone who seems to be the leader of a country or organization but who has no real power
Sense.TRAN: 名义上的领导人﹐名义元首
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Queen is merely a figurehead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王只是名义上的元首。

Sense.DEF: a wooden model of a woman that used to be placed on the front of ships
the pattern or shape of a number eight, as seen in a knot, dance etc
a word or expression that is used in a different way from the normal meaning, to give you a picture in your mind

a kind of
skating
in which you move in patterns on the ice
a small model of a person or animal used as a decoration
a very thin thread or wire
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric filament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯丝

Sense.DEF:
a
hazelnut
to steal something small or not very valuable
Sense.TRAN: 偷〔小的或不贵重的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He filched a bottle of wine from the cellar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从地窖里偷了一瓶酒。

Sense.DEF: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mendoza read over the file on the murders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门多萨阅读了这几起凶杀案的卷宗。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The FBI keeps files on former White House employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦调查局存有前白宫雇员的档案。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We will keep your details on file store them for later use .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a copy of the court file
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份法庭档案

Sense.DEF: a box or piece of folded card in which you store loose papers
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pulled a blue file from the shelf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从架子上拉出一个蓝色文件夹。

Sense.DEF: information on a computer that you store under a particular name
Sense.EXAMPLE: a list of all the files and folders on your hard disk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你硬盘上全部文件及文件夹的列表

Sense.DEF: a metal tool with a rough surface that you rub on something to make it smooth
a line of people who are standing or walking one behind the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a file of soldiers marching in step
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 齐步行进的一队士兵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was dark as we set off in file.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我们排着纵队出发时天已经黑了。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meaning 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Click on the icon to open the file.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击此图标打开文件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You may need to close the file and restart the computer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你或许得关闭文件﹐重启电脑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Save the file under a different filename.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 将文件以另一个名称保存。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I created a file of useful contacts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我新建了一份实用联系人文件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: remove it
open or read it
make changes to it
move it from one computer system to another
move a copy of it from the Internet or another computer to your computer
move a copy of it from your computer to the Internet or another computer
put a file onto a computer
send it using email
send it with an email

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Delete some of the old computer files and create some space on the hard drive.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 删除一些旧电脑文件﹐把硬盘腾出空间。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a copy of a file, which is made in case the original becomes lost or damaged
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can burn your backup file to CD or DVD.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以将备份文件刻录在CD或DVD上。

Sense.DEF: to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The contracts are filed alphabetically .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些合同是按字母顺序归档的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I looked to see if anything was filed under my name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看了看﹐想知道是否有什么文档存在我的名下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The handbooks are filed away for future reference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些手册被存放起来以备将来参考。

Sense.DEF: to give or send an official report or news story to your employer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The officer left the scene without filing a report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察没有提交报告就离开了现场。

Sense.DEF: to give a document to a court or other organization so that it can be officially recorded and dealt with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Genoa filed a formal complaint against the department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉诺阿先生正式投诉了那个部门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Morrisons have filed for divorce .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里森夫妇已提出离婚申请。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Today is the deadline for Americans to file their tax returns .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天是美国人递交纳税申报单的截止日。

Sense.DEF: if people file somewhere, they walk there in a line
Sense.EXAMPLE: We began to file out into the car park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们鱼贯而出﹐去停车场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mourners filed past the coffin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吊唁者依次经过棺木。

Sense.DEF: to use a metal or wooden tool to rub something in order to make it smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: File down the sharp edges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把尖锐的边缘锉平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat filing her nails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐着锉指甲。

Sense.DEF: a piece of office furniture with drawers for storing letters, reports etc
the name you give to a particular computer file
the act of sharing computer files, such as music files, with other people using the Internet

an American spelling of
fillet
relating to the relationship of a son or daughter to their parents
Sense.EXAMPLE: her filial duty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的孝道

Sense.DEF: to try to delay action in Congress or another law-making group by making very long speeches
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美国国会或其他立法机构中〕以冗长的发言阻挠（议事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opponents of the bill tried to filibuster its final stages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对者发表长篇大论﹐试图阻挠议案的最终通过。

Sense.DEF: delicate designs or decorations made of gold or silver wire
Sense.EXAMPLE: silver filigree jewellery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银丝细工珠宝

Sense.DEF:
the work of arranging documents in the correct
files

small sharp bits that come off when a piece of metal is cut or
filed
Sense.EXAMPLE: iron filings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁锉屑

Sense.DEF: a document, report etc that is officially recorded
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bankruptcy filing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破产档案

Sense.DEF: a piece of office furniture with drawers for storing letters, reports etc
if a container or place fills, or if you fill it, enough of something goes into it to make it full
Sense.EXAMPLE: He poured her a drink, then filled his own glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给她倒了一杯﹐然后将自己的杯子斟满。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My job was filling the flour sacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作是装面粉袋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a deep breath and allow your lungs to fill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深吸一口气﹐让肺部涨满。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes filled with tears .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双眼噙满了泪水。

GramExa.PROPFORM: fill sth to the brim/to overflowing
GramExa.GLOSS: fill something completely
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bucket filled to the brim with ice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 装满冰的桶

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was just enough wind to fill the sails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正好有足够大的风鼓满船帆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller’s band was filling dance halls attracting a lot of people all over the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒的乐队在全国各地的舞厅都人气爆棚。

PIC.HEADING: FILL 装满
PIC.PICCONTENT: fill 装满；load 装车；cram 硬塞

Sense.DEF: if a thing or group fills something, there is no space left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds of well-wishers filled the streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上满是祈愿的人群。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wartime experiences would fill a book!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的战时经历足以写一本书了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the seats were filled and a number of people were standing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位子全坐满了﹐还有许多人站着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Numerous pictures fill every available space .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密密麻麻的照片填满了每一块空处。
