Sense.DEF: if a sound, smell, or light fills a place, you notice it because it is very loud or strong
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音﹑气味或光〕遍及﹐弥漫﹐照满
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell of freshly baked bread filled the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚出炉的面包香味弥漫整个房间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The air was filled with the sound of children’s laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中荡漾着孩子们的笑声。

Sense.DEF: if you are filled with an emotion, or if it fills you, you feel it very strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was filled with admiration for her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对她满怀钦佩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their faces were suddenly filled with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的脸上顿时写满了恐惧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prospect filled him with horror.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将要发生的事使他心中充满恐惧。

Sense.DEF: to provide something that is needed or wanted but which has not been available or present before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Volunteers fill a real need for teachers in the Somali Republic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 志愿者满足了索马里共和国对教师的迫切需求。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent most of the summer filling the gaps in my education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一年夏天我大部分时间在弥补自己学识上的欠缺。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has moved quickly to fill the niche in the overnight travel market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司立刻采取行动﹐填补夜间旅行市场的空白。

Sense.DEF: if you fill a period of time with a particular activity, you spend that time doing it

GramExa.PROPFORM: fill your time/the days etc (with sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no trouble filling my time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很会打发时间。

Sense.DEF: to perform a particular job, activity, or purpose in an organization, or to find someone or something to do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women fill 35% of senior management positions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性担任35%的高级管理职位。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your letter. Unfortunately, the vacancy has already been filled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你的来信﹐遗憾的是这一空缺已经有人填补。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UK should find another weapon to fill the same role .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国应当寻求其他武器来发挥同样的作用。

Sense.DEF: to put a substance into a hole, crack etc to make a surface level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fill in any cracks before starting to paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先把裂缝填塞好再开始粉刷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: materials developed to fill tooth cavities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研制出来以填补牙洞的材料

Sense.DEF: to eat so much food that you cannot eat any more
to supply the goods that a customer has ordered
Sense.TRAN: 供应订单﹔按单配足订货
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is struggling to fill $11 million in back orders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司在赶一批1,100万美元的欠交订单。

Sense.DEF: to have exactly the right qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: We needed an experienced reporter and Willis fills the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一个经验丰富的记者﹐而威利斯正是合适的人选。

Sense.DEF: to do the work that someone else normally does, especially when this is difficult because they have set a high standard
Sense.TRAN: 代做某人的工作〔尤用于某人定下很高标准以致工作很难做时〕

Exponent.DEF: to put enough of something into a container to make it full
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jenny filled the kettle and put it on to boil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮把壶灌满﹐开始烧水。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Party balloons can be filled with helium.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会上用的气球可以充氦气。

Exponent.DEF: to fill something completely – used especially about putting petrol in the tank of a car
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need to fill up the car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得给车加满油。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The waiter filled up everyone’s glasses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 侍者把每个人的杯子都斟满了。

Exponent.DEF: to fill a vehicle with goods, furniture etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two men were loading a truck with boxes of melons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子在将一箱箱甜瓜装上卡车。

Exponent.DEF: to quickly fill something such as a bag or pocket by pushing things into it tightly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She hurriedly stuffed some things into an overnight bag and left.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她匆匆往小旅行包里塞了一些东西就走了。

Exponent.DEF: to fill a container again, after what was in it has been used
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m just going to refill this bottle from the tap.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正要打开龙头再把这瓶子灌满。

Exponent.DEF: to fill a glass or cup that still has some liquid in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I top up your glass of wine?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你斟满酒杯好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to make something full again, especially with a supply of something such as water or food
Exponent.TRAN: 把…再装满〔尤指水﹑食物等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The lake is fed by springs that are eternally replenished by the rain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水源源不断注入溪流﹐溪流又汇入该湖。

Sense.DEF: to write all the necessary information on an official document, form etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to fill in your boarding cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了填写你们的登机卡。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about recent events, especially because they have been away from a place
Sense.TRAN: 向…提供最新消息〔尤因某人曾去别处〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you’d better fill me in on what’s been happening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你最好还是告诉我发生了什么。

Sense.DEF: to put a substance into a hole, crack etc so it is completely full and level
to spend time doing something unimportant because you are waiting for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flipped through a magazine to fill in the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她翻着一本杂志打发时间。

Sense.DEF: to paint or draw over the space inside a shape
to do someone’s job because they are not there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m filling in for Joe for a few days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给乔代几天班。

Sense.DEF: to write all the necessary information on an official document, form etc
if you fill out, or your body fills out, you become slightly fatter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric has filled out around the waist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克腰围变粗了。

Sense.DEF: if a young person fills out, their body becomes more like an adult’s body, for example by having bigger muscles, developing breasts etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: At puberty, a girl’s body begins to fill out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了青春期﹐女孩子的身体就开始丰满起来。

Sense.DEF: to add more details to a description or story
Sense.TRAN: 使〔描述或故事〕更详尽﹐充实

Sense.DEF: if a container or place fills up, or if you fill it up, it becomes full

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes filled up with tears .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼里噙满泪水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall I fill the car up with petrol ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我给车加满油吗？

Sense.DEF: to eat so much food that you cannot eat any more

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t fill yourself up with cookies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别吃太多曲奇饼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He filled up on pecan pie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用山核桃馅饼填饱了肚子。

Sense.DEF: food that fills you up makes you feel as though you have eaten a lot when you have only eaten a small amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物〕使某人觉得饱〔实际吃的量很少〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: have had your fill of sth
Sense.DEF: to have done something or experienced something, especially something unpleasant, so that you do not want any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had my fill of screaming kids for one day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一整天我已经听够了孩子们的尖叫。

Sense.DEF: to eat or drink as much as you want or need
a substance used to fill cracks in wood, walls etc, especially before you paint them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在上油漆或粉刷之前使用的〕填料

Sense.DEF: stories, information, pictures etc that are not important but are used to fill a page in a newspaper or magazine
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或杂志上的〕补白﹔补足版面用的文字[图画]

Sense.DEF: the lid that fits over the hole in a car that you pour a liquid into, especially oil or petrol
a piece of meat or fish without bones

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fillet of sole
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鳎鱼片

Sense.DEF: to remove the bones from a piece of meat or fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: filleted fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去骨鱼片

Sense.DEF: someone who does someone else’s job because that person is not there
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m here as a fill-in while Robert’s away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特不在﹐我来这里临时替工。

Sense.DEF: food that is filling makes your stomach feel full
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pasta and rice are both very filling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利面食和米饭都很能填饱肚子。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of metal that is put into your tooth to cover a hole
Sense.EXAMPLE: gold fillings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金填料

Sense.DEF:
the food that you put inside a
pie
, sandwich etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: cherry filling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 樱桃馅

Sense.DEF:
the soft material inside a
cushion
,
pillow
etc
a place where you can buy petrol for your car
something that improves a situation or adds excitement or interest to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cut in lending rates would give a fillip to the housing market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贷款利率下调将会刺激房产市场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: British athletics received a tremendous fillip when Wells won the Gold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦尔斯赢得金牌后﹐英国运动员受到极大鼓舞。

Sense.DEF: a young female horse
a story that is told using sound and moving pictures, shown at a cinema or on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen any good films recently?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最近看过什么好的影片吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a film about a young dancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲述一个年轻舞者的电影

Sense.DEF: moving pictures of real events that are shown on television or at a cinema
Sense.EXAMPLE: newsreel film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻片
Sense.EXAMPLE: the race to be first with film footage pictures of news events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢先播出新闻事件实况片段的竞赛

Sense.DEF: the work of making films, considered as an art or a business
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m interested in photography and film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对摄影和电影制作感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the film industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a background in film and animation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影及动画制作的背景

Sense.DEF: the thin plastic used in a camera for taking photographs or recording moving pictures
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shot five rolls of film on vacation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在度假时拍了五卷胶卷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole incident was recorded on film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事件的整个过程都被拍摄下来。

Sense.DEF: a very thin layer of liquid, powder etc on the surface of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a film of oil on the surface of the water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水面上的一层油

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He stayed in and watched a film on TV.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他待在家﹐看了一部电视上播出的影片。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We saw a good film last night at the cinema.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们昨晚在电影院看了一部好看的影片。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She once appeared in a film with Al Pacino.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾与艾尔•帕西诺联袂出演过影片。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be one of the main characters in a film
it is made available for people to see
it is being shown at a cinema

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He likes watching horror films.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢看恐怖片。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: John Wayne was best-known for his roles in cowboy films.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰•韦恩最出名的是在西部片中的角色。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a full-length film shown in the cinema

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Scorsese is a highly respected figure in the film industry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科塞斯是电影界德高望重的人物。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a company that produces films
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a European film company trying to compete with the major Hollywood studios
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图与好莱坞电影巨头竞争的一家欧洲电影公司

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a special building where films are made
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many of the scenes were shot in a film studio.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多场景是在一个摄影棚内拍摄的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who controls the preparation of a film
someone who makes films, especially as a director
the recorded music for a film
the first showing of a film
a group of people working together to make a film
someone who is interested in films and knows a lot about them

Sense.DEF: to use a camera to record a story or real events so that it can be shown in the cinema or on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: The love scenes are sensitively filmed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱情戏拍得很细腻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s in South Africa filming a documentary for the BBC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在南非为英国广播公司拍摄一部纪录片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thriller filmed entirely on location in Washington
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全部拍摄于华盛顿外景地的一部惊悚片

Sense.DEF: if your eyes film over, they become covered with a thin layer of liquid
someone who goes to see films, especially regularly
Sense.TRAN: （经常）上电影院的人﹐爱看电影的人

Sense.DEF: relating to films or the art of making films
Sense.TRAN: 电影的﹔有关电影制作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new filmic style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的电影风格

Sense.DEF:
someone who makes films, especially a
director
or
producer
Sense.TRAN: 电影制作人〔尤指导演或制片人〕

Sense.DEF: a film that deals with subjects such as evil, moral problems etc, often using a story about people involved in a crime and filmed in a way that seems dark or filled with shadows
Sense.TRAN: 黑色电影〔以罪恶﹑道德问题等为主题﹐常讲述涉案人员的故事﹐色调灰黑〕

Sense.DEF: a famous actor or actress in cinema films
a photographic film that shows photographs, pictures etc one at a time, not as moving pictures
Sense.EXAMPLE: an educational filmstrip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教学幻灯影片

Sense.DEF: very thin, so that you can almost see through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a filmy nightdress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄如蝉翼的女式睡袍

Sense.DEF:
a type of very thin
pastry
which is used by placing many layers together
a small book for writing addresses, things you must do etc, which has pages you can add or remove
Sense.TRAN: 斐来仕万用手册﹐活页备忘记事本

Sense.DEF: something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pond filter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 池塘过滤器
GramExa.EXAMPLE: coffee filter papers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡滤纸

Sense.EXAMPLE: filter cigarettes with a filter at the end
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过滤嘴香烟

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment or computer program that only allows certain sounds, images, signals, types of information etc to pass through it
Sense.TRAN: 〔只允许特定声音﹑图像﹑信号﹑信息等通过的〕过滤器﹐过滤程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: a UVA light filter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长波紫外线滤光器
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm uses electronic filters to prevent workers from accessing the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司利用电子过滤器来防止员工上网。

Sense.DEF: a traffic light that shows car drivers when they can turn right or left
Sense.TRAN: 〔指示汽车司机左转或右转的〕分流转弯信号灯

Sense.DEF: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

Sense.DEF: if people filter somewhere, they move gradually to that place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chattering noisily, the crowd began to filter into the auditorium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群叽叽喳喳地说着话﹐慢慢步入会堂。

Sense.DEF: if news, information etc filters somewhere, people gradually hear about it from each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔消息﹑信息等〕慢慢传开﹐走漏﹐泄漏
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news gradually filtered through from Bombay last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚消息渐渐从孟买传开了。

Sense.DEF: if light or sound filters into a place, it can be seen or heard only slightly
Sense.TRAN: 〔光线或声音〕隐约地透过﹐隐约地传入
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moonlight filtered in through the frosted window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光透过磨砂玻璃窗隐约照射进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The familiar notes of Beethoven’s ‘Für Elise’ filtered from the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝多芬《致爱丽丝》那熟悉的旋律从酒吧传来。

Sense.DEF: if traffic filters, or if a system filters it, cars can turn left or right while other vehicles going straight ahead must wait
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔车辆〕分流转弯〔直行的车辆必须等待〕

Sense.DEF: to remove something, using a filter
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pump filters out mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台泵滤掉泥浆。

Sense.DEF: to remove words, information etc that you do not need or want
Sense.TRAN: 滤除〔不需要的单词﹑信息等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Net users can filter out unwanted emails with software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网络用户可以使用软件过滤掉不想收到的电子邮件。

Sense.DEF: a filter at one end of a cigarette that removes some of the harmful substances from the smoke
very offensive language, stories, or pictures about sex
Sense.TRAN: 下流话﹔淫秽故事﹔淫秽图片
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how you can watch that filth!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道你怎么会看那种淫秽的东西！

Sense.DEF: dirt, especially a lot of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mound of filth and rubbish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆脏东西和垃圾
Sense.EXAMPLE: people living in filth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在肮脏环境里的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Passing cars covered his shoes with filth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来往的车辆弄得他鞋子上全是脏东西。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for the police
very dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was filthy, with clothes and newspapers strewn everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋子里很脏﹐衣服和报纸扔得到处都是。

Sense.DEF: showing or describing sexual acts in a very rude or offensive way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your problem is you’ve got a filthy mind you are always thinking about sex .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的问题是满脑子下流念头。

Sense.DEF: showing anger or annoyance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simon had been drinking and was in a filthy temper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙一直在喝酒﹐气冲冲的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a filthy look .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她气愤地看了他一眼。

Sense.DEF: the weather, a night etc that is very cold and wet
Sense.TRAN: 寒冷潮湿的天气/夜晚/一天
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a filthy night to be out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上出去又冷又潮湿。

Sense.DEF: very dirty
very rich – usually used to say you think someone has too much money
Sense.TRAN: 腰缠万贯的﹐非常有钱的

Sense.DEF:
a liquid from which a substance has been removed using a
filter

the process of cleaning a liquid by passing it through a
filter
one of the thin body parts that a fish uses to swim
part of a plane that sticks up at the back and helps it to fly smoothly
a thin piece of metal that sticks out from a car or bomb at the back

a
flipper
to obtain something that is difficult to get by using unusual or unfair methods
Sense.TRAN: 用欺诈手段得到﹔耍花招弄到
Sense.EXAMPLE: How he finagled four front row seats to the game I’ll never know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是怎样骗到比赛的四张前排票子的﹐我永远不会知道。

Sense.DEF: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final episode will be shown tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一集将于今晚播出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: students preparing for their final examinations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在准备期末考试的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stone is filming the final instalment of his Vietnam trilogy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯通正在拍摄越战三部曲的最后一部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the final stages in their relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间关系的最后阶段
Sense.EXAMPLE: They scored in the final minutes of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在比赛的最后几分钟得分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final whistle blown at the end of a game was only seconds away when Redknapp equalised.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷德克纳普将比分扳平的时候﹐离终场哨声吹响只剩几秒钟了。

GramExa.GLOSS: the last bill you receive for money you owe before court action is taken against you
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔账单的〕最后偿付要求﹐最终催付通知

Sense.DEF: being the result at the end of a process
Sense.EXAMPLE: the quality of the final product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成品的质量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does anyone know the final score?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谁知道最后的比分是多少？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I do not know what the final outcome will be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道最终结果将会是什么。

Sense.DEF: if a decision, offer, answer etc is final, it cannot or will not be changed
Sense.TRAN: 〔决定﹑报价﹑答复等〕不可改变的﹐决定性的﹐最终的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge’s decision is final .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位法官的判决是最终判决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can advise the client, but in the end it is he who has the final say .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以提出建议﹐但是最终的决定权还是在客户自己手里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is that your final answer?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就是你最终的回答吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say forcefully that you will not change your decision
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s not coming with us, and that’s final!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不跟我们一起去﹐就这么定了！

Sense.DEF: happening at or near the end of an event or process
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the final years of his life, Hervey achieved high office in the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫维在他生命的最后几年中获得了教会的要职。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the last thing in a series of events is very severe or damaging
Sense.TRAN: 最大的〔强调最后出现的某事物是极严重或极具破坏力的〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vote of no confidence was the final humiliation for a government that had been clinging to office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不信任投票是对死赖在台上的政府的最大羞辱。

Sense.DEF: the last and most important game, race, or set of games in a competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s through to the men’s tennis final for the first time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他第一次打进男子网球决赛。

GramExa.GLOSS: the last few games or races in a competition
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the NBA finals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: NBA决赛

Sense.DEF: the set of examinations that students take at the end of their time at university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna sat her finals last summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜去年夏天参加了大学毕业考试。

Sense.DEF: an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college
the last part of a piece of music or of a show, event etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出的〕终场﹐最后一幕﹔〔音乐的〕终曲﹔〔事件等的〕结尾
Sense.EXAMPLE: the finale of a Broadway show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一出百老汇表演的终场
Sense.EXAMPLE: a game with a dramatic finale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结局颇具戏剧性的一场比赛

GramExa.GLOSS: very impressive end to a show
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fireworks were the grand finale of the ceremonies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 仪式在烟火齐放中隆重结束。

Sense.DEF: one of the people or teams that reaches the final game in a competition
the quality something has when it is finished or complete and cannot be changed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The word ‘retirement’ has a terrible air of finality about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “退休”这个词有终结的可怕意味。

Sense.DEF: to finish the last part of a plan, business deal etc
Sense.TRAN: 最后定下﹐使〔计划﹑交易等〕确定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo flew out to Thailand to finalize the details of the deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔乘飞机去往泰国﹐敲定这笔生意的具体事宜。

Sense.DEF: after a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: After several delays we finally took off at six o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几经耽搁后﹐我们终于在六点起飞了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally, Karpov cracked under the pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐卡尔波夫承受不住压力崩溃了。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the last in a series of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: And finally, I’d like to thank the crew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐我要感谢全体工作人员。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about the last in a series of actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: She drove off at great speed, hit several parked cars, and finally crashed into a lamp-post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她驾车飞速离去﹐连撞几辆停着的汽车﹐最后撞到了一根路灯柱上。

Sense.DEF: in a way that does not allow changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The matter was not finally settled until 1475.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事到了1475年才彻底解决。

Sense.DEF: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: leasing and other forms of business finance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租赁及其他商业金融形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Russia’s finance minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯财政部长
Sense.EXAMPLE: the world of high finance financial activities involving very large amounts of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级金融界

Sense.DEF: the money that an organization or person has, and the way that they manage it
Sense.EXAMPLE: concerns about the company’s finances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对公司财务的担忧
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to answer questions about her personal finances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝回答有关个人财务状况的问题。

Sense.DEF: money provided by a bank or other institution to help buy or do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to raise finance for further research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要为进一步研究筹资。

Sense.DEF: to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concerts are financed by the Arts Council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会由艺术协会出资举办。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The financing for the deal has been approved in principle.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔交易的资金投入原则上已经得到批准了。

Sense.DEF: a company that lends money, especially to businesses
relating to money or the management of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: financial transactions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务往来
Sense.EXAMPLE: financial assistance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务援助
Sense.EXAMPLE: a financial advisor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务顾问
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success something that makes a profit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一部出色的影片﹐但在票房上不是很成功。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was successful and financially secure .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他事业有成﹐经济有保障。
这个项目财务上可行吗？

Exponent.DEF: relating to money or the management of money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: businesses that provide personal financial services
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供个人金融服务的公司
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the financial problems of old age
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人的财务问题

Exponent.DEF: relating to the money of a country, area, or society, and the way it is earned, spent, and controlled
Exponent.EXAMPLE: American voters were anxious for a change in economic policy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国选民担心经济政策的变化。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an economic crisis
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济危机

Exponent.DEF: relating to the money, debts, tax etc that are owned and managed by the government
Exponent.EXAMPLE: fiscal control
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政控制
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Indian government is trying to reduce the fiscal deficit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度政府在尽量减少财政赤字。

Exponent.DEF: relating to money, especially all the money in a country, and how it is managed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Bank of Thailand has retained a tight monetary policy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰国央行一直保持从紧的货币政策。

Exponent.DEF: relating to the official plan of how the money of a country or organization is spent
Exponent.EXAMPLE: City officials are facing tough budgetary decisions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政官员正面临棘手的预算决策。

Sense.DEF: money given or lent to students at college or university to pay for their education
a business organization that lends and borrows money, for example a bank
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the big financial institutions cut their interest rates today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各大金融机构今天都降低了利率。

Sense.DEF: the 12-month period over which a company’s accounts are calculated
someone who controls or lends large sums of money
a small bird with a short beak
to discover, see, or get something that you have been searching for
Sense.TRAN: 发现﹐找到 〔一直在寻找之物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t find the car keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到汽车钥匙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold on while I find a pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别挂电话﹐我找支笔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body was later found hidden in the bushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来有人发现她的尸体被藏在了灌木丛里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to find somewhere else to live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得另找住处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had almost given up hope of finding a husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她差不多要放弃找个丈夫的希望了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tony asked us to find him office facilities in New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼要我们替他在纽约找个办公地点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother went to the shops, and on her return, Kathleen was nowhere to be found could not be found .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈去买东西﹐回来的时候凯思琳找不到了。

Sense.DEF: to discover something by chance, especially something useful or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 〔意外〕碰见〔尤指有用或有意思的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found a purse in the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在大街上捡到一只皮夹子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found a nice pub near the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在宾馆附近发现一家不错的酒吧。

Sense.DEF: to discover that someone or something is in a particular condition or doing a particular thing when you see or touch them
Sense.TRAN: 发现〔某人或某物处在某状态或在做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure we’ll find her hard at work when we get home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信我们到家时会发现她在努力用功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried the door and found it unlocked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他推了推门﹐发现没锁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She woke to find a man by her bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醒来时发现床边有个男人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Often he found her quietly weeping alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他常常发现她独自默默流泪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked at her glass and was amazed to find it was empty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看了一眼自己的杯子﹐惊奇地发现里面空了。

Sense.DEF: to be in a particular state or do a particular thing, or to realize that this is happening, especially when you did not expect or intend it
Sense.TRAN: 发现﹐发觉〔尤指无意中处于某状态或在做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After wandering around, we found ourselves back at the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闲逛一圈之后﹐我们不知不觉又回到了宾馆。

GramExa.PROPFORM: find yourself/your mind etc doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When he left, Karen found herself heaving a huge sigh of relief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走了﹐卡伦如释重负﹐长舒了一口气。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tried to concentrate, but found her mind drifting back to Alex.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想集中精神﹐但是发觉自己的思绪又飘回到了亚历克斯身上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He found he was shivering.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发觉自己在发抖。

Sense.DEF: to discover or learn something by study, tests, sums etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔经研究﹑测试﹑计算等〕发现﹐找出﹐查明
Sense.EXAMPLE: The federal government isn’t doing enough to find a cure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦政府寻找对策不力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you find the square root of 20?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么计算20的平方根？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The liquid was found to contain 7.4g of phenylamine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 测得该液体中含有7.4克苯胺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His study found that married men and women had similar spending patterns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的研究发现﹐已婚男女的消费模式相似。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular feeling or opinion, or to have a particular feeling or opinion about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will Gary and Gail find happiness together?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里和盖尔在一起会幸福吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She found the work very dull.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得这工作很无聊。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lots of women I know find him attractive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认识的许多女性都认为他有魅力。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found them quite easy to use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得它们很好用。

GramExa.PROPFORM: find it hard/easy/difficult etc (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hyperactive children find it difficult to concentrate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多动的孩子觉得集中注意力很难。

Sense.DEF: to have the experience of discovering that something happens or is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You might find that his work improves now he’s at a new school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能会发现﹐他到了新学校﹐学习进步了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I find people are often surprised at how little it costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现人们常常很惊讶于它竟那么便宜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you’ll find more women entering the film business now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你会发现越来越多的女性进入电影业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found the people to be charming and very friendly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现那里的人可爱而且非常友好。

Sense.DEF: if something is found somewhere, it lives or exists there naturally
Sense.TRAN: 生长在某处﹐存在于某地
Sense.EXAMPLE: This species is only found in West Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一物种仅见于西非。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting enough of something, especially money, time, or energy, to be able to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s struggling to find the money for the trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在努力筹措旅行的资金。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where are we going to find the time, the support, and the resources to do all this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到哪里去找时间和人力物力做这一切呢？

Sense.DEF: to make an official decision in a court of law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both men were found guilty of illegally entering the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子都被判定为非法入境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tribunal found in favour of the defendant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别法庭判被告胜诉。

Sense.DEF: to reach a place by discovering the right way to get there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be able to find your way back?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你找得到回去的路吗？

Sense.DEF: if something finds its way somewhere, it arrives or gets there after some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her invention has found its way into the shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的发明摆上了商店的柜台。

Sense.DEF: to experience a good feeling because of something
Sense.TRAN: 在某事中找到安慰/快乐/满足等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He eventually found solace in religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于在宗教中找到了慰藉。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or some-thing, often unfairly and frequently
Sense.TRAN: 批评某人/某物﹐挑某人/某物的毛病
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could always find fault with something, either in my writing or in my personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总能找出什么毛病来﹐不是我的文章就是我的性格。

Sense.LEXUNIT: find it in your heart/yourself to do sth
Sense.DEF: to feel able or willing to do something
Sense.TRAN: 感觉能做某事﹔愿意做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seb could not find it in his heart to tell Nahum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞布不愿意告诉内厄姆。

Sense.DEF: to discover what you are really like and what you want to do – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 发现自我〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went to India to find herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去印度寻找自我。

Sense.DEF: to be liked or approved of by someone
Sense.TRAN: 得宠﹐受青睐（于某人/某事物）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recipes rapidly found favour with restaurant owners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些食谱很快就受到了餐馆老板的青睐。

Sense.DEF: to become confident in a new situation, especially one that is difficult at first
Sense.TRAN: 习惯新的环境〔尤指起初困难的环境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob is still finding his feet as a coach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布当教练还在适应过程中。

Subsense.DEF: if a remark, criticism etc finds its mark etc, it has the effect that you intended it to have
Subsense.TRAN: 〔言论﹑批评等〕击中要害﹐达到目的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She soon saw that her accusation had found its mark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快就看到﹐她的谴责达到了预期效果。

Subsense.DEF: to manage to say something after being too nervous to talk
if a writer, musician etc finds their voice, they are able to express their views, ideas, art etc in the way they want to
Subsense.TRAN: 〔作家﹑音乐家等〕能从心所欲表达自己的心声
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a young film-maker who has finally found his voice
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 终于能表达自己心声的一位年轻的电影制作人

Sense.DEF: to not be good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their defence was found wanting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的辩词有待改进。

Exponent.DEF: to get or see something that you have been searching for
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you found your passport yet?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你找到护照了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police later found the car abandoned in a wood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方后来发现﹐那辆车被丢弃在树林里。

Exponent.DEF: to find something that was hidden or that people did not know about before
Exponent.TRAN: 发现〔隐藏的或以前不知晓的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A second bomb has been discovered in south London.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二枚炸弹在伦敦南部被人发现。

Exponent.DEF: to find the exact position of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The airline are still trying to locate my luggage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司仍在努力寻找我的行李。

Exponent.DEF: to find something unexpectedly when you are not looking for it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I came across some old letters from my father in my drawer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偶然在抽屉里发现了几封父亲过去的来信。

Exponent.DEF: to find something unexpectedly, especially something very important
Exponent.TRAN: 碰巧找到某物〔尤指极为重要之物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They may have stumbled across some vital evidence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可能碰巧找到了一些极其重要的证据。

Exponent.DEF: to find someone or something that has disappeared, especially by a careful process of collecting information
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指通过仔细收集信息〕找到
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had given up all hope of tracing her missing daughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经完全放弃了找到失踪女儿的希望。

Exponent.DEF: to find someone or something that is difficult to find by searching in different places
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been trying to track down a book that’s out of print.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在搜寻一本绝版书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police managed to track down the killer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方追踪到了凶犯。

Exponent.DEF: to find something that has been hidden or lost for a long time, by digging or searching for it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 1796, a carved stone was unearthed near the burial mound.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1796年﹐在墓冢附近出土了一块石刻。

Sense.DEF: to judge that someone is wrong or guilty
Sense.TRAN: 作出不利〔于某人〕的判决﹔判〔某人〕败诉
Sense.EXAMPLE: The inspectors are likely to find against the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查人员可能会认为这家公司有问题。

Sense.DEF: to judge that someone is right or not guilty
Sense.TRAN: 作出有利〔于某人〕的判决﹔判〔某人〕胜诉
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge found for the plaintiff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官判原告胜诉。

Sense.DEF: to get information, after trying to discover it or by chance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Has anyone bothered to find out how much all this is going to cost?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谁去了解清楚这一切要花多少钱了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you find out whether there are any seats left?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你弄清楚是否还有座位剩余了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found out that my parents had never been married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现我的父母一直没有登记结婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To find out more, visit our website.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如欲了解详情﹐请访问我们的网站。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to find out more about these night courses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要再了解一下这些夜校课程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could find out from the local council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以从当地市政会了解情况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought it best to let you find out for yourself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想最好你自己去弄弄清楚。

F2NBox.HEADING: RIGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually say that someone discovers something rather than finds out something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英语书面语中﹐人们一般用discover﹐不用find out
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Scientists soon discovered that this was false.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家很快就发现这是错的。

Sense.DEF: if you are found out, someone discovers that you have been doing something dishonest or illegal
Sense.TRAN: 发现某人〔做不诚实或违法之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What happens if we get found out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们被查出来会怎么样？

Sense.DEF: something very good or useful that you discover by chance
Sense.TRAN: 〔偶然〕发现的好东西﹔〔有用的〕发现物
Sense.EXAMPLE: That restaurant was a real find!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家餐厅真是个好地方！

Sense.DEF: something that someone finds, especially by digging or by searching under water
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过挖掘或水下打捞找到的〕发现物
Sense.EXAMPLE: important archaeological finds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大的考古发现

Sense.DEF: someone who finds something that was lost or stolen
Sense.TRAN: 〔失物或赃物的〕寻得者﹐发现者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finder usually receives a reward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找到失物的人一般会有酬金。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if someone finds something, they have the right to keep it
typical of the end of the 19th century, especially its art, literature, and attitudes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指艺术﹑文学和观念〕具有19世纪末特征的

Sense.DEF: the information that someone has discovered as a result of their study, work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surveys conducted in other countries reported similar findings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在其他国家进行的调查也报告说有类似的结果。

Sense.DEF:
a decision made by a judge or
jury
satisfactory or acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 令人满意的﹐可以接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We’re meeting at 8.30.’ ‘Okay, fine.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们8点30分见吧。”“好的﹐可以。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In theory, the scheme sounds fine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论上﹐这个计划听起来不错。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want to use cheese instead of chicken, that’s fine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你想用奶酪来替代鸡肉﹐也是可以的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want chili sauce on it?’ ‘No, it’s fine as it is , thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要浇上辣椒汁吗？”“不用了﹐这样子就很好﹐谢谢。”

GramExa.GLOSS: used when telling someone that you do not want any more when they offer you something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘More coffee?’ ‘No, I’m fine , thanks.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “再来点咖啡吗？”“不了﹐我够了﹐谢谢。”

GramExa.PROPFORM: that’s fine by me/that’s fine with me etc
GramExa.GLOSS: used when saying that you do not mind about something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If Scott wanted to keep his life secret, that was fine by her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果斯科特想要隐瞒他的生活状况﹐她也无所谓。

Sense.DEF: in good health
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks, how are you?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你好吗？”“很好﹐谢谢﹐你呢？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel fine , really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉很好﹐真的。

Sense.DEF: very good or of a very high standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people regard Beethoven’s fifth symphony as his finest work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人认为贝多芬的第五交响曲是他最杰出的作品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very fine player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很优秀的选手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a fine idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个很妙的主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hatfield House is a fine example of Jacobean architecture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈特菲尔德宅第是英王詹姆斯一世时期建筑的典范。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant was chosen for its good food and fine wines .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅因其美酒佳肴而入选。

Sense.DEF: bright and not raining
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it’s fine tomorrow we’ll go out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果明天天气晴朗﹐我们就出门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope it stays fine for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望天气能为你一直晴下去。

Sense.DEF: very thin or narrow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fine needles are inserted in the arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很细的针扎在胳膊上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fine thread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细线
Sense.EXAMPLE: very fine hairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纤细的头发

Sense.DEF: attractive, neat, and delicate
Sense.EXAMPLE: fine china
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精美的瓷器
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dark hair accentuates her fine features nose, eyes, cheeks etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑发更衬托出了她清秀的五官。

Subsense.DEF: fine details, changes, differences etc are very small and therefore difficult to understand or notice
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We stayed up discussing the finer points of Marxist theory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们讨论马克思主义理论的细微之处直到三更半夜。

Subsense.DEF: in small grains, pieces, or drops
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A fine drizzle started falling.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天上下起了毛毛细雨。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a mixture of fine and coarse breadcrumbs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大小不等的面包屑

Subsense.DEF: fine material is made so that the spaces between the threads are very small
Subsense.EXAMPLE: fine netting
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细密的网
Subsense.EXAMPLE: scarlet cloth with a very fine weave
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 织得很密的猩红色布料

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone or something is bad in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s another fine mess bad situation he’s got himself into.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他闯下的又一个大祸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re a fine one to talk you are criticizing someone for something you do yourself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也好意思说别人。

Sense.DEF: sounding important and impressive, but probably not true or honest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only time will tell whether these fine sentiments will translate into action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯有时间才知道这番豪情能否变成行动。

Sense.DEF: a good person that you respect
Sense.TRAN: 值得尊敬的好男人/女人等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your father is a fine man, a real gentleman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你父亲是个值得尊敬的好人﹐一位真正的绅士。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a fine line between sth and sth
Sense.DEF: if you say that there is a fine line between two different things, you mean that they are so similar that one can easily become the other
Sense.TRAN: 某事物和某事物之间只有一线之差
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a fine line between bravery and recklessness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇敢和鲁莽仅一线之差。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get sth down to a fine art
Sense.DEF: to practise something so often that you become very skilled at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike had got the breakfast routine down to a fine art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克对早餐那一套非常在行。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not to put too fine a point on it
Sense.DEF: used when you are criticizing something in a plain and direct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: That wasn’t the best meal I’ve ever had, not to put too fine a point on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不客气地说﹐那真不是我吃过的最好吃的一顿饭。

Sense.DEF: someone’s finer feelings are the moral values they have, such as love, honour, loyalty etc
Sense.TRAN: 美好的感情〔如爱﹑荣誉﹑忠诚等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can hardly expect such finer feelings in a thief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难指望一个小偷会有这种高尚的情感。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a fine figure of a man/woman
Sense.DEF: someone who looks big, strong, and physically attractive
Sense.TRAN: 体形强壮的男性/身材曼妙的女性
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his portrait, Donlevy is a fine figure of a man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖像画中的唐利维是个体形强壮的男子。

Sense.DEF: a time when someone is very successful, brave etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tournament proved to be Gascoigne’s finest hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次锦标赛成为加斯科因的事业高峰。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: chance would be a fine thing

Sense.DEF: in a way that is satisfactory or acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s it going?’ ‘Fine, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你好吗？”“很好﹐谢谢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress fitted me fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条连衣裙我穿正合身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I had a good job and my boyfriend stayed at home, that’d suit me fine be very acceptable to me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我有一份好工作﹐而我男朋友待在家里﹐我完全能够接受。

Subsense.DEF: to be satisfactory or acceptable
Subsense.TRAN: 能行﹐能令人满意﹔可以接受
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Something very light,’ he ordered. ‘An omelette will do fine.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “来点简单的﹐”他点餐说﹐“一份煎蛋卷就可以了。”

Subsense.DEF: to do something well or in a satisfactory way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, you’re doing fine. Keep at it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐你做得不错﹐坚持下去。

Subsense.DEF: to be healthy and well
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s your husband?’ ‘He’s doing fine, thank you.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你丈夫好吗？”“他很好﹐谢谢。”

Sense.DEF: if you cut something fine, you cut it into very small or very thin pieces
to leave yourself only just enough time to do something
Sense.TRAN: 留出刚刚好的时间﹐把时间扣得很紧

Sense.DEF: to make someone pay money as a punishment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was fined for speeding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因超速驾车而被罚款 。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The club was fined £50,000 for financial irregularities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家俱乐部因财务违规被罚款5万英镑。

Sense.DEF: money that you have to pay as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £40 fine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40英镑罚款

GramExa.PROPFORM: pay a fine/pay £100/$50 etc in fines
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was ordered to pay £150 in parking fines, plus court costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被责令支付150英镑停车罚金﹐外加诉讼费。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Councils will get sweeping powers to impose fines on drivers who park illegally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各市政会将有绝对权力对违章停车者处以罚款。

GramExa.GLOSS: a large fine
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If convicted, the men face heavy fines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦定罪﹐这些人将面临巨额罚金。

Sense.DEF:
forms of art, especially paintings or
sculpture
, that are produced and admired for their beauty and high quality
Sense.TRAN: 艺术﹐美术〔尤指绘画﹑雕塑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can photography be considered fine art?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影能被认为是艺术吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the faculty of fine arts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术系

Sense.DEF: into very thin or very small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: finely chopped onion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剁得细碎的洋葱

Sense.DEF: in a very careful, delicate, or exact way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saunders’ finely crafted drawings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德斯精心绘制的画作
Sense.EXAMPLE: These instruments are very finely tuned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些乐器都非常仔细地调过音。

Sense.DEF: beautifully or impressively
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore a silk cloak over a finely embroidered robe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在华美的绣花袍外套了件真丝斗篷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: high-quality, finely carved statues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工艺上乘﹑雕工精美的塑像

Sense.DEF: clothes and jewellery that are beautiful or very expensive, and are worn for a special occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guests arrived in all their finery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾客们盛装到来。

Sense.DEF: if you do something with finesse, you do it with a lot of skill and style
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dario played the sonata with great finesse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达里奥以高超的技艺弹奏了这首奏鸣曲。

Sense.DEF: to handle a situation well, but in a way that is slightly deceitful
Sense.TRAN: 用巧妙的〔但略带欺骗性的〕手段处理

Sense.DEF: to do something with a lot of skill and style

Sense.LEXUNIT: go through/over sth with a fine-tooth comb
Sense.DEF: to examine something very carefully and thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police went over the scene of the crime with a fine-tooth comb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方彻底检查了犯罪现场。

Sense.DEF: to make very small changes to something such as a machine, system, or plan, so that it works as well as possible
Sense.TRAN: 对〔机器﹑系统﹑计划等〕进行微调﹐精密调节
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the next few days, we fine-tuned the scheme and made some useful improvements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的几天﹐我们对计划进行微调﹐作了些有益的改进。

Sense.DEF: one of the four long thin parts on your hand, not including your thumb
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman had a ring on her finger, so I assumed she was married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人手指上戴着戒指﹐因此我猜想她已经结婚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ate with our fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用手抓着吃。

GramExa.PROPFORM: run your fingers through/over/along etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ran her fingers through his hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手指给他拢了拢头发。

Subsense.DEF: to hope that something will happen the way you want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re keeping our fingers crossed that she’s going to be OK.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们祈求她不会有事。

Subsense.DEF: to secretly put one finger over another finger, because you are telling a lie – done especially by children
Subsense.TRAN: 〔说谎时〕偷偷将两根手指交叉〔尤为小孩所为〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s nice,’ said Laura, crossing her fingers under the table.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他不错啊。”劳拉说﹐偷偷地在桌子底下交叉手指。

PIC.HEADING: FINGER 手指
PIC.PICCONTENT: cross your fingers （交叉手指）祈求心想事成

Sense.DEF: to not make any effort to help someone with their work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do all the work around the house - Frank never lifts a finger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里所有的活儿都是我干——弗兰克一点忙都不帮。

Sense.DEF: to know or be able to explain exactly what is wrong, different, or unusual about a situation
Sense.TRAN: 确切地明白﹐弄清﹐准确地指出〔错误﹑不同或异常之处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was something about the man that worried Wycliffe, but he couldn’t put his finger on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男子身上有种东西让威克利夫不安﹐但是他说不出那究竟是什么。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not lay a finger on sb
Sense.DEF: to not hurt someone at all, especially to not hit them
Sense.TRAN: 不伤害某人〔尤指不动手打人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t lay a finger on me, or I’ll call the police!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你敢动我一指头﹐我就报警！

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/keep your finger on the pulse (of sth)
Sense.DEF: to always know about the most recent changes or developments in a particular situation or activity
Sense.TRAN: 掌握（某事物的）脉搏﹐了解（某事物的）最新变化[发展]
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who have their finger on the pulse of fashion and pop culture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掌握时尚及流行文化脉搏的人

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a finger in every pie/in many pies
Sense.DEF: to be involved in many activities and to have influence over a lot of people, used especially when you think someone has too much influence
Sense.TRAN: 插手每件/许多事情﹐每件/许多事情上都有一份

Sense.LEXUNIT: twist/wrap/wind sb around your little finger
Sense.DEF: to be able to persuade someone to do anything that you want
Sense.TRAN: 任意摆布某人﹐左右某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed could wrap his mother around his little finger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德能让自己的母亲言听计从。

Sense.DEF: if the finger of blame or suspicion points or is pointed at you, you’re blamed for or suspected of being responsible for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finger of suspicion immediately fell on Broderick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫌疑立刻指向了布罗德里克。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
glove
that covers your finger
anything that is long and thin, like the shape of a finger, especially a piece of land, an area of water, or a piece of food
Sense.TRAN: 指状物〔尤指土地﹑水域﹑食物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: fish fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼条
Sense.EXAMPLE: chocolate fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力条

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the long finger of Chile
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 智利的狭长地域

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to work harder
Sense.TRAN: 更努力地工作﹐加把劲干 〔用于告诫某人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: put two fingers up at sb
Sense.DEF: to show someone you are angry with them in a very offensive way by holding up your first two fingers with the back of your hand facing them
Sense.TRAN: 〔手背朝对方〕向某人竖起食指和中指〔表示愤怒﹔此动作极具冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: to show someone you are angry with them in a very offensive way by holding up your middle finger with the back of your hand facing them
Sense.TRAN: 〔手背朝对方〕向某人竖起中指〔表示愤怒﹔此动作极具冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: to use your hands in an awkward or careless way, so that you drop or break things
having long fingers, slim fingers etc
Sense.TRAN: 手指长的/手指纤细的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: lovely long-fingered hands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纤纤玉手

Sense.DEF: an amount of an alcoholic drink that is as high in the glass as the width of someone’s finger
Sense.TRAN: 一指宽﹐一横指〔指玻璃杯内酒的量度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: two fingers of whiskey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两指宽的威士忌

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have your hands/fingers in the till
count sth on the fingers of one hand
burn your fingers/get your fingers burnt
let sth slip through your fingers
work your fingers to the bone

Sense.DEF: to touch or handle something with your fingers
Sense.TRAN: 用手指触碰﹐拨弄﹐抚摸﹐触摸
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fingered the beautiful cloth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摸了摸这块漂亮的布。

Sense.DEF: if someone, especially a criminal, fingers another criminal, they tell the police what that person has done
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指罪犯向警察〕告发〔另一个罪犯〕

Sense.DEF:
the long part of a
stringed instrument
which the player presses the strings onto
a small bowl in which you wash your fingers during a meal
the positions in which a musician puts his or her fingers to play a piece of music, or the order in which he or she uses the fingers
a mark made by dirty fingers on something clean
the hard flat part that covers the top end of your finger
special paints that children use to paint with, using their fingers
when people blame other people for something that has gone wrong, instead of trying to solve the problem
Sense.TRAN: 指责〔指怪罪某人而不是去解决问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There followed months of name-calling and finger-pointing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来是一连几个月的辱骂和指责。

Sense.DEF: a mark made by the pattern of lines at the end of a person’s finger, which is used by the police to find out who has committed a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: His fingerprints were all over the gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪上到处是他的指纹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was careful not to leave any fingerprints .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心地不留下指纹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police questioned Beresford and took his fingerprints made a record of them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察审问了贝雷斯福德﹐并提取了他的指纹。

PIC.HEADING: FINGERPRINT 指纹
PIC.PICCONTENT: fingerprint 指纹；footprint 脚印

Sense.DEF: the practice of making a record of people’s fingerprints, and using them to try and find out who has committed a crime

a system of speaking to people who are
deaf
by touching their hand with your fingers and making the shapes of letters
Sense.TRAN: 〔与聋人交谈时使用的〕手指拼写

Sense.DEF: the end of your finger that is furthest away from your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: She touched his cheek gently with her fingertips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用指尖轻轻地触摸他的脸颊。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sth at your/their etc fingertips
Sense.DEF: to have knowledge or information ready and available to use very easily
Sense.TRAN: 手头有某物〔可供随时使用〕﹐对某物了如指掌
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have all the facts and figures at our fingertips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们手头掌握所有的详细资料。

Sense.DEF: in all ways; completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s British to her fingertips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是地道的英国人。

Sense.DEF: too concerned with unimportant details and small things that you like or dislike
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s very finicky about what she eats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃东西非常讲究。

Sense.DEF: needing to be done very carefully, while paying attention to small details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a finicky job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细致活

Sense.DEF: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t go anywhere until you’ve finished your homework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没完成家庭作业前你哪儿也不能去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you finished that book yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本书你看完了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finished typing the report just minutes before it was due.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在截止时间前几分钟才把报告打完。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s the decorating going?’ ‘We’ve nearly finished.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “装修进行得怎么样了？”“差不多快完成了。”

Sense.DEF: when an event, activity, or period of time finishes, it ends, especially at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The football season finishes in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球赛季在 5 月份结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time does school finish?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校什么时候放学？

Sense.DEF: to eat or drink all the rest of something, so there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just finish my coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喝完咖啡就好。

Sense.DEF: to complete an event, performance, piece of work etc by doing one final thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party finished with a sing-song.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会以一首合唱结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would like to finish by thanking you all for your help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在最后对大家的帮助表示感谢。

Sense.DEF: to be in a particular position at the end of a race, competition etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He finished second in the 100 metres, behind Ben Johnson.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 百米赛跑中他获得第二名﹐排在本•约翰逊之后。

Sense.DEF: to take away all of someone’s strength, energy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another run like that would just about finish me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再那样跑一次会把我累趴下的。

Sense.DEF: to completely use up the supply of something, especially food
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ice cream’s finished - can you get some more?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰激凌吃完了﹐你能再买一点吗？

Sense.DEF: to add the final details that make your work complete
Sense.TRAN: （对某物）作最后的润饰﹐做完最后的细节工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band are putting the finishing touches to their new album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队在为新专辑作最后的加工。

Sense.DEF: to give the surface of something, especially wood, a smooth appearance by painting, polishing, or covering it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用油漆﹑抛光或贴面等方法〕使光滑﹐给…作最后加工
Sense.EXAMPLE: The furniture had been attractively finished in a walnut veneer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具上贴了一层胡桃木饰面板﹐十分漂亮。

Exponent.DEF: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you finished your homework?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你作业做完了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The builders say they should have finished by Friday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人说他们本该在星期五前完工的。

Exponent.DEF: to finish making or doing something that has taken a long time to finish
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new bridge will be completed in two years’ time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新桥要两年时间完工。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has just completed her PhD.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚读完博士。

Exponent.DEF: to do the last things that are necessary in order to settle a plan or agreement in a satisfactory way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A spokesman said that they were hoping to finalize an agreement in the near future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 发言人说他们希望能在不久的将来达成协议。

Exponent.DEF: to officially finish something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police have now concluded their investigations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方目前已经结束了调查。

Exponent.DEF: to finish something successfully – used especially about agreements or sports competitions
Exponent.TRAN: 圆满完成某事﹐结束某事〔尤指协议或体育比赛〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Negotiators are meeting on Friday to wrap up the deal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判代表星期五开会以达成协议。

Exponent.DEF: to do something as a way of ending a day, an evening, an event etc in an enjoyable or suitable way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They rounded off the day with a barbecue at the beach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以沙滩烧烤结束了圆满的一天。

Exponent.EXP: get it over with/get it over and done with
Exponent.DEF: to do something that you have to do now, so that it is finished and you can stop worrying about it
Exponent.TRAN: 完成某事〔不再为此担心〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let’s go and do the shopping now and get it over with.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在去购物吧﹐早买完早踏实。

Exponent.DEF: if you are done, you have finished – used especially when other people are waiting for you
Exponent.TRAN: 完成了〔尤用于别人在等候时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re nearly done.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们差不多做好了。

Exponent.EXP: be through with sth/be done with sth
Exponent.DEF: to have finished using something – used especially when other people are waiting to use it
Exponent.TRAN: 用完某物了〔尤用于别人等着用时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m done with the file.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用完锉刀了。

Sense.DEF: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll take me a couple of hours to finish this job off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要几个小时才能完成这项工作。

Sense.DEF: to use or eat all of something, so there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who finished off the cake?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁把蛋糕吃光了？

Sense.DEF: to complete an event, performance, piece of work etc by doing one final thing
Sense.TRAN: 结束〔事件﹑演出﹑一项工作等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll finish off with a track from Adam’s new album.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将播放亚当新专辑中的一首歌作为结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She finished off her speech by thanking her sponsors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在演讲的最后向赞助方表示了感谢。

GramExa.PROPFORM: finish off/finish sth ↔ off by doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Finish off by cleaning the monitor and the keyboard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后要清洁显示器和键盘。

Sense.DEF: to kill a person or animal when they are already weak or wounded
Sense.TRAN: 〔在其体弱或受伤时〕结束某人/某物的生命

Sense.DEF: to take away all of someone’s strength, energy etc
Sense.TRAN: 耗尽某人的精力﹐使某人精疲力竭﹐累垮某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walk up the hill really finished me off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 徒步登山真把我累垮了。

Sense.DEF: to arrive at a particular place, after going to other places first
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took a long holiday in Italy and finished up in Rome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在意大利度了个长假﹐最后一站是罗马。

Sense.DEF: to get into a particular state or situation as the result of what you have done, especially without planning or expecting it
Sense.TRAN: 结果﹐最终〔进入某状态或某局面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to bribe a police officer and finished up in jail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图贿赂警察﹐结果进了监狱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brett got into a fight and finished up with a broken wrist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布雷特和人打了起来﹐结果手腕骨折。

Sense.DEF: to eat or drink all the rest of something, so there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, finish up your drinks!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐大家干杯！

Sense.DEF: to no longer need to use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you finished with the scissors?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用完剪刀了吗？

Sense.DEF: to have finished talking to someone or dealing with them, especially when you are angry with them or want to punish them
Sense.TRAN: 和某人说完话﹔收拾过某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go. I haven’t finished with you yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别走﹐我还没跟你说完呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When I’m finished with you,’ he said, ‘you’ll be lucky if you’re still alive.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “等我收拾完你﹐”他说﹐“你要是还能活着就算你运气。”

Sense.DEF: to end a romantic or sexual relationship with someone
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某人〕分手﹐与〔某人〕断绝关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: So I told him I wanted to finish with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是我就告诉他我想和他分手。

Sense.DEF: the end or last part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was watching the race but I didn’t get to see the finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看了比赛﹐但没看到最后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The day was a disaster from start to finish from the beginning until the end .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一天从头到尾就是一场灾难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t walk out - I like to see things through to the finish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会半途而废——我要把事情做完。

GramExa.GLOSS: an end of a race where two competitors are very close to each other
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔两名选手在比赛终结时〕不相上下﹐以微小差距分出高下

Sense.DEF: a fight or game in which the teams or competitors struggle until one is completely defeated
Sense.TRAN: 一定要分出胜负的战斗﹐一定要分出输赢的比赛

Sense.DEF: the appearance of the surface of an object after it has been painted, polished etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: That table has a beautiful finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张桌子的表面光洁漂亮。

Sense.DEF: no longer doing, dealing with, or using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m almost finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我差不多完成了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you finished with my tools yet?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用完我的工具了吗？

Sense.DEF: fully and properly made or completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took a long time to do, but the finished product was worth it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然花了很长时间﹐但从成品看是值得的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The painting began to look like the finished article.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画开始有点儿成品的样子了。

Sense.DEF: no longer successful, effective, or able to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the bank refuses to increase our loan, we’re finished!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果银行拒绝增加贷款﹐我们就完蛋了！

Sense.DEF: the line at which a race ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: James crossed the finish line in just under four minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯以不到四分钟的成绩冲过终点线。

Sense.DEF: a private school where rich girls go to learn social skills
Sense.TRAN: 精修学校〔指富家女孩学习社交技能的一种私立学校〕

Sense.DEF: having an end or a limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: the earth’s finite resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球有限的资源

Sense.DEF: a finite verb form shows a particular time. ‘Am’, ‘was’, and ‘are’ are examples of finite verb forms, but ‘being’ and ‘been’ are not.
someone who tells the police, a teacher, or a parent when someone else breaks a rule or a law
a person who you do not like or respect
to tell the police, a teacher, or a parent that someone has broken a rule or a law

another spelling of
fjord
a tree with leaves shaped like needles that do not fall off in winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fir tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷杉树

Sense.DEF: the hard brown fruit that contains the seeds of a fir tree
uncontrolled flames, light, and heat that destroy and damage things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The warehouse was completely destroyed by fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仓库全给烧毁了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thirty people died in a fire in downtown Chicago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 30人死于芝加哥市中心的一场火灾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police think that the fire was started deliberately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为有人故意纵火。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rioters set fire to a whole row of stores made them start burning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴徒纵火焚烧了一整排商店。

Sense.DEF: burning material used to heat a room, cook food etc, or get rid of things you do not want
Sense.EXAMPLE: You put up the tent and I’ll make a fire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你搭帐篷﹐我来生火。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you help me light the fire ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我点火好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire has almost gone out stopped burning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火差不多灭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all sat around the camp fire , singing songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全都坐在篝火旁唱歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire was still smouldering in the grate there was a little smoke and it had almost stopped burning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉膛里仍有余火。

GramExa.PROPFORM: by the fire/in front of the fire
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come and sit by the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐到炉火前面来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They dried their clothes in front of an open fire .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在明火前烘衣服。

Sense.DEF: a machine that produces heat to warm a room, using gas or electricity as power
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gas fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气取暖器
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电取暖器

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turn on the fire, I’m cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开取暖器吧﹐我冷。

GramExa.GLOSS: make it hotter or colder

Sense.DEF: shots fired from a gun, especially many guns at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Troops opened fire on started shooting at the demonstrators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队朝示威人群开枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These women did vital work, often under enemy fire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些女性的工作至关重要﹐而且往往是在敌人的炮火之下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels agreed to hold their fire not shoot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子同意停止射击。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be in the line of fire

Subsense.DEF: to be severely criticized for something you have done – used in news reports
Subsense.TRAN: 受到严厉[猛烈]批评〔用于新闻报道〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rail chiefs came under fire after raising train fares.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车票涨价之后﹐铁路方面主管人员受到猛烈抨击。

Subsense.DEF: to be shot at

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our patrol came under fire from rooftop gunmen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的巡逻队遭到了屋顶枪手的射击。

Sense.DEF: a very strong emotion that makes you want to think about nothing else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fire of religious fanaticism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教狂热的烈火

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ali returned to boxing with a new fire in his belly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里怀着重新燃起的斗志返回拳坛。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is on fire feels very painful
to do something that makes someone who is being lazy start doing their work
Sense.TRAN: 使某人〔指偷懒者〕加把劲

Sense.DEF: to do something very difficult and dangerous for someone
a phrase describing Hell, used by some religious people
Sense.TRAN: 硫磺烈火〔一些宗教人士形容地狱的说法〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: get on like a house on fire

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fire may have been started by a cigarette.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 火灾可能是由一支香烟引起的。

Collocate.COLLOC: set fire to sth/set sth on fire
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make something start burning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A candle fell over, setting fire to the curtains.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支蜡烛倒了﹐点着了窗帘。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it starts burning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The boat caught fire and sank.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船着火沉没了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop a fire burning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Firemen successfully extinguished the fire.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员成功扑灭了大火。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try to make a fire stop burning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Further attempts to fight the fire were abandoned.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 放弃了继续救火的尝试。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fire was burning more strongly every minute.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼看着火越烧越旺。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it starts suddenly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A fire broke out in the engine room.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮机舱失火了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it stops burning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After several hours, the fire eventually went out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个小时后﹐火终于熄灭了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it burns strongly for a long time over a large area
be burning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The whole house was on fire within minutes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不消几分钟﹐整幢房子都烧了起来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Firefighters took more than an hour to bring the fire under control.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员用一个多小时控制住了火势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A big fire was raging at the fuel depot.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 油库燃起大火。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very large fire in a forest
a fire that starts inside a house

Exponent.DEF: flames that burn in an uncontrolled way and destroy or damage things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In April, a fire at the school destroyed the science block.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 四月份,学校的一场大火烧毁了理科大楼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a forest fire
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林火灾

Exponent.DEF: the bright parts of a fire that you see burning in the air
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The flames from the burning building were lighting up the night sky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失火大楼上腾起的火焰照亮了夜空。

Exponent.DEF: a large and dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Firemen fought to keep the blaze under control.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员奋力控制火势。

Exponent.DEF: an extremely large and dangerous fire which is out of control – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 熊熊烈火﹐火海〔指难以控制的火势﹔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The entire building was on fire and hundreds of people were trapped in the inferno.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整幢大楼都在燃烧﹐数百人被困火海。

Exponent.DEF: a very large fire that destroys a lot of buildings, trees etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The conflagration spread rapidly through the old town.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大火迅速蔓延整个古镇。

Sense.DEF: to shoot bullets or bombs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soldiers fired on the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵朝人群开枪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police fired two shots at the suspects before they surrendered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察朝嫌犯开了两枪他们才投降。

GramExa.GLOSS: make it shoot
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 开枪/发射武器/击发步枪等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sound of a gun being fired
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guerrillas fired five rockets at the capital yesterday, killing 23 people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天﹐游击队朝首都发射了5枚火箭弹﹐炸死23人。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave their job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She didn’t want to get fired.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想被解雇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve just been fired from my job, and I don’t know what to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚被解雇﹐不知道该怎么办。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The airline fired him for being drunk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司因为他醉酒把他开除了。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually say that someone is dismissed rather than fired , which is slightly informal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英语书面语中﹐人们一般说someone is dismissed﹐不说fired﹐因为后者显得不那么正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He was dismissed for being drunk.

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel interested in something and excited about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was fired with enthusiasm to go traveling in Asia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我满怀热情去亚洲旅行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: stories of magic and adventure that fire children’s imaginations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 激发儿童想象力的魔法和历险故事

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions quickly often in order to criticize them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人提出一连串质问

Sense.DEF:
using wood, gas, or coal as
fuel
Sense.TRAN: 烧木柴的/烧煤气的/烧煤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gas-fired stove
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气炉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a coal-fired boiler
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃煤锅炉

Sense.DEF:
to bake bricks, clay pots etc in a
kiln
Sense.EXAMPLE: fired earthenware
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧制好的陶器

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle’s engine fires, the petrol is lit to make the engine work
to be thinking or doing something well, using all your mental abilities and energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the team’s firing on all cylinders, they can beat the best in the league.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支球队如果全力以赴﹐可以击败联赛中的最强者。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are ready to answer questions
Sense.TRAN: 请说吧〔用于准备好回答问题时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you mind if I ask you something, Woody?’ ‘Fire away.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “问你一些事行吗﹐伍迪？”“说吧。”

Sense.DEF: to quickly and angrily answer a question or remark
Sense.TRAN: 快速而气愤地回答[反驳]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: President Bush has fired back at his critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什总统反驳了他的批评者。

Sense.DEF: to shoot a bullet, bomb etc into the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chuck reloaded and fired off both barrels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查克重新给枪上了膛﹐然后把两根枪筒中的子弹都打了出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mexicans have a tradition of firing off guns to welcome in the new year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥人有鸣枪迎新年的传统。

Sense.DEF: to quickly send an angry letter to someone
Sense.TRAN: 匆忙寄发〔表达愤怒的信件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fired off a furious letter to the editor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我气冲冲地给编辑发了一封信。

Sense.DEF: to make someone become very excited, interested, or angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was alarming the way she got so fired up about small things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对一些小事情也发这么大的火﹐真是令人担忧。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn people of a fire in a building
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物内的〕火警钟﹐火警报警器
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were in the middle of an exam when the fire alarm went off .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的考试正进行到一半﹐这时火警报警器响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone set off the fire alarm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人触响了火警报警器。

Sense.DEF: a type of insect that lives in groups. They build large piles of earth to live in, and can give a very painful bite.
a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was charged with illegal possession of a firearm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控非法持有火器。

Sense.DEF: a ball of fire, especially one caused by an explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jet exploded in midair and turned into a fireball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那架喷气式飞机在半空爆炸﹐变成了一团火球。

Sense.DEF: a bomb that makes a fire start burning when it explodes
to attack a place with firebombs
Sense.EXAMPLE: His home was firebombed by animal rights activists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家被动物权利支持者投掷了燃烧弹。

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to make people angry about a law, government etc so that they will try to change it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an idealistic young firebrand from the valleys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个来自山沟沟﹑满脑子空想的年轻煽动分子

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of land where all the plants and trees have been removed, made to prevent fires from spreading
a brick that is not damaged by heat, used in chimneys

the
fire service
a group of people who work together to stop fires burning, but are not paid to do this
someone who deliberately starts fires to destroy property

someone who is in charge of all the
fire stations
in a city or area
Sense.TRAN: 消防署署长﹔消防队队长

Sense.DEF:
a small
firework
that explodes loudly
the organization that works to prevent fires and stop them burning
a heavy door in a building that is kept closed to help to prevent a fire from spreading
an occasion when people pretend that a building is burning and practise leaving it, so that they learn what to do if there is a real fire
an entertainer who puts burning sticks into his mouth
a special large vehicle that carries equipment and the people that stop fires burning, especially the equipment that shoots water at a fire

metal stairs or a metal
ladder
on the outside of a tall building, that people can use to escape if there is a fire
Sense.TRAN: 〔高楼外部供火警时逃生用的〕太平梯

Sense.DEF: a door that is used to let people out of a building such as a cinema, hotel, restaurant etc when there is a fire
a metal container with water or chemicals in it, used for stopping small fires
a short gun battle, involving soldiers or the police
someone whose job is to stop fires burning
the work of stopping fires burning
the actions that are taken to find out what has caused a sudden problem in an organization, machine etc, and to correct it
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织﹑机器等出现问题时的〕紧急应对措施

Sense.DEF: an insect with a tail that shines in the dark

a large wire or metal screen that is put in front of a
fireplace
to protect people
Sense.TRAN: 〔放在壁炉前保护人的〕炉栏﹐挡火隔网

Sense.DEF:
a small
fire station
, especially in a small town
a water pipe in a street used to get water to stop fires burning

a metal tool used to move or put coal or wood on a fire in a
fireplace
the light produced by a small fire
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room glowed in the firelight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间被炉火映照得红红的。

Sense.DEF: a piece of a substance that burns easily and helps to light a coal fire
a man whose job is to stop fires burning
a special place in the wall of a room, where you can make a fire
the number of weapons that an army, military vehicle etc has available
the amount of something important or necessary that is available
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no shortage of financial firepower to fund atomic research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原子能研究不愁没有财力支持。

Sense.DEF: a building, piece of cloth etc that is fireproof cannot be badly damaged by flames
Sense.EXAMPLE: fireproof clothing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防火服

Sense.DEF: the crime of starting a fire de-liberately
fire retardant materials or substances do not burn easily and are put on things to stop them from burning quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: furniture treated with fire-retardant chemicals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经阻燃化学剂处理的家具

Sense.DEF: a sale of goods at a lower price because they have been slightly damaged by a fire, or of goods that cannot be stored because of a fire

a large wire or metal screen that is put in front of a
fireplace
to protect people
Sense.TRAN: 〔壁炉前保护人的〕炉栏﹐挡火隔网

Sense.DEF: the organization that works to prevent fires and stop them from burning
the area close to or around a small fire, especially in a home
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cat dozing by the fireside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只在炉边打瞌睡的猫

Sense.DEF:
a building where the equipment used to stop fires burning is kept, and where
firefighters
stay until they are needed
a very large fire that is kept burning by the high winds that it causes
a lot of protests, complaints, or arguments that happen suddenly and all at once

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Green’s proposal provoked a firestorm of protests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林的提议激起一阵抗议风暴。

Sense.DEF: a building that would be very difficult to escape from if a fire started there
Sense.TRAN: 火灾时很难逃生的建筑物

Sense.DEF:
a
fire engine
a special wall that prevents fires from spreading to other parts of a building

a system that protects a computer
network
from being used or looked at by people who do not have permission to do so
a system that is used by large financial or law companies to stop secret information from being passed from one department to another
Sense.TRAN: 〔大型金融公司或律师事务所用于防止秘密信息在各部门间传递的〕防火墙

Sense.DEF:
a strong alcoholic drink, such as
whisky
wood that has been cut or collected in order to be burned in a fire
a small container filled with powder that burns or explodes to produce coloured lights and noise in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: a New Year’s Eve fireworks display
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除夕夜的烟火表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff and David were in the back yard setting off fireworks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫和戴维在后院放烟花。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will be angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’ll be fireworks if I get home late again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我再晚回家﹐有人会发火的。

Sense.DEF: something that is exciting or impressive
Sense.TRAN: 亮点〔令人兴奋或赞叹之物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The real fireworks are provided by Shakespeare’s poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真正的亮点来自莎士比亚的诗作。

Sense.DEF: to be in a position or situation in which you can be attacked or blamed for something, often unfairly
Sense.TRAN: （处于）首当其冲受攻击[责备]的地位[情形]

Sense.DEF: a group of soldiers whose duty is to punish prisoners by shooting and killing them
a business or company, especially a small one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指小型的〕公司﹐商行﹐事务所

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works for an electronics firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一家电子公司工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kevin is with a firm of accountants in Birmingham.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文在伯明翰的一家会计师事务所工作。

Sense.DEF: not completely hard, but not soft, and not easy to bend into a different shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sofa cushions are fairly firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙发的坐垫很硬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a firm green apple
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硬的青苹果
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most doctors recommend sleeping on a firm mattress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数医生建议睡硬床垫。

Sense.DEF: strongly fixed in position, and not likely to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the ladder feels firm before you climb up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保梯子稳固了再爬上去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A concrete foundation was poured after digging down to firm ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挖到坚实的地面后浇水泥地基。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mount the tanks side by side on a firm base .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把水箱靠在一起放在稳固的底座上。

Sense.DEF: not likely to change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our client hasn’t reached a firm decision on the matter yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的客户在这件事上还未作出最后决定。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blackpool remains a firm favourite with holiday makers from Northern Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布莱克浦仍是北爱尔兰度假者不变的最爱。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Corey was always a firm believer in prayer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科里一直坚信祷告的力量。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They made a firm offer offered to pay a particular amount on the house over the weekend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末﹐他们对那幢房子给出了最终买价。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Diana and Laura have been firm friends close friends since their early teens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜和劳拉从十几岁起一直友情甚笃。

Sense.DEF: showing in the way that you behave or speak that you are the person in control and that you are not likely to change your answer, belief etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cal replied with a polite but firm ‘no’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔很有礼貌但语气坚决地回答说“不行”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What this country needs is firm leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家需要的是强有力的领导。
