GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to be firm with her or she’ll try to take advantage of you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对她要强硬﹐否则她就会欺负你。

Sense.DEF: if you have something in a firm grip etc, you are holding it tightly and strongly
Sense.TRAN: 紧握﹐紧紧抓住﹐牢牢握住
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a firm grip of my arm and marched me towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他紧紧抓着我的手臂﹐快步往门口走去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a firm handshake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧紧的握手

Sense.DEF: to state your opinion clearly and not be persuaded to change it
to not change your actions or opinions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jones is urging Christians to stand firm against abortion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯力劝基督徒们坚决反对堕胎。

Sense.DEF: a strict way of dealing with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: These children need a firm hand .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子得严加管教。

Sense.DEF: if the value of a particular country’s money is firm, it does not fall in value

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pound is still firm against the dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑对美元依旧坚挺。

Sense.DEF: to press down on soil to make it harder or more solid
to make arrangements, ideas etc more definite and exact
Sense.TRAN: 把〔安排﹑想法等〕确定下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping to firm up the deal later this month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望能在这个月晚些时候把这笔买卖确定下来。

Sense.DEF: to make a part of your body have more muscle and less fat by exercising
the sky or heaven

instructions to computers that are stored on
chips
rather than in programs
coming before all the other things or people in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ella was his first girlfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉是他的首任女友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first time I flew on a plane I was really nervous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次乘飞机时确实很紧张。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the first year, all students take five courses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一年﹐所有学生都选五门课程。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He said the first thing that came into his head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想到什么就说什么。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first step towards achieving a peace agreement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成和平协议的第一步
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a meeting on the first Monday of every month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月第一个星期一都会开会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I only read the first two chapters of the book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只读了这本书的前两章。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It rained during the first few days of the trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行的头几天在下雨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The first and last mountain I climbed was Mount Rundle it was the only mountain I ever climbed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦多山是我爬过的第一座山﹐也是最后一座。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has never happened or been done before
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the first time in his life he felt truly happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这辈子第一次真正地感到幸福。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The survey revealed that, for the first time, there are more women in the workplace than men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查显示﹐职场里女性首次多于男性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not for the first time she wondered how he coped with so many children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不止一次想知道他是如何应付这么多小孩子的。

Sense.DEF: most important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our first priority is to maintain the standard of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的首要目标是保持工作的水准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I see it, my first responsibility is to my family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐我首先要对我的家庭尽责。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about the beginning of a situation, or the situation before something happened
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why did you agree to meet her in the first place?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一开始你为什么同意见她？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He wouldn’t have given you the job in the first place if he didn’t think you could do it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他认为你干不了﹐一开始就不会给你那份工作的。

Subsense.DEF: used to give the first in a list of reasons or points
Subsense.TRAN: 首先﹐第一〔用于列举理由或要点〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her success was secured by two factors. In the first place, she had the support of managers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的成功有两个因素作保证。首先﹐她得到了经理们的支持。

Sense.DEF: at the start of a situation or series of actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The appointment of research officer will be for two years in the first instance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究员的初始任期为两年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enquiries should be made in the first instance to the Human Resources Director.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如需查询﹐请先与人力资源主管联系。

Sense.DEF: the first time that you look at someone or something, before you notice any details
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first glance the twins look identical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对双胞胎乍一看一模一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first sight, there didn’t appear to be much damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乍看之下损失似乎不太大。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something should be done or dealt with first because it is the most important
Sense.TRAN: 重要的事先来﹐要紧的事先做

Sense.DEF: if you see, experience, hear etc something at first hand, you see, experience etc it yourself, not through other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people have seen the horrors of war at first hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人亲眼目睹过战争的恐怖。

Sense.DEF: the prize that is given to the best person or thing in a competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She won first prize in a painting competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一次绘画比赛中得了第一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a first prize of £10,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一等奖奖金为一万英镑。

Sense.DEF: the thing or person you like best
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was our first choice as a name for the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “约翰”是我们给宝宝取名的首选。

Sense.DEF: as soon as you get up in the morning, or as soon as you start work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll call you first thing tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天一上班就打电话给你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re leaving first thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早晨一醒来就出发。

Sense.DEF: very early in the morning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The search will resume at first light tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天天一亮继续搜寻。

Sense.DEF: to be the person who starts to do something when someone else is too nervous, embarrassed etc to do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔在别人紧张﹑尴尬等时〕首先采取行动﹐率先挺身而出
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was glad she had made the first move and kissed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很高兴她主动吻了他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have the first idea about sth

Variant.LEXVAR: not know/understand the first thing about sth

Sense.DEF: to not know anything about a subject, or not know how to do something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事一窍不通[一无所知]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t have the first idea about what to do in that situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我若遇此情形就会无所适从。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know the first thing about cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对汽车一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: the beginning of a good period of time when you are young, successful etc
Sense.TRAN: 某事物[某人]的初期强盛阶段

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in the first flush of passion/youth etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was no longer in the first flush of youth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已不再青春年少。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The first flush of enthusiasm had passed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热情高涨的初期已经过去。

Sense.DEF: used in the title of someone’s job or position to show that they have a high rank
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大副
Sense.EXAMPLE: the First Lord of the Admiralty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海军大臣

Sense.DEF: officially on the same level as other people but really having more power
of the highest quality
Sense.TRAN: 第一流的﹐上等的﹐质量最高的

Sense.DEF: before anything or anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cindy and Joe arrived first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪和乔最早到达。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An extra five points will be given to the team that finishes first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最先完成的队将再加五分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: First of all we’d better make sure we’ve got everything we need.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我们最好确保所需的东西都齐了。

Sense.DEF: before doing anything else, or before anything else happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll join you in a minute but I need to make a phone call first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一会儿就来﹐但是我得先打个电话。

Sense.DEF: done for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book was first published in 2000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此书2000年首次出版。

Sense.DEF: at the beginning of a situation or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we were first married we lived in Toronto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚结婚时住在多伦多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We first became friends when we worked together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最初是在共事时成为朋友的。

Sense.DEF: used before saying the first of several things you want to say
Sense.EXAMPLE: First, I’d like to thank everyone for coming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我要感谢各位的光临。

Subsense.DEF: before doing anything else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: First off I’d like you all to fill in an evaluation sheet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先我想请各位填写一张评估表。

Subsense.DEF: used before saying the first of several things you want to say, especially when you are annoyed
Subsense.TRAN: 首先〔用于想说的几件事之前﹐尤用于生气时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: First off I didn’t agree with the comments in your email.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我不同意你电子邮件里的意见。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the first thing you are going to talk about, or the first thing that is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: First up is the Blues song ‘Mississippi Lad’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一首是蓝调歌曲《密西西比小伙》。

Sense.DEF: to consider someone or something as the most important person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 认为某人/某事最重要﹐把某人/某事放在第一位
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to choose energy policies that put the environment first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得选择把环境放在首位的能源政策。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses should always put the customer first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业应该始终把顾客放在第一位。

Subsense.DEF: to be the most important person or thing to someone
Subsense.TRAN: 成为〔某人〕最重要的人[物]﹐处于最重要地位
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The care and well-being of patients should always come first.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人的护理和健康应该始终放在第一位。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As far as I’m concerned, the children come first.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就我而言﹐孩子最重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Business always came first with Luke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对卢克来说﹐生意总是第一位的。

Subsense.DEF: to win a competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The choir came first in all sections of the competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该合唱团在比赛中一路过关斩将夺得桂冠。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the most important quality, purpose, reason etc
Sense.TRAN: 首先﹐首要的是〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dublin is thought of first and foremost for its literary heritage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都柏林首先让人想到的是它的文学遗产。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is the most important thing or quality
Sense.TRAN: 主要地〔强调是最重要的事或品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She regarded herself as a teacher first and last, not a writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为自己主要是个教师﹐而不是作家。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will be given to the people who ask for it first, when there is not enough for everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tickets will be allocated on a first come, first served basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 票的发放遵循先到先得的原则。

Exponent.DEF: used when mentioning the first in a list of reasons, arguments, or questions to consider
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I want you to consider these three points in your essay: first, what is the writer’s attitude to the war in this poem ...
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能在文章中阐述以下三点: 首先﹐本诗中作者对战争的态度…
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are several reasons for this conclusion. Firstly ...
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本结论基于以下理由: 首先…

Exponent.DEF: used especially to emphasize that the first of several things you are going to say is the most important thing
Exponent.TRAN: 首先〔尤用于强调所说的第一件事最重要〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The content of the article must, first of all, be accurate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章的内容首先必须准确无误。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: First of all, a huge thank you to everyone who has supported us over the last two years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐非常感谢在过去两年里所有支持过我们的人。

Exponent.DEF: used when giving the first and most important reason or example, especially when you are arguing or discussing something with someone
Exponent.TRAN: 首先〔用于列举重要理由或事例,尤在辩论或讨论时用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our main priority should be better public transport – in the first place to reduce the amount of traffic on our roads.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的重点应当是改善公共交通——首先要减少马路上的车流量。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s not the right person for the job. For a start he’s too young.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不是这份工作的合适人选。首先﹐他太年轻。

Exponent.DEF: used when telling someone the first and most important thing that you want to say
Exponent.TRAN: 首先〔用于说明最先以及最重要的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are numerous activities on offer. To start with there are over 60 miles of walks with splendid views.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有各式各样的活动可供选择。首先便是长达60多英里的徒步观景之旅。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the beginning of a situation, especially when it is different now
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first, Gregory was shy and hardly spoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起先﹐格雷戈里很害羞﹐几乎不说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt quite disappointed at first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初我感觉很失望。

Sense.DEF: something that has never happened or been done before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 3-0 defeat was a first for the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 0比3失利对该队来说是前所未有的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: These results are firsts in the history of women’s athletics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些成绩在女运动员历史上是第一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think he’ll agree to it.’ ‘ That will be a first .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想他会同意的。”“那倒是破天荒头一遭。”

Sense.DEF: from the beginning of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was against the idea from the first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一开始就反对那个主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should have known from the first that the relationship would never work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一开始就该知道这种关系是不可能有结果的。

Sense.DEF:
the highest mark you can get in a university
degree
in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学学位中的〕优等成绩﹐最高成绩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen got a first in Law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦获得了法学学位的优等成绩。

Sense.DEF:
the lowest
gear
in a car or other vehicle, that you use when moving slowly
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车等交通工具的〕一挡﹐最低挡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should be in first on a hill like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上这样的山坡你应该挂一挡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He put the car into first and roared away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车挂到一挡﹐轰隆隆地开走了。

Sense.DEF: the first person to do something, or the first thing to happen
Sense.TRAN: 第一个人﹔首次出现的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are now many similar housing projects but this was the first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在类似的住宅项目有许多﹐但在当时这一项目是首创。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope this year’s festival will be the first of many .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望今年的节庆活动只是一个开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I always thought my sister would be the first to get married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直认为我姐姐会第一个结婚。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: James was the first to arrive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯第一个到达。

Sense.DEF: used when you have just discovered something that other people already know, and you are slightly annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 我第一次知道/听说〔指刚知道其他人已知之事﹐并略感气恼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first I knew he was in York was when I got an email from him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我收到他的电子邮件才知道他在约克。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first I knew about it was when Tony called me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼打电话来我才知道这件事。

Sense.DEF: used after the name of a king, queen, or Pope when other later ones have the same name
Sense.TRAN: 一世〔用于国王﹑女王或教皇的名字后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Queen Elizabeth the First written as Queen Elizabeth I
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王伊丽莎白一世

Sense.DEF: simple medical treatment that is given as soon as possible to someone who is injured or who suddenly becomes ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being given first aid at the scene of the accident probably saved his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在事故现场得到急救﹐这可能救了他的命。

Sense.DEF: someone who is trained to give first aid

a special bag or box containing
bandages
and medicines to treat people who are injured or become ill suddenly

PIC.HEADING: FIRST AID KIT 急救箱
PIC.PICCONTENT: antiseptic cream 抗菌乳膏；first aid kit 急救箱；bandage 绷带；cotton wool balls BrE【英】/cotton balls AmE【美】棉球；gauze 纱布；plaster BrE【英】/Band-Aid AmE【美】创可贴；syringe 注射器；scissors 剪刀

Subsense.DEF: the first of the four places in a game of baseball that a player must touch before gaining a point
the position of a defending player near this place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He plays first base for the Red Sox.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在红袜队打一垒。

Subsense.DEF: to reach the first stage of success in an attempt to achieve something
Subsense.TRAN: 达到成功的第一步﹐初步成功
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ve gotten to first base if you’ve landed an interview.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你得到了面试机会﹐那你就获得了初步的成功。

Subsense.DEF: to kiss someone in a sexual way, used especially by young men to talk about the first stage in a sexual relationship
Subsense.TRAN: 上第一步﹐上第一垒〔指男女关系中的第一阶段﹐即亲吻﹐尤为年轻男子使用〕

Sense.DEF: your first child
the best and most expensive seats on a plane or train, or rooms in a hotel
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑火车的〕头等舱位[车厢]﹔〔酒店的〕头等房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: We prefer to travel in first class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们喜欢乘坐头等舱出行。

Subsense.DEF: a class of post used in Britain for letters and parcels, that is quicker and more expensive than second-class post
Subsense.TRAN: 〔英国优先投递的〕第一类邮件〔比第二类邮件快但贵〕

Subsense.DEF: the class of post used in the US for ordinary business and personal letters
Subsense.TRAN: 〔美国递送普通商业信函和私人信函的〕第一类邮件﹐普通平邮

Sense.DEF: the highest class of degree from a British university
of very good quality, and much better than other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a first-class wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一种优等葡萄酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His writing is first-class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品是一流的。

Sense.DEF: relating to the class of post that is the most expensive and quickest to arrive

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 第一类邮件的邮票/第一类邮件等

Sense.DEF: relating to the best and most expensive class of seats on a plane or train, or rooms in a hotel
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机舱位﹑火车车厢﹑酒店房间〕头等的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 头等舱[车厢]乘客/座位/隔间等

RunOn.EXAMPLE: If I send the letter first class it should arrive tomorrow.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我把信作为第一类邮件投寄﹐那明天就能寄到。

Sense.DEF:
a child of your
aunt
or
uncle
Sense.TRAN: 堂兄 [弟﹐姐﹐妹]﹔表兄[弟﹐姐﹐妹]

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a university degree such as a BA or a BSc, obtained by people who do not already have a degree
first-degree murder
a burn that is not very serious
murder of the most serious type, in which someone deliberately kills someone else
one of the first copies of a book, which is often valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: an impressive collection of 19th century first editions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批精彩的19世纪初版图书

Sense.DEF: happening for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: her first-ever television interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的第一次电视采访
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first-ever visit to China by an American president
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国总统的首次访华

Sense.DEF: the family of the President of the US
Sense.TRAN: 第一家庭〔指美国总统的家庭〕

Sense.DEF: the floor of a building just above the one at the bottom level
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flat on the first floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二楼的一套公寓

Sense.DEF: the floor of a building at the bottom level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fire broke out on the first floor of the apartment building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公寓楼的底层起火了。

Sense.DEF: the first good result of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first fruits of the government’s privatization policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府私有化政策的最初成果

Sense.DEF:
the lowest
gear
in a car or other motor vehicle, used when starting to move or when going up or down a very steep hill
Sense.TRAN: 〔机动车辆的〕第一挡﹐头挡﹐最低挡

Sense.DEF: people who have moved to live in a new country, or the children of these people
Sense.TRAN: 第一代移民﹔第一代移民的子女

Sense.DEF: the first type of a machine to be developed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first generation of hand-held computers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一代掌上电脑

Sense.DEF: the first people to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first generation of radical feminists in the US
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国第一批激进的女权主义者

Sense.DEF: the first of two equal periods of time that a sports match is divided into
experience etc that has been learned or gained by doing something yourself or by talking to someone yourself
Sense.TRAN: 亲身体验/直接得来的知识/第一手报道等
Sense.EXAMPLE: journalists with first-hand experience of working in war zones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有战地工作经验的新闻记者

Sense.DEF:
the wife of the President of the US, or of the
governor
of a US state
Sense.TRAN: 第一夫人〔指美国的总统夫人或州长夫人〕

Sense.DEF: a woman who is considered to be the very best at a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first lady of jazz, Billie Holiday
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士乐天后比利•霍利戴

Sense.DEF: the language that you first learn as a child
a middle rank in the US army, Marines, or Air Force, or someone who has this rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国陆军﹑海军陆战队或空军的〕中尉

Sense.DEF: the time at the beginning of day when light first appears
used to say that the fact or reason that you are going to mention is the first one and will be followed by others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firstly, I would like to thank everyone who has contributed to this success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我要感谢对这次成功作出贡献的每一个人。

Sense.DEF: an officer who has the rank just below captain on a ship that is not a military ship
the name or names that come before your family name
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her first name’s Helen, but I don’t know her surname.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字叫海伦﹐但我不知道她姓什么。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on first name terms (with sb)

Variant.ORTHVAR: be on a first name basis

Sense.DEF: to know someone well enough to call them by their first name
Sense.TRAN: 〔因熟悉某人而〕直呼其名﹐（与某人）以名相称

Sense.DEF: the evening when the first public performance of a show, play etc is given
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出﹑戏剧等的〕首演[首映]之夜

Sense.DEF: someone who is guilty of breaking the law for the first time
a first-past-the-post system of electing a politician, a government etc is one in which the person or party who gets the most votes wins
Sense.TRAN: 〔竞选制度〕得票最多者当选的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s first-past-the-post electoral system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国得票最多者当选的选举制度

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 得票最多者当选的投票表决

Sense.DEF: a form of a verb or a pronoun that is used to show that you are the speaker. For example, ‘I’, ‘me’, ‘we’, and ‘us’ are first person pronouns, and ‘I am’ is the first person singular of the verb ‘to be’.
Sense.TRAN: 第一人称〔例如﹐I﹐me﹐we和us都是第一人称代词﹐I am是动词to be的第一人称单数形式〕

Sense.DEF: a way of telling a story in which the writer or speaker tells it as though they were involved in the story
Sense.EXAMPLE: a first person narrative
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一人称叙述

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘The Great Gatsby’ is written in the first person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《了不起的盖茨比》是以第一人称写的。

Sense.DEF: a computer or video game in which the person playing the game is the main character and has to shoot the other characters in the game
of the very best quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a first-rate surgeon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一流的外科医生。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/give sb first refusal on sth
Sense.DEF: to let someone decide whether to buy something before you offer to sell it to other people
Sense.TRAN: 有/给予某人对某物的优先购买权
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll let you have first refusal on the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把这辆车的优先购买权给你。

Sense.DEF: a member of the police, fire, or medical services who has been specially trained to be the first person to go to a very serious accident or to an extremely dangerous and unexpected situation that must be dealt with quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔警察﹑消防队或医疗机构的〕快速反应小组成员﹐第一线应变人员

Sense.DEF:
an attack made on your enemy before they attack you, especially an attack made using
nuclear
weapons
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指动用核武器的〕先发制人的打击

Sense.DEF: a first-string player in a team plays when the game begins because they are the most skilled
someone who is buying a house or an apartment for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 首次购房者﹐首次置业者

Sense.DEF: the rich industrial countries of the world
Sense.TRAN: 第一世界〔指世界上富有的工业国家〕

Sense.DEF: the big war fought in Europe between 1914 and 1918, which involved many different countries
a narrow area of sea between two areas of land, or the place where a river flows into the sea – used especially in Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 狭窄海湾﹐河口湾〔尤在苏格兰使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Firth of Forth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福斯湾

Sense.DEF: relating to money, taxes, debts etc that are owned and managed by the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fiscal crisis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政危机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: sound good fiscal policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合理的财政政策

Sense.EXAMPLE: a fiscal matter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政事务

Sense.DEF: the 12 month period used by governments to calculate spending and how much tax a person or business must pay

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 上一个/当前的/即将到来的/下一个财政年度

Sense.DEF: the 12 month period over which a company calculates its profits or losses

an animal that lives in water, and uses its
fins
and tail to swim
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake is well stocked with fish it contains a lot of fish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖中有许多鱼。

PIC.HEADING: FISH 鱼
PIC.PICCONTENT: eel 鳗鱼；mackerel 鲭鱼；sardine 沙丁鱼；swordfish 剑鱼；flatfish 比目鱼；shark 鲨鱼；eye 眼；dorsal fin 背鳍；tail fin 尾鳍；mouth 口；gill 鳃；pelvic fin 腹鳍；anal fin 臀鳍

Sense.DEF: the flesh of a fish used as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白葡萄酒一般配鱼喝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Japan, people eat raw fish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在日本﹐人们吃生鱼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oily fish fish that contains a lot of oil is supposed to be good for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含脂量高的鱼应该对你有好处。
Sense.HINTTRAN: You say 要说 fish and chips, not 而不说 ‘chips and fish’.

Sense.LEXUNIT: (be/feel) like a fish out of water
Sense.DEF: to feel uncomfortable because you feel you do not belong in a place or situation
Sense.TRAN: 如离水之鱼﹐感到生疏[不自在]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt like a fish out of water in my new school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在新学校里感到很不适应﹐就像鱼儿离开了水。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there are plenty more fish in the sea
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone whose relationship has ended that there are other people they can have a relationship with
Sense.TRAN: 海里的鱼有的是﹐天涯何处无芳草〔用于安慰失恋等被离弃的人〕

Sense.DEF: neither one thing nor another
to have other things to do, especially more important things
someone who is slightly strange or crazy
an unfriendly person who seems to have no strong feelings
Sense.TRAN: 态度冷冰冰的人﹐不热情的人

Sense.LEXUNIT: a big fish in a little/small pond
Sense.DEF: someone who is important in or who has influence over a very small area
Sense.TRAN: 小塘中的大鱼﹐小地方的要人

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that live in rivers or lakes
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pools are home to frogs, newts, and freshwater fish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些池塘中栖息着青蛙﹑蝾螈和淡水鱼类。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that live in the ocean
Collocate.EXAMPLE: saltwater fish such as cod and tuna
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 鳕鱼和金枪鱼等咸水鱼

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pike are river fish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗鱼是河鱼。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: fish that are from a fish farm

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pete caught a really big fish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特抓到一条很大的鱼。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has been breeding tropical fish for many years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他培育热带鱼有好些年了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have them as pets or for breeding
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We used to keep tropical fish when I was young.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小时候我们养过热带鱼。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Red fish swam on either side of the boat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色的鱼在船舷两边游来游去。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it takes food from a hook and gets caught
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fish aren’t biting today.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天鱼儿不肯上钩。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the quantity of fish in the sea
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fish stocks have declined dramatically.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼类资源已严重枯竭。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the group of fish that are similar and can breed together
Collocate.EXAMPLE: 74 of California’s 113 native fish species are in need of protection.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚的113种土生鱼类中﹐有74种需要保护。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for keeping fish indoors, usually as pets
for keeping fish outdoors, in a garden
for feeding fish
a large group swimming together
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Shoals of little fish were swimming around her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 成群的小鱼在她周围游来游去。

Sense.DEF: to try to catch fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad really loves to fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸很喜欢钓鱼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Japanese vessel fishing for tuna in the Eastern Pacific
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘在东太平洋上捕捞金枪鱼的日本船

Sense.DEF: to search for something in a bag, pocket etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fished around in her purse and pulled out a photo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在包里翻找﹐掏出一张照片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chris fished in his pocket for a coin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯在口袋里摸找硬币。

Sense.DEF: to try to catch fish in a particular area of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other nations are forbidden to fish the waters within 200 miles of the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他国家被禁止在离岸200英里内的海域捕鱼。

Sense.DEF: to try to make someone say something nice about you, usually by first criticizing yourself – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般通过自贬〕讨别人的恭维﹐故意要别人赞扬〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s sickening the way he’s always fishing for compliments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是讨人恭维﹐真恶心。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out information, without asking directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you here with your wife?’ she asked, fishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你和太太一起来的？”她试探地问道。

Subsense.DEF: to pull someone or something out of water

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The body was fished out of the East River a week later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一星期后﹐尸体从伊斯特河里被打捞上来。

Subsense.DEF: to find something after searching through a bag, pocket etc, and take it out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eric fished a peppermint out of the bag.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克从包里摸出一块薄荷糖。

Sense.DEF:
a meal consisting of fish covered with
batter a mixture of flour and milk
and cooked in oil, served with long thin pieces of potato also cooked in oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get some fish and chips on your way home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家路上顺道买些炸鱼加薯条。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fish and chip shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸鱼薯条店

Sense.DEF: a glass bowl that you can keep fish in
a place or situation in which you cannot do anything in private
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being in a small town like this is like living in a fishbowl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在这样的一个小镇上﹐就像生活在玻璃鱼缸里一样毫无隐私可言。

Sense.DEF: a small round flat food consisting of cooked fish mixed with cooked potato
someone who catches fish as a sport or as a job
a part of the sea where fish are caught in large numbers

a
fish farm

a type of curved
lens piece of glass on the front of a camera
that allows you to take photographs of a wide area
an area of water used for breeding fish as a business

a long piece of fish covered with
breadcrumbs
or
batter
and cooked
an outdoor event held to raise money for an organization, at which fish is cooked and eaten
a small hook with a sharp point at one end, that is fastened to the end of a long string in order to catch fish
the sport or business of catching fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fishing is one of his hobbies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钓鱼是他的一项业余爱好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terry’s going fishing at Lake Arrowhead next weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里下周末要到阿罗黑德湖钓鱼。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 捕捞三文鱼/鳟鱼/鲈鱼等

PIC.PICCONTENT: tackle box 钓具箱；fly 假蝇钓钩；spinner 旋式诱饵；hook 鱼钩；float 鱼漂；net 抄网；reel 钓线轴；fishing rod 钓竿；bait 鱼饵

Sense.DEF: to try to find out secret information by asking a lot of questions about different things
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过问大量问题〕打探秘密消息

Sense.DEF: very long string made of strong material and used to catch fish
a long thin pole with a long string and a hook attached to it, used to catch fish
equipment used for fishing
a long deep dish used for cooking whole fish
dried fish crushed into a powder and put on the land to help plants grow
someone who sells fish
a shop that sells fish

stockings
with a pattern of small holes that make them look like a net
a kitchen tool used especially for turning food when cooking, with a wide flat part and a handle

a
fish finger
if a vehicle or aircraft fishtails, the back end of it slides from side to side, usually because the tyres are sliding on water or ice
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆〕摆尾行驶﹔〔飞机〕摆尾飞行

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for a woman who shouts a lot and is often in a bad temper
seeming bad or dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something very fishy about him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很是可疑。

Sense.DEF: tasting or smelling of fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fishy smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼腥味

Sense.DEF: able to be split by atomic fission
the process of splitting an atom to produce large amounts of energy or an explosion
the process of dividing a cell into two or more parts
a deep crack, especially in rock or earth
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指岩石或土地的〕裂缝﹐裂隙

Sense.DEF:
the hand when it is tightly closed, so that the fingers are curled in towards the
palm
. People close their hand in a fist when they are angry or are going to hit someone.
Sense.EXAMPLE: She held the money tightly in her fist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把钱紧紧地攥在手中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Malcolm clenched his fist held his fist very tightly closed angrily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔科姆愤怒地握紧拳头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dooley stood up and shook his fist in her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜利站起身﹐在她眼前挥舞着拳头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Varney slammed his fist down onto the table so hard the dishes jumped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦尼一拳砸在桌子上﹐盘子都给震了起来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a good/bad fist of sth
Sense.DEF: to make a successful or unsuccessful attempt to do something
the action of hitting someone’s closed hand with your own, as a greeting or celebration
Sense.TRAN: 碰拳〔表示打招呼或庆贺〕

Sense.DEF:
a fight in which people hit each other with their
bare
fists
an amount that is as much as you can hold in your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a child clutching a fistful of toffees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧紧抓着一把太妃糖的小孩

Sense.DEF:
a fight in which you use your
bare
hands to hit someone – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 拳斗﹐斗殴〔常作幽默用法〕

Subsense.DEF: if a piece of clothing fits you, it is the right size for your body
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His clothes did not fit him very well .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衣服不是很合身。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The uniform fitted her perfectly .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套制服她穿合身极了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The jacket’s fine, but the trousers don’t fit.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上装不错﹐但裤子不合身。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I know this dress is going to fit you like a glove fit you very well .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道这条连衣裙你穿会非常合身。
Subsense.HINTTRAN: Use fit to say that clothes are not too big or too small. Use suit to say that clothes look attractive on someone. 衣服穿在身上不大不小用fit﹐衣服穿在身上漂亮用suit: The dress fits, but it doesn’t suit me. 这裙子大小正好﹐但不适合我穿。

Subsense.DEF: to try a piece of clothing on someone to see if it is the right size for them, or to make sure a special piece of equipment is right for them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m being fitted for a new suit tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我要试穿一套新的衣服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He may need to be fitted with a hearing aid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也许得戴个助听器试试。

Subsense.DEF: if something fits in a place, it is the right size or shape to go there
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t find a key which fitted the lock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到能插进这把锁的钥匙。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most cookers are designed to fit level with your work tops.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数灶具都设计成与操作台齐平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plastic cover fits neatly over the frame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个塑料罩套在架子上正合适。

Subsense.DEF: to put something carefully into a place that is the right size or shape for it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She fitted the last piece into the jigsaw puzzle.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拼上了最后一块拼图。

Sense.DEF: if something fits into a place, there is enough space for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to put the wardrobe behind the door, but I don’t think it’ll fit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原想把衣橱放在门后﹐但可能放不下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You might be able to fit some small flowering plants between the larger bushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你或许可以在较大的灌木之间种些小的开花植物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think we’ll be able to fit any more people into the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想车里坐不下更多的人了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We should be able to fit one more in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该还能再装进一个。

Sense.DEF: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to fit a lock on the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得在门上安把锁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anti-theft devices are fitted to all our cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有的汽车上都安装了防盗装置。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The windows are all fitted with security locks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有窗户都装上了防盗锁。

Sense.DEF: if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The punishment should fit the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罚需当罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police said the car fits the description of the stolen vehicle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称这辆车符合对被盗车辆的描述。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists often select facts to fit their theories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家经常会挑选符合自己理论的事实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t fit the conventional image of a banker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与传统的银行家形象不符。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rhythm should fit with the meaning of a poem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 韵律应当与诗歌的含义一致。

Sense.DEF: to make someone suitable for something or able to do something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人适合某事﹐使某人胜任某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: His natural authority fitted him for a senior position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与生俱来的威严使他适合担任领导工作。

Sense.DEF: to be the type of person or thing that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: We wanted an experienced sportscaster, and Waggoner fit the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一名经验丰富的体育节目主持人﹐瓦戈纳正符合要求。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you think a criticism of them is true
Sense.TRAN: 要是说得有理（就接受）〔用于告诉对方对其的批评是正确的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So you think I’m a liar.’ ‘Well, if the cap fits …’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么你认为我在撒谎喽。”“唔﹐要是这么说还算有理…”

Sense.DEF: if someone fits in, they are accepted by the other people in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never really fitted in at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在学校里从来都不是很合群。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t sure if she would fit in with my friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不确定她是否能与我的朋友融洽相处。

Sense.DEF: to manage to do something or see someone, even though you have a lot of other things to do
Sense.TRAN: 安排时间做〔某事〕﹐安排时间见〔某人〕﹔找出…的时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor said he can fit me in at 4:30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说他可以把我安排在4点30分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to fit in a swim before breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早餐前我想抽时间游个泳。

Sense.DEF: if something fits in with other things, it is similar to them or goes well with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know quite how this new course will fit in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是很明白这门新课程和其他课程有什么关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A new building must fit in with its surroundings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建筑必须与周围环境协调一致。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t expect a baby to fit in with your existing routine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能指望小宝宝来适应你原有的生活规律。

Sense.DEF: to be part of a group or system
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the patients we see do not fit neatly into any of the existing categories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们诊过的病人中有些不能完全归入现有的疾病类型。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How does this fit into the company’s overall marketing strategy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这和公司整体的营销策略相契合吗？

Sense.DEF: to be accepted by the people in a group or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fitted into the team very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与队员相处十分融洽。

Sense.DEF: to provide a person or place with the equipment, furniture, or clothes that they need
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office had been fitted out in style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室布置得很气派。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new recruits were fitted out with uniforms and weapons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新兵配发了制服和武器。

Sense.DEF: if something fits together or you fit it together, diffe-rent pieces can be joined to make something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, the tubes fit together like this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看﹐这些管子是这样接起来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pictures show you how to fit it together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些图片教你如何装配。

Sense.DEF: if a story, set of facts, set of ideas etc fit together, they make sense when considered together
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑事实﹑想法等〕合乎情理﹐相辅相成
Sense.EXAMPLE: Telecom and computer businesses fit together well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电信业和计算机业相辅相成。

Sense.DEF: to provide a place with the furniture or equipment that it needs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rooms are now fitted up with electric lights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里现已装上了电灯。

Sense.DEF: to make someone seem guilty of a crime when they are really not guilty
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that I had been fitted up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我被陷害了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is fit is strong and healthy, especially because they exercise regularly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因经常锻炼而〕健壮的﹐健康的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must be very fit if you do so much running.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你经常这样跑步﹐身体肯定很健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was young, good-looking, and physically fit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻英俊﹐体格健壮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swim twice a week to try and keep fit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一周游两次泳以保持健康。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He may not be fit for Saturday’s match.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体不适﹐可能无法参加星期六的比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know if I’ll be fit enough to take part in the race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道自己的身体状况是否能参加赛跑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Psychiatrists said he was fit to stand trial he was mentally healthy enough .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神科医生称他精神正常﹐可以受审。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s over eighty now, but still as fit as a fiddle very fit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现已年过八十﹐但身体依然很硬朗。

GramExa.GLOSS: very fit
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had just come back from holiday and was fighting fit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚度假回来﹐身体很健康。

Sense.DEF: suitable or good enough for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We made sure the land was fit for drilling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确认了这块土地适合钻井。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The food was not fit for human consumption.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这食物不适合人食用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This book is not fit for publication!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书不宜出版！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is not fit to govern this country!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不适合治理这个国家！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This room is not fit to be seen!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间的样子可见不得人！

Sense.DEF: to decide that something is the best thing to do, especially when other people do not agree with you
Sense.TRAN: 认为（做某事）恰当﹐决定（做某事）〔尤在其他人不同意时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government saw fit to ignore our advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决定对我们的建议不予理会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sort out the problem in any way you think fit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用你认为合适的方法解决这个问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in a fit state (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: healthy enough or in good enough condition for something
Sense.TRAN: 身体健康﹐状况良好（适合做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still very shocked and in no fit state to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍然惊魂未定﹐无法工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to make sure the house is in a fit state to receive visitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得确保家里的样子能够接待客人。

Sense.DEF: of very good quality
Sense.TRAN: 高质量的﹐精美的﹐最高级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meal they provided was fit for a king.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们做的饭菜简直是御膳水平。

Sense.DEF: sexually attractive
extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was getting late and most of us were fit to drop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色渐晚﹐我们大部分人都累得快要瘫倒在地了。

Sense.DEF: if you are laughing, shouting etc fit to burst, you are doing it a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls were laughing fit to burst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们笑破了肚皮。

Sense.DEF: very angry, anxious, or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was fit to be tied when she didn’t come home until 2 a.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她凌晨两点才到家﹐我都急疯了。

Sense.DEF: a time when you feel an emotion very strongly and cannot control your behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She killed him in a fit of temper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一怒之下杀了他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He quit his job in a fit of drunken depression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他酒后一时消沉辞了职。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time when someone loses consciousness and cannot control their body because their brain is not working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She used to have fits as a baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在婴儿时期经常昏厥抽搐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who suffer from epileptic fits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患有癫痫的人

Sense.DEF: a short time during which you laugh or cough a lot in a way that you cannot control
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a violent coughing fit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一阵剧烈咳嗽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girls collapsed into a fit of the giggles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们突然咯咯地笑起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were all in fits of laughter trying to clear up the mess.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家一边收拾残局﹐一边笑得前仰后合。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Carl had us all in fits made us laugh a lot with his stories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔的故事把我们大家逗得笑声阵阵。

Sense.DEF: to be very angry or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: If your mother finds out about this, she’ll have a fit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你母亲知道这事﹐她会大发脾气的。

Sense.DEF: the way in which something fits on your body or fits into a space
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress was a perfect fit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条连衣裙非常合身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to get everything into the suitcase, but it was a tight fit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于把所有东西都塞进了手提箱﹐不过最后是满满当当了。

Sense.DEF: if there is a fit between two things, they are similar to each other or are suitable for each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must be sure that there’s a fit between the needs of the children and the education they receive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须确保孩子们的需要和他们受到的教育相匹配。

Sense.DEF: if something happens in fits and starts, it does not happen smoothly, but keeps starting and then stopping again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Technology advances by fits and starts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术进步断断续续。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in fits and starts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他时断时续地说着话。

Sense.DEF:
to have a
seizure a sudden condition in which someone cannot control the movements of their body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient was fitting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个病人突然发病。

Sense.DEF: not regular, and starting and stopping often
Sense.EXAMPLE: John awoke from a fitful sleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰从断断续续的睡眠中醒来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The peace talks only seem to be making fitful progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平会谈似乎时而前进﹐时而停滞。

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture or equipment that is made especially for a particular space in a room
Sense.TRAN: 〔为房间某处定制的〕家具﹐设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: bathroom fitments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定制的浴室家具

Sense.DEF: when you are healthy and strong enough to do hard work or play sports
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exercise programme to improve your fitness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增进健康的锻炼计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: Running marathons requires a high level of physical fitness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑马拉松需要身体十分强健。

Sense.DEF: the degree to which someone or something is suitable or good enough for a particular situation or purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He questioned McNeil’s fitness for high office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他质疑麦克尼尔是否适合身居高位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor will first determine your fitness to receive the anaesthetic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生首先要确定你是否适合接受麻醉。

Sense.DEF: to have or include something as a permanent part
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is your car fitted with an alarm?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的车装有防盗装置吗？

Sense.DEF: built, made, or cut to fit a particular space
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fitted wardrobe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定做的衣橱
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fitted kitchen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配有定制设备的厨房
Sense.EXAMPLE: fitted carpets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定做的地毯

Sense.DEF: fitted clothes are designed so that they fit closely to someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fitted black jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合身的黑色上衣

Sense.DEF: having the right qualities or experience for a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elinor is well fitted to be the sales manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉诺非常适合担任销售经理。

Sense.DEF: someone who puts together or repairs machines or equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gas fitter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气设备装配工

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment in a house, for example a
cooker
or a
fridge
, that can be moved or taken with you when you sell the house
Sense.TRAN: 〔搬家时可带走的〕可拆移设备﹐附加设备

Sense.DEF: an outside part of a piece of equipment that makes it possible to use or handle it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sink with chrome fittings handle and taps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带镀铬配件的洗涤槽
Sense.EXAMPLE: new light fittings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新款灯具配件

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you put on a piece of clothing that is being made for you, to see if it fits properly
right for a particular situation or occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the memorial was a fitting tribute to the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这座纪念碑恰如其分地表达了对总统的敬意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fitting end to what was a memorable trip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次难忘旅行的完美收尾

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is only fitting that Simon should propose the first toast tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚让西蒙第一个祝酒是最合适的。

Sense.DEF: an area in a shop where you can put on clothes to see how they look
the number 5
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is also a golf course five miles away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五英里外还有个高尔夫球场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be back by five five o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我五点前回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family moved to Canada when he was five five years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他五岁时全家移居加拿大。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money that is worth five dollars or five pounds
Sense.TRAN: 五美元钞票﹔五英镑钞票
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have two fives for a ten?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有两张五美元的钞票来换一张十美元的吗？

Sense.DEF: to hit the inside of someone’s hand with your hand to show that you are very pleased about something
Sense.TRAN: 与某人击掌〔表示对某事很满意〕

Sense.DEF: used to tell people to stop working for a few minutes
a British ball game in which the ball is hit with the hand against any of three walls
a shop that sells many types of inexpensive goods, especially for the house
Sense.TRAN: 五分一角店﹐廉价日用商品店

Sense.DEF: five-a-side football is played with five players on each side, usually indoors
the dark colour on a man’s chin where the hair has grown during the day
Sense.TRAN: 〔早上刮过后当天又长出的〕短胡子茬儿

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth five pounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lend me a fiver, mate?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 借我五英镑行吗﹐哥们儿？

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth five dollars
Sense.EXAMPLE: It only costs a five-spot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只需花费五美元。

Sense.DEF: a five-star hotel, restaurant etc has been judged to be of the highest standard
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑餐厅等〕五星级的﹐第一流的

Sense.DEF:
a
general
of the highest rank, who controls an army
to repair something that is broken or not working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s outside fixing the brakes on the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在外面修理汽车的刹车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellis was able to quickly find and fix the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃利斯马上就找到并解决了问题。

Subsense.DEF: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率已经定为6.5%。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rent was fixed at $1,750 per month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金定为每月1,750美元。

Subsense.DEF: if two or more companies fix the price for a particular product or service, they secretly agree on the price they will charge for it, in order to keep the price high and make more profit. This practice is illegal.
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government accused the two companies of fixing petrol prices.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府指控那两家公司操纵汽油价格。

Sense.DEF: to decide on a particular time etc when something will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you fixed a date for the wedding yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你确定婚礼的日期了吗？

Sense.DEF: to make arrangements for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So when do I get to meet them?’ ‘Tomorrow, if I can fix it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么﹐我什么时候能见他们？”“明天﹐要是我能安排上的话。”

GramExa.PROPFORM: fix (it) for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve fixed for you to see him this afternoon at four.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我替你安排了今天下午四点同他会面。

Sense.DEF: to attach something firmly to something else, so that it stays there permanently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a meal or drinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll watch the kids and you fix dinner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看孩子﹐你去准备晚餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I fix you a snack?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我去给你弄点儿点心吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Terry fixed herself a cold drink and sat out on the balcony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里给自己倒了杯冷饮﹐坐到外面的阳台上。

Sense.DEF: to find a solution to a problem or bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government seems confident that environmental problems can be fixed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府似乎有信心解决环境问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fix your attention/eyes/mind etc on sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to think about or look at someone or something carefully
Sense.TRAN: 把注意力/双眼/思想等集中在某人/某物上
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aziz tried to fix his mind on the job at hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿齐兹努力想把思想集中在手头的工作上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every eye was fixed on the new girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每双眼睛都盯着那个新来的女孩。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fix sb with a stare/glare/look etc
Sense.DEF: to look directly at someone for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel fixed him with an icy stare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔冷冷地盯着他。

Sense.DEF:
to make your hair or
make-up
look neat and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who fixed your hair for the wedding?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在婚礼上的发式是谁给你梳的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold on. Let me just fix my face put on make-up before we go out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等﹐让我化一下妆再出门。

Sense.DEF: to do a medical operation on a cat or dog so that it cannot have babies
to arrange an election, game etc dishonestly, so that you get the result you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many suspected that the deal had been fixed in advance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人怀疑这交易有人事先操纵。

Sense.DEF: to use a chemical process on paintings, photographs etc that makes the colours or images permanent
used to say that you will punish someone you are angry with
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anybody did that to me, I’d fix him good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有人那样对我的话﹐我会好好修理他的。

Sense.DEF: to be preparing to do something – used in some parts of the US
Sense.TRAN: 准备[打算]做某事〔美国部分地区使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m fixing to go to the store. Do you need anything?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备去商店﹐你需要什么东西吗？

Sense.DEF: to choose a suitable thing or person, especially after thinking about it carefully
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过认真考虑后〕选定﹐确定
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve finally fixed on a place to have the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于定好了举行音乐会的地点。

Sense.DEF: to arrange a meeting, event etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fixed up an interview with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我安排了一次对他的采访。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to fix up a time to meet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得安排一个见面的时间。

Sense.DEF: to decorate or repair a room or building
Sense.TRAN: 装修﹐修整〔房间或建筑物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We fixed up the guest bedroom before he came to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在他来住之前收拾了客房。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with something they want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you fix me up with a bed for the night?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能弄张床让我过夜吗？

Sense.DEF: to find a suitable romantic partner for someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I asked my best friend to fix me up with someone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叫我最要好的朋友给我找个对象。

Sense.DEF: something that solves a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robinson called the proposal a quick fix a temporary or easy solution of limited value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁宾逊称那项提议只是个权宜之计﹐意义不大。

Sense.DEF: to have a problem that is difficult to solve
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to be in a real fix if we miss that bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们赶不上那班公交车﹐就真的麻烦了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s put us in a fix.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事让我们陷入了困境。

Sense.DEF:
an amount of something, especially an illegal drug such as
heroin
, that you often use and badly want
Sense.EXAMPLE: addicts looking for a fix
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找毒品的瘾君子
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need my fix of caffeine in the morning or I can’t think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早上总得来点咖啡因﹐不然就无法思考问题。

Subsense.DEF: to find out exactly where someone or something is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He peered out, trying to get a fix on the enemy’s position.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凝视着外面﹐试图确定敌人的位置。

Subsense.DEF: to understand what someone or something is really like
Subsense.TRAN: 对某人/某事得出确切的看法
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t seem to get a fix on the situation.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有些搞不清状况。

Sense.DEF: something that has been dishonestly arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: People think the election was a fix.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众认为这次选举有人搞鬼。

Sense.DEF: always thinking or talking about one particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想或谈话〕专注的﹐集中于…的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He never used to be so fixated on losing weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前从来没有那么专注于减肥。

Sense.DEF: a very strong interest in or love for someone or something, that is not natural or healthy
Sense.TRAN: 痴迷﹐不正常的依恋﹐固执的偏爱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carlo has an absolute fixation with the royal family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡洛对皇室有一种化不开的情结。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a mother fixation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恋母情结

Sense.DEF: a kind of mental illness in which someone’s mind or emotions stop developing
Sense.TRAN: 固着﹐滞留〔人的心理或情感停止发展的一种心理疾病〕

Sense.DEF: a substance used to stick things together or to hold things such as false teeth in place
a chemical used on a painting or photograph so that the colours do not change
firmly fastened to a particular position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mirror fixed to the bathroom wall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 固定在浴室墙上的一面镜子

Sense.DEF: fixed times, amounts, meanings etc cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 〔时间﹑数量﹑意思等〕确定的﹐不变的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The classes begin and end at fixed times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上下课的时间都是固定不变的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fixed prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固定价格
Sense.EXAMPLE: My contract was for a fixed term of five years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的合同是五年固定期限的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: interest at 10%, fixed for 5 years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10%的五年期固定利率

Sense.DEF: to have very definite ideas or opinions that you will not change – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有固执的想法/看法〔常含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has very fixed ideas about how a wife should behave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于为人妻者的行为准则﹐他有一套顽固的主张。

Sense.LEXUNIT: how are you fixed for sth?
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone how much of something they have, or to ask about an arrangement
Sense.TRAN: 你有多少…？ 你怎么安排…？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are you fixed for cash?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有多少现金？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are we fixed for Monday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期一怎么安排？

Sense.DEF: a fixed smile, expression etc does not show any emotion or does not show how someone really feels
to not have a permanent place to live
land, buildings, or equipment that a business owns and uses
buildings or machines that a business owns and that can be used for a long time to produce goods
costs, such as rent, that a business has to pay even when it is not producing anything
an amount of money that you receive to live on that does not change
Sense.EXAMPLE: pensioners living on a fixed income
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依靠固定养老金收入生活的人

Sense.DEF: without looking at or thinking about anything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ann stared fixedly at the screen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安目不转睛地盯着屏幕。

Sense.DEF:
a fixed-rate
loan
or
mortgage
is one in which the amount of interest you pay remains the same for a specific period of time
lasting for an agreed period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fixed-term contract
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份固定期限的合同

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at arranging things and solving problems for other people, sometimes by using dishonest methods
Sense.TRAN: 〔有时用不正当手段的〕代理人﹐代人疏通者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political fixer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治掮客

Sense.DEF: a house that you buy or sell that needs repairs
the vegetables, bread etc that are eaten with meat at a large meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: turkey with all the fixings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有各种配菜的火鸡

Sense.DEF:
things that are used to hold other things together, for example
screws
when something does not change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fixity of purpose
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对目标的执着

Sense.DEF: a sports match that has been arranged for a particular time and place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a list of this season’s fixtures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季比赛一览表

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋或建筑物内的〕固定设备﹐固定装置
Sense.EXAMPLE: light fixtures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照明设备

GramExa.GLOSS: all the equipment that is normally included as part of a house or building when it is sold

Sense.DEF: to be always present and not likely to move or go away
Sense.TRAN: 是固定存在物﹔是固定成员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerrard soon became a permanent fixture in the Liverpool team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰拉德很快就成了利物浦队的固定成员。

Sense.DEF: if a liquid fizzes, it produces a lot of bubbles and makes a continuous sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: champagne fizzing out of the bottle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒泡溢出瓶子的香槟酒

Sense.DEF: the bubbles of gas in some kinds of drinks, or the sound that they make
to gradually stop happening, especially because people become less interested
Sense.TRAN: 〔因越来越不感兴趣而〕渐停﹐夭折
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their romance just fizzled out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的恋情就这么不了了之。

Sense.DEF: a fizzy liquid contains bubbles of gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: fizzy water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒泡的水

Sense.DEF: a sweet non-alcoholic drink with bubbles of gas
a narrow area of sea between high cliffs, especially in Norway
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指挪威海岸峭壁间的〕峡湾

Sense.DEF: soft loose flesh on a person’s body – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 松弛的肌肉﹐赘肉〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: simple advice to help you fight the flab lose weight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助你消减赘肉的简单建议

Sense.DEF: extremely surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 大吃一惊的﹐目瞪口呆的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I heard how much money we’d made, I was flabbergasted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到我们赚了那么多钱﹐我大吃一惊。

Sense.DEF: having unattractive soft loose flesh rather than strong muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flabby stomach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松弛的腹部

Sense.DEF: used to describe something that is weak or not effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: intellectually flabby arguments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说不通的论据
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band’s performance was tired and flabby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队的表演有气无力。

Sense.DEF: soft and weak instead of firm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flaccid penis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲软的阴茎

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
flak
someone whose job is to represent an organization and answer questions about it, especially when something bad has happened
Sense.TRAN: 发言人〔尤指在不好的事发生后代表某机构回答有关问题的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They spent millions on lobbyists and flacks to improve their image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们掷重金在说客和发言人身上来改善自己的形象。

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children waving flags greeted the Russian leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们挥舞着旗帜﹐欢迎俄罗斯领导人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the flag of Kenya
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼亚国旗
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Spanish flag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙国旗

GramExa.GLOSS: a flag is shown on a pole
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flags were flying at half-mast because of the death of the Premier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 降半旗为总理的逝世志哀。

Sense.DEF: a coloured piece of cloth used in some sports as a signal or as a sign showing the position of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flag went down, and the race began.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着信号旗落下﹐比赛开始了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a free kick near the corner flag flag on a football pitch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 角旗附近的任意球

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning a country or organization and its beliefs, values, and people
Sense.TRAN: 旗帜〔指国家﹑组织及其所代表的信仰﹑价值观和民众〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: loyalty to the flag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对国家的忠诚

Sense.DEF: to achieve success on behalf of your country in a competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛中〕使国旗飘扬﹐代表祖国获胜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bristol kept the flag flying for English rugby with this win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里斯托尔队的这场胜利使英格兰橄榄球得以站上领奖台。

Sense.DEF:
a
flagstone
to make a mark against some information to show that it is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve flagged the parts I want to comment on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经标示出我要评论的部分。

Sense.DEF: to become tired or weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the meeting we had begun to flag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议结束时﹐我们已经开始打蔫了。

Sense.DEF: to make the driver of a vehicle stop by waving at them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I flagged down a taxi.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挥手拦下一辆出租车。

Sense.DEF: someone who whips themselves, especially as a religious punishment
to whip yourself or someone else, especially as a religious punishment
Sense.TRAN: 鞭打﹐鞭笞〔尤作为宗教上的一种处罚〕

Sense.DEF: a game like American football in which players tear off small pieces of cloth called flags from around other players’ waists instead of knocking them down
Sense.TRAN: 腰旗橄榄球﹐夺旗橄榄球

Sense.DEF:
covered with
flagstones
becoming tired or losing strength
Sense.TRAN: 疲倦的﹔逐渐衰弱的﹐萎靡的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By now the wine had lifted her flagging spirits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这时候﹐酒已经提振起她原本萎靡不振的情绪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He presents himself as the man to revive the party’s flagging fortunes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自命为拯救该党衰败命运的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: concern for the country’s flagging economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该国萎靡的经济的担忧

Sense.DEF: a large container for liquids, especially beer or wine
Sense.TRAN: 〔盛放液体﹐尤指啤酒或葡萄酒的〕大壶

Sense.DEF: a tall pole on which a flag hangs
a flagrant action is shocking because it is done in a way that is easily noticed and shows no respect for laws, truth etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: flagrant violations of human rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人权的公然践踏
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flagrant disregard for the law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对法律的公然蔑视

Sense.DEF: the most important ship in a group of ships belonging to the navy
the best and most important product, building etc that a company owns or produces
Sense.EXAMPLE: the flagship of the new Ford range
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新款福特汽车系列中的旗舰产品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm has just opened a flagship store in Las Vegas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司刚在拉斯维加斯开了一家旗舰店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s flagship product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的旗舰产品

Sense.DEF: a tall pole on which a flag hangs
a smooth flat piece of stone used for floors, paths etc
the expression of strong national feelings, especially when these feelings seem too extreme
Sense.TRAN: 爱国情绪的强烈表现﹔沙文主义表现

Sense.DEF: to wave your arms or legs in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flailed wildly as she tried to hold him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想按住他﹐他就乱踢乱打。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: James flailed about in the shallow water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯在浅水里扑腾。

Sense.DEF: to beat someone or something violently, usually with a stick
to beat grain with a flail
a tool consisting of a stick that swings from a long handle, used in the past to separate grain from wheat by beating it
Sense.TRAN: 连枷〔旧时用作打谷的农具〕

Sense.DEF: a natural ability to do something very well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo has a flair for languages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔有语言天赋。

Sense.DEF: a way of doing things that is interesting and shows imagination
Sense.TRAN: 独特的处事风格﹐有创意的行事作风

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a job for which artistic flair is essential
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术才华起关键作用的工作

Sense.EXAMPLE: Irwin has real entrepreneurial flair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文很有创业才能。

Sense.DEF: strong criticism
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lilley has taken a lot of flak for his views on drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利利对毒品的看法受到强烈抨击。

Sense.DEF:
bullets or
shells
that are shot from the ground at enemy aircraft
a small thin piece that breaks away easily from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: flakes of snow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪花

Sense.EXAMPLE: chocolate flakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力薄片

Sense.DEF: someone who seems strange or who often forgets things
Sense.TRAN: 古怪的人﹔丢三落四的人

Sense.DEF: to break off in small thin pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint is beginning to flake off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆开始剥落了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a moisturising cream to stop your skin flaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涂点润肤霜防止皮肤脱屑。

Sense.DEF: to break fish or another food into small thin pieces, or to break in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poach the fish until it flakes easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鱼炖到一碰就碎为止。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remove the skin and flake the flesh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去皮后把肉切成小薄片。

Sense.DEF: to fall asleep because you are extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil’s flaked out on the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔累得在沙发上睡着了。

Sense.DEF: to do something strange, or to not do what you said you would do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kathy said she’d help but she flaked out on us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜说过会帮忙的﹐但她对我们食言了。

Sense.DEF: a special coat made of strong heavy material to protect soldiers and policemen from bullets
tending to break into small thin pieces
Sense.TRAN: 易碎裂成屑的﹔易剥落的
Sense.EXAMPLE: flaky pastry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酥饼
Sense.EXAMPLE: flaky skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱屑的皮肤

Sense.DEF: a flaky person is slightly strange or often forgets things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrie’s pretty flaky but she’s fun to be with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽人很怪﹐可是和她在一起很有趣。

Sense.DEF:
food that is flambéed has an alcoholic drink such as
brandy
poured over it to produce flames
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物〕火烧的〔浇上白兰地等酒后点燃上桌〕

Sense.DEF: behaving in a confident or exciting way that makes people notice you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his flamboyant style of play
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他炫技的表现

Sense.EXAMPLE: He lifted his arms in a flamboyant gesture .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抬起胳膊﹐做了个炫耀的手势。

Sense.DEF: brightly coloured and easily noticed
Sense.TRAN: 色彩艳丽的﹐绚丽夺目的
Sense.EXAMPLE: flamboyant clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩艳丽的衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has red hair and a rather flamboyant appearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一头红发﹐外表相当艳丽。

Sense.DEF: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flames poured out of the windows of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火焰从大楼窗口冒出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rushed past us with buckets of water and tried to douse the flames .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提着一桶桶水跑过我们身边去灭火。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering flames .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们围坐在篝火旁﹐看着跳动的火焰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flames quickly engulfed the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火焰很快吞噬了大楼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a candle flame
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烛焰

Sense.DEF: burning in a way that is difficult to control
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we reached Mandalay it was in flames.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我们到达曼德勒时﹐那里已是一片火海。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They escaped just as the house was engulfed in flames .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在房子被大火吞噬的一刹那﹐他们逃了出来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go up in flames/burst into flames
Sense.DEF: to suddenly begin burning in a way that is difficult to control
Sense.EXAMPLE: The helicopter burst into flames after hitting a power line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机撞上电线﹐一下子燃烧起来。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling
Sense.TRAN: 怒火/欲火/激情的火焰等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flames of desire shot through her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲火在她心中燃烧。

Sense.DEF: an angry or rude email
to become suddenly bright with light or colour, especially red or orange
Sense.EXAMPLE: Erica’s cheeks flamed with anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃丽卡气得双颊通红。

Sense.DEF: to burn brightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A great fire flamed in an open fireplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敞开的壁炉里火烧得很旺。

Sense.DEF:
to send someone an angry or rude message in an email or on a
bulletin board
Sense.TRAN: 发送愤怒[辱骂]的电子邮件[网站帖子]

Sense.DEF: a fast exciting Spanish dance, or the music that is played for this dance
made of or covered with substances that will not burn easily

flameproof cooking dishes can be used in very hot places, such as in an
oven
a machine like a gun that shoots flames or burning liquid, used as a weapon or for clearing plants
Sense.TRAN: 喷火器﹐火焰喷射器〔用作武器或用于清除植物〕

Sense.DEF: a very angry argument or temper
Sense.TRAN: 激烈的争吵/火暴的脾气
Sense.EXAMPLE: They seem to have a flaming row at least once a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们好像每周至少大吵一次。

Sense.DEF: covered with flames
Sense.TRAN: 燃烧着的﹐被火焰吞噬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents panicked as flaming petrol poured down the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃烧的汽油沿街流淌﹐居民惊慌失措。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when you feel annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 十足的﹐该死的〔尤用于不耐烦时加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You flaming idiot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这十足的笨蛋！

Sense.DEF: orange or bright red in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: flaming red hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火焰般的红头发

Sense.DEF: a large pink tropical bird with very long thin legs and a long neck
something that is flammable burns easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Caution! Highly flammable liquid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心！高度易燃液体。

Sense.DEF: a round pie or cake that is filled with fruit, cheese etc
a sweet baked food made with eggs, milk, and sugar
the flat edge that stands out from an object such as a railway wheel, to keep it in the right position or strengthen it

the side of an animal’s or person’s body, between the
ribs
and the
hip
the side of an army in a battle, or a sports team when playing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were attacked on our left flank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的左翼受到攻击。

Sense.DEF: the side of a hill, mountain, or very large building
to be on both sides of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis entered flanked by two bodyguards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯在左右两名保镖的陪同下走了进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: mountains flanking the road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路两旁的群山

Sense.DEF: soft cloth, usually made of cotton or wool, used for making clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flannel shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法兰绒衬衫

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth you use to wash yourself
something that someone says that has no real meaning or does not tell you what you want to know
men’s trousers made of flannel
to say things that have no real meaning in order to avoid answering a question directly or to hide your lack of knowledge
soft cotton cloth used especially for making nightclothes and sheets
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于制作睡衣﹑被单等的〕绒布﹐棉法兰绒

Sense.DEF: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tent flap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷门帘
Sense.EXAMPLE: A loose flap of skin covered the wound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤口上覆盖着一片快要脱落的皮。

Sense.DEF: the noisy movement of something such as cloth in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: the flap of the sails
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船帆的拍动

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people feel very excited or worried about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rafi’s in a bit of a flap over the wedding plans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉菲对婚礼的安排有点焦虑不安。

Sense.DEF: a part of the wing of an aircraft that can be raised or lowered to help the aircraft go up or down
if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly
to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旗帜在微风中飘扬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flap your arms to keep warm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆动手臂以保持暖和。

Sense.DEF: to behave in an excited or nervous way
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to flap!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要紧张！

Sense.DEF:
a cake made of
oats
, sugar,
syrup
, and butter

a
pancake
a fashionable young woman in the late 1920s
to suddenly begin to burn, or to burn more brightly for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 突然烧起来﹔〔短暂地〕烧旺
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire flared up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火又忽地旺了起来。

Sense.DEF: if strong feelings flare or flare up, people suddenly become angry, violent etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rioting has flared up in several towns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个小镇爆发了骚乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tempers flared during the debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辩论时群情激奋。

Sense.DEF: if a disease or illness flares up, it suddenly becomes worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: The injury has flared up again, keeping him out of today’s game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他旧伤复发﹐无法参加今天的比赛。

Sense.DEF:
if a person or animal flares their
nostril s the openings at the end of the nose
, or if their nostrils flare, their nostrils become wider because they are angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或动物因气愤而〕张大（鼻孔）﹐张开（鼻翼）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bull flared its nostrils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那头公牛翕动着鼻翼。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of clothing flares out, it becomes wider at one end

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dress flares out from the hips.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条连衣裙自臀部往下逐渐展开。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that produces a bright flame, or the flame itself, used outdoors as a signal
Sense.TRAN: 闪光装置﹔信号灯﹔信号弹
Sense.EXAMPLE: The distress flares were spotted by another ship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇险信号被另外一艘船发现了。

Sense.DEF: a sudden bright flame
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a brief flare as the match was lit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火柴划着时闪出一道亮光。

Sense.DEF: trousers that become wide below the knee
a situation in which someone suddenly becomes angry or violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apart from one or two flare-ups the match went fairly smoothly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了一两次冲突外﹐比赛进行得还算顺利。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone suddenly has problems because of a disease or illness after not having any problems for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flare-up of her arthritis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她关节炎的突然复发

Sense.DEF: to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lightning flashed overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头顶上电光闪闪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why is that guy flashing his headlights at me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家伙为什么朝我闪前灯呢？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Red warning lights flashed on and off shone for a short time and then stopped shining .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色警告灯一闪一闪。

Sense.DEF: to be shown quickly on television, on a computer, or on a film
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电视﹑计算机或电影中〕闪现

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Images of the war flashed across the screen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视屏幕上闪过战争的画面。

Sense.DEF: if thoughts, images, memories etc flash through your mind, you suddenly think of them or remember them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The possibility that Frank was lying flashed through my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克可能在撒谎的想法闪过我的脑海。

Sense.DEF: to smile or look at someone quickly and for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I love this city,’ he said, flashing a big smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我爱这座城市。”他说﹐脸上闪现灿烂的笑容。

Sense.DEF: to show something to someone for only a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flashed his identification card.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他亮了一下自己的身份证。

Sense.DEF:
to send news or information somewhere quickly by radio, computer, or
satellite
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过无线电﹑计算机或衞星〕迅速播出﹐传送

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reporters at the scene flashed the news to their offices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现场记者迅速将新闻发回本社。

Sense.DEF: to move very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A meteor flashed through the sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗流星划过天空。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes flash, they look very bright for a moment, especially because of a sudden emotion
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指眼睛因突如其来的情感而〕闪耀﹐发亮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Janet’s blue eyes flashed with anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特的蓝眼睛闪现出怒火。

Sense.DEF: if a man flashes, or if he flashes someone, he shows his sexual organs in public

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s life flashes before their eyes
Sense.DEF: if someone’s life flashes before their eyes, they suddenly remember many events from their life because they are in great danger and might die
Sense.TRAN: 〔处于极度危险﹑可能死亡时〕某人的平生之事都闪现在自己眼前

Sense.DEF: if a period of time or an event flashes by or flashes past, it seems to end very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔一段时间或某件事情〕一闪而过﹐飞逝

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our vacation seemed to just flash by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的假期似乎一眨眼就过去了。

Sense.DEF: to use or show something in a way that will make people notice you and think you have a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always flashing his money around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是四处炫耀他有钱。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly think about or show something that happened in the past, especially in a film, book etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From here the movie flashes back to Billy’s first meeting with Schultz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里开始﹐影片闪回到比利初次遇见舒尔茨的时候。

Sense.DEF: if a film, book etc flashes forward, it shows what happens in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The movie then flashes forward to their daughter’s fifth birthday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片接着跳到未来他们女儿五岁生日的时候。

Sense.DEF: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two flashes mean danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两次闪光表示危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A flash of lightning lit up the night sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道闪电照亮夜空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brilliant flash of light
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道明亮的闪光

Sense.DEF: a special bright light used when taking photographs indoors or when there is not much light
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did the flash go off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪光灯亮过没有？

Sense.DEF: very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just wait here. I’ll be back in a flash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在这里等着﹐我马上回来。

Sense.DEF:
if someone has a flash of
brilliance
, anger etc, they suddenly have a clever idea or a particular feeling
Sense.TRAN: 灵感/才华/洞察力/怒气等的闪现

Sense.DEF: a sudden success that ends quickly and is unlikely to happen again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beene’s new novel proves he isn’t just a flash in the pan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比恩的新小说证明他并不是个昙花一现的作家。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 鲜艳的色彩/闪亮的物品
Sense.DEF: if there is a flash of something brightly coloured or shiny, it appears suddenly for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bird vanished in a flash of blue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只鸟蓝影一闪﹐不见了。

Sense.DEF: a system of instructions for a computer that is used especially to make pictures on a website appear to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flash animation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: flash动画﹐闪客动画

Sense.DEF: a quick look – used humorously
a small piece of coloured cloth worn on the shoulder of a military uniform
a flood or fire that happens very quickly or suddenly, and continues for only a short time
looking very new, bright, and expensive – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big flash car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆阔气的大轿车

Sense.DEF: liking to have expensive clothes and possessions so that other people notice you – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris didn’t want to seem flash in front of his mates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯不想在同伴面前显得是在摆阔。

Sense.DEF: a scene in a film, play, book etc that shows something that happened before that point in the story
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影的〕闪回镜头﹔〔戏剧的〕闪回场景﹔〔书中的〕倒叙
Sense.EXAMPLE: The events of the hero’s childhood are shown as a series of flashbacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人公童年的一些事情用一连串闪回镜头展现出来。

Sense.DEF: a sudden very clear memory of something that happened to you in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eaton still has flashbacks of the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊顿脑海中依然时常闪过车祸的情景。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone has the same bad feeling that they had when they took an illegal drug in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many users of this drug experience flashbacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多吸食这种毒品的人都会经历药效幻觉的重现。

Sense.DEF: a burning gas or liquid that moves back into a tube or container
Sense.TRAN: 火舌回闪﹐回火〔指燃烧的气体或液体循管道向气瓶或油罐退回〕
