Sense.DEF: a small object that produces a bright light, used when taking photographs indoors or when there is not much light
a card with a word or picture on it, used in teaching
Sense.TRAN: 抽认卡﹐闪卡〔上面有单词或图画﹐用于教学〕

Sense.DEF:
a small piece of electronic equipment that uses
flash memory
to store information and can be fitted into a computer
a man who shows his sexual organs to women in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔在公众场所向女子〕露阴的男子﹐暴露狂

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that lights a special bright light when you press the button on a camera to take a photograph
a small electric light that you can carry in your hand

a type of computer memory that can continue storing information without a power supply. It is used, for example, in
memory cards
.

a sudden and planned gathering of many people at a particular place that has been arranged earlier on an Internet website. All of the people do or say something that has also been planned earlier and then separate and leave quickly in different directions.
Sense.TRAN: 快闪族〔指许多人在因特网上约定在某地集合﹐完成特定的事后迅速四散〕

Sense.DEF: a place where trouble or violence might easily develop suddenly and be hard to control
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hebron has been a flashpoint for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数年来﹐希伯伦的局势一触即发。

Sense.DEF: the lowest temperature at which a liquid such as oil will produce enough gas to burn if a flame is put near it
big, bright, or expensive, and intended to be impressive – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: large flashy cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招摇的大轿车

Sense.DEF:
someone who is flashy wears expensive clothes,
jewellery
etc in a way that is intended to be impressive – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 穿着奢华招眼的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flashy dresser
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着奢华招眼的人

Sense.DEF: a special type of bottle that you use to keep liquids either hot or cold, for example when travelling

a
hip flask

a glass bottle with a narrow top, used in a
laboratory

PIC.HEADING: FLASKS 瓶
PIC.PICCONTENT: hip flask 扁酒瓶；flask 烧瓶；Thermos flask 保温杯

Sense.DEF: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
Sense.EXAMPLE: houses with flat roofs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平顶房
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perfectly flat sandy beach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分平坦的沙滩
Sense.EXAMPLE: The countryside near there is flat as a pancake very flat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿附近的乡间地势非常平坦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work on a clean, flat surface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在干净﹑平整的台面上工作。

Sense.DEF: a flat rate, amount of money etc is fixed and does not change or have anything added to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clients are charged a flat rate of £250 annually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向客户统一收取250英镑的年费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We charge a flat fee for car hire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收取固定的租车费。

Sense.DEF: a flat tyre or ball has no air or not enough air in it
not very deep, thick, or high, especially in comparison to its width or length
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与其宽度或长度相比〕浅的﹐薄的﹔矮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cake came out of the oven flat, not fluffy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕出炉时扁扁的﹐不够松软。

Sense.DEF: a drink that is flat does not taste fresh because it has no more bubbles of gas in it
a performance, book etc that is flat lacks interest, excitement, or energy
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出﹑书等〕沉闷乏味的﹐平淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arsenal looked flat for large parts of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛的大部分时间里﹐阿森纳队的表现都乏善可陈。

Sense.DEF:
a flat
battery
has lost its electrical power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you checked that the batteries haven’t gone flat become flat ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你检查过电池里还有电吗？

Sense.DEF: if prices, economic conditions, trade etc are flat, they have not increased or improved over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Analysts are expecting flat sales in the coming months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析人士预计未来数月销售不景气。

Sense.DEF:
a musical note that is one
semitone
lower than the note E, B, A etc
if a musical note is flat, it is played or sung slightly lower than it should be
not showing much emotion, or not changing much in sound as you speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s dead,’ she said in a flat voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他死了。”她淡淡地说。

Sense.DEF: a refusal etc that is definite and which someone will not change
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our requests were met with a flat refusal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的请求遭到断然拒绝。

Subsense.DEF: to be lying down so that all of your back is touching the floor
to be very ill so that you have to stay in bed for a period of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been flat on my back with the flu all week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得了流感﹐在床上躺了整整一个礼拜。

Sense.DEF: flat shoes have very low heels
having little variety of light and dark
Sense.TRAN: 无深浅反差的﹐无明暗的﹐缺乏层次的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flat lighting is typical of Avedon’s portraits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面照明是阿维顿肖像照的特征。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will definitely not change what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t go, and that’s flat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不去﹐就这样！

Exponent.DEF: on one level, without any holes or raised areas, and not sloping or curving
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a flat roof
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 平（屋）顶
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a flat screen
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面屏幕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Before you lay the tiles, make sure that the ground is completely flat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺地砖前要确保地面完全平整。

Exponent.DEF: not sloping in any direction, so that every part is at the same height
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is the top of this picture level?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画的上端平了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After four hours coming down the mountain, I was glad to be back on level ground.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 走完四个小时的下山路﹐我很高兴回到了平地上。

Exponent.DEF: without any holes or raised areas – used especially when saying how something feels when you touch it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her lovely smooth skin
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迷人光滑的皮肤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I ran my hand across the animal’s smooth fur.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抚摸着那动物光滑的皮毛。

Exponent.DEF: without any holes or raised areas
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Apply the paint to an even surface.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把涂料涂在平整的表面上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Be careful – the path is not very even here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心——这段路不是很平坦。

Exponent.DEF: going straight across and not sloping
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a horizontal line
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水平线
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Raise both arms to a horizontal position.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 平举双臂。

Sense.DEF: a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building
Sense.TRAN: 一套住房﹐一套公寓房﹐单元房
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have a flat in Crouch End.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在蹲尾区有一套公寓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-bedroom flat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带两间卧室的公寓
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was knocked down to make way for a block of flats a large building with many flats in it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢建筑被拆了﹐腾出地方建一幢公寓楼。

Sense.DEF: a tyre that does not have enough air inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damn, the car has a flat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真该死﹐车子有个轮胎没气了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped to change a flat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来换掉瘪了的轮胎。

Subsense.DEF:
a musical note that is one
semitone
lower than a particular note

the sign (b) in written music that shows that a note is one
semitone
lower than a particular note

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is at a low level, especially near water
Sense.EXAMPLE: mud flats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泥滩

Sense.DEF: a pair of women’s shoes with very low heels

Sense.LEXUNIT: the flat of sb’s hand/a knife/a sword etc
Sense.DEF: the flat part or flat side of something
Sense.TRAN: 某人的掌面/刀面/剑面等

Sense.DEF: on ground that is level and does not slope
in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bed can be folded flat for storage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张床可以折扁存放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay flat on the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他平躺在地板上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That night I lay flat on my back and stared up at the ceiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一夜﹐我仰面平躺﹐眼睛直直地盯着天花板。

Sense.DEF: in exactly three minutes, ten seconds etc – used to emphasize that something happens or is done very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 正好三分钟/十秒钟等〔用于强调事情发生或完成的速度很快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was dressed in five minutes flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只用五分钟就穿好衣服了。

Sense.DEF: if a joke, story etc falls flat, it does not achieve the effect that is intended
Sense.TRAN: 〔笑话﹑故事等〕没有达到预期效果
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, what could have been a powerful drama fell flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真可惜﹐本该是很有影响力的一出戏却没有出彩。

Sense.DEF: if you sing or play music flat, you sing or play slightly lower than the correct note so that the sound is unpleasant

Subsense.DEF: to fall so that you are lying on your chest on the ground
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Babe slipped and fell flat on her face.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴贝滑了一跤﹐趴在地上。

Subsense.DEF: to not have the result you want or expect, especially when this is embarrassing
Subsense.TRAN: 达不到预期的效果〔尤指造成尴尬〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The theory falls flat on its face when put into practice.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该理论在实际应用时栽了跟头。

Subsense.DEF: as fast as possible
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Everyone’s working flat out to finish on time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都全力以赴﹐争取按时完成。

Subsense.DEF: in a direct and complete way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She asked him flat out if he was seeing another woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她直截了当地问他是否在跟别的女人约会。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something directly and definitely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told him flat that I didn’t want to see him again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他直说我不想再见到他了。

Sense.DEF: having a flat surface to put something on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flatbed scanner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平板扫描仪
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flatbed truck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平板卡车

Sense.DEF:
a general name for any type of flat bread, for example
pitta bread
, or the base for a
pizza
Sense.TRAN: 扁面包〔口袋面包﹑比萨饼坯等的总称〕

Sense.DEF: a cap made of cloth, with a stiff piece that sticks out at the front
a railway carriage without a roof or sides, used for carrying goods
a woman who is flat-chested has small breasts
a medical condition in which someone’s feet rest flat on the ground because the middle of each foot is not as curved as it should be

a type of sea fish with a thin flat body, such as
cod
or
plaice
Sense.TRAN: 比目鱼〔扁平的海鱼﹐如鳕鱼﹑鲽鱼等〕

Sense.DEF: having flat feet
moving in an awkward way
Sense.TRAN: 拖着脚走的﹐蹒跚而行的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The defence looked flat-footed as Sutton scored easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防守队员看上去行动迟缓﹐萨顿轻易射门得分。

Sense.DEF: to surprise someone so that they cannot do something in the way they ought to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President’s announcement seemed to catch Democrats flat-footed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的声明似乎令民主党人猝不及防。

Sense.DEF: a small apartment
to be at a low level or standard that is neither increasing nor decreasing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tories have been flatlining in the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党在民意调查中一直不怎么受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a direct and definite way that is not likely to change
Sense.TRAN: 断然拒绝/否认/反对某事等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flatly denied ever having met the woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他断然否认见过那名女子。

Sense.DEF: without showing any emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Aunt Alicia has changed her will,’ she said flatly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “艾丽西亚姑姑已经改了遗嘱。”她淡淡地说道。

Sense.DEF: someone who shares a flat with one or more other people
furniture that is sold as parts in a box and has to be put together
Sense.EXAMPLE: flat-pack furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盒装组合家具

Sense.DEF: horse racing on flat ground without any fences

a flatscreen television or
computer monitor
is very thin
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视机或计算机显示器〕平面的﹐平板的

Sense.DEF: to make something flat or flatter, or to become flat or flatter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a rolling pin to flatten the dough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用擀面杖把面团擀平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land flattened out as we neared the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们接近海岸时﹐地势变平坦了。

Sense.DEF: to destroy a building or town by knocking it down, bombing it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of homes were flattened by the tornado.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百户住宅被龙卷风夷为平地。

Sense.DEF: to press your body against something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I flattened myself against the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我全身紧贴在墙上。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone completely and easily in a game, argument etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛﹑争论中轻易彻底地〕击败﹐击倒﹐驳倒
Sense.EXAMPLE: We flattened them 6-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以6比0彻底击败了他们。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone very hard
to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太﹐称赞她的烹调手艺。

Sense.DEF: to make someone look as attractive as they can
Sense.EXAMPLE: That dress really flatters your figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件连衣裙很显你的身材。

Sense.DEF: to make something look or seem more important or better than it is
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕显得更重要 [更好]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis’s novel doesn’t flatter Midwestern attitudes and morals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯的小说并没有美化美国中西部人的生活态度和道德观念。

Sense.DEF: if you flatter yourself that something is true about your abilities or achievements, you make yourself believe it is true, although it is not

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She flatters herself that she could have been a model.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自以为原本是可以当模特的。

Sense.DEF: pleased because someone has shown you that they like or admire you
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were flattered by all the attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到如此关注﹐我们深感荣幸。

Sense.DEF: clothes, pictures etc that are flattering make someone look as attractive as they can or make something as good as possible, even if it is not really very good
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服﹑照片等〕使人显得更漂亮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: That colour is very flattering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种颜色很衬人。

Sense.DEF: praise that you do not really mean
used humorously when someone has praised you and you want to say that you will help them or not help them
Sense.TRAN: 恭维很管用/不管用〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a type of hair style that is very short and looks flat on top
the condition of having too much gas in the stomach
knives, forks, and spoons
to show your money, success, beauty etc so that other people notice it – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rich flaunted their wealth while the poor starved on the streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富人摆阔﹐穷人却在大街上饿肚子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: if you’ve got it, flaunt it
Sense.DEF: used humorously to tell someone not to hide their beauty, wealth, or abilities
Sense.TRAN: 有的话就展示出来〔幽默用法﹐用于叫人不要掩饰自己的美貌﹑财富或能力〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who plays the
flute
a quality that something has that makes you feel or think a particular way about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: music with a little bit of Caribbean flava
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带点加勒比风情的音乐

Sense.DEF: the particular taste of a food or drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which flavour do you want - chocolate or vanilla?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要哪种味道的﹐巧克力还是香草？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dry wine with flavors of honey and apricot
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有蜂蜜和杏子口味的干葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: the quality of tasting good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I prefer this one because it has more flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢这种﹐因为它味道更好。

Sense.DEF: a substance used to give something a particular taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial flavours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人工调味品

Sense.DEF: a quality or feature that makes something have a particular style or character
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stories have a strong regional flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些故事有很强的地方色彩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Critics claim the building would destroy the flavor of the neighborhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评者称这幢建筑会破坏街区的风格。

Sense.DEF: an idea of what the typical qualities of something are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marston’s book gives you a flavour of life in the 16th century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马斯顿的书能让你体味到16世纪的生活。

Sense.DEF: an idea, person, style etc that is very popular at a particular time

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mango has a delicious flavour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 芒果很美味。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flavor was like peaches, but not as sweet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那味道像桃子﹐但不那么甜。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flavour of the sauce was quite strong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 酱汁的味道很浓。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: strong and pleasant
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The brown sugar makes the flavour especially rich.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 红糖令味道特别浓郁。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I prefer a sausage with a milder flavour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢味道更淡些的香肠。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pleasant and not strong or bitter
pleasant and not strong
very different from other foods or drinks

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These biscuits have a very distinctive flavour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些饼干味道很特别。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Herbs add flavor to a salad.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 香草使色拉增味。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make the flavour more noticeable

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The beef is tender and full of flavour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉很嫩﹐美味十足。

Sense.DEF: to give something a particular taste or more taste

tasting of
strawberries
, chocolate etc
Sense.TRAN: 草莓味的/巧克力味的等

Sense.DEF: having had a flavour added
Sense.EXAMPLE: flavored coffees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调味咖啡

Sense.DEF: having a strong pleasant taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: flavourful cheese
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓郁可口的奶酪

Sense.DEF: a substance used to give something a particular flavour or increase its flavour
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial flavourings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人工调味品

Sense.DEF: having a strong pleasant taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flavorful Mexican dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓郁可口的墨西哥菜

Sense.DEF: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flaw in the software
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该软件的缺点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slight flaw in the glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃上的一点小瑕疵

Sense.EXAMPLE: A design flaw a mistake or weakness in the way something was made caused the engine to explode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

Sense.DEF: a mistake or problem in an argument, plan, set of ideas etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔论点﹑计划﹑思想等中的〕错误﹐缺陷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beautiful scenery does not make up for the flaws of this film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的风光弥补不了此影片的不足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a fundamental flaw in Walton’s argument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔顿的论点中有一个根本性的错误。

GramExa.GLOSS: a weakness that makes something certain to fail

Sense.DEF: a fault in someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jealousy is Othello’s major flaw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫉妒是奥赛罗的主要弱点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the President’s character flaws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的性格缺陷

Sense.DEF: spoiled by having mistakes, weaknesses, or by being damaged
Sense.TRAN: 有错误的﹔有缺点的﹔有损坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flawed concept
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有错误的观念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The research behind this report is seriously flawed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告背后的研究工作存在严重错误。

Sense.DEF: having no mistakes or marks, or not lacking anything
Sense.TRAN: 无缺点的﹔无痕的﹔无瑕的﹐完美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adrian’s flawless French
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿德里安无可挑剔的法语

Sense.DEF: a plant with blue flowers, used for making cloth and oil

the thread made from this plant, used for making
linen
flaxen hair is light yellow in colour
to criticize someone very severely
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was well-known for flaying public officials in her daily column.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因在每日专栏里批判政府官员而出名。

Sense.DEF: to whip or beat someone very severely
to remove the skin from an animal or person, especially one that is dead
a very small insect without wings that jumps and bites animals and people to eat their blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure the dog has fleas ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你确定那只狗身上有跳蚤吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: send sb off with a flea in their ear
Sense.DEF: to talk angrily to someone, especially because they have done something you disapprove of
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因某人做了你不赞成的事而〕一顿臭骂轰走某人

Sense.DEF: a dirty animal or person that you dislike
a cheap dirty hotel
a special collar, worn by a dog or cat, that contains chemicals to keep fleas away from them
Sense.TRAN: 〔给狗或猫戴的含化学剂的〕驱蚤项圈

Sense.DEF: a market where old or used goods are sold
Sense.TRAN: 跳蚤市场〔旧货买卖市场〕

Sense.DEF: a cheap dirty cinema or theatre – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 蚤窝〔指肮脏的廉价电影院或剧院﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a small mark or spot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a black beard with flecks of gray
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斑白的胡子

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: flecks of sawdust
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 锯木屑

Sense.DEF: having small marks or spots, or small pieces of something, covering a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: red cloth flecked with white
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 红底白点的布

Sense.DEF: a young bird that is learning to fly
a fledgling state or organization has only recently been formed and is still developing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fledgling republic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个新兴的共和国

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: His attackers turned and fled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正有蹲了六个月监狱﹐然后逃出了该国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many German artists fled to America at the beginning of World War II.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战初期﹐许多德国艺术家逃到了美国。

Sense.DEF: the woolly coat of a sheep, especially the wool and skin of a sheep when it has been made into a piece of clothing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指连毛带皮做成衣服的〕羊毛

Sense.DEF: an artificial soft material used to make warm jackets
a jacket made of this artificial material
to charge someone too much money for something, especially by tricking them
soft and woolly, or looking soft and woolly
Sense.TRAN: 羊毛的﹔羊毛似的﹔毛茸茸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: fleecy white towels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的白毛巾

Sense.DEF: a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy
Sense.EXAMPLE: the US seventh fleet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国第七舰队

Sense.DEF: a group of vehicles that are controlled by one company

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fleet of taxis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车队

Sense.DEF: fast or quick
Sense.EXAMPLE: Atalanta was fleet of foot able to run quickly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

Sense.DEF: the highest rank in the US navy, or someone who holds this rank
lasting for only a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fleeting smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一闪即逝的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: For one fleeting moment , Paula allowed herself to forget her troubles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在这一片刻﹐葆拉让自己暂时忘却了烦恼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I caught a fleeting glimpse of them as they drove past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我瞥见他们驱车一闪而过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carol was paying a fleeting visit to Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔在巴黎短暂停留。

Sense.DEF: a street in London where many important newspaper offices used to be, often used as a name for the British newspaper industry
Sense.TRAN: 舰队街〔伦敦街名﹐曾为许多重要报社的办公地﹐常用来指英国报界〕

Sense.DEF: a language like German spoken in northern Belgium
Sense.TRAN: 佛兰芒语〔比利时北部地区的一种语言﹐近似德语〕

Sense.DEF: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones
Sense.EXAMPLE: a freshwater fish with firm white flesh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种肉色雪白﹑肉质紧实的淡水鱼

Sense.DEF: the skin of the human body
Sense.EXAMPLE: His flesh was red and covered in sores.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的皮肤发红﹐上面全是疮。

Sense.DEF: the soft part of a fruit or vegetable that can be eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the melon in half and scoop out the flesh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把瓜切成两半﹐然后挖出瓜瓤。

Sense.DEF: if you see someone in the flesh, you see someone who you previously had only seen in pictures, films etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked much shorter in the flesh than on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本人看上去要比在电视上矮得多。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel frightened, nervous, or uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: 使某人毛骨悚然 [胆战心惊]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way he stared at her made her flesh creep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盯着她看的那副神情令她毛骨悚然。

Sense.DEF: someone who is part of your family
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can he treat his own flesh and blood that way?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怎么能那样对待自己的至亲骨肉？

Sense.DEF: the physical human body, as opposed to the mind or spirit
Sense.TRAN: 肉体〔相对于思想或灵魂〕

GramExa.GLOSS: things such as drinking, eating a lot, or having sex

Sense.DEF: to give more details about something to make it clear, more interesting etc
Sense.TRAN: 充实某事物﹐加细节于某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll try to put some flesh on the plan Margaret has outlined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来具体说说玛格丽特刚才概述的这个计划。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go the way of all flesh
Sense.DEF: to die

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak

Sense.DEF: to add more details to something in order to make it clear, more interesting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to flesh out your argument with a few more examples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要再举几个例子来充实你的论点。

Sense.DEF: having a pinkish colour like the colour of white people’s skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: flesh-coloured tights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉色紧身裤

Sense.DEF: areas in a city or town where there are many places that people go to for pleasure, especially sexual pleasure – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 满足肉欲的场所﹔寻欢作乐的地方〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a wound that cuts the skin but does not injure the organs and bones inside the body
having a lot of flesh
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fleshy part of your hand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你手上肉厚的部分

Sense.DEF: having a soft thick inner part
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plant with fleshy leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长有肉质叶片的植物

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
fly1
to tighten your muscles or bend part of your body
Sense.TRAN: 收紧〔肌肉〕﹔屈曲〔身体部位〕

Sense.DEF: to show your ability to do something, especially your skill or power
Sense.TRAN: 展示自己的才能〔尤指技艺或力量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The role will allow her to flex her acting muscles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个角色使她能够施展自己的表演才能。

Sense.DEF: an electrical wire covered with plastic, used to connect electrical equipment to an electricity supply
the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

Sense.DEF: the ability to bend or be bent easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stretching exercises will help your flexibility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伸展运动能增强身体柔韧性。

Sense.DEF: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can be flexible about your starting date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你具体从哪天开始﹐我们可以灵活一点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our new computer software is extremely flexible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的新电脑软件兼容性极好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

Sense.DEF: something that is flexible can bend or be bent easily
Sense.TRAN: 易弯曲的﹐有弹性的﹐柔韧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: shoes with flexible rubber soles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带弹性橡胶底的鞋

Sense.DEF: a system in which people work a particular number of hours each week or month, but can change the times at which they start and finish each day
to make something move away by hitting or pushing it suddenly or quickly, especially with your thumb and finger
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用大拇指和另一手指〕弹﹐拂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Papa flicked the ash from his cigar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸弹去雪茄上的烟灰。

Sense.DEF: to move with a sudden quick movement, or to make something move in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cow’s tail flicked from side to side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 母牛的尾巴左右甩动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jackie flicked her long hair back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰姬将长发向后一甩。

Sense.DEF: to move a switch so that a machine or piece of electrical equipment starts or stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt inside the doorway and flicked the light switch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在门道里摸索﹐按下了电灯开关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sandra flicked the TV on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉打开了电视。

Sense.DEF: to look very quickly at someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leith flicked a glance at her watch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利思看了看手表。

Sense.DEF:
if you flick something such as a
towel
or rope, you move it so that the end moves quickly away from you
Sense.TRAN: 用〔毛巾﹑绳等〕轻拂﹐轻快地甩打
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old man flicked his whip and the horses moved off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人鞭子一挥﹐马儿上路了。

Sense.DEF: to look at a book, magazine, set of photographs etc quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速翻阅﹐浏览〔书﹑杂志﹑照片等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will flicked through Carla’s photo album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔翻着卡拉的相册。

Sense.DEF: a short quick sudden movement or hit with a part of your body, whip etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a flick of the wrist , Frye sent the ball into the opposite court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗赖伊手腕一甩﹐把球送到了对方半场。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how easy it is to start a machine and use it
Sense.TRAN: （只要）轻轻一按开关（就行了）〔用于强调开动和使用机器很容易〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can shut off all the power in the building at the flick of a switch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需按一下开关﹐我就能关闭大楼的所有电源。

Sense.DEF: a film
Sense.EXAMPLE: an action flick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动作片

Sense.DEF: the cinema
to look at a book, magazine, set of pictures etc very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a quick flick through your report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快地翻了一下你的报告。

Sense.DEF: to burn or shine with an unsteady light that goes on and off quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The overhead lights flickered momentarily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头顶灯闪了一会儿。

Sense.DEF: if an emotion or expression flickers on someone’s face or through their mind, it exists or is shown for only a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A puzzled smile flickered across the woman’s face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人脸上掠过一丝困惑的微笑。

Sense.DEF: to quickly make a sudden small movement or series of movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Polly’s eyelids flickered, then she slept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉眼皮颤了几下﹐然后就睡了。

Sense.DEF: an unsteady light that goes on and off quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the flicker of the firelight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火光的跳动

Sense.DEF: a feeling or expression that continues for a very short time
Sense.TRAN: 霎时的感情/犹豫/激动等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw a flicker of doubt in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到他的眼里闪过一丝怀疑。

Sense.DEF: a quick sudden movement or series of movements
a knife with a blade inside the handle that moves quickly into position when you press a button

another spelling of
flyer

a
fly32
a journey in a plane or space vehicle, or the plane or vehicle that is making the journey
Sense.TRAN: 〔乘坐飞机或太空飞船的〕飞行﹐航程﹔航班﹐班机
Sense.EXAMPLE: He immediately booked a flight to Toulouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当即就订了去图卢兹的航班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are only three flights a day to Logan Airport from Heathrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希思罗机场每天只有三趟飞往洛根机场的航班。

Sense.DEF: when something flies through the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: pelicans in flight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 展翅飞翔的鹈鹕

Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1968, the first supersonic airliner took flight began flying .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1968年﹐首架超音速客机飞上天空。

Sense.DEF: an object’s or bird’s movement through the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: During its flight, the weapon twists and turns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种武器能够在飞行过程中转向。

Sense.DEF: a set of stairs between one floor and the next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bert lives two flights down from here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这儿往下走两层就是伯特的住处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fell down a whole flight of stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从整整一段楼梯上跌落下来。

Sense.DEF: when you leave a place in order to try and escape from a person or a dangerous situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔从某人手中或险境中的〕逃走﹐逃跑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Donald Wood’s hasty flight from South Africa early in 1978
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1978年初唐纳德•伍德匆忙逃离南非

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When the alarm sounded, the whole gang took flight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警报响起﹐一帮人全逃跑了。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone run away especially by fighting or threatening them

Sense.DEF: thoughts, ideas etc that are full of imagination but that are not practical or sensible
a group of birds all flying together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flight of swallows
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群飞燕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: reserve a seat on a particular plane
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I booked the flight over the Internet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在网上预订了航班。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: book it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ll be there tomorrow morning if I can get a flight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是能订到航班的话﹐我明天早上就能到。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be in time to get on a plane
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They caught a flight that night to Frankfurt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们乘上了当晚飞往法兰克福的班机。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get on a flight
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We arrived at the departure lounge to board the flight to Madrid.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到了候机室﹐等待登机前往马德里。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: arrive too late for a flight
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Jack overslept and missed his flight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克睡过了头﹐误了班机。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay a company for the use of their aircraft
a flight that was due to go somewhere does not go
it is late leaving

Collocate.COLLOC: a flight is bound for London/New York etc
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it is going there
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 飞往伦敦/纽约等的航班

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have a good flight!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: （飞行）旅途愉快！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with no problems or sudden movements
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flight had been smooth all the way.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行一路平稳。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: uncomfortable because the plane moved up and down a lot
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flight was very bumpy, and we really wondered whether we would make it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 航程很颠簸﹐我们真怀疑能否撑到底。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was very tired after the long flight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 长途飞行后我很疲惫。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups are calling for an end to cheap flights.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保组织呼吁叫停廉价航班。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a flight going straight from one place to another without stopping
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the first direct flight to Tokyo
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 直飞东京航线的首航

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a flight between one country and another
a flight within a country
travelling a long distance
a plane service that flies at the same time every day or every week
a plane service that is arranged for a particular group or purpose
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is operating charter flights to Crete.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司运营前往克里特岛的包机业务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a flight that arrives before another one leaves
a flight that goes from one continent to another, for example from Europe to Asia
a normal flight
a plane’s first flight
how long it takes to fly somewhere
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our estimated flight time is three hours and fifteen minutes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计我们的飞行时间为三小时十五分钟。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the route taken by an aircraft

Sense.DEF: someone who serves food and drinks to passengers on a plane, and looks after their comfort and safety
Sense.TRAN: 空中服务员﹐〔客机的〕乘务员

Sense.DEF: the people, such as the pilot and flight attendants, who work on a plane during a flight
the room in a plane where the pilot sits to control the plane
the flat surface of a ship which military aircraft use to fly into the air from
unable to fly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flightless bird
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种不能飞的鸟

Sense.DEF: a middle rank in the British air force, or someone who holds this rank
the course that a plane or space vehicle travels along
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机或太空飞船的〕飞行路线

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment in an aircraft that records details such as the plane’s speed and direction
a middle rank in the British air force, or someone who holds this rank
a machine used to train pilots that copies closely the movements and conditions that exist when flying an aircraft
a woman who is flighty changes her ideas and opinions often, and only remains interested in people or things for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕反复无常的﹐轻浮的﹐见异思迁的

Sense.DEF: information or ideas that are not true or seem very stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was sick of his intellectual flimflam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听腻了他那些书呆子的废话。

Sense.DEF: flimsy cloth or clothing is light and thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flimsy cotton dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件又轻又薄的棉布连衣裙

Sense.DEF: something that is flimsy is not strong or well-made, and will break easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flimsy wooden building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不牢固的木屋

Sense.DEF: a flimsy agreement is weak and can easily be damaged or broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flimsy alliance between the two tribal groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个部落间脆弱的联盟

Sense.DEF: a flimsy argument or excuse does not seem very likely and people do not believe it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence against him is extremely flimsy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指控他的证据根本站不住脚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flimsy excuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 站不住脚的借口

Sense.DEF: to move your face or body away from someone or something because you are in pain, frightened, or upset
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疼痛﹑害怕﹑生气而〕退缩﹐畏缩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She flinched at the touch of his hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手碰到她时﹐她缩了一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy flinched away from him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男孩往后一缩﹐躲开了他。

Sense.DEF: to feel embarrassed or upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jo flinched at her sister’s insensitivity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔对姐姐的冷漠感到生气。

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do something even though it is difficult or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never flinched from doing his duty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来不逃避自己的责任。

Sense.DEF: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He flung the box into the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把盒子扔进河里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: People cheered and flung their hats into the air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众欢呼着把帽子抛向空中。

Sense.DEF: to throw or move something roughly and carelessly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flung his coat over the back of a chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把外套扔在椅背上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flung back the covers and got up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一掀被子﹐起了床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flung the books aside angrily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生气地把书扔到一边。

Sense.DEF: to push someone roughly, especially so that they fall to the ground
Sense.TRAN: 猛推〔某人〕〔尤指使其摔倒在地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed her arm and flung her to the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓住她的胳膊﹐将她推倒在地。

Sense.DEF: to move yourself or part of your body quickly, using a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 扑向﹐冲向﹔猛地移动﹐猛地伸出
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flung himself down on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一头倒在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flung her arms round Louise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她猛地伸出双臂搂住路易丝。

Sense.DEF: to say something to someone in an angry way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People were flinging all sorts of accusations at her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们向她发出种种责难。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His own words were flung back at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人用他自己说过的话回敬了他。

Sense.DEF: to open a door or window roughly, using a lot of force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door was flung open and Selkirk entered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门猛地被推开﹐塞尔扣克走了进来。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in prison, often without having a good reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指没有充分理由而〕把某人投入监狱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opposition leaders were flung into jail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对派领导人被投入监狱。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something with a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 全力投入某事﹐投身于某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the divorce he flung himself into his work to forget her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚后﹐他全身心扑在工作上﹐想忘掉她。

Subsense.DEF: to move suddenly towards someone in order to attack them or hold them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He flung himself at her and snatched the bag.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然向她冲过去﹐抢走了包。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The children flung themselves at him, squealing with joy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们高兴地尖叫着向他扑去。

Subsense.DEF: to show in a very clear, open way that you want to have a sexual relationship with someone – used to show disapproval
Subsense.TRAN: 向某人投怀送抱﹐主动把自己送给某人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to quickly remove a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flung off his coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扯去外套。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place when they do not want to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was flung out of school for swearing at a teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为辱骂老师被赶出了学校。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something you no longer want or need
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it doesn’t work, just fling it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是坏了﹐就把它扔掉吧。

Sense.DEF: a short and not very serious sexual relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a brief fling a few years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们几年前曾有过一段短暂的恋情。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time during which you enjoy yourself without worrying about anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sees this as his final fling before he retires.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把这看作是他退休前的最后一次放纵。

Sense.DEF: a type of smooth hard stone that makes a small flame when you hit it with steel
a piece of this stone or a small piece of metal that makes a small flame when you hit it with steel
not showing any emotions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Duvall gave him a flinty stare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜瓦尔冷冷地瞪了他一眼。

Sense.DEF: like flint or containing flint
to move something with a quick sudden movement so that it is in a different position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flipped the top off the bottle and poured himself a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下子打开瓶盖﹐给自己倒了杯饮料。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flipped the lid of the box open and looked inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迅速打开盒盖﹐往里面看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He flipped the paper over and started writing on the back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他唰地把纸翻过来﹐在背面写了起来。

Sense.DEF: to make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: We flipped a coin to see who would go first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们抛硬币决定谁先去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s quite an art to flipping pancakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻煎饼真是门艺术。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just flipped and started shouting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我动了火﹐大声叫嚷起来。

Sense.DEF: to move a switch so that a machine or piece of electrical equipment starts or stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna flipped the switch that opened the front gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜按了打开前门的开关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Josie flipped on the radio.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔西打开了收音机。

Sense.DEF: to turn the pages of a book or newspaper quickly, especially because you are looking for something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因寻找东西而快速地〕浏览〔书﹑报纸〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He picked up the newspaper and flipped straight to the sports pages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿起报纸﹐直接翻到体育版。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I flipped through my address book but couldn’t find her phone number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我翻了通讯录﹐但是找不到她的电话号码。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom flipped her lid when she found out I was pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈发现我怀孕后﹐暴跳如雷。

Sense.DEF: to make a rude sign at someone by lifting up your middle finger and keeping your other fingers down
Sense.TRAN: 朝…竖中指〔一种无礼的手势〕

Sense.DEF: an action in which you make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the end the decision was made by the flip of a coin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后是掷硬币决定的。

Sense.DEF: a movement in which you jump up and turn over in the air, so that your feet go over your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tripped and almost did a backward flip down the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绊了一下﹐差点从楼梯上倒栽下来。

Sense.DEF: an action in which you turn the pages of a book or newspaper quickly, especially because you are looking for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a quick flip through my cookery books and found a recipe that sounded quite nice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我匆匆翻了翻烹饪书﹐找了个似乎相当不错的菜谱。

Sense.DEF: not said or meant seriously
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was fed up with his flip comments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听够了他那些轻率的评论。

Sense.DEF: a set of large pieces of paper that are connected at the top so that you can turn the pages over to present information to people

a computer
chip
on which the electrical connections that store, use etc information face towards the computer’s
circuit board the part that carries electricity to all the electrical connections
, making it unnecessary to have electrical connections on both sides of the chip
Sense.EXAMPLE: flip-chip technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒装芯片技术

Sense.DEF: to change your opinion about something
open summer shoes, usually made of rubber, with a V-shaped band across the front to hold your feet
not being serious about something that other people think you should be serious about
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rather flippant remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当轻浮的话

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t be flippant about such things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的事情你不应该轻率。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: This is no time for flippancy.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时候容不得轻率行事。

Sense.DEF:
a flat part on the body of some large sea animals such as
seals
,that they use for swimming
a large flat rubber shoe that you wear to help you swim faster
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助加快游泳速度的〕脚蹼﹐鸭脚板﹐蛙鞋

Sense.DEF:
a
mobile phone
that has a cover which opens upwards
used to show that you are slightly annoyed about something
Sense.TRAN: 该死的[地]﹐讨厌的[地]〔表示对某事有点生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s flipping cold outside!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面冷得要命！
Sense.EXAMPLE: This flipping pen doesn’t work!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支该死的笔不出水！

Sense.DEF: the bad effects of something that also has good effects
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flip side of the treatment is that it can make patients feel very tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一疗法的副作用是会使病人感觉非常疲累。

Sense.DEF: the side of a record that does not have the main song on
to behave towards someone in a way that shows that you are sexually attracted to them, although you do not really want a relationship with them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She accused him of flirting with other women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指责他与别的女人调情。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was flirting outrageously a lot with some of the managers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她肆无忌惮地与一些经理调情。

Sense.DEF: to consider doing something, but not be very serious about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had flirted with the idea of emigrating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他曾经有过移民的念头。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is dangerous or could cause problems for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Climbers enjoy flirting with danger .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山者喜欢冒险。

Sense.DEF: someone who flirts with people

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who flirts a lot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s an incorrigible flirt!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱招惹男人﹐积习难改！

Sense.DEF: a short period of time during which you are interested in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started his own business last year, after a brief flirtation with political life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他玩过一段时间的政治之后﹐去年自己开了公司。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows you are attracted to someone sexually
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had no objection to a little mild flirtation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不反对来点小小的调情。

Sense.DEF: a short sexual relationship which is not serious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a brief flirtation with Tim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和蒂姆有过一段露水情缘。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that deliberately tries to attract sexual attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a flirtatious smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挑逗地对他笑了一笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flirtatious giggle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖弄风情的咯咯笑声

Sense.DEF: to move lightly or quickly and not stay in one place for very long
Sense.EXAMPLE: Birds flitted about in the trees above them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿在他们头顶的树枝间飞来飞去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed to spend her life flitting from one country to another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎一生都在各国间辗转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes flitted to his watch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞥了一眼手表。

Subsense.DEF: to stay or move on the surface of a liquid without sinking
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t sure if the raft would float.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能肯定这只木筏是否浮得起来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She spent the afternoon floating on her back in the pool.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个下午她都仰面浮在泳池里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A couple of broken branches floated past us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几根断枝从我们身边漂过。

Subsense.DEF: to put something on the surface of a liquid so that it does not sink
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The logs are trimmed and then floated down the river.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些原木经修整后被放进河里顺流漂下。

Sense.DEF: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仰望着天上的浮云。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

Sense.DEF: if sounds or smells float somewhere, people in another place can hear or smell them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sound of her voice came floating down from an upstairs window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音从楼上的一个窗户飘下来。

Sense.DEF: to walk in a slow light graceful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel floated around the bedroom in a lace nightgown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔穿着蕾丝睡袍﹐在卧室里轻盈地走来走去。

Sense.DEF: to suggest an idea or plan in order to see if people like it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We first floated the idea back in 1992.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最早是在1992年提出这个想法的。

Sense.DEF: if the government of a country floats its money, the value of the money is allowed to change freely in relation to money from other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: Russia decided to float the rouble on the foreign exchange market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯决定让卢布在外汇市场上自由浮动。

Sense.DEF:
to sell
shares
in a company or business to the public for the first time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company will be floated on the stock market next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司将于明年上市。

Sense.DEF: to write a cheque when you do not have enough money in the bank to pay it
used to say that someone can do or use whatever they like
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can add raisins, nuts, chocolate chips – whatever floats your boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以加葡萄干﹑果仁﹑碎巧克力——想加什么就加什么。

Sense.DEF: to be present in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of cash floating around in the economy at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前的经济领域中有大量现金在流通。

Sense.DEF: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood and watched the Carnival floats drive past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站着观看狂欢节彩车经过。

Sense.DEF: a sweet drink that has ice cream floating in it
a small light object that floats on the surface of the water, used by people trying to catch fish to show where their line is
a flat light object that you can rest part of your body on in water to help you learn to swim
a small amount of money that someone in a shop keeps so that they have enough money to give change to people

a time when
shares
in a company are made available for people to buy for the first time

a time when you sit in a
flotation tank
in order to treat illness or injury, or to relax
Sense.TRAN: 坐浮箱〔以治病﹑疗伤或放松〕

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
flotation
often changing, and not staying the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can choose either a fixed or floating interest rate for the loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔贷款你可以选择固定利率﹐也可选择浮动利率。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area has a large floating population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区有大量流动人口。

Sense.DEF:
the activity of sitting in a
flotation tank
in order to relax, or to treat illness or injury
Sense.TRAN: 坐浮箱〔以放松﹑治病或疗伤〕

Sense.DEF: someone who does not always vote for the same political party at elections
Sense.TRAN: 游离选民〔指不是固定为某一政党投票的人〕

Sense.DEF: a group of sheep, goats, or birds

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flock of small birds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群小鸟

Sense.DEF: a large group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flock of children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群孩子

Sense.DEF: a priest’s flock is the group of people who regularly attend his or her church
Sense.TRAN: 〔经常到某位牧师所属教堂礼拜的〕全体教徒[会众]

Sense.DEF:
small pieces of wool or cotton that are used for filling
cushions

a soft substance that is used to make patterns on the surface of
wallpaper
, curtains etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于在墙纸﹑窗帘等表面制作图案的〕植绒材料﹐柔软贴料

Sense.DEF: if people flock to a place, they go there in large numbers because something interesting or exciting is happening there
Sense.TRAN: 成群结队地去﹐蜂拥而至

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tourists flock to see the town’s medieval churches and buildings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客蜂拥而至﹐参观该镇的中世纪教堂和建筑。

Sense.DEF:
an
ice floe
to beat a person or animal with a whip or stick
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was publicly flogged and humiliated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当众受到鞭打和羞辱。

Sense.DEF: to sell something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to flog all my old video tapes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备把旧录像带都卖掉。

Sense.DEF: to be wasting time or effort by trying to do something that is impossible
to repeat a story or use an idea etc so often that people become bored with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They take a good idea and flog it to death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有了一个好主意就会念叨个没完。

Sense.DEF: a punishment in which someone is severely beaten with a whip or stick
to cover a place with water, or to become covered with water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Towns and cities all over the country have been flooded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国各地的城镇都被淹没了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The houses down by the river flood quite regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿河的房屋常遭水淹。

Sense.DEF: if a river floods, it is too full, and spreads water over the land around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are now fears that the river could flood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在人们担心河水会泛滥。

Sense.DEF: to arrive or go somewhere in large numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refugees are still flooding across the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有大批难民涌过边界。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donations have been flooding in since we launched the appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发出呼吁后﹐捐款如潮水般涌来。

Sense.DEF: to send a very large number of things to a place or organization
Sense.TRAN: 将某物大量送至某地[某机构]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plan to flood the country with forged banknotes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使大量假钞流入该国的计划

Sense.DEF: to receive so many letters, com-plaints, or inquiries that you cannot deal with them all easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been flooded with offers of help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们纷纷表示愿意为我们提供帮助。

Sense.DEF: to produce and sell a very large number of one type of thing, so that the price goes down
Sense.TRAN: 〔用某物〕充斥市场〔以造成价格下跌〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Car manufacturers have been accused of flooding the market with cheap cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车制造商被指责以廉价汽车充斥市场。

Sense.DEF: if light floods a place or floods into it, it makes it very light and bright

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Light flooded into the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 光线照亮厨房。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The morning sun flooded the room with a gentle light.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔和的晨光洒满房间。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or memory floods over you or floods back, you feel or remember it very strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt happiness and relief flooding over me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到幸福和宽慰包围了我。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Memories of my time in Paris flooded back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在巴黎生活的回忆又涌上我心头。

Sense.DEF: if an engine floods or if you flood it, it has too much petrol in it, so that it will not start
to force someone to leave their home because of floods
a very large amount of water that covers an area that is usually dry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The village was cut off by floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个村子因洪水而与外界中断了联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the worst floods for over fifty years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五十多年来最严重的水灾

Sense.DEF: a very large number of things or people that arrive at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN appealed for help with the flood of refugees crossing the border.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量难民涌过边界﹐联合国呼吁援助。

Sense.DEF: crying a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came downstairs in floods of tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她泪流满面地走下楼来。

Sense.DEF: a river that is in flood has much more water in it than usual

Subsense.DEF: if something opens the floodgates, or if the floodgates open, it suddenly becomes possible for a lot of things to happen which were prevented from happening before
Subsense.TRAN: 打开闸门﹐（使）一发不可收拾
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If this case is successful it could open the floodgates for thousands of similar claims.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果本案胜诉﹐就有可能引发成千上万的类似索赔。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are fears that the floodgates will open and large numbers of parents will take their children out of school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心闸门将由此打开﹐许多父母会将孩子从学校带走。

Subsense.DEF: if the floodgates open, or if something opens the floodgates, someone begins to cry and show their emotions after keeping them hidden
Subsense.TRAN: 打开感情的闸门﹐（使）感情爆发
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His display of kindness to her opened the floodgates again, and she began to sob loudly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她的关怀再次打开了她感情的闸门﹐她大声地抽泣起来。

Sense.DEF: a gate that is used to control the flow of water from a large lake or river
a situation in which an area of land becomes covered with water, for example because of heavy rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heavy rain has led to serious flooding in some areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨造成部分地区爆发严重水灾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river banks have been built up to prevent flooding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河堤被加高以防洪水泛滥。

Sense.DEF: a very bright light that is used to light the outside of a building or sports ground at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church was lit up by floodlights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂被泛光灯照亮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The game will be played under floodlights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛将在泛光灯下进行。

Sense.DEF: surrounded by floodlights so that people can see at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: a floodlit football pitch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泛光灯照明的足球场

Sense.DEF: the large area of flat land on either side of a river that is sometimes covered with water when the river becomes too full
Sense.TRAN: 〔河边的〕洪泛区﹐泛滥平原﹐涝原

Sense.DEF: the flow of the sea in towards the land
water that covers an area during a flood
the flat surface that you stand on inside a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a polished wooden floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上过蜡的木地板
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puddle of water on the kitchen floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房地面上的一摊水
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warehouse that has 410,000 square feet of floor space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼面面积为41万平方英尺的仓库

Sense.DEF: the part of a car that forms its inside floor
one of the levels in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ground floor flat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 底层公寓房

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our office is on the top floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的办公室在顶层。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are located on the seventh floor of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在大楼的第七层。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 海底/森林地面/洞穴底等
Sense.DEF: the ground at the bottom of the ocean, the forest etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: creatures that live on the ocean floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在海底的生物

Sense.DEF: an area in a room where people can dance
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were two or three couples already on the dance floor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞池里已经有两三对人了。

GramExa.GLOSS: begin dancing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone took to the floor for the last waltz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都跳起了最后一支华尔兹。

Sense.DEF: a large area in a building where a lot of people do their jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t keen on the idea of working on the shop floor the part of a factory where people make things using machines .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对去工厂车间干活不感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the busy trading floor area where stocks and shares are bought and sold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忙碌的证券交易所大厅

Sense.DEF: an officially agreed limit below which something cannot go
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manufacturers have tried to put a floor under the price of their products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厂商试图给自己的产品定一个底价。

Subsense.DEF: the people attending a public meeting
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are there any questions from the floor?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 底下有人要提问吗？

Subsense.DEF: the part of a parliament, public meeting place etc where people sit
Subsense.TRAN: 〔议会的〕议员席﹔〔公开会议的〕座位区
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The delegates crowded the floor of the House.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表们挤满了议院的议员席。

Sense.DEF: to begin speaking at an important public meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman then took the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着主席发言。

Sense.DEF: to be speaking or have the right to speak at an important public meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stepped aside to allow other speakers to have the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站到一旁﹐让其他演讲者发言。

Sense.DEF: if a price, amount etc goes through the floor, it becomes very low
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑数量等〕降到很低的水平
Sense.EXAMPLE: Share prices have gone through the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价已经探底。

Exponent.DEF: one of the levels in a building
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She lives in an apartment on the eighteenth floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住在18楼的一间公寓。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying how many levels a building has
Exponent.TRAN: 楼层〔用于指建筑总共的楼层数〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a five-storey car park
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座五层的停车场
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school is a single storey building.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学校是座平房。

Exponent.DEF: the floor of a building that is at ground level
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is a shop on the ground floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 底楼有家商店。

Exponent.DEF: one of the levels on a ship, bus, or plane
Exponent.TRAN: 甲板﹔〔公共汽车或飞机的〕层
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Horizon Lounge is on the top deck of the ship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “地平线厅”位于船的顶层甲板。

Sense.DEF: to surprise or shock someone so much that they do not know what to say or do
Sense.TRAN: 使惊讶得不知所措﹔难倒
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of the questions completely floored me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个问题把我完全问倒了。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone so hard that they fall down
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was floored in the first round of the fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拳击赛第一回合他就被击倒了。

Sense.DEF: to make a car go as fast as possible
Sense.TRAN: 踩足〔汽车〕的油门﹐使全速行驶
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got into the car and floored it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上了车﹐把油门踩到底。

Sense.DEF: a board in a wooden floor
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lifted the carpet to check the floorboards for woodworm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我掀开地毯﹐检查地板里是否有木蛀虫。

Sense.DEF: the floor in a car
any material that is used to make or cover floors
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve chosen wood flooring for the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大厅里我们选择木地板。
Sense.EXAMPLE: vinyl flooring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乙烯基塑胶地板

Sense.DEF: a tall lamp that stands on the floor
long enough to reach the floor
Sense.EXAMPLE: floor-length curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拖到地面的窗帘
Sense.EXAMPLE: a floor-length skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 及地长裙

Sense.DEF: a drawing of the shape of a room or building and the position of things in it, as seen from above

a performance by singers, dancers etc at a
nightclub

when an adult gets down onto the floor in order to play with a child. People do this so that the child will feel more comfortable playing with an adult, and some people also believe that it can help a child’s mental abilities to develop fully.
Sense.TRAN: 地板时间〔指成年人趴在地板上与小孩玩耍﹐使小孩感觉自在﹐有人认为这样有助于小孩智力充分发展〕

Sense.DEF: a woman who has sexual relationships with a lot of different men, in a way that you disapprove of
to sit or lie down in a relaxed way, by letting all your weight fall heavily onto a chair etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flopped down onto the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一头倒在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got home and flopped in front of the TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回到家﹐一屁股坐在电视机前。

Sense.DEF: to hang or fall loosely, in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: His head flopped back pathetically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脑袋向后仰着﹐一副可怜相。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a product, play, or idea flops, it is not successful because people do not like it
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品﹑戏剧﹑想法等因无人喜欢而〕失败﹐砸锅

Sense.DEF: a film, play, product etc that is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧﹑产品等的〕失败之作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film was a complete flop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片一败涂地。

Sense.DEF: the movement or noise that something makes when it falls heavily
Sense.TRAN: 重重坠下﹔重坠声﹐扑通声
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fell with a flop into the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扑通一声掉进水里。

Sense.DEF: a very cheap hotel where people can stay when they have very little money and nowhere to live
something that is floppy is soft and hangs down loosely rather than being stiff
Sense.EXAMPLE: a floppy hat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松松垂下的帽子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dog with long floppy ears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耷拉着长耳朵的狗

Sense.DEF: a square piece of plastic that you can store computer information on, and which you can remove from and put into a computer
all the plants that grow in a particular place or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourism is damaging the flora and fauna plants and animals of the island.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业正在破坏该岛的动植物资源。

Sense.DEF: made of flowers or decorated with flowers or pictures of flowers
Sense.TRAN: 花的﹔用花制作的﹔用花装饰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scarf with a bold floral pattern
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印有鲜艳花卉图案的围巾
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pretty floral dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的印花连衣裙
Sense.EXAMPLE: a light floral fragrance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽幽的花香
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were floral tributes flowers sent as a sign of respect after someone has died from his colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有他同事敬献的鲜花。

Sense.DEF:
one of the parts that a vegetable such as
broccoli
or
cauliflower
can be divided into
a florid face is red in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-aged man with a florid complexion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名脸色红润的中年男子

Sense.DEF: florid language, music, or art has a lot of extra unnecessary details or decorations
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言﹑音乐或艺术〕修饰过多的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book written in a very florid style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文风过于华丽的一本书

Sense.DEF: a coin that was used in Britain before 1971, worth about l0p
Sense.TRAN: 弗罗林〔英国1971年以前使用的硬币﹐约等于10便士〕

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells flowers and indoor plants for the home
a shop that sells flowers and indoor plants for the home
a type of thin thread that you use for cleaning between your teeth
a type of thin thread that you use for sewing
to clean between your teeth using floss

a time when
shares
in a company are made available for people to buy for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has decided to postpone its flotation on the stock market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司决定暂缓股票上市。

Sense.DEF: a container filled with air or gas, fixed to something to make it float
a large container full of warm salty water, often with a cover on it to make it dark inside, that you float in so that you can relax, or to treat illness or injury
Sense.TRAN: 浮箱〔内装温盐水的大容器﹐通常不透光﹐人在里面漂浮可以放松﹑治病或疗伤〕

Sense.DEF: a group of small ships
broken pieces of wood and other things from a wrecked ship, floating in the sea or scattered on the shore
Sense.TRAN: 〔漂在海面或冲到岸上的〕残骸﹐碎木﹐零碎杂物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would walk along the beach collecting the flotsam and jetsam that had been washed ashore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会沿着沙滩去捡拾被冲上岸的零碎杂物。

Sense.DEF: things that people no longer want and so throw away
Sense.EXAMPLE: works of art made from the flotsam and jetsam of everyday life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用日常废弃物做成的艺术品

Sense.DEF: people who are very poor and do not have jobs or homes
Sense.TRAN: 流离失所的人﹐流浪者﹐无业游民
Sense.EXAMPLE: Camps were set up to shelter the flotsam and jetsam of the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建了营地来收容那些战争难民。

Sense.DEF: to walk in a quick determined way without looking at people because you are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flounced out of the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她愤怒地冲出房间。

Sense.DEF: a wide band of cloth with folds, which is stitched onto the edge of a skirt, dress, shirt, or curtain as a decoration
Sense.TRAN: 〔裙子﹑衬衫或窗帘上的〕荷叶边
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress had red satin flounces at the bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件连衣裙的下摆是红色的缎子荷叶边。

PIC.HEADING: FLOUNCE 荷叶边
PIC.PICCONTENT: frill 褶边；flounce 荷叶边

Sense.DEF: a way of walking in a quick determined way without looking at people, because you are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked off with a flounce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怒气冲冲地走掉了。

Sense.DEF: decorated with flounces
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flounced skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶荷叶边的裙子

Sense.DEF: to not know what to say or do because you feel confused or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found myself floundering as I tried to answer her questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想回答她的问题﹐却不知说什么好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry,’ she floundered helplessly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起。”她无助地嗫嚅道。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of problems and be likely to fail completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more firms are floundering because of the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于经济衰退﹐越来越多的公司举步维艰。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to move easily because you are in deep water or mud, or cannot see very well
Sense.TRAN: 〔因深陷在水中﹑泥里或因看不清而〕挣扎
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were floundering chest-deep in the freezing water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在齐胸深的冰冷的水里挣扎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could hear them floundering around in the dark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能听到他们在黑暗中挣扎。

Sense.DEF: a type of small fish that you can eat ﹔
a powder that is made by crushing wheat or other grain and is used for making bread, cakes etc

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 精白面粉/全麦面粉/米粉/小麦粉等

Sense.DEF: to cover a surface with flour when you are cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roll the pastry out on a lightly floured board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面团放在撒有少许面粉的案板上擀平。

Sense.DEF: to develop well and be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy is booming and small businesses are flourishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济繁荣﹐小企业蒸蒸日上。

Sense.DEF: to grow well and be very healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most plants will flourish in the rich deep soils here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数植物在此处肥厚的土壤里都能茁壮成长。

Sense.DEF: to wave something in your hand in order to make people notice it
Sense.TRAN: 〔为引起注意而〕挥动〔手中的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked quickly to the desk, flourishing her cheque book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挥着支票簿快步走到桌子旁。

Sense.DEF: with a large confident movement that makes people notice you
Sense.TRAN: 用引人注意的动作﹐用夸张的动作
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened his wallet with a flourish and took out a handful of notes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他夸张地打开皮夹﹐拿出一把钞票。

Sense.DEF: a special or impressive part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing like a luxurious dessert to give a menu a final flourish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以一道丰盛的甜点为菜单压轴是无可媲美的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They finished the season with a flourish, winning their last three matches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拿下最后的三场比赛﹐辉煌地结束了这个赛季。

Sense.DEF: a loud part of a piece of music, played especially when an important person enters
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指重要人物进场时演奏的〕花彩号声
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flourish of trumpets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 号角齐鸣

Sense.DEF: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
covered with flour or tasting of flour
Sense.TRAN: 覆有面粉的﹔（似）面粉味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wiped her floury hands on her apron.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在围裙上擦了擦沾满面粉的手。

Sense.DEF: floury potatoes become very soft and break easily when they are cooked
to deliberately disobey a law, rule etc, without trying to hide what you are doing
Sense.TRAN: 公然无视﹐违抗〔法律﹑规定等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some companies flout the rules and employ children as young as seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些公司无视规定﹐雇用年仅七岁的儿童。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The union had openly flouted the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该工会公然无视法律。

Sense.DEF: a smooth steady movement of liquid, gas, or electricity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He struggled to swim against the flow of the water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他逆着水流拼命地往前游。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tied a towel round his leg to try to stem the flow of blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在他腿上包扎了块毛巾止血。

Sense.DEF: the steady movement of traffic
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new road system to improve traffic flow through the city centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疏导市中心车流的新道路系统

Sense.DEF: the movement of goods, people, or information from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the flow of funds from the US to Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从美国向欧洲的资金流动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a steady flow of people leaving the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区人口持续外流。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have accused the government of trying to block the free flow of information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们指责政府试图阻止信息的自由流通。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to stem the flow of refugees across the border
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻止难民潮跨越边境的尝试

Sense.DEF: the continuous stream of words or ideas when someone is speaking, writing, or thinking about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to interrupt her flow , so I said nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想打断她的话头﹐所以什么也没有说。

Sense.DEF: the regular movement of the sea towards the land
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ebb and flow of the tide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮水的涨落

Sense.DEF: if someone is in full flow, they are busy talking about something and seem likely to continue for a long time
to agree that you will do the thing that most people want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind, I’ll just go with the flow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无所谓﹐就随大家好了。

Sense.DEF: to do something very different from what other people are doing
when a liquid, gas, or electricity flows, it moves in a steady continuous stream

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These gates regulate the amount of water flowing into the canal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些闸门调节流入运河的水量。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If the windows are shut, air cannot flow freely through the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是关闭窗户﹐空气就无法在大楼里自由流通。

Sense.DEF: if goods, people, or information flow from one place to another, they move there in large numbers or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money has been flowing into the country from Western aid agencies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资金源源不断地从西方援助机构流入该国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of refugees flowing into the area is still increasing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流入该地区的难民数量仍在上升。

Sense.DEF: if traffic flows, it moves easily from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new one-way system should help the traffic to flow better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的单行道系统应可使车流更加畅通。

Sense.DEF: if alcohol flows at a party, people drink a lot and there is a lot available
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beer and whisky flowed freely as the evening wore on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜越来越深﹐啤酒和威士忌也越喝越多。

Sense.DEF: if conversation or ideas flow, people talk or have ideas steadily and continuously, without anything stopping or interrupting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone was relaxed and the conversation flowed freely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都很放松﹐畅所欲言。

Sense.DEF: when the sea flows, it moves towards the land
Sense.EXAMPLE: We watched the tide ebb and flow .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着潮起潮落。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling flows through you or over you, you feel it strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt hot rage flowing through her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到一股强烈的愤怒传遍全身。

Sense.DEF: if clothing or hair flows, it falls or hangs loosely and gracefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her long hair flowed down her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的长发松松垂在背后。

Sense.DEF: to happen as a result of something
Sense.TRAN: 来自某物﹐产生于某物﹐源于某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: the political consequences that flowed from this decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项决定所产生的政治后果

Sense.DEF: a drawing that uses shapes and lines to show how the different stages in a process are connected to each other
a coloured or white part that a plant or tree produces before fruit or seeds
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovely rose bush with delicate pink flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一簇开着娇嫩的粉红色花朵的美丽蔷薇
Sense.EXAMPLE: fields full of beautiful wild flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开满美丽野花的田野

PIC.HEADING: FLOWERS 花
PIC.PICCONTENT: clematis 铁线莲；orchid 兰花；lily 百合花；carnation 康乃馨；daisy 雏菊；violet 紫罗兰；petal 花瓣；stem 花梗；rose 玫瑰；sunflower 向日葵；holly 冬青；chrysanthemum 菊花；crocus 番红花；foxglove 毛地黄；geranium 天竺葵；azalea 杜鹃；waterlily 睡莲；bluebell 蓝钟花；daffodil 黄水仙；rush 灯芯草；tulip 郁金香；thistle 蓟；poppy 罂粟花；iris 鸢尾；narcissus 水仙

Sense.DEF: a small plant that produces beautiful flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t interested in growing flowers in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对在花园里种花没兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bent down and picked a flower .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她弯下身﹐摘了一朵花。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first night we met he gave me a bunch of flowers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认识的第一个晚上﹐他就送给我一束花。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful flower arrangement flowers arranged together in an attractive way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的插花

Sense.DEF: a plant or tree that is in flower has flowers on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was May, and the apple trees were all in flower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个5月﹐苹果树开满了花。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roses start to come into flower in June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰6月份开始开花。

Sense.DEF: the best part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: young men killed in the flower of their youth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在风华正茂之时被夺去生命的年轻人

Sense.DEF: to produce flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bulbs that you plant in the autumn should flower the following spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天种下的鳞茎植物来年春天就会开花。

Sense.DEF: to develop in a very successful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic and social conditions that will allow democracy to flower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将促进民主繁荣的经济和社会环境

Sense.DEF: the skill of arranging flowers in an attractive way
an area of ground, for example in a garden, in which flowers are grown
a young person in the 1960s and 70s who was against war and wanted peace and love in society
Sense.TRAN: 佩花嬉皮士〔指20世纪60﹑70年代反对战争﹑主张和平与爱的年轻人〕

Sense.DEF: decorated with a pattern of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flowered silk dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印花真丝连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a young girl who carries flowers at a wedding ceremony
when something develops in a very successful way
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的顶峰时期[繁荣时期]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 19th century saw a flowering of science and technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 19世纪见证了科学和技术的繁荣。

Sense.DEF: a plastic or clay pot in which you grow plants
the ideas of young people in the 1960s and 70s who believed that peace and love were the most important things in life
Sense.TRAN: 权力归花﹐花之力〔指20世纪60﹑70年代年轻人的主张﹐认为和平与爱是生活中最重要的东西〕

Sense.DEF: decorated with a pattern of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flowery cotton dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印花棉质连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a flowery place has a lot of flowers growing in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flowery meadow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开满鲜花的草地

Sense.DEF: a flowery smell or taste is strong and sweet, like flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: her flowery perfume
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的花味香水

Sense.DEF: flowery speech or writing uses complicated and rare words instead of simple clear language
Sense.EXAMPLE: flowery language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华丽的语言

Sense.DEF: hanging or moving in a smooth graceful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had pale skin and dark, flowing hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她皮肤白皙﹐黑发飘飘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: long, flowing robes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飘逸的长袍

Sense.DEF: continuing in a smooth, graceful way, with no sudden changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flowing melody
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流畅的旋律
Sense.EXAMPLE: flowing curves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平滑的曲线

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
fly1

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= fluid ounce or 或 fluid ounces 液盎司﹐液量盎司

Sense.DEF: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steven’s still in bed with flu .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文患了流感﹐仍卧病在床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got the flu .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得了流感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t go because I had flu .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得了流感﹐去不了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the spread of the flu virus
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 流感病毒的传播

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors now fear a flu epidemic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生现在担心会出现流感大爆发。

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake or do something badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several of the actors flubbed their lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个演员念错了台词。

Sense.DEF: if a price or amount fluctuates, it keeps changing and becoming higher and lower
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格或数量〕波动﹐上下变动﹐起伏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between $20 and $40.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格不稳定﹐在20至40美元之间波动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of children in the school fluctuates around 100.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校的学童人数在100左右波动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

Sense.DEF: a change in a price, amount, level etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑数量﹑水平等的〕波动﹐起伏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fluctuation in interest rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率的波动

Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices are subject to fluctuation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格可能会有波动。

Sense.DEF: a metal pipe or tube that lets smoke or heat from a fire out of a building
able to speak a language very well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was fluent in English, French, and German.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的英语﹑法语和德语都很流利。

Sense.DEF: someone who speaks fluent French etc speaks it like a person from that country
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in fluent Italian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用流利的意大利语讲话。

Sense.DEF: fluent speech or writing is smooth and confident, with no mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a fluent and rapid prose writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个文思流畅﹑下笔成章的散文作家。

Sense.DEF: fluent movements are smooth and gentle, not sudden and sharp
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rose with the fluent movement of an athlete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站起身来﹐动作犹如运动员般优美流畅。

Sense.DEF: soft light bits of thread that have come from wool, cotton, or other materials
Sense.TRAN: 〔羊毛﹑棉或其他材料产生的〕绒毛﹐蓬松毛团﹐碎絮
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was picking bits of fluff off his trousers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在揪裤子上的绒毛球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ball of carpet fluff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯的绒毛团

Sense.DEF: soft light hair or feathers, especially on a young bird or animal
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指雏鸟或幼兽身上的〕绒毛﹐软毛
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chicks were just balls of yellow fluff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些小鸡还只是一个个黄色的绒毛球。

Sense.DEF: news, music, writing, work etc that is not serious or important
Sense.TRAN: 意义不大的新闻 [音乐﹐文章﹐工作等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine full of pop and fashion fluff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全是流行音乐和时尚信息的杂志

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake or do something badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fluffed his shot and missed the goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脚把球 踢飞了﹐没有射中球门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fluffed her lines in the first scene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在第一场里念错了台词。

Sense.DEF: to make something soft become larger by shaking it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fluffed up the pillows for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她帮我把枕头抖松。

Sense.DEF: if a bird fluffs its feathers, it raises them and makes itself look bigger
very light and soft to touch
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fluffy little kitten
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的小猫
Sense.EXAMPLE: fluffy towels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻而柔软的毛巾

Sense.DEF: food that is fluffy is made soft and light by mixing it quickly so that a lot of air is mixed into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cream the butter and sugar until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搅拌黄油和糖﹐直到混合物变得松软。

Sense.DEF: fluffy clouds look light and soft
not serious or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her new book is a fluffy romantic fantasy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新书是一本肤浅的爱情幻想小说。

Sense.DEF: a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is not allowed solid food yet, only fluids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还不能吃固体食物﹐只能进流食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful cleaning fluid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种强力清洁液

Sense.DEF: a situation that is fluid is likely to change
