fluid movements are smooth, relaxed, and graceful
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作〕优美自然的﹐优雅的﹐流畅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loose, fluid style of dancing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舒展而优美的舞姿

Sense.DEF: a fluid substance is a liquid

a unit for measuring liquid, equal to 1/20
pint
or 0.028 litres in Britain, and 1/16 pint or 0.030 litres in the US
Sense.TRAN: 液盎司﹐液量盎司〔液量单位﹐英制等于1/20品脱或0.028升﹐美制等于1/16品脱或0.030升〕

Sense.DEF: something good that happens because of luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: He agreed that the second goal was a fluke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也认为第二个进球实属侥幸。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow structure built for water to slide down, which is used to move water or wood, or which people slide down for fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a log flume
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运送原木的水滑道

Sense.DEF: completely confused by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was completely flummoxed by the whole thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被整件事弄得晕头转向。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
fling
to fail a test
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony flunked chemistry last semester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼上学期化学考试不及格。

Sense.DEF: to give someone low marks on a test so that they fail it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hadn’t done the work so I flunked her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没做作业﹐所以我给她打了不及格。

Sense.DEF: to be forced to leave a school or college because your work is not good enough

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben flunkedout of college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本只得从大学退学。

Sense.DEF: someone who does small jobs for an important person, especially someone who does this because they are trying to please the person – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人手下的〕小卒﹐﹝尤指﹞马屁精〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of his flunkeys let me in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他手下的一个小喽啰让我进去了。

Sense.DEF: fluorescent colours are very bright and easy to see, even in the dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fluorescent pink T-shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发亮的粉红色 T 恤衫

Sense.DEF: a fluorescent light contains a tube filled with gas, which shines with a bright light when electricity is passed through it
to add fluoride to the water supply
a chemical which is believed to help protect teeth against decay
Sense.TRAN: 氟化物〔被认为有助于防止龋齿〕

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance that is usually in the form of a poisonous pale yellow gas. It is a chemical element: symbol F
Sense.TRAN: 氟〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Ｆ〕

Sense.DEF:
any chemical that contains fluorine and
carbon
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of pollution from fluorocarbons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碳氟化合物造成的污染问题

Sense.DEF: confused and nervous or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack never seemed to be flurried, even when they were very busy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克似乎从来不慌乱﹐即使在他们很忙时也一样。

Sense.DEF: a time when there is suddenly a lot of activity and people are very busy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a quiet spell there was a sudden flurry of phone calls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 平静了一阵子之后﹐电话突然响个不停。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The day started with a flurry of activity .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一天在一阵忙碌中开始了。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of snow or rain that is blown by the wind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He opens the door and a flurry of snow blows in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开门﹐飘进来几片雪花。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow flurries are expected overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间将有阵雪。

Sense.DEF: a red colour that appears on your face when you are angry or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生气或尴尬而引起的〕脸红﹐潮红
Sense.EXAMPLE: His words brought a warm flush to her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那番话讲得她脸红发烫。

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling of anger, embarrassment etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a sudden flush of anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然感到一阵愤怒。

Subsense.DEF: the part of a toilet that cleans it with a sudden flow of water
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The flush isn’t working properly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽水马桶的冲洗装置有故障。

Subsense.DEF: the act of cleaning a toilet by forcing water through it

Sense.DEF:
a set of cards that someone has in a card game that are all of the same
suit
the beginning of a period of time when you are young etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of adolescent boys in the first flush of manhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群刚刚步入成年的青春期男孩

Sense.DEF: a large number of things that happen or arrive at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔同时发生或到来的〕大批某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spring brings a flush of young animals to the farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天给农场带来了许许多多的动物幼崽。

Sense.DEF: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊脸涨得通红﹐目光转向别处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flushed angrily .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气得满脸通红。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Robyn felt her cheeks flush scarlet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萝宾感觉自己的两颊涨得通红。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Cooper flushed with indignation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库珀太太愤怒得涨红了脸。

Sense.DEF: if you flush a toilet, or if it flushes, you make water go through it to clean it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do children never remember to flush the loo?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子为什么从来都不记得冲马桶？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flushed the rest of her drink down the toilet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把剩下的酒倒进抽水马桶里冲走了。

Sense.DEF: to force water through a pipe in order to clean it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They flush clean water through the pipes once a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每天都用干净的水冲洗一次管子。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place where they are hiding
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人从隐匿处〕驱赶出来
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is determined to flush out the terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决心把恐怖分子从藏身之处赶出来。

Sense.DEF: to clean something by forcing water through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heating system needs to be flushed out once a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供暖系统每年得清洗一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drinking water helps flush out toxins from the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮水有助于清除体内毒素。

Sense.DEF: if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat
Sense.TRAN: 在同一平面上的﹐齐平的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the cupboard is flush with the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保碗橱与墙面齐平。

Sense.DEF: if someone is flush, they have plenty of money to spend
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling flush at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这阵子感觉很宽裕。

Sense.DEF: red in the face
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked hot and rather flushed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去很热﹐脸色通红。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her cheeks were flushed , her expression angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双颊通红﹐一脸愤怒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He leaned forward, his face flushed with anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体前倾﹐脸都气红了。

Sense.DEF: excited because you have achieved something
Sense.TRAN: 因成功/激动/满意等而兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team are still flushed with success after their weekend victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支球队仍在为周末的胜利而兴奋。

Sense.DEF: to make someone nervous and confused by making them hurry or interrupting them
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过催促或打断某人〕使紧张﹐使慌乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t fluster me, or I’ll never be ready on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别扰得我心神不宁﹐要不到时候我准备不好。

Sense.DEF: nervous and confused because you are trying to do things quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔因想快速做某事而〕慌乱的﹐紧张困惑的

Sense.DEF: confused and nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul was looking flustered and embarrassed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗看上去神情慌乱﹐一脸窘迫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always get flustered in interviews.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我面试时老是紧张。

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument like a thin pipe, that you play by holding it across your lips, blowing over a hole, and pressing down buttons with your fingers

a tall narrow glass, used especially for drinking
champagne
something that is fluted has hollow or rounded lines down it
Sense.EXAMPLE: fluted stone columns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有凹槽纹的石柱

Sense.DEF: someone who plays the flute
if a bird or insect flutters, or if it flutters its wings, it flies by moving its wings lightly up and down
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small bird fluttered past the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只小鸟拍打着翅膀飞过窗前。

Sense.DEF: to make small gentle movements in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dead leaves fluttered slowly to the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枯叶缓缓飘落到地上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旗帜在微风中飘动。

Sense.DEF: if your heart or your stomach flutters, you feel very excited or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏或胃因激动或紧张而〕悸动﹐颤抖

Sense.DEF: if your eyelids flutter, they move slightly when you are asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyelids fluttered but did not open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼皮动了一下﹐但眼睛没有睁开。

Sense.DEF: if a woman flutters her eyelashes at a man, she looks at him and moves her eyes to make herself attractive to him
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕（朝某人）忽闪眼睫毛〔用来吸引男子注意〕

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being nervous, confused, or excited

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was all in a flutter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她浑身紧张。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His sudden resignation caused quite a flutter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然辞职﹐引起了不小的骚动。

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling that is not very strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a flutter of curiosity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到一阵好奇。

Sense.DEF: a light gentle movement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flutter of wings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 翅膀的拍动

Sense.DEF: to risk a small amount of money on the result of something such as a horse race
relating to rivers or caused by rivers
a situation in which things are changing a lot and you cannot be sure what will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything is in flux at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下一切都变化不定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The education system is still in a state of flux .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育体制仍处于不断变化之中。

Sense.DEF: to travel by plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s flying back to the States tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她明天乘飞机回美国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you take the train there or fly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去那里是坐火车还是坐飞机？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maurice is nervous about flying, so he usually travels overland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯害怕乘坐飞机﹐因此他一般走陆路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prime minister will be flying to Delhi later today for a three-day visit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相将于今天晚些时候乘机飞往德里﹐展开为期三天的访问。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was arrested at Heathrow after flying from Brussels airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从布鲁塞尔机场飞抵希思罗机场后被逮捕。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lewis stopped off in Jamaica before flying on to Toronto.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯在牙买加稍作停留﹐然后继续飞往多伦多。

Sense.DEF: if a plane, spacecraft etc flies, it moves through the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was attacked as it flew over restricted airspace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在飞越空中禁区时遭到了攻击。

Sense.DEF: to be at the controls of a plane and direct it as it flies
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the first woman to fly Concorde.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是第一位驾驶协和式飞机的女性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pilot was instructed to fly the plane to Montreal airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员接到指令将飞机开往蒙特利尔机场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sonny learnt to fly when he was 15.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑尼15岁学开飞机。

Sense.DEF: to take goods or people somewhere by plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: The injured boy was flown by air ambulance to the Royal London Hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤男孩由空中救护车送往伦敦皇家医院。

GramExa.PROPFORM: fly sth into/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: US planes have been flying food and medical supplies into the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国飞机一直在向该地区空运食品和医疗物资。

Sense.DEF:
to use a particular
airline
or use a particular type of ticket when you travel by plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: We usually fly economy class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘飞机一般坐经济舱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of passengers fly British Airways every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有数百万人乘坐英国航空公司的飞机。

Sense.DEF: to cross a particular ocean or area of sea in a plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔乘坐或驾驶飞机〕飞越〔某一海洋〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who was the first person to fly the Atlantic?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁是飞越大西洋的第一人？

Sense.DEF: to move through the air using wings
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mother bird will feed her chicks until they are able to fly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母鸟将喂养小鸟直到它们会飞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evening air was clouded with mosquitoes and other flying insects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚﹐空中到处是蚊子和其他飞虫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At that moment, a wasp flew in through the open window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐一只黄蜂从敞开的窗口飞了进来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The robin shook its feathers and flew away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知更鸟抖了抖羽毛飞走了。

Subsense.DEF: to move somewhere quickly and suddenly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ellen flew across the room and greeted her uncle with a kiss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦从房间那头飞奔过来﹐给了她叔叔一个吻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rachel’s hand flew to her mouth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔连忙用手捂住嘴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The door flew open and a child rushed out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门忽地打开﹐一个小孩冲了出来。

Subsense.DEF: to move quickly and suddenly through the air
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was a loud explosion, and suddenly there was glass flying everywhere.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声巨大的爆炸声响起﹐顿时玻璃四处飞溅。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: William hit Jack on the head and sent his glasses flying .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉一拳打在杰克的脑袋上﹐把他的眼镜打飞了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ball bounced off the wall and went flying into the garden next door.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球从墙上弹出去﹐飞进了隔壁人家的院子。

Sense.DEF:
to make a
kite
fly in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the park people were walking their dogs or flying their kites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园里﹐人们或在遛狗﹐或在放风筝。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you must leave quickly
to move freely and loosely in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harriet ran after him, her hair flying behind her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丽雅特追着他跑﹐头发在身后飘动。

Sense.DEF: if a flag flies, or if you fly it, it is fixed to the top of a tall pole so that it can be easily seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the invasion, people were forbidden to fly their national flag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沦陷后﹐民众被禁止悬挂他们的国旗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flags were flying cheerfully in the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旗帜在微风中轻快地飘扬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government ordered that all flags should be flown at half mast halfway down the pole, in order to express public sadness at someone’s death .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府下令全国降半旗志哀。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that shows that you are proud of your country, organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 为自己的国家[组织等]骄傲

Sense.DEF: used to say that a period of time seems to pass very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is it midnight already?’ ‘Well, you know what they say – time flies when you’re having fun !’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “已经午夜了？”“是啊﹐正所谓快活不知时日过！”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The following weeks flew by, and soon it was time to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来几周过得飞快﹐一晃又得走了。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly get extremely angry, extremely worried etc
Sense.TRAN: 勃然大怒/突然大发脾气/突然惊慌起来等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebecca flew into a rage when she realized no-one had been listening to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到没人在听她说话﹐丽贝卡勃然大怒。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly get very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Calm down – there’s no need to fly off the handle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷静一点——没有必要大发雷霆。

Subsense.DEF: to suddenly start shouting angrily at someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The prisoner let fly with a torrent of abuse.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个囚犯突然破口大骂。

Subsense.DEF: to suddenly attack someone, especially with bullets or a weapon that is thrown
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤用子弹或投掷的武器〕突然攻击﹐突袭

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The soldiers let fly with a hail of machine-gun fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们突然用机关枪猛烈扫射。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fly in the face of sth
Sense.DEF: to be the opposite of what most people think is reasonable, sensible, or normal
Sense.TRAN: 违反某事〔指人们认为合理﹑正常的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He likes to fly in the face of convention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢和传统习俗对着干。

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere in order to escape
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time the police arrived, the men had flown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察赶到时﹐那些人已经逃走了。

Sense.DEF: to be having a lot of success
Sense.EXAMPLE: The architectural firm has been flying high recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家建筑公司近来生意蒸蒸日上。

Subsense.DEF: if a young bird flies the nest, it has grown old enough to look after itself and is no longer dependent on its parents
if a young person flies the nest, he or she moves out of their parents’ home in order to live independently
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now that the kids have flown the nest, I’m thinking about taking a job abroad.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然孩子们都已经离家自立﹐我在考虑去国外工作。

Sense.DEF: a plan that will fly will be successful and useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: News is that the plan for the new hotel isn’t going to fly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有消息说新酒店开不成了。

Sense.DEF: to tell people about an idea, plan etc in order to get their opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my latest book, I wanted to fly the kite for an unfashionable theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最新出的这本书中﹐我想试探一下人们对一个不合潮流的理论有何看法。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to go away, stop saying something, or stop annoying you
when a lot of people are talking about something, saying someone has done something wrong etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rumours were flying as to how the fire started.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于火灾的起因谣言四起。

Sense.DEF: to leave or escape
Sense.EXAMPLE: All my children have flown the coop now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的孩子现在都已经搬出去住了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fly by the seat of your pants
Sense.DEF: to have to deal with a situation by guessing what to do, because you know very little about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因对某事几乎一无所知而〕凭感觉处置
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes you’ll get back and find that things have changed, so you’ll be flying by the seat of your pants for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候你回过头来发现情况又变了﹐就只好暂且见机行事了。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly rush towards someone and try to hit them because you are very angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔因非常生气而〕冲向﹐扑向〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: to hit a ball in baseball high into the air
a small flying insect with two wings
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were flies buzzing all around us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苍蝇嗡嗡地在我们周围飞来飞去。

Sense.DEF: the part at the front of a pair of trousers which you can open
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickly did up his fly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速拉上裤子的门襟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your flies are undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的裤子门襟没拉上。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is very gentle and is not likely to hurt anyone
Sense.TRAN: 某人连一只苍蝇也不会伤害〔指某人心地善良〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that a lot of people are dying or becoming ill
Sense.TRAN: 许多人相继死亡/纷纷病倒

Sense.DEF: the only thing that spoils something and prevents it from being successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only fly in the ointment was Jacky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一扫兴的人是雅基。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a fly on the wall
Sense.DEF: to be able to watch what happens without other people knowing that you are there
Sense.TRAN: 做墙壁上的一只苍蝇﹐做不被察觉的观察者
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I’d been a fly on the wall during that conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望自己能神不知鬼不觉地偷听到那次谈话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there are no flies on sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is not stupid and cannot be tricked
Sense.TRAN: 某人很机灵﹐某人不会上当受骗

Subsense.DEF: while a computer program is actually running
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The code is translated on the fly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 程序运行过程中会进行编码转换。

Subsense.DEF: while dealing with a situation, rather than before dealing with it
Subsense.TRAN: 在处理过程中﹐在进行过程中
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So far, policy is being made on the fly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐政策都是在进行过程中制定的。

Sense.DEF: a hook that is made to look like a fly and is used for catching fish
a fly ball
very fashionable and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wear something really fly for your Friday date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼拜五的约会要穿得漂漂亮亮地去。

Sense.DEF: clever and not easily tricked
Sense.TRAN: 机灵的﹐聪明的﹐不易上当受骗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bit of a fly character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人挺机灵。

Sense.DEF: hair that is soft and thin and becomes untidy easily

a ball that has been hit high into the air in a game of
baseball
old, dirty, and in bad condition
meat that is flyblown has flies’ eggs in it and is not suitable for eating
Sense.TRAN: 〔肉类〕沾有蝇卵的﹐不能食用的

Sense.DEF:
someone who flies a plane, especially in the US
armed forces

an occasion when a spacecraft flies close to a
planet
etc in order to gather information about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔航天器的〕近天体探测飞行﹐近飞探测

Sense.DEF: a fly-by-night company or businessman is one that you cannot trust because they have only been in business for a short time and are only interested in making quick profits
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或商人只求迅速获利而〕不讲信用的﹐不可靠的

Sense.DEF: a system in an aircraft which uses computers and electrical signals to help control the aircraft
Sense.TRAN: 〔利用计算机和电子信号的〕线控飞行

Sense.DEF: a type of small bird that catches flies and other insects in the air ﹐
a holiday arranged at a fixed price that includes your flight to a place, a car to drive while you are there, and a place to stay
Sense.TRAN: 空陆联游假期〔指包括机票﹑租车和住宿的全包度假旅游〕

Sense.DEF: a small sheet of paper advertising something
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were giving out flyers advertising the event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在分发这次活动的广告传单。

Sense.DEF: a pilot
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was one of the first solo flyers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是最早作单人飞行的人之一。

Sense.DEF: someone who travels in an aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLE: Delays are familiar to all regular flyers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于经常坐飞机的人来说﹐误点并不陌生。

Sense.DEF: the sport of fishing in a river or lake with special hooks that are made to look like flies

a player in a game of
rugby
. A fly half has to be able to run quickly.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球赛中的〕接球前卫

Sense.DEF: able to fly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a story about a flying horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一则讲述飞马的故事

Sense.DEF: if you pass a test with flying colours, you are very successful in it
Sense.TRAN: 出色地﹐很成功地﹐以优异成绩〔通过考试〕

Sense.DEF: a quick visit because you do not have much time
Sense.TRAN: 〔因时间不多而进行的〕闪电式访问﹐短暂访问

Sense.DEF: a very good or successful start
Sense.EXAMPLE: The appeal has got off to a flying start , with over £200,000 raised in the first week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一呼吁一开始就有很好的反响﹐第一周就筹款20多万英镑。

Sense.DEF: a long high jump made while you are running
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a flying leap and just managed to clear the stream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他飞跳起来﹐刚好越过小溪。

Sense.DEF: the activity of travelling by plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quite a lot of people are still nervous about flying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有很多人害怕乘飞机。

Sense.DEF: a curved line of stones or bricks that are joined to the outside wall of a large building such as a church, and help to support it
a doctor, especially in Australia, who goes by plane to visit sick people who live a long way from the nearest town
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指澳大利亚乘飞机到偏远地区出诊的〕飞行医生

Sense.DEF: a type of sea fish that can jump out of the water and move along in the air for a short way

a type of
bat
that lives in hot countries and eats fruit
an officer in the British airforce

someone who travels to different factories during a
strike
and tries to persuade workers to stop working
Sense.TRAN: 〔罢工运动中到各处工厂劝说工人罢工的〕流动宣传员

Sense.DEF: a large round spacecraft from somewhere else in space, that some people believe they have seen in the sky
a special group of police officers in Britain whose job is to travel quickly to the place where there has been a serious crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕闪电行动队﹐快速特警队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the head of Scotland Yard’s Flying Squad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰场快速特警队队长

Sense.DEF: a way of stopping someone from running by putting your arms around their legs and making them fall over
Sense.TRAN: 〔抱住对方双腿使其摔倒的〕鱼跃擒抱

Sense.DEF: a page at the beginning or end of a book, on which there is no printing
a fly-on-the-wall television programme shows people’s daily lives in a very natural way, because they forget that they are being filmed
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视节目〕秘密实拍的﹐隐秘拍摄的

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be a fly on the wall

Sense.DEF: a bridge that takes one road over another road
a flight by a group of planes on a special occasion for people to watch

the middle part of the US, considered as a place that rich, famous, or fashionable people living on the East or West coast of America would never visit, but which they often fly over on journeys to the other coast - used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 飞越之地〔幽默用法﹐指美国中部地区﹐被认为是住在美国东西两岸的富人﹑名流或时尚人士经常乘飞机经过却不会到访的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel happy at 20,000 feet, approaching flyover country, far above that wasteland between Manhattan and California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接近曼哈顿和加利福尼亚之间的“飞越之地”时﹐我很开心自己处在距离这片荒漠两万英尺的高空。

Sense.DEF: paper covered with a sticky substance that is hung up in a room in order to catch flies
a flight by a group of planes on a special occasion for people to watch
a sheet of material that is put over a tent to protect it from the rain
a piece of plastic that you use for hitting and killing flies

a
boxer
who weighs less than 50.80 kilograms, and who is heavier than a
strawweight
but lighter than a
bantamweight
Sense.TRAN: 蝇量级拳击手﹐次最轻量级拳击手〔体重在50.80公斤以下，级别在草量级和最轻量级之间〕

Sense.DEF: a heavy wheel that keeps a machine working at a steady speed
a system used for broadcasting radio programmes
the British government department responsible for foreign affairs. It is officially called the Foreign and Commonwealth Office.
a young horse
to give birth to a foal
a type of soft rubber with a lot of air in it, used in furniture
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foam mattress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海绵橡胶床垫

Sense.DEF: a mass of very small bubbles on the surface of a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea was covered in foam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海面上泛着一层泡沫。

Sense.DEF: a substance which is like a very thick soft liquid with a lot of bubbles in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firefighters using water and foam are still tackling the blaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员还在利用水和灭火泡沫和大火搏斗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: shaving foam
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剃须泡沫

PIC.HEADING: FOAM 泡沫
PIC.PICCONTENT: froth 泡沫；shaving foam 剃须泡沫

Sense.DEF: to produce foam
Sense.EXAMPLE: The green water splashed and foamed over the rocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碧绿的水花四溅﹐岩石上满是泡沫。

Subsense.DEF: to have bubbles coming out of your mouth because you are very ill
to be very angry

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that is not true in order to stop them from complaining

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fobbed him off with a promise to pay him the money next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她答应下周付给他钱﹐把他敷衍了过去。

Sense.DEF: to give someone something that is not very good instead of the thing they really want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tried to fob me off with a cheap camera.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图用一台廉价相机打发我。

Sense.DEF: a small object that is fixed to a key ring as a decoration
a watch that fits into a pocket, or is pinned to a woman’s dress
a type of Italian bread
Sense.TRAN: 香草橄榄油扁面包﹐佛卡夏面包〔一种意大利面包〕

Sense.DEF: the focal thing is the one that people pay most attention to
Sense.EXAMPLE: This issue has now become the focal centre of interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一问题现已成为关注的焦点。

Sense.DEF: the distance between the centre of a lens and the focal point
the person or thing that you pay most attention to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pool is the focal point of the hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泳池是这家酒店的聚焦点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new tax has been the focal point for much discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的税项已成为热议的焦点。

Sense.DEF:
the point at which beams of light meet after they have been through a
lens
the front part of a ship, where the sailors live
to give special attention to one particular person or thing, or to make people do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He needs to focus more on his career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他需要更加关注自己的事业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图集中精神干活。

GramExa.GLOSS: make people give their attention to something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 集中（某人的）注意力（于某物上）
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to focus public attention on this issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要把公众的注意力集中到这个问题上来。

Sense.DEF:
to point a camera or
telescope
at something, and change the controls slightly so that you can see that thing clearly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She turned the camera and focussed on Martin’s face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过镜头﹐对准马丁的脸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He focused his binoculars on the building opposite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把双筒望远镜对准对面的建筑物。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes focus, or if you focus your eyes, you look at something and can see it clearly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All eyes focussed on her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的眼睛都盯着她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were focussed straight ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的双眼盯着正前方。

Sense.DEF: if you focus beams of light, you aim them onto a particular place
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The focus of recent research has been on environmental issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近期的研究重点是环境问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The war in Afghanistan had become the focus of media attention .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在阿富汗发生的战争已成为媒体关注的焦点。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The focus of interest in the series is what goes on in everyday life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部连续剧关注的焦点是日常的生活琐事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Another focus of feminist debate has been the film industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女权主义辩论的另一个焦点是电影业。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I shall now turn to the main focus of this essay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我来讲讲这篇文章的要点。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The focus of the conference shifted from population growth to the education of women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议的重点由人口增长问题转移到了妇女教育问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

Sense.DEF: if your focus is on something, that is the thing you are giving most attention to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our main focus is on helping people get back into work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们关注的重点是帮助人们再就业。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a shift of focus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重心的转移

Sense.LEXUNIT: come into focus/bring sth into focus
Sense.DEF: if something comes into focus, or you bring it into focus, people start to talk about it and pay attention to it
Sense.TRAN: 成为焦点/使某事成为焦点
Sense.EXAMPLE: These issues have recently come into sharp focus people have started to talk about them a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题近来已成了热门的焦点。

Sense.DEF: if a photograph or an instrument such as a camera is in focus, you can see the picture clearly. If it is out of focus, you cannot see the picture clearly.
Sense.TRAN: 〔照片﹑相机等〕焦点对准/没有对准﹐对焦/失焦

Sense.DEF: the clearness of the picture seen through an instrument such as a camera
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raised his binoculars and adjusted the focus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举起双筒望远镜﹐调整焦距。

Sense.DEF: a small group of people that a company, political party etc asks questions in order to find out what they think of their products, actions etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为公司﹑政党等就产品或行动等提供反馈意见的〕焦点小组﹐焦点团体

Sense.DEF: paying careful attention to what you are doing, in a way that shows you are determined to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 集中注意力的﹐聚精会神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to stay focussed if I want to win this competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想赢得这场比赛﹐我必须全神贯注。

Sense.DEF: food for farm animals
something or someone that is useful only for a particular purpose – used in order to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The murders made prime fodder for newspapers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些凶杀案成了报纸的主要素材。

Sense.DEF: an enemy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s friends and foes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的朋友和敌人

Sense.DEF: belonging or related to a foetus
Sense.EXAMPLE: a test to detect foetal abnormalities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胎儿畸形检查

Sense.DEF: the body position of an unborn child inside its mother, in which the body is curled and the legs are pulled up against the chest
a baby or young animal before it is born
cloudy air near the ground which is difficult to see through

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We got lost in the thick fog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在浓雾中迷路了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be a cold night, and there may be fog patches .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今夜天气寒冷﹐部分地区可能有雾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A blanket of fog covered the fields.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雾笼罩了田野。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fog lifted disappeared in the afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午﹐雾散了。

Sense.DEF: a state in which you feel confused and cannot think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mind was in a fog .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脑子里一片混沌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fog of tiredness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲累引起的头脑昏沉

Sense.DEF: if something made of glass fogs or becomes fogged, it becomes covered in small drops of water that make it difficult to see through
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔玻璃制品因有微小水滴而〕起雾变得模糊
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windscreen had fogged up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挡风玻璃上起了雾。

Sense.DEF: to make something less clear
unable to travel or work normally because of fog
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airport was fogbound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场因雾关闭。

Sense.DEF: someone who has old-fashioned ideas and does not like change
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re turning into a real old fogey !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在变成一个十足的老顽固！

Sense.DEF: if the weather is foggy, there is fog
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foggy day in November
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 11月的一个雾天
Sense.EXAMPLE: driving in foggy conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾天驾驶

Sense.DEF: to not know at all
Sense.TRAN: 完全不知道﹔全然不明白
Sense.EXAMPLE: None of us had the foggiest idea about how to put the tent up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都对搭帐篷一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: if your mind is foggy, you cannot think or remember things clearly
Sense.TRAN: 头脑迷糊的﹔记忆模糊的

Sense.DEF: a loud horn on a ship, used in fog to warn other ships of its position
a very loud unpleasant voice

a strong light on the front of a car that helps drivers to see when there is
fog
Sense.TRAN: 雾灯〔有雾时使用的车前强光灯〕

Sense.DEF: a small weakness or strange habit that someone has, which does not harm anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all have our little foibles .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家都有各自的小毛病。

Sense.DEF:
a smooth food made from the
liver
of a
goose
metal sheets that are as thin as paper, used for wrapping food

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cover the chicken with silver foil and bake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用银箔把鸡肉包起来烘烤。

Sense.DEF: paper that is covered with very thin sheets of metal
Sense.EXAMPLE: chocolates in foil wrappers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 箔纸包的巧克力

Sense.DEF: to emphasize the good qualities of another person or thing, by being very different from them
Sense.TRAN: 衬托出某人/某物﹐作为某人/某物的陪衬
Sense.EXAMPLE: The simple stone floor is the perfect foil for the brightly coloured furnishings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朴素的石材地板完美地衬托出色彩鲜艳的家具。

Sense.DEF:
a light narrow sword used in
fencing
to prevent something bad that someone is planning to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: A massive arms-smuggling plan has been foiled by the CIA.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项大规模的军火走私计划已被中央情报局挫败。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to accept or have to deal with something that they do not want
Sense.EXAMPLE: I keep getting extra work foisted on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我老是被强加额外的工作。

Sense.DEF: to bend a piece of paper, cloth etc by laying or pressing one part over another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fold the paper along the dotted line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿虚线将纸折起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll fit in if you fold it in half .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对折的话就能放下了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spoon the filling onto the dough, fold it over, and press down the edges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用调羹把馅料舀在面团上﹐对折后把边捏紧。

Sense.DEF: to fold something several times so that it makes a small neat shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you kids would fold up your clothes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你们这些孩子能把衣服叠好！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He folded the map neatly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把地图折得整整齐齐。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a piece of furniture folds, or you fold it, you make it smaller or move it to a different position by bending it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairs fold flat for storage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些椅子可折起来存放。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a useful little bed that folds away when you don’t need it
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不需要时可折起来的一张有用的小床
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you fold the shutters back?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把护窗打开好吗？

Sense.DEF: to bend your arms so that they rest together against your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: George stood silently with his arms folded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治交叉着双臂一言不发地站着。

Sense.DEF: if an organization folds, it closes because it does not have enough money to continue
to cover something, especially by wrapping it in material or putting your hand over it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a silver dagger folded in a piece of white cloth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 裹在一块白布里的一把银匕首

Sense.DEF: to hold someone closely by putting your arms around them
to gently mix another substance into a mixture when you are preparing food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next, fold in the sugar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来﹐把糖拌进去。

PIC.HEADING: FOLD 折叠
PIC.PICCONTENT: fold a chair 折椅子；fold your arms 交叠双臂；fold clothes 叠衣服

Sense.DEF: a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bend back the card and cut along the fold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打开折好的卡纸﹐然后沿折痕剪开。

Sense.DEF: the folds in material, skin etc are the loose parts that hang over other parts of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔材料﹑皮肤等的〕褶子﹐褶皱﹐折叠处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dress hung in soft folds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的连衣裙垂下来﹐上面打着松松的褶子。

Sense.DEF: the group of people that you belong to and share the same beliefs and ideas as
Sense.TRAN: 同一群体的人﹐志同道合的人

GramExa.PROPFORM: return to/come back into the fold
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Church will welcome him back into the fold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会将欢迎他重返会众之中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a former advocate of free market economics who had strayed from the fold
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾经倡导自由市场经济﹑后来已经脱离这一学派的人

Sense.DEF: a small area of a field surrounded by a wall or fence where sheep are kept for safety
a bend in layers of rock, caused by underground movements in the earth
of a particular number of kinds
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s role in health care is twofold: first, to provide the resources and, second, to make them work better for patients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在医疗保健方面的作用有两个: 一是提供资源﹐二是使资源更好地为患者服务。

Sense.DEF: a particular number of times
Sense.EXAMPLE: The value of the house has increased fourfold it is now worth four times as much as before .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价涨到了原来的四倍。

Sense.DEF: a foldaway bed, table etc can be folded up so it uses less space
a container for keeping loose papers in, made of folded card or plastic
a group of related documents that you store together on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机里储存相关文件的〕文件夹

Sense.DEF: a folding bicycle, bed, chair etc has parts that you can bend or fold together to make it easier to carry or store
the leaves of a plant
Sense.EXAMPLE: dark green foliage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨绿色的叶子

Sense.DEF:
a
vitamin
found especially in green vegetables, used by the body to produce red blood cells
Sense.TRAN: 叶酸〔尤存在于绿色蔬菜中的一种维生素﹐人体利用其来制造红细胞〕

Sense.DEF: a book made with very large sheets of paper
a single numbered sheet of paper from a book
people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure there are some folk who would rather they weren’t here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定有些人宁愿自己不在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks to the folks at NBC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢全国广播公司的工作人员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait till the folks back home hear about this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到家乡的人听说这事吧！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young folk these days don’t know the meaning of work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的年轻人不懂得工作的意义。

Subsense.DEF: your parents and family
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is it OK if I call my folks?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打电话给家里人可以吗？

Subsense.DEF: used when talking to a group of people in a friendly way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s all for now, folks,
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各位﹐到此为止。

Sense.DEF: people who live in a particular area or do a particular kind of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: simple country folk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯朴的乡下人

Sense.EXAMPLE: a folk singer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民歌手

Sense.DEF: folk art, stories, customs etc are traditional and typical of the ordinary people who live in a particular area
Sense.EXAMPLE: folk tales
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民间故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Irish folk song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首爱尔兰民歌

Sense.DEF: science etc that is based on the ideas or beliefs that ordinary people have, and does not involve a high level of technical knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 民间科学/心理学/智慧等

Sense.DEF: a traditional type of medical treatment that uses plants or simple treatments rather than scientific methods
a traditional dance from a particular area, or a piece of music for this dance
someone who people in a particular place admire very much because of something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 民间英雄﹐民众心目中的英雄
Sense.EXAMPLE: Casey Jones is an American folk hero.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯西•琼斯是美国民众心目中的英雄。

Sense.DEF: the traditional stories, customs etc of a particular area or country
someone who studies folklore
traditional music that has been played by ordinary people in a particular area for a long time

a style of popular music in which people sing and play
guitars
, without any electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 民谣〔一种流行音乐风格〕

Sense.DEF: friendly and informal
Sense.TRAN: 友好的﹐随和的﹐无拘束的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town had a certain folksy charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座镇子给人一种亲切感。

Sense.DEF: in a style that is typical of traditional countryside styles or customs
one of the small holes in the skin that hairs grow from
to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are those men following us?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人在跟着我们吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patrol car followed the BMW for a few miles and then lost it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巡逻车跟了那辆宝马几英里﹐后来就跟丢了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom’s already gone out to Rome and his wife and children will follow shortly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆已经去罗马了﹐他的妻儿很快就会跟着去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peggy followed her out onto the landing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩姬跟着她出来走到楼梯平台上。

PIC.HEADING: FOLLOW 跟随
PIC.PICCONTENT: chase 追逐；follow 跟随

Sense.DEF: to happen or do something after something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agreement followed months of negotiation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过数月的谈判﹐协议达成了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assassination of Martin Luther King in 1968 was followed by that of Robert Kennedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1968年马丁•路德•金遭暗杀﹐之后是罗伯特•肯尼迪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After weeks of intense fighting, there followed a brief period of calm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个星期的激战之后﹐接下来是短暂的平静。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most EU countries have signed the agreement and the US is expected to follow shortly soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数欧盟国家已签署这份协议﹐预计美国也会紧随其后。

Sense.DEF: to come directly after something else in a series, list, or order
Sense.TRAN: 紧随而来﹔位于…之后﹐在…之后
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chapters that follow deal mainly with mathematics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 之后的几章主要讲数学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In English, the letter Q is always followed by U.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语中﹐字母Q之后总跟着字母U。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had vegetable casserole with a fruit salad to follow as part of a meal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吃了蔬菜砂锅﹐然后是水果色拉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There followed several pages of incomprehensible statistics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来是数页难懂的统计资料。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a list of things that you will mention next
Sense.EXAMPLE: The winners are as follows: in third place, Mandy Johnson; in second place ...
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获胜者如下: 第三名﹐曼迪•约翰逊﹔第二名…

Sense.DEF: to do something in the way that someone has told or advised you to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He followed the doctor’s advice and had no further trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听从了医生的建议﹐就没有再出现问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Follow the instructions very carefully when filling in the form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认真地按照说明填写表格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They followed the plan that Elizabeth had worked out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们采用了伊丽莎白制订的计划。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere by a particular way according to road signs or to what someone has told you
Sense.TRAN: 跟着路标/某人指引的方向
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just follow the signs for the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟着机场方向的路标走就行了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I followed Brown’s directions and found the farm quite easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我按着布朗指的路﹐很容易就找到了农场。

Sense.DEF: to do the same thing as someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some state schools follow the example of private schools in asking parents to donate money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些公立学校仿效私立学校的做法﹐要求家长捐款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists are urging the government to follow the lead of Scandinavian countries in this matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保主义者敦促政府在这件事上仿效斯堪的纳维亚国家的做法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just like any young woman who enjoys following the latest fashions wearing fashionable clothes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和任何年轻女性一样﹐喜欢追随时尚。

GramExa.GLOSS: do the same job as someone else
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He does not want to follow his father into a scientific career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想追随父亲从事科学工作。

Sense.DEF: to believe in and obey a particular set of religious or political ideas
Sense.TRAN: 信奉〔某一宗教或政治主张〕

Subsense.DEF: to continue along a particular road, river etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I followed the main road up the mountain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我沿大路上山。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tom followed the track that leads to the old Roman road.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆沿着通往古罗马大路的小道走着。

Subsense.DEF: to go in the same direction as something else, or to go parallel to something else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The road follows the line of the river.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路与河平行。

Sense.DEF: to understand something such as an explanation or story
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t quite follow what he was saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太明白他说的话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plot is a little difficult to follow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节有点难以理解。

Sense.DEF: to be true as a result of something else that is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conclusion that follows from these findings is that inner city schools need more investment, not less.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据这些调研得出的结论是﹐旧城区学校的资金投入需要增加﹐而不是减少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: doesn’t necessarily follow that you’re going to do well academically even if you’re highly intelligent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使你非常聪明﹐学业成绩也不一定就优秀。

Sense.DEF: to be interested in something and in the way it develops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you been following that crime series on TV?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一直在看电视上那部警匪连续剧吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been following his progress very closely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直非常密切地关注他的进展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just doesn’t understand people who follow football or any other kind of sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是不能理解热衷于足球或任何其他体育运动的人。

Sense.DEF: to continue to happen or develop in a particular way, especially in a way that is expected
Sense.TRAN: 按照某一模式/遵循某一进程/按照某种趋势等
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Australia, the weather follows a fairly predictable pattern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚的天气变化模式基本上是可以预料的。

Sense.DEF: to do the same as someone else has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Budget companies have been so successful that other airlines have had to follow suit and lower their fares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价航空公司很成功﹐其他航空公司只得仿效他们降低票价。

Sense.DEF: to do the same job or to work or live in the same way as someone else before you, especially someone in your family
Sense.TRAN: 步某人的后尘﹐继承某人〔尤指家人〕的事业
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is a doctor and expects his son to follow in his footsteps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是医生﹐期盼儿子继承他的事业。

Sense.DEF: to show or describe someone’s life or a series of events, for example in a film or book
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book follows the plight of an orphaned Irish girl who marries into New York society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书讲述了一个爱尔兰孤女嫁入纽约上流社会后所面临的困境。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a hard act to follow
Sense.DEF: to be so good or successful at something that it will be difficult for the next person, team etc to be as good
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re looking for a replacement for Sue, but she’s going to be a hard act to follow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在找人接替休﹐但是别人很难比得上她。

Sense.DEF: to carefully watch someone do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She followed Simon with her eyes as he walked to the gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙走向大门口﹐她的目光一直追随着他。

Sense.DEF: to study or think about a particular idea or subject and try to learn something from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It turned out we were both following the same line of research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来我们俩的研究方向相同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you follow that idea to its logical conclusion, we’d have to ban free speech altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果把这一观点的逻辑推理到极致﹐那我们就必须要完全禁止言论自由了。

Sense.DEF: to do the thing that you immediately feel is best without needing to stop and think about it
Sense.TRAN: 凭直觉/感觉/本能反应等

Sense.DEF: to do the same thing that most other people are doing, without really thinking about it for yourself - used in order to show disapproval

Subsense.DEF: to go straight forward or continue in the same direction
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just follow your nose until you come to a small bridge.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直向前﹐走到一座小桥那里。

Subsense.DEF: to go to the place from where there is a particular smell coming
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I followed my nose to the kitchen, where Marcie was making coffee.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我循着香味来到厨房﹐马西正在那里煮咖啡。

Subsense.DEF: to do something in the way that you feel is right
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After a few years in the detective game, you learn to follow your nose.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干过几年侦探行当﹐你就学会凭直觉行事了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: follow a profession/trade/way of life etc
Sense.DEF: to do a particular job or have a particular way of life
Sense.TRAN: 从事某种职业/从事某种行业/遵循某种生活方式等

Exponent.DEF: to walk, drive etc behind or after someone, for example in order to see where they are going
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The man had followed her home to find out where she lived.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名男子跟踪她回家﹐想查出她住在哪里。

Exponent.DEF: to quickly run or drive after someone or something in order to catch them when they are trying to escape
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police chased the car along the motorway at speeds of up to 90 mph.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方沿高速公路追逐那辆车﹐时速达到90英里。

Exponent.DEF: to quickly follow someone or something in order to stop them or talk to them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I ran after him to say sorry, but he’d already got on the bus.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想追上他道个歉﹐可他已经上了公共汽车。

Exponent.DEF: to secretly follow an animal in order to kill it, or to secretly follow a person in order to attack them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为猎杀动物或袭击某人而〕悄悄跟踪
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tiger stalking its prey
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 悄悄跟踪猎物的一只老虎
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a long history of stalking women in his neighbourhood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有很长一段时间跟踪过住在他附近的女性。

Exponent.DEF: to chase someone in a very determined way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ship was being pursued by enemy submarines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船一直被敌军潜艇紧紧追击。

Exponent.DEF: to chase someone or something who is trying to escape from you
Exponent.TRAN: 追赶〔试图逃脱的人或物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the officers gave chase and arrested the man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一名警察追上去逮捕了那个男子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The calf ran away and the lion gave chase.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小牛奔逃﹐狮子在后面追。

Exponent.DEF: to secretly follow someone in order to watch what they do and where they go
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Apparently, the police had been tailing the terrorists for months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然,警方已经跟踪恐怖分子好几个月了。

Exponent.DEF: to follow and find a person or animal by looking at the marks they leave on the ground
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Bushmen were tracking antelope in the Kalahari desert.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 布须曼人在卡拉哈里沙漠追踪羚羊。

Sense.DEF: to follow someone everywhere they go, especially when this is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 到处跟随某人〔尤指让人讨厌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She told him to go away and stop following her around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她叫他走开﹐别到处跟着她。

Sense.DEF: to happen after something else and be connected with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The discussion sessions are supposed to follow on from this morning’s lecture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨论课应该是今天上午讲座的延续。

Sense.DEF: to go to the same place as someone else at a later time
Sense.EXAMPLE: You go ahead – I’ll follow on later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你先走——我随后就来。

Sense.DEF: to do what needs to be done to complete something or make it successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project went wrong when the staff failed to follow through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工没有执行下去﹐于是项目出了问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you have followed through all the exercises in this book, you should be ready for the second year course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你完成了本书的全部练习﹐就可以学第二年的课程。

Sense.DEF:
to continue moving your arm after you have hit the ball in tennis,
golf
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球﹑高尔夫球等击球后〕做随球动作

Sense.DEF: to find out more information about something and take action if necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police take people’s statements and then follow them up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方会按照人们的供述继续追查。

Sense.DEF: to do something in addition to what you have already done in order to make it more likely to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 对…采取进一步行动﹐采取后续行动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If there is no response to your press release, follow it up with a phone call.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你的新闻稿没有回应﹐再打个电话跟进一下。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This experiment was quickly followed up by others using different forms of the drug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个实验之后不久﹐又有其他人用这种药品的不同形态进行实验。

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in a particular system of ideas, or who supports a leader who teaches these ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marx and his followers were convinced that capitalism would destroy itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思及其支持者确信资本主义将自我毁灭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the early followers of Jesus
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣的早期信徒

Sense.DEF: the next afternoon, month etc
Sense.TRAN: 第二天下午/下个月/下一页/下一章等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sick in the evening, but the following day he was better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上他生病了﹐但第二天就好一些了。

Sense.DEF: the example, way etc that will be mentioned next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Payment may be made in any of the following ways: cheque, cash, or credit card.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可用以下任意一种方式付款: 支票﹑现金或信用卡。

Sense.DEF: a wind that is blowing in the same direction as a ship, and helps it to move faster
a group of people who support or admire someone
Sense.TRAN: 一批追随者[支持者﹐崇拜者]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band has a big following in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队在欧洲有一大批乐迷。

Sense.DEF: the people or things that you are going to mention
Sense.EXAMPLE: The following have been selected to play in tomorrow’s game: Louise Carus, Fiona Douglas…
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下列人员已被选中参加明天的比赛: 路易丝•卡勒斯﹑菲奥娜•道格拉斯…

Sense.DEF: after an event or as a result of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Following the president’s speech, there will be a few minutes for questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的演讲之后将有几分钟提问时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of refugees left the country following the outbreak of civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内战爆发后﹐成千上万的难民逃离该国。

Sense.DEF: a children’s game in which one of the players does actions which all the other players must copy
Sense.TRAN: 学样〔参加者要模仿领头人做动作的儿童游戏〕

Sense.DEF: something that is done or made in addition to something else, or done to continue something that was done before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The inspection was a follow-on from the review process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项调查是审查程序的后续工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a follow-on product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后续产品

Sense.DEF: the continued movement of your arm after you have hit the ball in tennis, golf etc
Sense.TRAN: 随球动作﹐顺势动作〔网球﹑高尔夫球等击球后手臂的延续动作〕

Sense.DEF: the things that someone does in order to complete a plan
Sense.EXAMPLE: The budget has to cover not only the main project but the follow-through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算不仅要包括项目本身﹐还要包括落实工作。

Sense.DEF: done in order to find out more or do more about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a follow-up study on children and poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对儿童与贫困问题的后续研究

Sense.DEF: something that is done to make sure that earlier actions have been successful or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: preventative treatment and follow-up several weeks later
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预防性治疗以及数星期后的后续措施

Sense.DEF: a book, film, article etc that comes after another one that has the same subject or characters
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影等的〕续集﹔〔文章等的〕续篇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spielberg says he’s planning to do a follow-up next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯皮尔伯格说他打算明年拍一部续集。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a follow-up to their hit album
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的畅销专辑的续篇

Sense.DEF: a very stupid thing to do, especially one that is likely to have serious results
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指可能导致严重后果的〕蠢事﹐荒唐事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somerville bitterly regretted his folly at becoming involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨默维尔对于把自己牵涉进去的愚蠢行为后悔不迭。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it would be folly to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be sheer folly to reduce spending on health education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少健康教育上的支出是再愚蠢不过的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the follies of aristocratic society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贵族社会的荒唐事

Sense.DEF: an unusual building that was built in the past as a decoration, not to be used or lived in
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时无实用价值的〕怪异的装饰性建筑

Sense.DEF: to cause trouble and make people start fighting each other or opposing the government
Sense.TRAN: 煽动革命/挑起事端/造成不和等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were accused of fomenting rebellion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被指控煽动叛乱。

Sense.DEF: to like someone very much, especially when you have known them for a long time and almost feel love for them
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢某人〔尤指相识很久的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe’s quite fond of her, isn’t he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔很喜欢她﹐是不是？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the years we’ve grown very fond of each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来﹐我们渐渐喜欢上了对方。

Sense.DEF: to like something, especially something you have liked for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢（做）某事﹐爱好某物〔尤指长期喜爱之物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not overly fond of cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不怎么喜欢烹饪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d grown fond of the place and it was difficult to leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已渐渐爱上这个地方﹐舍不得离开了。

Sense.DEF: to do something often, especially something that annoys other people
Sense.TRAN: 老爱做某事〔尤指惹他人生气的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandfather was very fond of handing out advice to all my friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖父喜欢对我的每一位朋友大赠忠告。

Sense.DEF: a fond look, smile, action etc shows you like someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a fond look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深情地看了她一眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we parted we said a fond farewell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们分手时深情道别。

Sense.DEF: to remember someone or something with great pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 对某事/某人有愉快的回忆
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marie still had fond memories of their time together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽依然很怀念他们在一起时的美好时光。

Sense.DEF: a belief or hope that something will happen, which seems silly because it is very unlikely to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sent him to another school in the fond hope that his behaviour would improve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把他送到另一所学校﹐天真地希望他的行为会有所改善。

Sense.DEF: a soft mixture made from sugar and water, used for covering cakes
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于制作糖果或糕饼糖霜的〕软糖料﹐方旦糖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cake decorated with fondant icing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以方旦糖霜装点的蛋糕

Sense.DEF: a soft sweet made of fondant
to gently touch and move your fingers over part of someone’s body in a way that shows love or sexual desire
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fondled his neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抚摸着他的脖子。

Sense.DEF: to believe something that is untrue, hope for something that will probably not happen etc
Sense.TRAN: 天真地以为/盲目地相信/痴心地希望等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people still fondly believe that modern science can solve all the world’s problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人仍然天真地相信现代科学能解决世界上所有的问题。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you like someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned to see her smiling fondly at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身﹐看见她正朝他温柔浅笑。

Sense.DEF: a dish made of melted cheese, hot oil, or chocolate into which you put small pieces of meat, fruit etc using a long fork
a set of letters of a particular size and style, used for printing books, newspapers etc or on a computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于印刷书籍﹑报纸等或显示于计算机屏幕上的〕字体﹐字型

PIC.HEADING: FONT 字体
PIC.PICCONTENT: 斜体；大号；粗体；小号

Sense.DEF:
a large stone container in a church, that holds the water used for the ceremony of
baptism
things that people and animals eat, such as vege-tables or meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant serves good food at affordable prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家餐厅物美价廉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love Italian food, especially pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢意大利食物﹐尤其是面食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was told to cut down on salty and fatty foods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被告知要少吃过咸和油腻的食物。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you think carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher’s advice certainly gave me food for thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师的忠告确实引起了我的深思。

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Food is usually uncountable.
F2NBox.TRAN: food一般为不可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a shortage of food
F2NBox.EXPL: It is used as a countable noun only to refer to one or more types of food.
F2NBox.TRAN: 仅在指一种或多种食物时才用作可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She avoids processed foods.

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The hotel was nice and the food was really good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店很棒﹐食物相当好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Thanks for dinner – the food was delicious.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢晚餐招待——菜很好吃。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The food is all so fresh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物都很新鲜。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We try to give the kids good healthy food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量给孩子们吃优质﹑健康的食物。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: making you strong and healthy
without anything added or without decoration
with a hot taste

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 意大利菜/法国菜/中国菜等

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unusual because of being from a foreign country

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The family hadn’t had any food for days.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一家人几天没吃东西了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He sat in the corner and ate his food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在角落里吃自己的东西。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have to cook some food for this evening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我得做饭。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give food to someone, especially in a restaurant
not want to eat
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The baby is off his food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个婴孩不想吃东西。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to stop wanting to eat
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Since becoming ill, he has gone off his food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从生了病﹐他就不想吃东西。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government must ensure an adequate food supply.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须确保足够的粮食供给。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The food industry has responded to consumer concerns about health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品业界回应了消费者关于健康的担忧。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the process of making or growing food to be sold
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Farmers have increased food production to meet demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民增加了粮食生产以满足需求。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when people are afraid to eat a particular food
substances added to food in order to improve its taste or appearance

Exponent.DEF: things that people and animals eat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can buy good fresh food in the market.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场里可以买到新鲜食物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you like Japanese food?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你爱吃日式料理吗？

Exponent.DEF: a type of food that is cooked in a particular way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a traditional English dish
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道传统的英格兰菜
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They also offer vegetarian dishes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们也供应素食。

Exponent.DEF: a type of food that a restaurant or place is famous for
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fish dishes are a specialty of the region.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼类菜肴是这个地区的特色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Home made pies are one of the hotel’s specialities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 家常馅饼是那家酒店的特色食品之一。

Exponent.DEF: an unusual food which people in a particular place like to eat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The local delicacies include laverbread (boiled seaweed).
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地美食中有紫菜燕麦煎饼。

Exponent.DEF: the type of food that someone usually eats
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t have too much salt in your diet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 日常饮食不该摄入过多的盐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the Andes, the main diet is beans, potatoes, and corn.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安第斯山区的主食是豆类﹑马铃薯和玉米。

Exponent.DEF: food made in a particular way, or by a particular person
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用某种方法或由某人烹调的〕菜
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Herbs are used a lot in French cooking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国菜中经常使用香草。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I love my Mum’s home cooking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爱吃妈妈做的家常菜。

Exponent.DEF: the food you can eat in a particular restaurant, country, or area
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某一餐厅﹑国家或地区的〕菜肴
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Italian cuisine
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利菜
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Trying the local cuisine is all part of the fun of travelling.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 品尝地方菜肴是旅游的全部乐趣所在。

Exponent.DEF: food considered as something that is necessary for good health and growth
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a book on nutrition
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于营养的书
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many homeless people suffer from poor nutrition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多无家可归者营养不良。

Exponent.DEF: goodness that you get from food, which helps your body to stay healthy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s not much nourishment in fast food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 快餐没多大营养。

Exponent.DEF: the kind of food that is served in a place – used especially when saying how interesting it is
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某地的〕饭菜〔尤指其富有趣味〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In China you can feast on bird’s nest soup and other exotic fare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在中国﹐你可以尽情享用燕窝以及其他具有异域风味的食物。

Section.SECHEADING: TYPES OF FOOD 食物的种类

Exponent.DEF: food such as hamburgers, which is prepared quickly and which you can take away with you to eat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He ballooned to 300lbs on a diet of fast food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他常吃快餐﹐体重快速升到300磅。

Exponent.DEF: food that is full of sugar or fat, and is bad for your health
Exponent.TRAN: 垃圾食品〔指糖或脂肪含量极高的食品〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I used to eat loads of junk food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过去经常吃很多垃圾食品。

Exponent.DEF: food made from vegetables and animals that have had their genetic structure changed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There has been a lot of research into the safety of GM food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于转基因食品的安全性已进行了大量研究。

Exponent.DEF: food that is produced without using harmful chemicals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shoppers are willing to pay more for organic food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客愿意多花钱来买有机食品。

Exponent.DEF: food that is thought to be good for your health
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can buy the ingredients in any good health food shop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在任何一家健康食品店都可以买到这些配料。

Exponent.DEF: a type of food that is believed to be good for your health because it contains a lot of a particular type of vitamin, mineral etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔据信富含某种营养素的〕超级食品

Exponent.DEF: food that does not contain meat
food that has chemicals in it to make it last a long time
food that is sold in cans
food that is kept at a very low temperature to make it last a long time
food that is sold in cans, packages etc, so that it can be prepared quickly and easily
special food for babies
food for animals that you keep as pets
Exponent.TRAN: 宠物食品/狗粮/猫粮/鸟食等

Sense.DEF: a place that gives food to poor people
Sense.TRAN: 〔向穷人发放食物的〕粮食银行

Sense.DEF: all animals and plants considered as a group in which a plant is eaten by an insect or animal, which is then eaten by another animal and so on
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution is affecting many creatures lower down the food chain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染正影响着食物链下层的许多生物。

PIC.HEADING: FOOD CHAIN 食物链
PIC.PICCONTENT: shark 鲨鱼；seal 海豹；penguin 企鹅；squid 鱿鱼；krill 磷虾；plankton 浮游生物

Sense.DEF:
a
food stamp
the area in a shopping centre where there are many small restaurants
one of the groups that types of food are divided into, such as meat, vegetables, or milk products
someone who is very interested in cooking and eating food
Sense.TRAN: 喜爱烹调和美食的人﹔美食家

Sense.DEF: the distance between the place where food is produced and the place where it is eaten, which is a way of measuring its harmful effect on the environment
Sense.TRAN: 食物里程〔指食物产地与消费地的距离﹐可用于衡量对环境的不良影响程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reducing food miles would reduce carbon dioxide emissions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缩短食物里程可降低二氧化碳的排放量。

Sense.DEF:
a stomach illness caused by eating food that contains harmful
bacteria
, so that you
vomit
a piece of electrical equipment used to prepare food by cutting and mixing it
Sense.TRAN: 食品加工器﹐多功能食品切碎搅拌机

Sense.DEF: an official piece of paper that the US government gives to poor people so they can buy food
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国政府发给穷人的〕食物券﹐粮食券

Sense.DEF: food - used especially when talking about the business of producing or selling food
Sense.TRAN: 食品〔尤用于谈论食品生产或销售〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shortage of basic foodstuffs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基本食品短缺

Sense.DEF: a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a fool she had been to think that he would stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竟然那么傻﹐以为他会留下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like a fool, I accepted straight away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我像个傻子﹐立刻就接受了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You silly old fool !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个大傻瓜！

Sense.DEF: to do something stupid that you feel embarrassed about afterwards and that makes you seem silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry I made such a fool of myself last night. I must have been drunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐昨天晚上我太失态了﹐我一定是喝醉了。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately do something to make someone else seem stupid
Sense.TRAN: 愚弄某人﹐使某人显得愚蠢
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suddenly realised that I was being made a fool of.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然明白过来﹐我被人耍了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is very easy to do something or to see that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 傻瓜都会做某事﹐任何人都会做某事〔用于表示某事很简单〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any fool could have seen what would happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傻瓜都看得出来将会发生什么事。

Sense.DEF: to be difficult to trick or deceive, because you have a lot of experience and knowledge about something
Sense.TRAN: 不会轻易上当﹐为人精明﹐不是傻瓜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katherine was nobody’s fool when it came to money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳在钱的问题上一点也不傻。

Sense.DEF: a sweet food made of soft cooked fruit mixed with cream
used to say that you think someone was stupid to do something, and it is their own fault if this causes trouble
Sense.TRAN: 这是你自己傻/他自己傻等
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Jim smashed up my car.’ ‘More fool you for letting him borrow it!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “吉姆把我的车撞坏了。”“你自己傻呀﹐把车借给他开！”

Sense.DEF: if you say that someone doesn’t suffer fools gladly, they do not have any patience with people who they think are stupid

Sense.LEXUNIT: be living in a fool’s paradise
Sense.DEF: to feel happy and satisfied, and believe there are no problems, when in fact this is not true
Sense.TRAN: 陶醉在幻想之中﹐做黄粱美梦

Sense.DEF: to behave in a silly way, especially in order to make people laugh
Sense.TRAN: 做傻事﹐瞎胡闹﹔装傻﹐逗人笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop playing the fool! You’ll fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别胡闹了！你会摔倒的。

Sense.DEF: to make someone go somewhere or do something for no good reason

Sense.LEXUNIT: fools rush in (where angels fear to tread)
Sense.DEF: used to say that people are stupid if they do something immediately without thinking about it first
Sense.TRAN: 傻瓜急不可待（﹐智者三思后行）

Sense.LEXUNIT: a fool and his money are soon parted
Sense.DEF: used to say that stupid people spend money quickly without thinking about it
a man whose job was to entertain a king or other powerful person in the past, by doing tricks, singing funny songs etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时供国王或其他权势人物娱乐的〕弄臣﹐小丑

Sense.DEF: to trick someone into believing something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even art experts were fooled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连艺术品专家也被骗了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t fool me with that old excuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那老一套的借口是骗不了我的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be fooled by appearances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要被外表欺骗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was fooled into believing their promises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受了骗﹐相信了他们的承诺。

Sense.DEF: to try to make yourself believe something that you know is not really true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no good fooling yourself. He’s not coming back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己骗自己没有用﹐他不会回来的。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you do not believe what someone has told you
Sense.TRAN: 你别骗我了﹐我才不信你呢
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look, we’re doing our best to fix it.’ ‘Well, you could have fooled me.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “看﹐我们正尽力修呢。”“嘿﹐你骗不了我的。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is not serious and is only pretending that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t pay any attention to Henry. He’s just fooling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别理会亨利﹐他只是闹着玩的。

Sense.DEF: to waste time behaving in a silly way or doing things that are not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always used to fool around in class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去上课老是瞎混。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way which is careless and not responsible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some idiot’s been fooling around with the electricity supply!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知道哪个傻子一直在乱弄电源！

Sense.DEF: to spend time doing something that you enjoy, but that does not have a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys were out in the yard, just fooling around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们在外面院子里玩耍。

Sense.DEF: to have a sexual relationship with someone else’s wife, boyfriend etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found out that he’d been fooling around behind her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现他一直在偷情。

Sense.DEF: to touch or play with something, especially when you should not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s been fooling with the radio dial?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁在乱调收音机？

Sense.DEF: to become involved in something which could cause damage or be dangerous
silly or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you say a fool thing like that for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么要说那种蠢话？

Sense.DEF: silly or stupid behaviour
taking stupid and unnecessary risks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foolhardy attempt to capture more territory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想占领更多地盘的鲁莽行为

Sense.DEF: a foolish action, remark etc is stupid and shows that someone is not thinking sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never heard anything so foolish in all my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子从没听到过这么愚蠢的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be foolish to ignore his advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不听他的劝告才傻呢。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be foolish enough to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was foolish enough to believe him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真傻﹐竟然相信了他。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say silly or stupid rather than foolish .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说silly或stupid﹐而不说foolish
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It was a silly thing to say.
I felt a bit stupid when she said no.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说不的时候﹐我感觉有点傻。

Sense.DEF: a foolish person behaves in a silly way or looks silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was young and foolish at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那时候年幼无知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foolish grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傻笑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d been made to look foolish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被弄得一副傻样。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She foolishly agreed to go with them.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她傻乎乎地同意跟他们去。

Sense.DEF: a foolproof method, plan, system etc is certain to be successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔方法﹑计划﹑系统等〕肯定成功的﹐万无一失的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foolproof way of preventing credit card fraud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防止信用卡诈骗的一个万全之策

Sense.DEF: a large size of paper, especially paper for writing on
Sense.TRAN: 大裁﹐大页纸〔尤指书写用纸〕

Sense.DEF: a kind of yellow metal that exists in some rocks and looks like gold
Sense.TRAN: 愚人金﹐黄铁矿〔一种存在于岩石中看似黄金的黄色金属〕

Sense.DEF: something that you think will be very exciting, very attractive etc but in fact is not
Sense.TRAN: 虚幻的东西﹐华而不实的东西

Sense.DEF:
table football
, especially played as a sport rather than a game
Sense.TRAN: 桌上足球〔尤作为运动而非游戏〕

Sense.DEF: someone who plays foosball
the part of your body that you stand on and walk on
Sense.EXAMPLE: My foot hurts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脚痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had blisters on the soles of my feet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脚底起泡了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dropped a glass earlier, so don’t walk around in bare feet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚才打破了一个玻璃杯﹐所以不要光着脚到处走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The vet examined the horse’s hind feet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兽医检查了马的后蹄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t wipe your feet on the carpet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别在地毯上蹭脚！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood on the platform, her suitcase at her feet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在月台上﹐手提箱放在脚边。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring length, equal to 12
inches
or about 30 centimetres
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s six feet tall , with blonde hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身高六英尺﹐一头金发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark was standing just a few feet away from me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克就站在离我几英尺远的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d say she’s about five foot three five feet and three inches .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜她大约五英尺三英寸高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a four foot wall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堵四英尺高的墙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 15,000 square feet of office space
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 15,000平方英尺的办公空间

Sense.DEF: the lowest or bottom part of something
Sense.TRAN: 某物的底部﹐某物的下端

GramExa.PROPFORM: the foot of the stairs/ladder etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He walked to the foot of the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走到楼梯下面。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the foot of a mountain/cliff etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small cottage at the foot of the hill
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山脚下的一间小村舍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large wooden trunk at the foot of his bed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他床脚的一个大木箱
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The date is shown at the foot of the page .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日期显示在页末。

Sense.DEF: if you go somewhere on foot, you walk there
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes about 30 minutes on foot, or 10 minutes by car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步行去大约需要30分钟﹐如果坐车去﹐则需要10分钟。

Sense.DEF: to stand up after you have been sitting
Sense.TRAN: 直起身来/跳起来/站起身来等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leapt to his feet and ran outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跳起来﹐跑了出去。

Subsense.DEF: to be standing for a long time without having time to sit down
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The worst thing about working in the shop is that you’re on your feet all day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在商店里工作最不好的就是要整天站着。

Subsense.DEF: to be standing up
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As soon as the bell rang the class were on their feet and out of the door.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃声一响﹐全班学生就立即起身跑到门外去了。

Subsense.DEF: to feel better again after being ill and in bed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll soon have you on your feet again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很快就会让你恢复健康。

Sense.DEF: to have enough money again, or to be successful again after having problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to get back on my feet again and forget all this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得重新振作起来﹐忘掉这一切。

Sense.DEF: sitting or lying down, rather than standing or walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor told me to stay off my feet for a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生嘱咐我躺几天。

Sense.LEXUNIT: knock/lift etc sb off their feet
Sense.DEF: to make someone fall over
Sense.TRAN: 撞倒某人/使某人双脚离地
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were blown off their feet by the force of the explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被爆炸的冲力掀倒在地。

Sense.DEF: to be very busy
Sense.TRAN: 非常忙碌﹐忙得脚不沾地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before Christmas, most salespeople are rushed off their feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节前﹐大多数销售人员忙得脚不沾地。

Sense.DEF: to go to or enter a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swore she would never set foot in his house again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发誓再也不会踏进他的住处一步。

Sense.DEF: to annoy you by always being in the same place as you and preventing you from doing what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate summer vacation. The kids are under my feet all day long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢暑假﹐孩子们整天缠着我。

Subsense.DEF: to say very firmly that someone must do something or must stop doing something
Subsense.TRAN: 果断行事﹐坚持立场﹔坚决阻止
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ll just have to put your foot down and tell him he can’t stay out on school nights.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要态度坚决﹐告诉他如果第二天要上学﹐晚上就不能在外面逗留。

Subsense.DEF: to make a car go faster

Sense.DEF: to relax, especially by sitting with your feet supported on something

Variant.ORTHVAR: put your foot in your mouth

Sense.DEF: to say something without thinking carefully, so that you embarrass or upset someone
Sense.TRAN: 失言﹐讲错话﹐〔因说话随便而〕惹怒人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve really put my foot in it this time. I didn’t realize that was her husband!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这次真是讲错话了﹐我没想到那人是她的丈夫！

Sense.LEXUNIT: start/get off on the wrong/right foot
Sense.DEF: to start a relationship badly or well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon and I got off on the wrong foot but we’re good friends now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和西蒙一开始相处不来﹐但是现在成了好朋友。

Sense.DEF: to do everything right and make no mistakes, especially in your job

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/keep both feet on the ground
Sense.DEF: to think in a sensible and practical way and not have ideas or aims that will be impossible to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a great result, but we have to keep our feet firmly on the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个结果很好﹐但我们还是得脚踏实地。

Sense.DEF: to get into a good situation because you are lucky, especially after being in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry about Nina, she always falls on her feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别为尼娜担心﹐她每次都能逢凶化吉。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get/have/keep your foot in the door
Sense.DEF: to get your first opportunity to work in a particular organization or industry
Sense.TRAN: 获得机会加入〔某机构〕﹐得以首次涉足〔某行业〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a foot in both camps
Sense.DEF: to be involved with or connected with two opposing groups of people
used to say that people admire or respect someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 令某人/某事物拜倒在某人脚下
Sense.EXAMPLE: All Paris was at his feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个巴黎都拜倒在他脚下。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have the world at your feet

Sense.DEF:
to be very
clumsy

Sense.LEXUNIT: have one foot in the grave
Sense.DEF: to be very old or very ill - used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔老得或病得〕一只脚已踏进坟墓﹐离死不远〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used to show that you do not believe something that someone has just said
Sense.TRAN: 算了吧﹐去你的﹐得了〔表示不相信对方的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: £50 my foot! It’ll cost £200 at least.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么可能50英镑！这至少得200英镑。

Sense.DEF: to die before you leave a place or job -used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 还没离开[离职]就没命了〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you keep fooling around that gun you’ll be leaving this camp feet first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你还要瞎摆弄那支枪﹐就得横着离开这个营地了。

Sense.DEF: someone that you admire who has feet of clay has faults and weaknesses that you did not realize they had
Sense.TRAN: 〔偶像的〕不为人知的弱点﹐内在缺点

Sense.DEF: a soldier or group of soldiers that walks and does not use a horse or a vehicle
a passenger on a ship who has not brought a car with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔渡轮上的〕步行旅客﹐无车旅客

Subsense.DEF: using your left foot or right foot when you kick a ball
having a particular type or number of feet

Sense.DEF: a machine or control that you operate using your feet
the part of a sock that covers your foot

a part of a line of poetry in which there is one strong
beat
and one or two weaker ones

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the boot is on the other foot
not let the grass grow under your feet

Sense.DEF: to pay for something, especially something expensive that you do not want to pay for
Sense.TRAN: 付账〔尤指不情愿地为昂贵的东西付钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ordered drinks and then left me to foot the bill!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要了酒水﹐然后让我来付账！

Sense.DEF: cinema film showing a particular event
Sense.TRAN: 〔展示某一事件的〕影片﹐影片片段
