Sense.EXAMPLE: old footage from the First World War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一次世界大战时期的旧影像

Sense.DEF: a serious disease that kills cows and sheep
Sense.TRAN: 口蹄疫〔一种导致牛﹑羊死亡的严重疾病〕

Sense.DEF:
a game played by two teams of eleven players who try to kick a round ball into the other team’s
goal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which football team do you support?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你支持哪个球队？
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids playing football in the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在街上踢球的小孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: My Dad took me to watch my first football match .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸带我去看了我人生第一场足球比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a football club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球俱乐部

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a group of Scottish football fans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群苏格兰球迷

GramExa.GLOSS: clothes worn to play football

PIC.HEADING: FOOTBALL 足球运动
PIC.PICCONTENT: goal 球门；crossbar 球门横梁；goalpost 球门柱；linesman 边线裁判；forward 前锋；goalkeeper/goaltender AmE 【美】 守门员；penalty post 罚球点；penalty area 禁区；field 球场；referee 裁判；save 救球；shoot 射门；head 头球；score 进球；tackle 抢断；throw-in 掷边线球；dribble 带球

Sense.DEF:
a game played by two teams of eleven players who try to carry or kick an
oval
ball into the other team’s
goal
Sense.TRAN: 美式橄榄球﹐美式足球（运动）
Sense.EXAMPLE: college football games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学美式橄榄球比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: a football field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美式橄榄球场
Sense.EXAMPLE: He played football in high school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在高中时打美式橄榄球。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a noisy or violent way at a football match
a ball used in these games
someone who plays football, especially a professional player
relating to football
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the high point of his footballing career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他足球事业的巅峰。

Sense.DEF:
another word for the
pools
a narrow bridge used by people who are walking
when someone is deliberately being slow to do something
someone or something that measures six feet tall, eighteen feet long etc
Sense.TRAN: 六英尺高的人[东西]/十八英尺长的东西等

Sense.DEF: a line of writing which appears at the bottom of each page of a document which is printed by a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机打印的每页的〕页脚﹐页尾

Sense.DEF: the sound of each step when someone is walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy footfalls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉重的脚步声

Sense.DEF: the number of people who visit a shop or shopping area – used in business

a mistake in tennis when the person who
serves
is not standing behind the line
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球的〕脚步犯规〔发球踩线或越线犯规〕

Sense.DEF: one of the smaller hills below a group of high mountains
Sense.EXAMPLE: the foothills of the Himalayas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜马拉雅山脉的山麓丘陵

Sense.DEF: a position from which you can start to make progress and achieve your aims

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Extreme right-wing parties gained a foothold in the latest European elections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极右翼党派在最近的欧洲各国选举中站稳了脚跟。

Sense.DEF: a small hole or crack where you can safely put your foot when climbing a steep rock
football
the conditions or arrangements on which something is based

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wanted to put their relationship on a permanent footing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想长久维系他们的关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm started the new year on a stronger financial footing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新年伊始﹐公司有了更加雄厚的财力基础。

GramExa.PROPFORM: on an equal footing (with sb/sth)/on the same footing (as sb/sth)
GramExa.GLOSS: in the same state or condition as other people or things
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 以（与某人/某物）平等的地位/在（与某人/某物）相同的状况下
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new law puts women on an equal legal footing with men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的法律把妇女放在和男人平等的法律地位上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the old polytechnics are now on the same footing as universities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去的理工学院现在有许多都与大学地位相等了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They managed to get the business onto a more secure footing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们设法为企业打下了更加牢固的基础。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole country was on a war footing ready to go to war at any time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国处于战备状态。

Sense.DEF: a firm hold with your feet when you are standing on a dangerous surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seb struggled to keep his footing on the slippery path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞勃努力在滑溜的小道上站稳脚跟。

GramExa.GLOSS: be unable to keep standing or balancing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl lost her footing and fell about 150 feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩失足摔倒﹐下落了约150英尺。

Sense.DEF: the solid base of bricks, stone etc that is under a building to support it and fasten it to the ground
a row of lights along the front of the stage in a theatre
a large strong box that you keep your things in, used especially by soldiers
free to do exactly what you want because you have no responsibilities, for example when you are not married or do not have children
Sense.TRAN: 行动自由自在的〔如未婚或没有孩子时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: footloose students traveling around Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲旅游﹑自由自在的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the kids leave home, you’ll be footloose and fancy-free free and without worries .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子离家之后﹐你就会自由自在﹑没有牵挂了。

Sense.DEF: a male servant in the past who opened the front door, announced the names of visitors etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时应门﹑通报访客姓名等的〕男仆

Sense.DEF: a note at the bottom of the page in a book, which gives more information about something
a piece of additional information that is not very important but is interesting or helps you understand something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an interesting footnote to the story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那则故事有个有趣的注脚。

Sense.DEF: a narrow path for people to walk along, especially in the country
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指乡间的〕人行小径﹐人行道

Sense.DEF: the place on a steam train where the driver stood
a mark made by a foot or shoe
Sense.EXAMPLE: We followed the footprints of a deer in the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们追踪雪地里一头鹿的足迹。

Sense.DEF: the amount of space on a desk that a computer uses
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机在桌子上的〕占位面积
Sense.EXAMPLE: PCs with a 50% smaller footprint than other models
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 占位面积比其他型号小50%的个人计算机

Sense.DEF:
something that supports your feet when you are sitting, for example a small piece of furniture or the part of a
motorcycle
where you put your feet

Subsense.DEF: to secretly touch someone’s feet with your feet under a table to show that you think they are sexually attractive
Subsense.TRAN: （与某人）〔暗中在桌下〕用脚调情

Subsense.DEF: to work together and help each other in a dishonest way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: politicians playing footsie with each other
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狼狈为奸的政客

Sense.DEF: having feet that hurt because you have walked a long distance
the sound each step makes when someone is walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: He heard someone’s footsteps in the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听见门厅里有脚步声。

Sense.DEF: a low piece of furniture used to support your feet when you are sitting down

PIC.HEADING: FOOTSTOOL 脚凳
PIC.PICCONTENT: footstool 脚凳；armchair 扶手椅

Sense.DEF: things that people wear on their feet, such as shoes or boots
Sense.EXAMPLE: outdoor footwear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 户外用鞋

Sense.DEF: skilful use of your feet when dancing or playing a sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔舞蹈﹑运动中的〕步法﹐腿脚功夫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The England keeper revealed some fancy footwork in the victory over Nottingham Forest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位英格兰国家队的守门员在战胜诺丁汉森林队的那场比赛中展现了出色的脚法。

Sense.DEF: skilful methods that you use to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took a bit of deft footwork to get them to agree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说服他们同意颇费了点巧计。

Sense.DEF: football
Sense.EXAMPLE: footy fans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球迷

Sense.DEF: a man who is very interested in his clothes and appearance - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 过分讲究衣着和外表的男子〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: used to say who is intended to get or use something, or where something is intended to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a present for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有件礼物送给你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone left a message for Vicky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人给维基留了言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an English course for foreign students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为外国学生开的一门英语课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a new battery for the radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的收音机需要一节新电池。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These chairs are for the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些椅子是办公室的。

Sense.DEF: in order to help someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked after the kids for them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为他们照看孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me carry that bag for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来给你拿那个包吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor knew that there was nothing he could do for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生知道自己无能为力﹐帮不了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles died fighting for his country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯在战斗中为国捐躯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What can I do for you used to ask a customer if you can help them ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以帮您做点什么？

Sense.DEF: used to say what the purpose of an object, action etc is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a knife for cutting bread
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 切面包的刀子

Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you do that for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那样做是为了什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve bought him a watch for his birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给他买了块手表作为生日礼物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the documents prepared for his defence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为给他辩护而准备的文件

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMER 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use for before a to-infinitive to say what the purpose of an action is. Use in order to , or just a to-infinitive.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某一行为的目的时﹐不要将for用在带to的不定词之前﹐而要用in order to或直接用不定式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They wanted to raise money in order to build up the business (NOT不用 ... for to build up the business).
She went downtown to do some shopping.

Sense.DEF: in order to have, do, get, or obtain something
Sense.TRAN: 为了要﹔为了做﹔为了得到
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you waiting for the bus?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在等公共汽车吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the qualifications necessary for a career in broadcasting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事广播业必须具备的资格
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother was too ill to get up for dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲病得无法起床吃晚饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I paid $3 for a ticket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花三美元买了张票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For further details, write to this address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知详情﹐请致函此地址。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去散步吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say how long an action or situation continues for
Sense.TRAN: 达﹐计〔表示动作或情况持续的时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bake the cake for 40 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将蛋糕烘烤40分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had been talking for a good half hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈了足足半个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been off work for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他休了一段时间假。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked for miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走了好几英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Factories stretch for quite a way along the canal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂沿运河延伸了很长一段距离。

Sense.DEF: if something is arranged for a particular time, it is planned that it should happen then
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve invited them for 9 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我邀请他们9点来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A meeting was arranged for 18th May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个会议安排在5月18日。

Sense.DEF: used to say where a person, vehicle etc is going
Sense.EXAMPLE: I set off for work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我动身去上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the train for Manchester
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开往曼彻斯特的列车
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few days later she would be leaving for New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过几天她就要去纽约了。

Sense.DEF: used to say what the price or value of something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheque for a hundred pounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张100英镑的支票
Sense.EXAMPLE: The diamond was insured for two thousand dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这颗钻石上了2,000美元的保险。

Sense.DEF: because of or as a result of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If, for any reason, you cannot attend, please inform us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如因故不能出席﹐请通知我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hardly see for the mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于雾气﹐我们几乎什么也看不见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll feel better for a break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休息一下你会感觉好些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reward for making good progress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对取得良好进步的奖赏

Sense.EXAMPLE: Campbell was arrested for dangerous driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎贝尔因危险驾车而遭逮捕。

Sense.DEF: used to say which thing or person your statement or question is related to
Sense.TRAN: 对于〔表示陈述或问题的对象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure she’s the ideal person for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信她是这个职位的理想人选。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The questions on this paper are too difficult for 10-year-olds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张试卷上的题目对于10岁的孩子来说太难了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you all right for money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱你没有问题吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fortunately for him, he can swim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好在他会游泳。

Sense.DEF: used to say which person or thing your feelings are directed towards
Sense.TRAN: 对于〔表示情感表露的对象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I came away feeling sorry for poor old George.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走的时候﹐心里为可怜的老乔治感到难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My deep love for him still remains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他深爱依旧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They show no respect for authority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们无视权威。

Sense.DEF: used to say at which meal you eat something
Sense.TRAN: 当作〔表示食物在哪一餐吃〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had pasta for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们午餐吃了意大利面。

Sense.DEF: used to say which company, team etc you belong to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve worked for the BBC ever since I left university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大学毕业后一直在英国广播公司工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deborah used to play for the A team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德博拉曾效力于A队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He writes for a weekly paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为一家周报撰稿。

Sense.DEF: supporting or in agreement with something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have studied the arguments for and against nuclear energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们研究了支持和反对核能的论点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many people voted for the proposal?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多少人投票支持这项提议？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three cheers for the captain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为队长欢呼三声吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: support something very much
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m all for giving people more freedom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全赞成给予民众更多的自由。

Sense.DEF: used to say what a word or sign means
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the French word for ‘happy’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法语“开心”怎么讲？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Red is for danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色表示危险。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular quality of someone or something is surprising when you consider what they are
Sense.TRAN: 就…而言〔表示某种特点令人惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looks young for her age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就她的年龄而言﹐她看上去算是年轻的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s cold for July.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就7月份来说﹐这天气算是冷的。

Sense.DEF: as a representative of other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paisley claims to speak for the majority of local people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩斯利声称自己是当地大部分民众的喉舌。

Sense.DEF: used to say what is possible, difficult, necessary, unusual etc
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人〕来说〔可能﹑困难﹑必须﹑不寻常等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unusual for Donald to be so bad-tempered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐纳德这么暴躁很不寻常。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is an urgent need for someone to tackle this problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 急需有人来解决这个问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here is a chance for everyone to learn new skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个机会﹐每个人都能学到新的技能。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing worse than for a parent to ill-treat a child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么比父母虐待小孩更恶劣了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was too far for her to walk in high-heeled shoes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对穿着高跟鞋的她来说﹐这段路太长了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is a relationship between one amount and another
Sense.EXAMPLE: For each mistake, you’ll lose half a point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你每错一处﹐就要扣去半分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For every three people who agree, you’ll find five who don’t.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每三个人同意﹐就有五个人不同意。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not the kind of thing that someone likes or will enjoy
Sense.EXAMPLE: City life is not for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市生活不适合我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This book is not for everyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书不是所有人都会喜欢的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is (not) for sb to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say whether it is someone’s right or duty to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not for me to tell you what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不应该由我来告诉你怎么办。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be for you to decide what action you should take.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该采取什么行动由你自己来决定。

Variant.LEXVAR: if it hadn’t been for sb/sth

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what prevents or prevented something from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it hadn’t been for you, I should have drowned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是你的话﹐我就淹死了。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a particular kind of behaviour or situation is typical of someone or something, especially when you do not expect anything better from that person or thing
Subsense.TRAN: 那正是某人/某物的特点！〔尤用于表示某人或某物不可能有多好〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I know it’s outrageous, but that’s Melissa for you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道这很离谱﹐但梅利莎就是这么个人。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are annoyed or disappointed to say that something is the opposite of the quality you are mentioning
Subsense.TRAN: 那还能算是…？ 那恰好跟…相反！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, there’s gratitude for you! Here am I trying to help and you tell me not to interfere!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐哪有这样表示感谢的！我来帮忙﹐你却叫我别插手！

Sense.DEF: to be likely to be blamed or punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be in for it if she finds out what you’ve done!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是她发现你干的事﹐你就麻烦了！

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I cannot tell whether she is old or young, for I have never seen her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道她是年老还是年轻﹐因为我从没见过她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found it increasingly difficult to read, for his eyesight was beginning to fail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得阅读越来越费劲﹐因为他的视力开始衰退了。

Sense.DEF: to go around searching for food or other supplies

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are being forced to forage for food and fuel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们只得四处寻找食物和燃料。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In the summer, the goats forage freely in any place they want to go .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天﹐羊群自由自在地觅食。

Sense.DEF: to search for something with your hands in a bag, drawer etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手在袋子﹑抽屉等中〕搜寻﹐翻找

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She foraged around in her purse and produced her ticket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在包里找来找去﹐最后拿出票来。

Sense.DEF: food supplies for horses and cattle
an act of searching for something
a short attempt at doing a particular job or activity, especially one that is very different from what you usually do
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤对某项非本行的工作或活动的〕短暂尝试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It will be my first foray into local government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将是我首次尝试进入地方政府。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Wright is about to make his first foray into the music business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖特即将进军音乐界。

Sense.DEF: a short sudden attack by a group of soldiers, especially in order to get food or supplies
Sense.TRAN: 〔一队士兵的〕突袭〔尤为获得食物或补给〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: their nightly forays into enemy territory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每晚对敌区的突袭

Sense.DEF: a short journey somewhere in order to get something or do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为得到某物或做某事而进行的〕短暂旅行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We make regular forays to France to buy wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经常去法国买葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
forbid
to not do something you could or would like to do because you think it is wiser not to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He decided to forbear from interfering.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定克制自己﹐不去干预。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clara forbore to mention his name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉拉忍住没提他的名字。

Sense.DEF:
a
forebear
the quality of being patient, able to control your emotions, and willing to forgive someone who has upset you
patient and willing to forgive
to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为惩罚﹐他被禁止离开家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women are forbidden from going out without a veil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女不戴面纱禁止出门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law strictly forbids racial or sexual discrimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律严禁种族或性别歧视。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone is not allowed to do something rather than is forbidden to do something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说someone is not allowed to do something﹐不说someone is forbidden to do something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He was not allowed to leave the house.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被禁止离开那幢房子。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you hope that something will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 但愿不会发生这样的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Supposing I had an accident.’ ‘God forbid!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “假设我出了意外事故呢。”“但愿不会发生这样的事！”

Sense.DEF: to make it impossible for someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 阻止﹔妨碍﹐使〔某人〕不可能做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于篇幅限制﹐无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone in a very strong way that they must not do something or that something is not allowed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His doctor had strictly forbidden him to drink alcohol.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的医生严禁他饮酒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is forbidden to say such things.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此类话语是禁止的。

Exponent.DEF: to say that someone must not do or have something, and stop them doing or having it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company does not allow smoking inside the building.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司不准在大楼内吸烟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mobile phones are not allowed in school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 校内禁用手机。

Exponent.DEF: to not allow someone to do something. Not let is more informal than not allow .
Exponent.TRAN: 不让〔较not allow正式程度低〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My parents won’t let me stay out later than 11 o’clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母不准我11点之后还不回家。

Exponent.DEF: if something is not permitted, a rule or law says that you must not do it. Not permit is more formal than not allow .
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Candidates are not permitted to use dictionaries in this examination.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本次考试考生不得使用词典。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parking is not permitted here after 8 am.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上8点后此处禁止停车。

Exponent.DEF: to say officially that people must not do or have something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parliament decided to ban fox-hunting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会决定禁止猎狐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book was banned in many countries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此书在许多国家被禁。

Exponent.DEF: to say officially that an action is illegal and make a law or rule about this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Acts of vandalism are prohibited.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止破坏公物的行为。

Exponent.DEF: to not allow someone to enter a place or do something, especially by preventing it officially
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Foreign journalists were barred from entering the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国记者被禁止进入该国。

Exponent.DEF: to say officially that people are not allowed to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The law proscribes discrimination in the workplace.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该法律禁止工作场所的歧视行为。

Sense.DEF: not allowed, especially because of an official rule
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因官方规定而〕被禁止的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is forbidden to smoke at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校内禁止吸烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alcohol is strictly forbidden in Saudi Arabia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮酒在沙特阿拉伯是严格禁止的。

Sense.DEF: a forbidden place is one that you are not allowed to go to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Great Mosque is forbidden to Christians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大清真寺禁止基督徒入内。

Sense.DEF: a forbidden activity, subject etc is one that people think that you should not do, talk about etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sex was always a forbidden topic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性在过去一直是个禁忌话题。

GramExa.GLOSS: something that you should not have, but that you want
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forbidden fruit is always more attractive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁果总是更诱人。

Sense.DEF: having a frightening or unfriendly appearance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sailed past the island’s rather dark and forbidding cliffs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们驾船驶过﹐岛上黑森森的峭壁令人望而生畏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was forbidding, even hostile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面容冷峻﹐甚至可以说是带有敌意。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
forbear

the past participle of
forbear

Subsense.DEF: a group of people who have been trained to do military work for a government or other organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The riots were suppressed by government forces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴乱被政府军镇压了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He strengthened US forces in the Gulf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他加强了美军在海湾地区的军力。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plan to disarm the rebel forces those fighting against the government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解除叛军武装的计划

Subsense.DEF:
the army, navy, and
air force
Subsense.TRAN: 武装力量﹔陆海空三军部队﹔军队

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both her sons are in the forces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的两个儿子都在军队里。

Subsense.DEF:
nuclear
weapons or ordinary weapons
Subsense.EXAMPLE: short-range nuclear forces
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短程核武器

Sense.DEF: military action used as a way of achieving your aims
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peace cannot be imposed by force .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平不能通过武力来实现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN will allow the use of force against aircraft violating the zone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国将允许对侵犯这一地区的飞机采取军事行动。

Sense.DEF: violent physical action used to get what you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔为得到某结果而使用的〕暴力﹐武力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police used force to overpower the demonstrators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方动用了武力来制服示威者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the end he had to be thrown out of the house by force.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到最后﹐人们不得不强行把他赶出了房子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They kicked the door down using sheer brute force .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全凭蛮力将门踹倒了。

Sense.DEF: the amount of physical power with which something moves or hits another thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体移动或撞击时的〕力﹐力量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The force of the explosion blew out all the windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸的冲力把所有的窗子都震碎了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He raised his hand and struck her with terrifying force.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举起手﹐狠命地打她。

Sense.DEF: a natural power or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: the force of gravity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引力
Sense.EXAMPLE: powerful natural forces such as earthquakes, floods, and drought
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震﹑洪水﹑干旱等强大的自然力
Sense.EXAMPLE: the forces of nature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大自然的威力

Sense.DEF: a group of people who have been trained and organized to do a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 〔受过训练﹑有组织地做某一件事的〕一群人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s sales force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的销售队伍
Sense.EXAMPLE: the quality of the teaching force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师队伍的素质

Sense.DEF: something or someone who is powerful and has a lot of influence on the way things happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔对事情发展〕有影响力的事物[人]

GramExa.GLOSS: the person or thing that makes something happen
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Betty Coward was the driving force behind the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂•科沃德是这个项目的推动者。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone or something that makes change, peace etc more likely to happen
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 变革/和平/民主等的推动力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Healthy competition is a force for innovation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 良性竞争是革新的推动力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a quick and decisive player – a force to be reckoned with a person, team, company etc that influences what happens .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打球敏捷果断﹐是个不可小觑的人物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fall in prices was due to forces beyond their control .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格下降是由他们无法控制的因素造成的。

Sense.DEF: the powerful effect that something has on you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even after 30 years, the play has lost none of its force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即便在30年之后﹐这出戏的感染力也丝毫未减。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the force of his personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的人格魅力

Sense.DEF: to work together so that you can deal with a problem, be more powerful etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为解决问题﹑壮大力量等而〕（与某人/某组织）联合﹐合作﹐同心协力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local schools have joined forces with each other to share facilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地学校携手合作﹐共享设施。

Subsense.DEF: if a law, rule etc is in force, it already exists
Subsense.TRAN: 〔法律﹑法规等〕已生效﹐在实施中
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The trade embargo has been in force for a year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易禁令已经实施一年了。

Subsense.DEF: in a large group, especially in order to protest about something
Subsense.TRAN: 大量﹐众多〔尤为抗议某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Villagers turned out in force to protest about the new road.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众多村民出来反对修筑新公路。

Sense.LEXUNIT: come into force/bring sth into force
Sense.DEF: if a new law, rule, change etc comes or is brought into force, it starts to exist
Sense.TRAN: 开始生效/使某法规开始实施
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parking restrictions in the town centre came into force last month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心限制停车的法规于上月开始实施。

Sense.DEF: because you have always done a particular thing and it is difficult to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: I get up at 6 o’clock every day out of force of habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于习惯﹐我每天6点钟起床。

Sense.DEF: if something happens by force of circumstance, events outside your control make it happen

Subsense.DEF: a unit for measuring the strength of the wind
extremely strong wind that does a lot of damage
Subsense.TRAN: 〔能造成巨大破坏的〕大风/飓风

Sense.DEF:
a word meaning the
police force
, used especially by police officers
Sense.TRAN: 警察部队〔尤为警方用语〕

Sense.DEF: people or things that increase the amount of good or bad in the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: the battle against the forces of evil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与恶势力的较量

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something they do not want to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Government troops have forced the rebels to surrender.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军已迫使叛乱分子投降。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Due to the high cost of borrowing, many companies have been forced to close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于借贷成本高﹐许多公司被迫关门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to force myself to get up this morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早晨我不得不逼迫自己起床。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: women who are forced into arranged marriages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被迫接受包办婚姻的妇女
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bad health forced him into taking early retirement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康不佳迫使他提前退休。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength
Sense.EXAMPLE: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想打开门﹐但那男人硬是把它推开了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: force your way through/into etc sth
Sense.DEF: to push very hard in order to get somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor forced his way through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生挤过人群。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demonstrators forced their way past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威人群硬挤了过去。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen or change, especially more quickly than planned or expected
Sense.TRAN: 使发生[改变]〔尤指比计划或预计的要快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unfortunate events that forced his resignation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迫使他辞职的不幸事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to force the pace on alternative energy policies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要加快步伐制定替代能源政策。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The effect will be to increase unemployment and force down wages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果将是失业人数增加﹐工资被压低。

Sense.DEF: to open a door etc using physical strength, often causing damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forced the lock on the cupboard to see what was inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我撬开壁橱的锁﹐想看看里面有什么。

Sense.DEF: to do something that makes it necessary for someone to make decisions or take action, instead of waiting to see what happens
Sense.TRAN: 强迫立即作出决定﹔迫使采取行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Polly decided to force the issue by demanding an explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉决定讨个说法﹐从而逼迫他们采取行动。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something unwillingly or earlier than they had intended
Sense.TRAN: 迫使某人采取行动﹔迫使某人提前行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re reluctant to sell the house yet but the right offer could force their hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们目前还不是很愿意出售房子﹐不过价格合理的话也许能让他们出手。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself smile, laugh etc even though you feel upset or annoyed

Exponent.DEF: to make someone do something they do not want to do – used when people or situations make you do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were beaten and forced to confess to crimes they had not committed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遭到殴打﹐被迫承认自己并没有犯下的罪行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drought forced millions of farmers to sell their cattle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旱灾迫使数百万农民卖掉自己的牛。

Exponent.DEF: to force someone to do something by using pressure, threats, or violence. Make sb do sth is more common than force sb to do sth in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔通过施压﹑威胁或暴力〕迫使〔在日常英语中﹐make sb do sth比force sb to do sth更常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her parents disapproved of Alex and they made her stop seeing him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母不喜欢亚历克斯﹐逼着她不再和他见面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two men with guns made the staff hand over the money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名持枪男子迫使员工交出钱款。

Exponent.DEF: to try to force someone to do something by making them feel that they should do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some employers pressure their staff into working very long hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些雇主强迫员工长时间工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She felt they were trying to pressurize her into getting married.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得他们是在逼她结婚。

Exponent.DEF: to force someone to give you money or do what you want by threatening to tell embarrassing secrets about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tried to blackmail him with photographs of them together at the hotel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图用和他一起在酒店里的照片敲诈他。

Exponent.DEF: to force someone to do something using official power or authority. Also used when someone has to do something because of their situation.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town was surrounded and compelled to surrender.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇遭到包围﹐被迫投降。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt compelled to offer them some kind of explanation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉有必要向他们解释一下。

Exponent.DEF: to force someone to do something by threatening them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Local people were coerced into joining the rebel army.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地民众被迫加入叛军。

Exponent.DEF: if someone is obliged to do something, they must do it because it is the law or the rule, or because of the situation they are in
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You are not obliged to say anything which may harm your defence in court.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必说任何可能在法庭上对你的辩护不利的话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were obliged to sell the land.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被迫变卖土地。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from showing that you are upset or frightened, especially with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janet forced back her tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特强忍住泪水。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself eat or drink something, although you do not want it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forced down a piece of stale bread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我强咽下一片不新鲜的面包。

Sense.DEF: to make a plane land by threatening to attack it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hijacked plane was forced down by military jets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭劫持的飞机被军用飞机拦截了下来。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do or accept something even though they do not want to
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某事〕强加于〔某人〕﹐迫使〔某人〕接受
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no good trying to force a diet on someone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想给一个人强行规定饮食是没有用的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who try to force their own views on you
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图把自己的观点强加给你的人

Sense.DEF: to make someone tell you something by asking them many times, threatening them etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过多次要求﹑威胁等〕强迫〔某人〕说出
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t going to tell Matt but he forced it out of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想告诉马特﹐但他逼我说了出来。

Sense.DEF: a forced smile, laugh etc is not natural or sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, hello,’ said Eileen, with forced brightness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “啊﹐你好。”艾琳装出一副高兴的样子说道。

Sense.DEF: done suddenly and quickly because the situation makes it necessary, not because it was planned or wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane had to make a forced landing in a field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机不得不迫降在一块农田上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the forced repatriation of thousands of refugees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数千难民的强制遣返

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone gets into a building illegally by breaking a door, window etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police found no signs of forced entry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方没有发现强行进入的痕迹。

Sense.DEF:
when prisoners or
slaves
are forced to do very hard physical work, or a system in which this happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two million suffered imprisonment or forced labour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两百万人遭到囚禁或被强制劳动。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to eat by putting food down their throat
a forceful person expresses their opinions very strongly and clearly and people are easily persuaded by them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gained a reputation as a forceful member of the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了党内悍将的名声。

Sense.DEF: forceful arguments, reasons etc are strongly and clearly expressed
Sense.TRAN: 〔论据﹑理由等〕有力的﹐有说服力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a forceful attack on government policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府政策的有力抨击

Sense.DEF: having a powerful effect that is likely to change a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President hasn’t been forceful enough in changing the judicial system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统改革司法体系力度不够。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Governments should adopt a more forceful approach to improve the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各国政府应当采取更有力度的办法来改善环境。

Sense.DEF: using physical force

unexpected events, for example a war, that prevent someone from doing what they had officially planned or agreed to do. An event like this can legally allow an agreement or contract to be changed or ended.
Sense.TRAN: 不可抗力〔指战争等无法预料的事件﹐见于合约的免责条款〕

Sense.DEF: a medical instrument used for picking up and holding things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of forceps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把镊子

Sense.DEF: done using physical force
Sense.EXAMPLE: the forcible overthrow of the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力推翻政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: signs of forcible entry into the building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强行入楼的迹象

Sense.DEF: using physical force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police threatened to have protestors forcibly removed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方威胁要强行驱走示威者。

Sense.DEF: in a way that has a strong clear effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case was forcibly put by the speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发言人有力地阐述了理由。

Sense.DEF: a place where a river is not deep, so that you can walk or drive across it
Sense.TRAN: 〔河流的〕可涉水而过之处﹐浅滩

Sense.DEF: to or in a position of importance or influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmental issues came to the fore in the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代﹐环境问题成了热点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case brought to the fore a lot of racial tensions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起案件凸显出诸多种族矛盾。

Sense.DEF: the fore parts of a ship, plane, or animal are the parts at the front
before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The enemy had been forewarned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌人已事先得到警告。

Sense.DEF: placed at the front
Sense.EXAMPLE: her forenames
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horse’s forelegs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马的前腿

Sense.DEF: the front part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: his forehead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的前额

Sense.DEF: the lower part of the arm, between the hand and the elbow
someone who was a member of your family a long time in the past
a strong feeling that something bad is going to happen soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waited for news with a grim sense of foreboding .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等待着消息﹐心里有一种不祥的预感。

Sense.DEF: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the company’s annual sales forecast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的年度销量预测

Sense.DEF: to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预报周末有雨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Federal Reserve Bank forecasts that the economy will grow by 2% this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦储备银行预测今年经济将增长2%。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to say what is likely to happen in the future, especially what kind of weather is expected
Sense.TRAN: 预测者〔尤指气象预报员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the weather forecaster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气象预报员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic forecasters think that the stock market is set to fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济预测专家认为股市很可能下跌。

Sense.DEF: the front part of a ship, where the sailors live
if a bank forecloses, it takes away someone’s property because they have failed to pay back the money that they borrowed from the bank to buy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因抵押人无法偿还贷款〕止赎﹐取消抵押品赎回权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Building societies may foreclose on a mortgage if payments are not kept up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果房贷断供﹐购房互助协会就有可能取消房产的赎回权。

Sense.DEF: a large open area in front of a building such as a garage or hotel
Sense.TRAN: 〔车库﹑酒店等的〕前院﹐前庭﹐前场

Sense.DEF:
intended by
fate the power that is believed to control people’s lives
to be unsuccessful or unhappy
the people, especially men, who were part of your family a long time ago in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What would our forefathers have thought?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果是我们的祖先﹐会怎么想呢？

Sense.DEF: someone in the past who did something important that influences your life today
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two hundred years ago our forefathers established this nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二百年前﹐我们的先辈建立了这个国家。

Sense.DEF: the finger next to your thumb
one of the two front feet of an animal with four legs
to be in a leading position in an important activity that is trying to achieve something or develop new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 位于（某事物的）最前列﹐处于（某事物的）领先地位
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has always been at the forefront of science and technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司在科学技术方面始终处于领先地位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prison conditions have been pushed to the forefront of public debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱条件问题已被推到公众讨论的风口浪尖。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in/at/to the forefront of sb’s mind/attention etc
Sense.DEF: to be what someone is thinking about most, because it is very important to them
Sense.TRAN: 是某人首先考虑/注意到等的事情
Sense.RELATEDWD: at the back of sb’s mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fear of unemployment was at the forefront of everyone’s minds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业是每个人心中最大的担忧。

Sense.DEF: to meet in a group

another spelling of
forgo
something that has just been mentioned, read, dealt with etc
Sense.TRAN: 刚提到的（某事）﹐前面提到的（某事）﹐上述（某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The foregoing examples illustrate this point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上述例证阐明了这个观点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The foregoing helps to explain these results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前面所说的可以解释这些结果。

Sense.DEF: if something is a foregone conclusion, its result is certain, even though it has not happened yet
Sense.TRAN: 是预料中的结果﹔成为定局
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election result was a foregone conclusion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举结果已成定局。

Sense.DEF: the part of the view in a picture or a photograph that is closest to you when you are looking at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were three figures in the foreground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前景有三个人。

Sense.DEF: to be regarded as important and receive a lot of attention
Sense.TRAN: 处于最突出的地位﹔成为众所瞩目者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Education has been very much in the foreground recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近教育问题备受关注。

Sense.DEF: a way of hitting the ball in tennis and some other games, with the flat part of your hand facing the direction of the ball
the part of your face above your eyes and below your hair
from or relating to a country that is not your own
Sense.EXAMPLE: foreign students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you speak any foreign languages?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会讲外语吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the success of foreign companies in various industries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国公司在各行业的成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought she sounded foreign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她说话像外国人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: transactions in foreign currencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外汇买卖

Sense.DEF: involving or dealing with other countries
Sense.TRAN: 对外的﹐涉外的﹐外事的﹐外交的
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s foreign policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的对外政策

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Foreign competition provides consumers with a greater variety of goods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自国外的竞争为消费者提供了更丰富的商品。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: our budget for foreign aid financial help to countries in need
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的对外援助预算

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Chinese Foreign Minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国外交部长

Subsense.DEF: to seem strange to someone as the result of not being known or understood
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The language of finance is quite foreign to me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金融用语我相当生疏。

Subsense.DEF: to be not typical of someone’s usual character
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Aggression is completely foreign to his nature .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争强好胜绝不是他的本性。

Sense.DEF: a piece of dirt, glass, or other material that has got inside something, especially someone’s body, and that should not be there
Sense.EXAMPLE: cells that are designed to attack and destroy foreign bodies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责攻击并摧毁异物的细胞

Sense.DEF: politics, business matters etc that affect or concern the relationship between your country and other countries
someone who comes from a different country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the local people are suspicious of foreigners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些当地人不信任外国人。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: The word foreigner can sound negative and not very friendly. In everyday English, people often say people from other countries .
F2NBox.TRAN: foreigner一词有时听上去带贬义﹐不是很友好。在日常英语中﹐人们常说people from other countries
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I like meeting people from other countries .

Sense.DEF: used to talk about buying and selling foreign money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dollar is expected to fall in the foreign exchange markets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计外汇市场上美元会下跌。

Sense.DEF: foreign money, especially money obtained by selling goods to a foreign country
Sense.EXAMPLE: foreign exchange earned through exports
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过出口赚取的外汇

Sense.DEF: an arrangement through which a student exchanges homes, schools etc with a student from another country for a particular length of time, especially in order to learn a language
Sense.TRAN: 对外交流﹐〔与外国学生之间的〕互访
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school organizes a foreign exchange to France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校组织去法国的对外交流。

Sense.DEF: the British government department that is responsible for dealing with matters concerning other countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕外交部﹐外交和联邦事务部

Sense.DEF: the British Government minister who is in charge of the Foreign Office
knowledge that something is going to happen before it actually does
one of the two front legs of an animal with four legs
a piece of hair that falls over someone’s forehead
the hair on a horse’s head that grows between its ears and hangs forward on its face
to show too much respect towards someone in authority -used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 顶礼膜拜﹐额手加礼〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a worker who is in charge of a group of other workers, for example in a factory

the leader of a
jury
, who announces their decision in court
the best or most important
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the country’s foremost authorities on chemical warfare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国化学战方面的最高权威之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期以来﹐罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

Sense.DEF: in a leading position among a group of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sharpton was foremost among the protesters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙普顿走在抗议人群的前列。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

Sense.DEF:
someone’s
first name
relating to the scientific methods used for finding out about a crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forensic experts found traces of blood in the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法医专家在车里发现了血迹。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a career in forensic science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究法医学的职业
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a forensic pathologist
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法医病理学家

Sense.DEF: the use of scientific tests to solve crimes
sexual activity, such as kissing and touching the sexual organs, that happens before having sex
someone or something that existed before something similar that developed or came later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Babbage’s engine was the forerunner of the modern computer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴贝奇发明的机器是现代计算机的前身。

Sense.DEF: a sign or warning that something is going to happen
to think or know that something is going to happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把你的名字写在名单上了﹐估计不会有什么问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Few analysts foresaw that oil prices would rise so steeply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析家大多没有预料到油价会如此大幅度地上涨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one foresaw what he was planning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人事先知道他有什么打算。

Sense.DEF: for as long as it is possible to know what is likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation is likely to continue for the foreseeable future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种局面在可预见的将来可能还会持续下去。

Sense.DEF: fairly soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a possibility of water shortages in the foreseeable future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久的将来可能会出现水荒。

Sense.DEF: foreseeable difficulties, events etc should be planned for because they are very likely to happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 〔困难﹑事件等〕可预料的﹐很可能发生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge found that it was not foreseeable that the fuel would catch fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官裁定﹐燃料着火是无法预料的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: foreseeable risk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可预料的风险

Sense.DEF: to show or say that something will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The revolution foreshadowed an entirely new social order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场革命预示着一种全新的社会秩序将要出现。

Sense.DEF: the part of the shore between the highest and lowest levels that the sea reaches
Sense.TRAN: 〔高潮线和低潮线之间的〕前滩﹐前滨

Sense.DEF: the part of the shore between the edge of the sea and the part of the land that has houses, grass etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔水陆相接的界线与房屋﹑草木等之间的〕海滨

Sense.DEF: objects, places etc that are foreshortened appear to be smaller, shorter, or closer together than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Viewed from high up, their bodies were oddly foreshortened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从高处往下看﹐他们的身体小得出奇。

Sense.DEF: ended before the usual or expected time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foreshortened career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提前结束的职业生涯

Sense.DEF: the ability to imagine what is likely to happen and to consider this when planning for the future
Sense.TRAN: 先见之明﹐预见﹔深谋远虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an example of the authorities’ lack of foresight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是当权者缺乏远见的一个例证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Luckily I’d had the foresight to get in plenty of food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好在我有先见之明﹐买了许多食品。

Sense.DEF:
a loose fold of skin covering the end of a man’s
penis
a large area of land that is covered with trees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Much of Scandinavia is covered in dense forest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯堪的纳维亚的许多地方都覆盖着茂密的森林。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a tropical forest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带森林
Sense.EXAMPLE: the danger of forest fires
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生森林火灾的危险

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not see the forest for the trees

Exponent.DEF: a very large area of land with a lot of trees growing closely together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 1500, most of the country was forest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1500年﹐该国的大部分地区是森林。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Black Forest in Germany
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国的黑森林

Exponent.DEF: an area of land covered with a lot of trees, that is smaller than a forest
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Behind the house were the woods that we used to play in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋后是一片树林﹐我们以前常在那里玩耍。

Exponent.DEF: an area of land that is covered with trees –used especially for describing the type of land in an area
Exponent.TRAN: 林地〔尤用于形容某一地区的土地类型〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The site covers 74 acres of beautiful ancient woodland.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一遗址覆盖了74英亩美丽的古林地。

Exponent.DEF: a thick forest with tall trees, in tropical parts of the world that have a lot of rain
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tropical rainforests are home to over half of the planet’s plant and animal species.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带雨林是地球上超过半数动植物物种的家园。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Indonesian rainforest
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 印尼的热带雨林

Exponent.DEF: an area of tropical forest where trees and large plants grow very closely together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the jungles of Borneo
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婆罗洲的丛林
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The palace was hidden for centuries in Guatemala’s dense jungle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座宫殿在危地马拉的密林里隐藏了数个世纪。

Exponent.DEF: a small group of trees, or an area of land planted with a particular type of fruit tree
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The temple was built in the centre of a small grove of trees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 寺庙建造在一片小树林的中央。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the olive groves of southern Spain
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙南部的橄榄园

Exponent.DEF: a small area of trees or bushes growing closely together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At the top of the field was a copse full of rabbits.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 田野的最高处是一片小树林﹐里面住着很多兔子。

Exponent.DEF: a large area of trees planted for their wood, fruit etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rubber plantation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡胶种植园

Exponent.DEF: a small group of bushes, plants, or small trees growing closely together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tall bamboo thickets fringed the narrow river.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭窄河道的两岸生长着高高的竹丛。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from happening or prevent someone from doing something by doing something first
Sense.EXAMPLE: a measure intended to forestall further attacks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意在预先阻止进一步攻击的措施

Sense.DEF: forested areas are covered in forests
Sense.TRAN: 满是森林的﹐林木覆盖的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: heavily forested terrain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林密布的地带

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a forest taking care of, planting, and cutting down the trees
the science or skill of looking after large areas of trees
to be a sign of something more important, more impressive etc that will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two wins at the start of the season were a foretaste of things to come .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛季伊始便两战告捷﹐预示着好戏还在后头。

Sense.DEF: to say what will happen in the future, especially by using special magical powers
Sense.EXAMPLE: the birth of Christ, foretold by prophets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先知们所预言的基督的诞生

Sense.DEF: careful thought or planning before you do something
Sense.TRAN: 事先的考虑﹐事先的筹划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one had the forethought to bring a map.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也没有事先想到带一张地图。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
foretell
for all future time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted that moment to last forever .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望那一刻成为永远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many valuable works of art were lost forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许许多多珍贵的艺术品永远消失了。

Sense.DEF: for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once built, stone walls last forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦建成﹐石墙可以经久不倒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took forever to clean up after the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会后收拾打扫花了很长时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting seemed to go on forever and a day .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议似乎要没完没了地开下去。

Sense.DEF: to do something often, especially in a way that annoys people
Sense.TRAN: 老是做某事﹐不断做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s forever making comments about my weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是议论我的体重。

Sense.DEF: a phrase meaning forever, used especially in stories
Sense.TRAN: 永远﹐永久〔尤用于故事中〕

Sense.DEF: to be extremely long or large
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road just went on forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长路漫漫﹐没有尽头。

Sense.DEF: to warn someone about something dangerous, unpleasant, or unexpected before it happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’d been forewarned of the dangers of travelling at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预先被告知夜间行路有什么危险。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to know about something before it happens, so that you can be prepared for it
Sense.TRAN: 凡事预则立﹐先知先戒备﹐有备无患

Sense.DEF: a female worker who is in charge of a group of other workers, especially in a factory
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指工厂里的〕女工头﹐女领班

Sense.DEF:
a woman who is the leader of a
jury
and announces their decision in court
a short piece of writing at the beginning of a book that introduces the book or its writer
to lose a right, position, possession etc or have it taken away from you because you have broken a law or rule
Sense.TRAN: 〔因违反法律或规定而〕失去﹐丧失﹐被没收
Sense.EXAMPLE: By being absent from the trial, he forfeited the right to appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因缺席审判﹐他丧失了上诉权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was fined £3,000 and ordered to forfeit her car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被罚款3000英镑并没收汽车。

Sense.DEF: something that is taken away from you or something that you have to pay, because you have broken a rule or made a mistake
Sense.TRAN: 没收物﹐罚金﹔代价〔作为对某人违反规则或犯错误的惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: to be legally or officially taken away from you as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s property may even be forfeit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司财产甚至可能被没收。

Sense.DEF: when someone has their property or money officially taken away because they have broken a law or rule
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refusal to sign meant forfeiture of property and exile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拒绝签字意味着被没收财产并流放国外。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
foregather

the past tense of
forgive
to develop something new, especially a strong relationship with other people, groups, or countries
Sense.TRAN: 形成﹐缔造〔尤指与其他人﹑团体或国家形成牢固的关系〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1776 the United States forged an alliance with France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1776年美国与法国结盟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The two women had forged a close bond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个女人结下了亲密情谊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Back in the 1980s, they were attempting to forge a new kind of rock music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代﹐他们尝试开创一种新的摇滚乐。

Sense.DEF: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
Sense.TRAN: 伪造﹐假冒〔尤指文书﹑笔迹等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人偷了我的信用卡﹐并假冒我的签名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a forged passport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假护照

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crowds of people forged through the streets towards the embassy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群坚定地穿过街道走向大使馆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He forged into the lead in the fourth set.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第四局他稳步领先。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her speech wasn’t going down too well, but she forged on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的演讲反响不是太好﹐但她还是坚持讲下去。

Sense.DEF: to make something from a piece of metal by heating the metal and shaping it
to make progress, especially quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指迅速地〕取得进展﹐突飞猛进

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jo’s forging ahead with her plans to write a film script.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔创作电影剧本的计划正在顺利进行。

Sense.DEF: a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects
a large piece of equipment that produces high temperatures, used for heating and shaping metal objects
someone who illegally copies documents, money, paintings etc and tries to make people think they are real
a document, painting, or piece of paper money that has been copied illegally
Sense.TRAN: 〔文件﹑画作或纸币的〕伪造品﹐赝品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting was a very clever forgery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画是件很巧妙的赝品。

Sense.DEF: the crime of copying official documents, money etc
to not remember facts, information, or people or things from the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I’ve forgotten your name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我忘记你的名字了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know you told me, but I forgot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你告诉过我﹐但是我忘了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What happened that day will never be forgotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一天的事永远难忘。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Karl says he forgot about our date.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔说他把我们的约会忘了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She forgot all about their anniversary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把他们的纪念日忘得一干二净。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I forgot that there’s a speed limit here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘记了这里有限速。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can you forget where you’ve parked the car?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么会把停车地点忘了呢？

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s someone who never forgets a face forgets who someone is .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种见人一面就不会忘记的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: said when you have just remembered or been reminded about something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh yes, I was forgetting she was pregnant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐对了﹐我差点忘记她怀孕了。

Sense.DEF: to not remember to do something that you should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you remember to post that letter?’ ‘Oh, sorry, I forgot.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有没有记得寄那封信？”“哦﹐对不起﹐我忘了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me your phone number before I forget forget to get it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的电话号码告诉我吧﹐免得我忘了跟你要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone’s forgotten to turn off their headlights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人忘记关汽车前灯了。

GramExa.GLOSS: completely forget
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He meant to invite Monica, but he clean forgot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是打算邀请莫妮卡的﹐但却忘得一干二净。

Sense.DEF: to not remember to bring something that you need with you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh no, I’ve forgotten my wallet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐不好﹐我忘了带钱包。

Sense.DEF: to stop thinking or worrying about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forget him, he’s not worth it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忘了他吧﹐他不值得。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At my age, I think I can forget fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我这个年龄﹐我觉得自己可以不用考虑时尚了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a while you’ll forget you’re wearing contact lenses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过一会儿你就会忘记自己是戴着隐形眼镜的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll never be able to forget about the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远也无法忘记这起事故。

Sense.DEF: to not care about or give attention to someone or something any longer
Sense.TRAN: 忘记﹐不再把…放在心上﹐不再关心

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget about your old friends when you go off to college, okay?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去上大学可不能忘记老朋友。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t afford to forget your relationship with your husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可以不顾你和丈夫的关系。

Sense.DEF: to stop planning to do something because it is no longer possible or sensible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to forget about going on holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将不得不放弃度假的想法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If we can’t get any funding we might as well forget the whole thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们不能得到资金﹐那就不如干脆放弃这件事。

Sense.DEF: used to add something to a list of things you have mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 也包括某事在内﹐别忘了还有某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to pay for the packaging and transportation costs, not forgetting airport taxes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得支付包装和运输费﹐别忘了还有机场税。

Subsense.DEF: to do something stupid or embarrassing, especially by losing control of your emotions
Subsense.TRAN: 忘乎所以﹐失去理智﹔行为[言谈]失态[不得体]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lisa forgot herself and reached out to touch his knee.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨失了态﹐伸出手去碰他的膝盖。

Subsense.DEF: to become so involved in something that you do not think about or notice anything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Often he would forget himself in his work for hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他常常会一连好几个小时忘我地工作。

Subsense.DEF: used to remind someone to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We need bread, milk, and eggs – don’t forget.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要面包﹑牛奶和鸡蛋——可别忘了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to lock up when you leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开时别忘了上锁。

Subsense.DEF: used to remind someone about an important fact or detail that they should consider
Subsense.TRAN: 别忘了〔某个重要事实或细节〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: But don’t forget that you have to pay interest on the loan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可是别忘了你还得支付贷款的利息。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget, I’ll be home late tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了﹐我今晚要晚回家。

Subsense.DEF: used to remind someone to take something with them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget your sandwiches.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了带上你的三明治。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that something is not important and they do not need to worry about it
Subsense.TRAN: 没关系﹐别在意〔用于表示某事不重要〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sorry I didn’t phone.’ ‘Forget it.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起﹐我没有打电话来。”“没关系。”

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop asking or talking about something, because it is annoying you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not coming with you, so forget it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不跟你去﹐别说了。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you refuse to do something or that it will be impossible to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you lend me $10?’ ‘Forget it, no way.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “借我十美元好吗？” “不可能﹐没门儿。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you’re thinking of getting Roy to help, you can forget it!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你在考虑让罗伊来帮忙的话﹐干脆别想了！

Subsense.DEF: used when someone asks you what you just said and you do not want to repeat it
Subsense.TRAN: 算了〔用于表示不想重复刚刚说过的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Nothing, just forget it.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你说什么？”“没什么﹐算了。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will always remember something from the past, because it was sad, funny, enjoyable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll never forget the look on his face when he opened the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远也忘不了他开门时脸上的表情。

Sense.DEF: used to remind someone about something, often humorously
Sense.TRAN: 你是不是忘了…？〔用于提醒﹐常作幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aren’t you forgetting that you’re already married?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是忘了你已经结婚了？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot remember a particular detail about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I forget what he said exactly but it was very rude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记不起他的原话﹐不过他的话是很无礼的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I forget the name of the street, but it’s the first on the left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记不起街名﹐但那是左边第一条街。

Sense.DEF: used to remind someone angrily about an important fact that should make them behave differently
Sense.TRAN: 你可别忘了！〔用于提醒某人一个重要的事实﹐让他们改变自己的行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m the boss around here, and don’t you forget it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里我说了算﹐你可别忘了！

Exponent.DEF: to not remember something or someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I’ve forgotten your name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我忘记你的名字了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was an experience she would never forget.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次经历她永生难忘。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that you have forgotten something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I know I needed something at the shops, but I can’t remember what it was.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道要在店里买东西﹐但记不起要买什么了。

Exponent.DEF: to not remember anything about something that happened in the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He told the jury that he had no recollection of the accident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对陪审团称自己不记得那起事故了。

Exponent.DEF: if something that you must do slips your mind, you forget to do it because you are busy thinking about other things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry I didn’t call. There was so much going on that it completely slipped my mind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我没打电话。事情太多﹐我把这件事忘得干干净净。

Exponent.EXP: it goes in one ear and out the other
Exponent.DEF: used to say that someone forgets what you tell them very quickly because they are not interested or do not listen properly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: With kids you have to say everything twice. It all goes in one ear and out the other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对孩子你什么都得说两遍﹐他们总是一个耳朵进一个耳朵出。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that you are suddenly unable to remember something at a time when you need it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was so nervous that my mind went blank as soon as they asked me a question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我太紧张了﹐他们提问时我脑子里一片空白。

Section.SECHEADING: TO TRY TO FORGET SOMETHING 试图忘记某事

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately try not to think about something sad or unpleasant
Exponent.TRAN: 忘记﹐忘却〔悲伤或不愉快的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After the divorce came through, I just wanted to forget about it all.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚程序完成后﹐我就希望能把这件事全部忘记。

Exponent.EXP: put sth out of your mind
Exponent.DEF: to make yourself stop thinking about something that stops you concentrating or makes you angry, sad, or nervous
Exponent.TRAN: 不再想某事〔指让人失神﹑生气﹑悲伤或紧张的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I’m competing I put everything out of my mind and concentrate on winning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛时﹐我把一切都抛在脑后﹐一心想着获胜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Try to put the whole thing out of your mind – there’s nothing you can do about it now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 试着把整件事都忘记吧——现在你对此无能为力了。

Exponent.DEF: to stop thinking about something sad or unpleasant that happened to you in the past, so that you can continue with your life and be happy
Exponent.TRAN: 把某事忘掉〔指忘记过去悲伤或不高兴的事以重新振作〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It can take a long time to put a traumatic experience like that behind you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要很长时间才能将那样痛苦的经历忘掉。

Exponent.DEF: to do something that helps you stop thinking about a problem for a short time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔做某事以〕暂时忘记烦恼的事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sara went out for a walk to try and take her mind off things.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉出去散步﹐想把事情先搁在脑后。

Exponent.DEF: to forget an unpleasant memory or thought, by deliberately stopping yourself from thinking about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He started drinking heavily in an effort to blot out the thought of what he had done.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始酗酒﹐想把自己的所作所为从记忆中抹去。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately forget someone or something and not let them be part of your thoughts and feelings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The marriage was a disaster, and her husband shut her out of his life completely.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那桩婚姻真是场灾难﹐她丈夫把她完全排除在生活之外。

Sense.DEF: often forgetting things
a small plant with pale blue flowers
Sense.TRAN: 勿忘我﹐勿忘草〔一种开淡蓝色小花的植物〕

Sense.DEF: not very interesting or good - often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 易被忘记的﹐无聊的﹔糟糕的〔常作幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d had a role in one or two forgettable movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一两部不起眼的影片中饰演过角色。

Sense.DEF: if something bad is forgivable, you can understand how it happened and you can easily forgive it
Sense.TRAN: 〔糟糕的行为〕可宽恕的﹐可原谅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an easily forgivable mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个错误情有可原。

Sense.DEF: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve tried to forgive him for what he said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图原谅他所说的话。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He never forgave her for walking out on him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直没有原谅她抛弃自己。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If anything happened to the kids I’d never forgive myself .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果孩子们出了什么事﹐我永远也不会原谅自己。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone that you are not angry with them
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 原谅你了
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m really sorry.’ ‘It’s okay, you’re forgiven.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “真的很抱歉。”“没关系﹐原谅你了。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: God forgives us our sins.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上帝会赦免我们的罪孽。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t look the sort of man to forgive and forget forgive someone and no longer think about it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去不是那种不记仇的人。

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to say or do something that might seem rude or offensive and you want it to seem more polite
Sense.TRAN: 请原谅我〔用于即将说出或做出可能显得粗鲁或无礼的事时﹐以显得较有礼貌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forgive me, but I don’t think that is relevant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恕我直言﹐我认为那是不相关的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: forgive me for asking/saying etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forgive me for saying so, but that’s nonsense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请原谅我这么说﹐那是胡说八道。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forgive my phoning you so late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 原谅我这么晚打电话给你。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can be forgiven for thinking/believing/feeling etc sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is easy to understand why someone might think or do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人有某种想法/信念/感受是可以理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could be forgiven for thinking football is a religion here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说足球在这里是种宗教也不为过。

Sense.DEF: if a country or organization forgives a debt, it says that the money does not have to be paid back
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saudi Arabia’s decision to forgive the debt owed by the poorest Islamic countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙特阿拉伯免除最贫困伊斯兰国家债务的决定

Sense.DEF: when someone forgives another person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He never admitted his guilt or asked for forgiveness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不认罪﹐也从不请求宽恕。

Sense.DEF: willing to forgive
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was a kind and forgiving man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲是个善良宽容的人。

Sense.DEF: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to forgo lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得放弃午餐。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
forget

the past participle of
forget
that people have forgotten about or do not pay much attention to
Sense.EXAMPLE: a forgotten corner of the churchyard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂墓地一个被人遗忘的角落

Sense.DEF: a tool you use for picking up and eating food, with a handle and three or four points
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the knives and forks on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把刀叉摆放在桌子上。

Sense.DEF: a garden tool used for digging, with a handle and three or four points
a place where a road, river, or tree divides into two parts, or one of the parts it divides into
Sense.TRAN: 〔路的〕岔口﹔〔河流的〕分流处﹔〔树的〕分杈（处）
Sense.EXAMPLE: the north fork of the Sacramento river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨克拉门托河的北向分流
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the left fork then go straight on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走左边的岔道﹐然后一直往前。

Sense.DEF:
a sudden flash of
lightning
with two or more lines of light

one of the two metal bars between which the front wheel of a bicycle or
motorcycle
is fixed

PIC.HEADING: FORKS 叉
PIC.PICCONTENT: garden fork 园艺叉；fork 餐叉；forked lightning 叉状闪电；a fork in the road 道路岔口；tuning fork 音叉

Sense.DEF: if a road, river etc forks, it divides into two parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The path forked off in two directions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路分岔后通往两个方向。

Sense.DEF: to go left or right when a road divides into two parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fork left at the bottom of the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在山脚的岔口往左拐。

Sense.DEF: to put food into your mouth or onto a plate using a fork

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He forked some bacon into his mouth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叉了几片熏猪肉送进嘴里。

Sense.DEF:
to put
manure
into soil or to move soil around using a large garden fork

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In November, the soil should be forked over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 11月应当翻整土壤。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of money on something, not because you want to but because you have to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to fork out £600 on my car when I had it serviced.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把车送去检修﹐不得不花了600英镑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to have to fork out for an expensive meal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可不想掏钱去吃一顿很贵的饭。

Sense.DEF: to give money to someone or something, or spend money on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arena won’t be finished until private donors fork over more money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育场要等有了更多的私人捐助才能建成。

Sense.DEF: having one end divided into two or more parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snakes have forked tongues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇有叉状的舌头。

Sense.DEF: lightning that looks like a line of light that divides into several smaller lines near the bottom
an amount of food on a fork

GramExa.EXAMPLE: huge forkfuls of food
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一满叉一满叉的食物

Sense.DEF: a vehicle with special equipment on the front for lifting and moving heavy things
Sense.TRAN: 叉车﹐铲车﹐叉式升降装卸车

Sense.DEF:
an
upgrade
to a computer system something done to the computer system that makes it better or able to do more that involves buying a lot of new equipment
Sense.TRAN: 叉车式升级〔一种计算机系统升级方式﹐需要购买大量新设备〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to choose between an expensive forklift upgrade and keeping our old machines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须在花大钱进行叉车式升级和保留旧机器之间作出选择。

Sense.DEF: seeming lonely and unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 孤苦伶仃的﹐愁苦的﹐凄凉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a forlorn figure sitting all by herself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她独自坐着的孤苦身影
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ana sat with a bowed head and spoke in a forlorn voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜低头坐着﹐话音凄凉。

Sense.DEF: a place that is forlorn seems empty and sad, and is often in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house looked old and forlorn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子看上去破旧荒凉。

Sense.DEF: a forlorn hope, attempt, or struggle etc is not going to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the forlorn hope of finding a peace formula
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找和平方案的渺茫希望

Sense.DEF: a particular type of something that exists in many different varieties

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a severe form of cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种严重的癌症
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bicycle is an environment-friendly form of transport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车是一种环保的交通方式。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the art forms of the twentieth century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪的各种艺术形式

Sense.DEF: the way something is or appears to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: We oppose racism in all its forms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们反对各种形式的种族主义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are bombarded with information in the form of TV advertising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们受到大量电视广告信息的狂轰滥炸。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Vitamin C can be taken in capsule or tablet form .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 补充维生素C可以服用胶囊﹐也可以服用片剂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A typical training programme takes the form of a series of workshops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般的培训计划都采用一系列研习班的形式。

Sense.DEF: a shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the shadowy forms of the divers swimming below the boat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜水员在船下游动的模糊身影

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main staircase was in the form of a big ‘S’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主楼梯呈一个大大的S形。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The female form is a thing of beauty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性形体是一种美。

Sense.DEF: an official document with spaces where you write information, especially about yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Application forms are available from the college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可向学院索取申请表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just complete the entry form write the answers to the questions on a form and return it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 填好参赛表格后交回即可。

GramExa.GLOSS: write the answers to the questions on a form
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fill in the form and send it back with your cheque.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 填好表格后连同支票一起寄回。

Sense.DEF: the structure of a work of art or piece of writing, rather than the ideas it expresses, events it describes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the distinction between form and content
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形式与内容的区别

Sense.DEF: how well a sports person, team, musician etc is performing, or has performed recently
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动员﹑运动队﹑乐手等的〕表现﹐状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have been greatly encouraged by the team’s recent form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队近来的表现极大地鼓舞了我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On current form he’s one of the top three players in the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就目前的情况看﹐他是全国选手的前三强。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been in good form all this season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这整个赛季他一直表现良好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had no qualms about dropping players he thought were off form not performing well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不选他认为状态不好的队员﹐他觉得这没什么不对。

Sense.DEF: a class in a school

GramExa.EXAMPLE: examinations taken in the fourth form
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四年级的考试

Sense.DEF: a way of writing or saying a word that shows its number, tense etc. For example, ‘was’ is a past form of the verb ‘to be’.
if someone has form, they are known to the police because they have committed crimes in the past
behaviour that is considered to be socially unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 不合礼节要求的行为﹐不礼貌的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: It used to be considered bad form to talk about money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去﹐谈论金钱被认为是不礼貌的。

Sense.DEF: a way of expressing something official
Sense.EXAMPLE: The precise form of words has been agreed by the 12 heads of government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准确的措辞已经由12名政府首脑商定。

Sense.DEF: to be full of confidence and energy, so that you do something well or talk in an interesting or amusing way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michelle was in great form at last week’s conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔在上星期的会议上状态很好。

Subsense.DEF: to begin to exist or develop
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The womb represents the very first place in which life takes form.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子宫就是生命开始形成的地方。

Subsense.DEF: to start to become a particular shape
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As the men worked, I watched the ship’s hull take form.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人在工作﹐我看着船体逐渐成形。

Sense.DEF: to establish an organization, committee, government etc
Sense.TRAN: 建立﹐组成〔组织﹑委员会﹑政府等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The winning party will form the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获胜的党派将组建政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: CARE was formed in 1946 and helps the poor in 38 countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国援外合作署成立于1946年﹐为38个国家的穷人提供援助。

Sense.DEF: to be the thing, or one of the things, that is part of something else, often having a particular use
Sense.EXAMPLE: Love and trust should form the basis of a marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱和信任应当成为婚姻的基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project forms part of a larger project investigating the history of the cinema.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目是电影史研究这个大项目的一部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river formed a natural boundary between the two countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河成了两国的自然边界。

Sense.DEF: to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过自然过程而〕形成﹐产生
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rocks were formed more than 4,000 million years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些岩石是40多亿年前形成的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By midnight ice was already forming on the roads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了午夜﹐路面已开始结冰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxide combine to form acid rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二氧化硫和氮氧化物结合形成酸雨。

Sense.DEF: to make something by combining two or more parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: In English the past tense of a verb is usually formed by adding ‘ed’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英语中﹐动词的过去式通常是加ed构成。

Sense.DEF: to come together in a particular shape or line, or to make something have a particular shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: Film-goers began to form a line outside the cinema.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来看电影的人在电影院外面排起了长队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut off the corners of the square to form a diamond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切下正方形的四个角形成一个菱形。

Sense.DEF: to establish and develop a relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed incapable of forming any relationships.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎难以与人建立起任何关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On returning to Boston, she formed a close friendship with her aunt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到波士顿﹐她就与婶婶建立起了非常亲密的关系。

Sense.DEF: to use available information to develop or reach an opinion or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: She formed the opinion that one of the pupils was bullying the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得其中一个学生在欺侮另一个学生。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong influence on how someone’s character develops and the type of person they become
Sense.EXAMPLE: Events in early childhood often help to form our personalities in later life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼年时期的经历往往影响到我们后来个性的形成。

Sense.DEF: made or done officially or publicly
Sense.EXAMPLE: formal recognition of the reformed church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认
Sense.EXAMPLE: a formal agreement between the countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间的正式协议
