Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Kelly has lodged a formal complaint against the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯利先生已正式投诉警方。

Sense.DEF: formal behaviour is very polite, and is used in official or important situations, or with people you do not know well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the years, teaching methods have changed and become less formal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几年来﹐教学方法已有所改变﹐不再那么正式了。

Sense.DEF: formal language is used in official or serious situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Yours sincerely’ is a formal way of ending a letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: Yours sincerely（谨上）是一个正式的书信结尾。

Sense.DEF: a formal event is important, and people who go to it wear special clothes and behave very politely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve met her twice but only on formal occasions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我见过她两次﹐但都只是在正式场合。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a formal dinner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式的晚宴

Sense.DEF:
formal dress is clothing such as a
tuxedo
for men or a long dress for women, that is worn to formal events
Sense.EXAMPLE: We insist on formal dress for dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坚持要求穿正装赴晚宴。

Sense.DEF: education etc in a subject or skill, that you receive in a school, college etc rather than practical experience of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: knowledge and wisdom gained from experience rather than from formal education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过经验而不是正规教育得来的知识和智慧

Sense.DEF: done in a very organized way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course includes formal lectures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程包括正式的讲座。

Sense.DEF: a formal garden, park, or room is arranged in a very organized way
Sense.EXAMPLE: the palace’s beautifully restored formal gardens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座宫殿经修复后美丽齐整的花园

Sense.DEF: a dance at which you have to wear formal clothes
an expensive and usually long dress that women wear on formal occasions
a strong-smelling gas that can be mixed with water and used for preserving things such as dead animals to be used in science etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: frogs preserved in formaldehyde
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保存在甲醛中的青蛙

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
formalize
a style or method in art, religion, or science that pays a lot of attention to the rules and correct forms of something, rather than to inner meanings
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术﹑宗教或科学的〕形式主义

Sense.DEF: something that you must do as a formal or official part of an activity or process
Sense.EXAMPLE: the formalities necessary for a valid marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有效婚姻所需的正式手续

Sense.DEF: something you must do even though it has no practical importance or effects

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Getting a gun license here seems to be just a formality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里取得持枪执照似乎只是个形式。

Sense.DEF: careful attention to polite behaviour and language in formal situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is always some degree of formality when one speaks to a stranger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同陌生人说话总得讲点礼节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The loan was arranged with little formality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没说多少客套话就商定了贷款。

Sense.DEF: to make a plan, decision, or idea official, especially by deciding and clearly describing all the details
Sense.TRAN: 使〔计划﹑决定或想法〕正式化﹔使定形﹔使具体化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Final arrangements for the takeover have yet to be formalized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次收购的最后协议还没有正式确定。

Sense.DEF: officially
Sense.EXAMPLE: We announced a decision formally recognizing the new government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们宣布了一个决定﹐正式承认新政府。

Sense.DEF: in a polite way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his hand out formally, and Liza took it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他礼貌地伸出手﹐莉莎握了握。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I apologize, Captain,’ she said formally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我向你道歉﹐队长。”她礼貌地说。

Sense.DEF: the way in which something such as a television show or meeting is organized or arranged
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视节目﹑会议等的〕安排﹐形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: The courses were run to a consistent format.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些课程的编排是有连续性的。

Sense.DEF: the size, shape, design etc, in which something such as a book or magazine is produced
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large-format book for the partially-sighted
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本给弱视者阅读的大开本的书

Sense.DEF: used to talk about video, CD, tape etc when saying what type of equipment it can be played on

to organize the space on a computer
disk
so that information can be stored on it
to arrange the pages of a book or the information on a computer etc into a particular design
Sense.TRAN: 为〔书刊等〕安排版式﹔为…编排格式
Sense.EXAMPLE: better ways to format your spreadsheets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编排电子表格格式的更好方法

Sense.DEF: the process of starting a new organization or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the formation of a new government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新政府的组成

Sense.DEF: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the substances which lead to the formation of ozone
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致臭氧形成的物质

Sense.EXAMPLE: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a group of things are arranged to form a pattern or shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: troop formations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队编队

Sense.DEF: if a group of planes, ships, soldiers etc are moving in formation, they are flying, marching etc in a particular order or pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: a squadron of aircraft, flying in formation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编队飞行的飞行中队

Sense.DEF: rock or cloud that is formed in a particular shape, or the shape in which it is formed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

Sense.DEF: society, politics etc seen as a system of practices and beliefs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marx founded a new science: the science of the history of social formations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思创立了一门新的学科: 社会形态历史学。

Sense.DEF: having an important influence on the way someone or something develops
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人或某事物发展〕有重大影响的

GramExa.GLOSS: the period when someone’s character develops
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He exposed his children to music throughout their formative years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在孩子的个性形成时期让他们接受音乐的熏陶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: International politics were a formative influence on the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际政治对该党具有重大影响。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing before, but not now
Sense.TRAN: 以前〔发生或存在〕的﹐从前的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the former Soviet Union
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前苏联
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

Sense.DEF: having a particular position in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: my former husband
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的前夫
Sense.EXAMPLE: former President Clinton
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前总统克林顿

Sense.DEF: in the past
what someone or something was like before they were changed by age, illness, trouble etc
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物以前的模样〔指与现在经历衰老﹑疾病﹑苦难等后对比〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems more like her former self.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎回到了以前的样子。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be a shadow/ghost of your former self
GramExa.GLOSS: be much less confident, healthy, energetic etc than you used to be
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 不像以前那样﹐远不如以前〔自信﹑健康﹑有活力等〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team’s a shadow of its former self.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队雄风不再。

Sense.DEF: the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这两种可能性中﹐前者似乎更有可能。

Sense.DEF: used in some schools to show which class a student is in, according to how many years they have been in school
Sense.TRAN: 一年级/二年级/六年级等的学生

Sense.DEF: in earlier times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kiribati, formerly known as the Gilbert Islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基里巴斯﹐旧称吉尔伯特群岛
Sense.EXAMPLE: This elegant hotel was formerly a castle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家雅致的酒店以前是座城堡。

Sense.DEF:
strong plastic made in thin sheets, used especially for covering the surfaces of tables and kitchen
counters
Sense.TRAN: 富美家塑料贴面〔尤用于桌面和厨房操作台面〕

Sense.DEF: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢建筑呈灰色﹐气势凛然﹐与漂亮沾不上边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

Sense.DEF: difficult to deal with and needing a lot of effort or skill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the formidable task of local government reorganization
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 重组地方政府的艰巨任务

Sense.DEF: without a definite shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: To the listener, this music is incoherent and formless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于听众来说﹐这个曲子既不连贯又无章法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: formless horrors that await you in the fog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在雾中等待你的无形的恐怖

Sense.DEF: a standard letter that is sent to a number of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔寄给许多人的〕通函﹐印刷函件﹐打印信件

Sense.DEF: the teacher who is responsible for all the students in the same class at a school
a method or set of principles that you use to solve a problem or to make sure that something is successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a formula for the withdrawal of US forces from the area
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美军从该地区撤退的方案

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no magic formula a method that is certain to be successful that will transform sorrow into happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收视人数增加了一百万﹐这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

Sense.DEF: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule
Sense.EXAMPLE: the formula for calculating distance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算距离的公式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sugar is represented by the simple formula CHO.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖以简单的分子式CHO表示。

Sense.DEF:
a list of the substances used to make a medicine,
fuel
, drink etc, showing the amounts of each substance that should be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our products are handmade from traditional formulas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的产品采用传统配方﹐手工制作。

Sense.DEF: a type of car racing, in which the different types are based on the size of the cars’ engines
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛车的〕一级/二级/三级方程式等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Formula One car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一级方程式赛车

Sense.DEF: a type of liquid food for babies that is similar to a woman’s breast milk
a fixed and familiar series of words that seems meaningless or insincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech full of the usual formulas and clichés
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充斥着套话和陈词滥调的演说

Sense.DEF: containing or made from ideas or expressions that have been used many times before and are therefore not very new or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 公式化的﹔充满俗套话的﹔没有独创的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children love jokes and riddles that are heavily formulaic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子喜欢一些充满套语的笑话和谜语。

Sense.DEF: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He formulated Labour Party education policy in 1922.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1922年﹐他制定了工党教育政策。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Darwin formulated the theory of natural selection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文创立了自然选择学说。

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about what to say, and say it clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are studying the situation but have not formulated any response yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在研究形势﹐但尚未考虑好如何回应。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning to have sex with someone who you are not married to - used to show strong disapproval
to leave someone, especially when you should stay because they need you
Sense.EXAMPLE: children forsaken by their parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被父母遗弃的孩子

Sense.DEF: to stop doing, using, or having something that you enjoy
Sense.TRAN: 放弃﹐摒弃﹔戒掉〔喜爱的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She will never forsake her vegetarian principles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绝不会放弃自己的素食主义原则。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place, especially when you do not want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has forsaken his native Finland to live in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开祖国芬兰移居英国。

Sense.DEF: certainly
to stop doing something or promise that you will stop doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are forswearing the use of chemical weapons for any reason.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们保证绝不以任何理由使用化学武器。

Sense.DEF: a strong building or group of buildings used by soldiers or an army for defending an important place
to be something that you do well or are skilled at
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found that running long distances was not his forte .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现长跑并不是他的强项。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a writer, her forte is comedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为作家﹐她的专长是写喜剧。

Sense.DEF: a note or line of music played or sung loudly
Sense.TRAN: 强音﹔用强音演奏[唱出]的一段乐曲

Sense.DEF: played or sung loudly
used to refer to other things of the type you have already mentioned, without actually naming them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She started telling me about her bad back, her migraines, and so forth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始向我诉说她背痛啦﹑偏头痛啦等等。

Sense.DEF: going out from a place or point, and moving forwards or outwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was still burning, pouring forth thick black smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子仍在燃烧﹐冒出浓浓的黑烟。

Sense.DEF: a famous metal railway bridge built in 1889 over the River Forth in Scotland, which is considered to be a fine example of 19th century engineering. People sometimes say that a job is ‘like painting the Forth Bridge’ when they mean that it seems to never end, because the metal bridge takes a long time to paint, and when the job is finished it has to start again.
Sense.TRAN: 福斯桥〔苏格兰福斯河上一座著名钢桥﹐建于1889年﹐被视为19世纪工程设计的典范。人们有时用like painting the Forth Bridge形容某件工作似乎没完没了〕

Sense.DEF: a forthcoming event, meeting etc is one that has been planned to happen soon
Sense.TRAN: 即将到来的﹐即将出现的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the forthcoming elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即将到来的选举
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep an eye on the noticeboards for forthcoming events .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请注意布告牌上的活动预告。

Sense.DEF: willing to give information about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: IBM is usually pretty forthcoming about the markets for its products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: IBM公司一般很乐意透露其产品的市场信息。

Sense.DEF: if something is forthcoming, it is given or offered when needed -often used to say that this does not happen
Sense.TRAN: 可得到的〔常用来表示尚未获取〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When no reply was forthcoming, she wrote again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为没有得到回复﹐于是她再次致信。

Sense.DEF: direct and honest - used in order to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 直率的﹐直截了当的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She answered in her usual forthright manner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以一贯的直率作了回答。

Sense.DEF: immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fined £40, with 28 days’ imprisonment if the money was not produced forthwith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被罚款40英镑﹐如不立即缴付则监禁28天。

Sense.DEF: the process of making something stronger or more effective
towers, walls etc built around a place in order to protect it or defend it
Sense.TRAN: 防御工事〔如塔楼﹑城垣等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a site of ancient fortifications dating from about 500 B.C.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公元前500年左右的一个古代防御工事遗址

Sense.DEF:
wine such as
sherry
or
port
that has strong alcohol added
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town was heavily fortified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇设有重防。

Sense.DEF: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
Sense.TRAN: 激励﹐鼓舞﹔加强 〔态度或感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel physically or mentally stronger
Sense.TRAN: 使…增强体质﹔使…振奋精神

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We fortified ourselves with a breakfast of bacon and eggs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们给自己补充能量﹐早餐吃了熏肉和鸡蛋。

Sense.DEF:
to make food or drinks more healthy by adding
vitamins
to them
Sense.TRAN: 〔加维生素〕强化〔食品或饮料〕﹔提高〔食品或饮料〕的营养价值
Sense.EXAMPLE: fortified breakfast cereals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强化早餐麦片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: foods fortified with vitamin B
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 添加维生素B的食品

Sense.DEF: music that is fortissimo is played or sung very loudly
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐〕非常响的[地]﹔极强的[地]﹔用极强音的[地]

Sense.DEF: courage shown when you are in great pain or experiencing a lot of trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winnie is a woman of quiet fortitude who has endured a lot of suffering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温妮是个坚强寡言的女子﹐她忍受了许多痛苦。

Sense.DEF: people often use the name ‘Fort Knox’ when talking about a place that is extremely well guarded or impossible to enter without permission. It comes from a military building in the US state of Kentucky which holds the government’s store of gold.
Sense.TRAN: 诺克斯堡〔形容戒备森严或不得擅入的地方。 此名源自美国肯塔基州一处存有政府黄金储备的军事建筑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His house is like Fort Knox.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这房子就像诺克斯堡一样密不透风。

Sense.DEF: two weeks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fortnight’s holiday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十四天的假期
Sense.EXAMPLE: in a fortnight’s time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两周后
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fortnight ago
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两周前

Sense.DEF: happening every fortnight or once a fortnight
Sense.TRAN: 两星期一次的[地]﹐每两周的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We used to dread my uncle’s fortnightly visits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过去都很怕叔叔每两周一次的到访。

Sense.DEF: a large strong building used for defending an important place
happening by chance, especially in a way that has a good result
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting with Jack was fortuitous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇到杰克是机缘巧合。

Sense.DEF: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been fortunate to find a career that I love.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是幸运的﹐找到了自己喜欢的职业。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was fortunate enough to obtain a research studentship at Stanford.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真幸运﹐取得了斯坦福大学的研究生奖学金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt fortunate in being able to please herself where she lived.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在自己住的地方能随心所欲﹐她觉得很幸运。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m fortunate that I have such an understanding wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有这样一位通情达理的妻子﹐我很有福气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been more fortunate than a lot of farmers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们比许多农场主幸运多了。

Sense.DEF: a fortunate event is one in which something good happens by chance, especially when this saves you from trouble or danger
Sense.TRAN: 巧合的﹐偶然发生的﹔侥幸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

Sense.DEF: people who are poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should all consider the plight of the less fortunate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都应考虑到穷人的困境。

Sense.DEF: happening because of good luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fortunately, everything worked out all right in the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是﹐最后一切顺利。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say luckily rather than fortunately .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说luckily﹐而不说fortunately
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Luckily , no one was hurt.

Sense.DEF: a very large amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a fortune selling property in Spain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在西班牙卖房产﹐发了大财。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first painting sold for £25, a small fortune then for an art student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一幅画卖了25英镑﹐这在当时对一个学艺术的学生来说是一大笔钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in poverty in 1947, but his art is worth a fortune .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1947年他在贫困中死去﹐但是现在他的美术作品值大钱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carpet must have cost a fortune .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块地毯肯定花了不少钱吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is quite easy to decorate your house without spending a fortune .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不花大钱装修房子也是很容易的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her personal fortune was estimated at £37 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的个人财产估计有3,700万英镑。

Sense.DEF: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

Sense.DEF: the good or bad things that happen in life
Sense.EXAMPLE: a downturn in the company’s fortunes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司运势的衰退
Sense.EXAMPLE: This defeat marked a change in the team’s fortunes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次失败标志着该队开始走下坡路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The geographical position of the frontier fluctuated with the fortunes of war the things that can happen during a war .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边界的地理位置随着战争局势而变动。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone what will happen to them in the future by looking at their hands, using cards etc

a
biscuit
served in Chinese restaurants, containing a piece of paper that says what is supposed to happen to you in the future
Sense.TRAN: 签饼﹐幸运曲奇〔国外的中国餐馆提供的一种小饼﹐内有预测命运的小纸条〕

Sense.DEF: someone who uses cards or looks at people’s hands in order to tell them what is supposed to happen to them in the future
the number 40
the years from 1940 to 1949
Sense.EXAMPLE: The place was built as a casino in the forties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地方建于20世纪40年代﹐起初是一座赌场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spent several years in Paris in the late forties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪40年代末﹐他在巴黎待了几年。

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 40 and 49
Sense.TRAN: 在四十到四十九岁之间﹐是四十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The woman was probably in her mid forties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人可能是45岁左右。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the forties, it is between 40 degrees and 49 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temperature was up in the high forties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度上升到了近50度。

Sense.DEF: the number 45
a small record with one song on each side
a small gun
a very short sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a lot better after I had forty winks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打了个盹儿我感觉好多了。

Sense.DEF: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔让人公开讨论重要话题的〕论坛﹐讨论会﹐电视专题讨论节目

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The journal aims to provide a forum for discussion and debate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份杂志旨在为探讨和辩论提供一个平台。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the new national forum on the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的全国性环境论坛

Sense.DEF:
a group of computer users who are interested in a particular subject and discuss it using
email
or the Internet
a large outdoor public place in ancient Rome used for business and discussion
Sense.TRAN: 〔古罗马城市中用于商业和公共讨论的〕广场

Sense.DEF: towards a place or position that is in front of you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leaned forward , his elbows resting on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体前倾﹐胳膊肘撑在桌子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd surged forwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群向前涌去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took another small step forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又向前走了一小步。

Sense.DEF: towards greater progress, improvement, or development
Sense.EXAMPLE: We agreed that the sensible way forward was for a new company to be formed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一致认为﹐合理的发展方向是成立一家新的公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the Labour Party conference, he stated that we could now go forward as a united party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党大会之后﹐他声明我们现在可以作为一个团结的政党继续发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain is now ready to move forward .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在英国已经准备好前进了。

Sense.DEF: towards the future in a way that is hopeful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt that at last I could begin to look forward .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己终于可以开始向前看了。

Sense.DEF: beginning on that day or at that time
Sense.TRAN: 从那[这]天/那[这]时/那[这]刻等起
Sense.EXAMPLE: They never met again from that day forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那天起﹐他们再也没见过面。

Sense.DEF: to successfully complete one stage of a competition so that you are able to compete in the next stage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan went forward into the next round of the World Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本队进入了世界杯的下一轮比赛。

Sense.DEF:
if you put a clock or a watch forward, you change it so that it shows a later time, for example when the time changes to
british summer time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We put our watches forward by 2 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把手表拨快了两小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clocks go forward this weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个周末时钟要拨快。

Sense.DEF: in or towards the front part of a ship
closer to a person, place, or position that is in front of you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Army roadblocks prevented any further forward movement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有军队的路障﹐不能继续前行了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always enter or leave a helicopter from a forward direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要从正侧方上下直升机。

Sense.DEF: plans, ideas etc that are helpful in a way that prepares you for the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a bit of forward planning we make sure your budget goes as far as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事先稍作计划﹐我们可以保证让你的预算撑得尽可能久。

Sense.DEF: not having made much progress, especially compared to what was expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are no further forward in solving the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们破案没有进展。

Sense.DEF: at or near the front of a ship, vehicle, building etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat in one of the forward sections of the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在火车前部的一节车厢里。

Sense.DEF: too confident and friendly in dealing with people you do not know very well
Sense.TRAN: 〔与不大熟悉的人交往时〕鲁莽的﹔冒失的﹔过分主动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father thinks she’s far too forward for a young girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲觉得﹐对一个年轻女孩来说她太冒失了。

Sense.DEF: to send letters, goods etc to someone when they have moved to a different address
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you make sure that you forward my mail promptly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请您一定及时转寄我的信﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to send letters, information etc to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flight times will be forwarded to you with your travel documentation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航班时间会连同旅行文件一起寄给你。

Sense.DEF: to help something to develop so that it becomes successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good chance to forward my career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 促进我事业发展的一个好机会

Sense.DEF:
an attacking player on a team in sports such as football and
basketball
an address that you leave for someone when you move to a new place so that they can send your letters etc to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did she leave a forwarding address ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她留下转递地址了吗？

Sense.DEF: planning for and thinking about the future in a positive way, especially by being willing to use modern methods or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 向前看的﹔有远见的〔尤指乐意运用现代方法或思想〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a forward-looking Russian statesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位有远见的俄罗斯政治家

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is too confident or friendly

a movement in
gymnastics
in which you roll over forwards onto your back so that your feet go over your head
a line (/) used in writing, to separate words, numbers, or letters
to search for something in a group of things or a container
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fossicked in her bag and took out a notepad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从包里翻找出一本记事本。

Sense.DEF: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock
Sense.EXAMPLE: fossils of early reptiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期爬行动物的化石
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marine sponges have a long fossil record their development has been recorded over a long period .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for an old person
Sense.TRAN: 老古董〔对老年人的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF:
a
fuel
such as coal or oil that is produced by the very gradual decaying of animals or plants over millions of years
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists would like to see fossil fuels replaced by renewable energy sources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护主义者希望看到化石燃料为可再生能源所取代。

Sense.DEF: if people, ideas, systems etc fossilize or are fossilized, they never change or develop, even when there are good reasons why they should change
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most couples, however fossilized their relationship, have some interests in common.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数夫妻﹐不管关系多么僵化﹐都有一些共同的兴趣。

Sense.DEF:
to become or form a
fossil
by being preserved in rock
Sense.EXAMPLE: fossilized dinosaur bones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐龙骨化石

Sense.DEF: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

Sense.DEF: to take someone else’s child into your family for a period of time but without becoming their legal parent
Sense.TRAN: 〔在一段时间内〕抚育﹐代养〔别人的孩子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

Sense.DEF: the people who foster a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is sometimes difficult to find suitable foster parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时很难找到合适的养父母。

Sense.DEF: a child who is fostered
someone who has different parents from you, but who is being brought up in the same family
a private home where a child is fostered

the past tense and past participle of
fight
a foul smell or taste is very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He woke up with a foul taste in his mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他醒过来﹐嘴里一股臭味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pile of foul-smelling garbage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆臭烘烘的垃圾
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put down his mug of foul-tasting coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放下手中一大杯难喝的咖啡。

Sense.DEF: in a very bad temper and likely to get angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The argument with his mother left Putt in a foul mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与母亲争吵后﹐帕特的情绪糟透了。

Sense.DEF: very dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refugees in the camps are short of food and at risk from foul water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营中难民缺少食物﹐还面临水源污染的危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: extractor fans to remove foul air from the tunnel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排出隧道污浊空气的排气扇

Sense.DEF: rude and offensive words
Sense.EXAMPLE: She claimed she had been subjected to abuse and foul language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她声称一直受到虐待和辱骂。

Sense.DEF: foul weather is stormy and windy, with a lot of rain or snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always carry foul weather gear when you go out walking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出去散步一定要携带雨具。

Subsense.DEF: if a sports player fouls another player, they do something that is not allowed by the rules
to hit a ball outside the limit of the playing area in baseball

Sense.DEF: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
Sense.EXAMPLE: rivers and lakes fouled almost beyond recovery by pollutants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被污染物糟蹋得几乎无法恢复的河流与湖泊

Sense.DEF: to do something wrong or spoil something by making mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t afford to foul up this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一次我们再也不能搞砸了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Glen completely fouled up the seating arrangements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格伦把座位安排完全搞乱了。

Sense.DEF: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用废弃物〕把某物弄得很脏
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lit a cigarette and started to foul up the air with stinging yellow smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他点了根烟﹐刺鼻的黄色烟雾开始让空气变得很污浊。

Sense.DEF: an action in a sport that is against the rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛中的〕犯规（动作）﹐违例（行动）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wright was booked for a foul on the goalkeeper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖特对守门员犯规﹐被记名警告。

Sense.DEF: a hit in baseball which goes outside the limits of the playing area
a line marked on a sports field outside of which a ball cannot be legally played
swearing too much
Sense.TRAN: 满口脏话的﹐恶语伤人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry was a nasty foul-mouthed old devil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里是个满口脏话﹑惹人嫌恶的老家伙。

Sense.DEF: if the police think someone’s death was caused by foul play, they think that person was murdered
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police said they had no reason to suspect foul play .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说他们没有理由怀疑是谋杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Detectives have not ruled out foul play .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探没有排除谋杀的可能。

Sense.DEF: an action that is dishonest, unfair, or illegal, especially one that happens during a sports game
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育比赛时的〕犯规动作﹔奸诈的行为﹔犯罪行径

Sense.DEF: a problem caused by a stupid or careless mistake
Sense.TRAN: 〔因蠢行或疏忽引起的〕混乱﹐一团糟
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer system foul-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机系统混乱

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
find
to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money
Sense.TRAN: 创立〔组织﹑公司﹑学校等〕﹔创建〔城市〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州﹐现在是一个世界性的组织。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

Subsense.DEF: to be the main idea, belief etc that something else develops from
Subsense.TRAN: 建立在某事物的基础上
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The British parliamentary system is founded on debate and opposition.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国议会制度的基础是辩论质询。

Subsense.DEF:
to be the solid layer of
cement
, stones etc that a building is built on
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The castle is founded on solid rock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城堡建在坚固的岩石上。

Sense.DEF:
to melt metal and pour it into a
mould a hollow shape
, to make things such as tools and parts for machines

Tail.EXAMPLE: the founding of the University of Chicago

Sense.DEF:
the solid layer of
cement
, bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

Sense.DEF: a basic idea, principle, situation etc that something develops from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All theories should be built on a foundation of factual knowledge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有理论都应当有事实根据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course gives students a solid foundation in the basics of computing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程可为学生掌握计算机基本知识打下坚实的基础。

Sense.DEF:
an organization that gives or collects money to be used for special purposes, especially for
charity
or for medical
research
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Heart Foundation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国心脏病基金会

Sense.DEF: the establishment of an organization, business, school etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school has served the community since its foundation in 1835.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校自1835年建立以来一直为该社区服务。

Sense.DEF: if a statement, idea etc is without foundation, there is no proof that it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Davis dismissed the allegations as being without foundation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯认为这些指控毫无根据。

Sense.DEF: to provide the conditions that will make it possible for something to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Careful planning laid the foundations for the nation’s economic miracle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精心的规划为国家的经济奇迹奠定了基础。

Sense.DEF:
a cream in the same colour as your skin that you put on before the rest of your
make-up
to completely change the way something is done or the way people think by having a completely new idea
Sense.TRAN: 从根本上动摇某事物﹔动摇某事物的基础
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darwin’s theory rocked the scientific establishment to its foundations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文的理论动摇了科学界的根基。

Sense.DEF: a general course of study that introduces students to a subject, and is taught in the first year at some universities in Britain
a large stone that is placed at the base of a new building, usually by an important person as part of a ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物奠基典礼时放置的〕基石﹐奠基石

Sense.DEF: the facts, ideas, principles etc that form the base from which something else develops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greek and Latin were once viewed as the foundation stones of a good education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊语和拉丁语一度被认为是良好教育的基础。

Sense.DEF: someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑组织﹑学校等的〕创立者﹐创办人﹔始创者

Sense.DEF: to fail after a period of time because something has gone wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻在蜜月之后不久便触礁了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The talks foundered on disagreements between the two parties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈因双方意见不合而搁浅。

Sense.DEF: if a ship or boat founders, it fills with water and sinks

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship foundered on the rocks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船触礁沉没。

Sense.DEF: someone who has helped to establish a new organization, club etc and is one of its first members
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织﹑俱乐部等的〕创立者之一﹐创办人之一

Sense.DEF: someone who begins something such as a new way of thinking, or a new organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔新思想或新组织的〕创立人﹐开创者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Saint Basil, one of the founding fathers of the Greek Orthodox Church
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣巴西略﹐希腊正教会的创立人之一

Sense.DEF: a baby who has been left by its parents, and is found and looked after by other people

a place where metals are melted and poured into
mould s hollow shapes
to make parts for machines, tools etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an iron foundry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铸铁厂

Sense.LEXUNIT: the fount of all knowledge/wisdom etc literary
Sense.DEF:
the place, person, idea etc that all knowledge,
wisdom
etc comes from
Sense.TRAN: 一切知识/智慧等的源泉

Sense.DEF: a structure from which water is pushed up into the air, used for example as decoration in a garden or park
a flow of liquid, or of something bright and colourful that goes straight up into the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fountain of blood was pouring from his chest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股鲜血从他胸口喷涌而出。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fountain of sparks shot high into the sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵火花蹿上高空。

Sense.DEF:
a
source
or supply of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a fountain of information on Asian affairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是亚洲事务的信息源。

Sense.DEF: the origin of something
a pen that you fill with ink
the number 4
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is married with four children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已婚﹐有四个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They arrived just after four four o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚过四点钟﹐他们就到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke will soon be four four years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克很快就要四岁了。

Sense.DEF: supporting your body with your hands and knees
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was down on all fours playing with the puppy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他趴在地上跟小狗玩。

Sense.DEF: in groups of four people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boxes were stacked in fours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 箱子四个一组堆在一起。

Sense.DEF:
a hit in
cricket
that scores four
runs
because it goes over the edge of the playing area
a team of four people who row a racing boat, or the boat that they row
Sense.TRAN: 四人赛艇的全体成员﹔四人赛艇

Sense.LEXUNIT: the four corners of the Earth/world
Sense.DEF: places or countries that are very far away from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: People from the four corners of the world have come to Ontario to make it their home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界各地的人都到安大略省来安家。

Sense.DEF:
a vehicle that has four wheels and a
four-wheel drive
four times as much or as many
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fourfold increase in price
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格的四倍上涨
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profits rose fourfold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润上升到原来的四倍。

Sense.DEF:
a
clover
plant that has four leaves instead of the usual three, and is considered to be lucky
Sense.TRAN: 四叶苜蓿﹐四叶草﹐幸运草

Sense.DEF: a word that is considered very rude and offensive, especially one relating to sex or body waste
a bed with four tall posts at the corners, a cover fixed at the top of the posts, and curtains around the sides
Sense.TRAN: 有四根帷柱的床﹐四柱大床

Sense.DEF: a group of four people, especially two men and two women, who come together for a social activity or sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指社交场合或体育活动中二男二女的〕四人一组﹔两对
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim and Tina made up a foursome with Jean and Bruce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆和蒂娜﹑琼和布鲁斯凑成了四人组。

Sense.DEF: a building that is four-square is strongly built and square in shape
firm and determined
if you stand four-square behind someone, you support them completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood four-square behind the Prime Minister in the dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这场纷争中坚定不移地支持首相。

Sense.DEF: firmly and solidly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hut stood four-square in a corner of the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小屋稳稳地坐落在花园一角。

Sense.DEF: a four-star hotel, restaurant etc is of a very high standard
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑餐厅等〕四星级的﹐高级的﹐极好的

Sense.DEF:
a type of petrol with
lead
in it

a
general
of a high rank in the US army

an engine that works with two up and down movements of a
piston
the number 14
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to work fourteen hours a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去一天工作14个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I started playing the guitar when I was fourteen 14 years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我14岁开始弹吉他。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the fourteenth the 14th day of the month .

Sense.DEF: coming after three other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the fourth century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在四世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her fourth birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的四岁生日

Sense.DEF: the fourth thing in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fourth of July
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7月4日

Sense.DEF: ¼; one of four equal parts

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四分之一/四分之三

Sense.DEF:
an expression meaning ‘time’, used especially by scientists and writers of
science fiction
Sense.TRAN: 第四维〔即时间﹐尤为科学家和科幻小说作家所用〕

Sense.DEF: newspapers, news magazines, television and radio news, the people who work for them, and the political influence that they have
Sense.TRAN: 第四等级〔指新闻界及其政治影响〕

Sense.DEF: a national holiday in the US that celebrates the beginning of the United States as a nation
Sense.TRAN: 美国独立纪念日﹐美国国庆〔7月4日〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Fourth of July picnic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国国庆野餐会

Sense.DEF: a system which gives the power of the engine to all four wheels in a vehicle, or a vehicle that has this type of system
Sense.TRAN: 四轮驱动﹔四轮驱动汽车

Sense.DEF: a bird, such as a chicken, that is kept for its meat and eggs, or the meat of this type of bird
any bird
a wild animal like a dog with reddish-brown fur, a pointed face, and a thick tail
someone who is clever and good at deceiving people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a sly old fox.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个狡猾的老狐狸。

Sense.DEF: the skin and fur of a fox, used to make clothes
someone who is sexually attractive
to be too difficult for someone to do or understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were foxed by the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被这个问题难住了。

Sense.DEF: to confuse or deceive someone in a clever way
a tall plant with many bell-shaped flowers
a hole in the ground that soldiers use to fire from or hide from the enemy
a hole in the ground where a fox lives
a dog with a very good sense of smell, trained to hunt and kill foxes

the sport of hunting
fox
es with dogs while riding on a horse
a small dog with short hair
a formal dance which combines short quick steps with long slow steps, or a piece of music for this dance
sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foxy lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妖艳媚人的女子

Sense.DEF:
like a
fox
in appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a foxy face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张狐狸脸

Sense.DEF: skilful at deceiving people
a room or hall at the entrance to a public building
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共建筑物入口处的〕休息厅﹐门厅

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店/剧院/电影院等门厅

Sense.DEF: a small room or hall at the entrance to a house or apartment
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋或公寓入口处的〕前厅﹐门厅
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= field post office or 或 fleet post office , used as part of the address of someone in the American navy or army 战地邮局﹔舰队邮局〔用于美国陆军或海军地址〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Father , used before the name of a priest 神父〔用于教士的姓名前〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= franc 法郎
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= French 法国的﹔法国人的﹔法语的﹔法国人﹔法语
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= France 法国

Sense.DEF: a short noisy fight involving several peo ple
Sense.TRAN: 〔多人参与的〕喧闹的打架﹐殴斗骚乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eight people were injured in the fracas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八人在打斗中受伤。

Sense.DEF: a pattern, usually produced by a computer, that is made by repeating the same shape many times in smaller and smaller sizes
a very small amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She paused for a fraction of a second.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她略微停顿了一下。

Sense.DEF: a part of a whole number in mathematics, such as ½ or ¾
very small in amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fractional increase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微升
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fractional hesitation before he said yes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说“是”之前的略微犹豫

Sense.DEF: happening or done in a series of steps
relating to fractions, in mathematics
someone who is fractious becomes angry very easily
Sense.TRAN: 烦躁的﹔易怒的﹔易发脾气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children become fractious when they are tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子累了就容易发脾气。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烦躁易怒的婴儿/小孩等

Sense.DEF: if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks
Sense.EXAMPLE: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fractured his right leg during training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在训练时摔断了右腿。

Sense.DEF: if a group, country etc fractures, or if it is fractured, it divides into parts in an unfriendly way because of disagreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opposition has been fractured by bitter disputes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党因为激烈的纠纷闹得分崩离析。

Sense.DEF: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stress fracture in his left knee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他左膝上的应力性骨折
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hairline fracture very thin crack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细小的裂缝

Sense.DEF: broken or cracked

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She suffered a fractured skull in the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在事故中颅骨骨折。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fractured shoulder
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨折的肩部

Sense.DEF:
a
grenade
that explodes into very small pieces
easily broken or damaged
Sense.TRAN: 脆弱的﹐易碎的﹐易损坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful with that vase – it’s very fragile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心那只花瓶——很容易打碎的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fragile bones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脆弱的骨头

Sense.DEF: a fragile situation is one that is weak or uncertain, and likely to become worse under pressure
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s fragile economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国脆弱的经济
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relations between the two countries are in a fragile state .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国关系脆弱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the party’s fragile unity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党不堪一击的团结

Sense.DEF: a weak physical condition because of illness
thin and delicate
Sense.EXAMPLE: fragile beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纤美

Sense.DEF: if someone feels fragile they feel ill, especially because they have drunk too much alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 有气无力的﹔虚弱的﹔〔尤指喝太多酒后〕精神不振的

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
Sense.EXAMPLE: glass fragments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃碎片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fragments of broken pottery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶器碎片

Sense.DEF: to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dangers of fragmenting the Health Service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健服务分崩离析的危险

Sense.DEF: consisting of many different small parts
Sense.TRAN: 碎片的﹔片断的﹔不完整的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fragmentary account
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零星的叙述

Sense.DEF: a pleasant smell

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rich fragrance of a garden flower
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种庭院花卉的馥郁芳香

Sense.DEF: a liquid that you put on your body to make it smell pleasant
having a pleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: fragrant flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芳香的花朵

Sense.DEF: someone who is frail is weak and thin because they are old or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔因年老或生病而〕瘦弱的﹐虚弱的﹐衰弱的
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年老体衰者
Sense.EXAMPLE: her frail health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虚弱的身体

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘦弱的身体/虚弱的体格
心理脆弱的/身体衰弱的

Sense.DEF: something that is frail is easily damaged or broken
Sense.TRAN: 不坚实的﹐不牢固的﹐易损坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed impossible that these frail boats could survive in such a storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些单薄的小船看样子经不起这样的狂风暴雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s frail economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国疲弱的经济

Sense.DEF: the lack of strength or health

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the frailty of her thin body
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她瘦弱的身体

Sense.DEF: something bad or weak in your character
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人性的弱点

Sense.DEF: a structure made of wood, metal, plastic etc that surrounds something such as a picture or window, and holds it in place
Sense.EXAMPLE: They removed the picture from its wooden frame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把画从木镜框中取下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门框/窗框/画框

Sense.DEF: the structure or main supporting parts of a piece of furniture, vehicle, or other object
Sense.TRAN: 〔家具﹑车辆或其他物体的〕构架﹐骨架﹐支架
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bicycle frame
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车车架
Sense.EXAMPLE: the frame of the chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 椅子架

Sense.DEF: the general shape formed by the bones of someone’s body

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大的/瘦的/瘦小的等骨架

Sense.DEF:
the metal or plastic part of a pair of
glasses
that holds the
lenses
the main ideas, facts etc that something is based on
Sense.EXAMPLE: A clear explanation of the subject provides a frame on which a deeper understanding can be built.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对主题的明确阐述为深入理解提供了一个框架。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some comments may or may not be understood as harassment, depending on your frame of reference knowledge and beliefs that influence the way you think .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些话可以理解为骚扰﹐也可以不被理解为骚扰﹐这取决于你的判断标准。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in/out of the frame (for sth)
Sense.DEF: to have or not have the chance to take part in something
Sense.TRAN: 有可能参加/不参加（某事）
Sense.SYN: be in/out of the running (for sth)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool are in the frame for a place in the Cup Final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦队有望进入足总杯决赛。

Sense.DEF: an area of film that contains one photograph, or one of the series of separate photographs that make up a film or video

a complete part in the games of
snooker
or
bowling
Sense.TRAN: 〔斯诺克或保龄球的〕一轮﹐一局﹐一个回合
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won the next three frames.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赢了之后的三局。

Sense.DEF:
one of the areas into which a
webpage
is divided
to surround something with something else so that it looks attractive or can be seen clearly
Sense.TRAN: 围住﹐框住〔因而使某物显得漂亮或清晰〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah’s face was framed by her long dark hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉长长的黑发衬着她的脸庞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood there, framed against the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在那儿﹐背景是门道。

Sense.DEF: to put a picture in a structure that will hold it firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to get the picture framed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算去给这幅画装上画框。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a framed photograph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装入相框的照片

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make someone seem guilty of a crime when they are not guilty, by lying to the police or in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Needham’s lawyers claimed that he had been framed by the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼达姆的律师称他是被警察诬陷的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two men were framed for murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名男子被诬陷杀人。

Sense.DEF: to carefully plan the way you are going to ask a question, make a statement etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wondered how she was going to frame the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知道如何提出这个问题。

Sense.DEF: to organize and develop a plan, system etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

Sense.DEF: having a frame or frames of a particular colour or material
Sense.EXAMPLE: wire-framed spectacles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属丝框的眼镜

Sense.DEF: a plan to make someone seem guilty of a crime which they did not do
a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This paper provides a framework for future research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇论文为今后的研究提供了一个框架。

Sense.DEF: the structure of a society, a legal or political system etc
Sense.TRAN: 社会/法律/政治等的框架
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

Sense.DEF: the main supporting parts of a building, vehicle, or object
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑车辆或物体的〕构架﹐框架﹐结构
Sense.EXAMPLE: the metal framework of the roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶的金属框架

Sense.DEF:
the standard unit of money in various countries, and used in France and Belgium before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 法郎〔一些国家的标准货币单位﹐法国和比利时等国家使用欧元之前的货币单位也为法郎〕

Subsense.DEF: permission given by a company to someone who wants to sell its goods or services
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a franchise holder
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特许经营权持有人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a franchise agreement
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特许经营协议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The beer is brewed under franchise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种啤酒根据特许经营权酿造。

Subsense.DEF: a business, shop etc that is run under a franchise
Subsense.TRAN: 获特许经营权的企业[商店]

Sense.DEF: a professional sports team
the legal right to vote in your country’s elections
to give or sell a franchise to someone
Sense.TRAN: 给予…特许经营权﹐向…出售特许经营权

Sense.DEF: someone who is given or sold a franchise to sell a company’s goods or services
a company that sells a franchise
Sense.TRAN: 出售特许经营权的公司

Sense.DEF: relating to France
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Francophile someone who loves France
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲法分子

Sense.DEF: French and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Franco-Belgian border
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法比边界

Sense.DEF: having French as a first or main language

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法语国家/社区

Sense.DEF: a mixture of the French and English languages
honest and truthful
Sense.TRAN: 坦率的﹐坦诚的﹐直言不讳的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was completely frank with her about what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于发生的一切﹐他都对她坦言相告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was quite frank about the whole thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对整件事直言不讳。
坦诚的讨论/访谈/意见交换等

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to say something that is true, but which other people may not like
Sense.EXAMPLE: To be perfectly frank, I think it’s a bad idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老实说﹐我认为这个主意不好。

Sense.DEF: to print a sign on an envelope showing that the cost of sending it has been paid
Sense.TRAN: 在〔信封〕上盖邮资已付戳记

Sense.DEF: a frankfurter

food that has been produced by plants that were
genetically modified
- used when you disapprove of this process

a novel by Mary Shelley which was
published
in 1818 and tells the story of a scientist called Frankenstein who makes a creature by joining together bits of dead bodies and then brings it to life by passing an electric current through its body. The creature is gentle at first, but later becomes violent and attacks its maker. People sometimes mistakenly call the creature Frankenstein, instead of the scientist who made it. The story is very popular and has been made into many films.
Sense.TRAN: 《科学怪人》〔玛丽•雪莱创作于1818年的小说〕

Sense.DEF:
a long reddish smoked
sausage
a substance that is burnt to give a sweet smell, especially at religious ceremonies

a machine used by businesses that puts a mark on letters and packages to show that
postage
has been paid
Sense.TRAN: 〔在信封上盖戳记表示邮资已付的〕邮资机

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are saying what you really think about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frankly, I think the Internet is overrated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦率地说﹐我认为因特网被高估了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His behaviour was frankly disgraceful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为老实说是可耻的。

Sense.DEF: honestly and directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She answered all our questions frankly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坦率地回答了我们所有的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nicholas frankly admitted that the report was a pack of lies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼古拉斯坦率地承认﹐报道全是谎言。

Sense.DEF: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔因极端焦急和恐惧而〕发疯似的﹔情绪失控的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was still no news of Jill, and her parents were getting frantic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍然没有吉尔的消息﹐她的父母急得要疯了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your mother’s been frantic with worry wondering where you’ve been.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的母亲不知道你去了哪里﹐担心得要发疯了。

Sense.DEF: extremely hurried and using a lot of energy, but not very organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent three frantic days trying to get everything ready.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了三天时间手忙脚乱地做准备。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite our frantic efforts, we were unable to save the boy’s life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我们拼命努力﹐还是无法挽回小男孩的生命。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a frantic rush to escape from the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们四处狂奔﹐想要逃离大楼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a day of frantic activity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 忙乱的一天
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a frantic search for her father
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疯狂地搜寻她的父亲

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He frantically searched for the key.

Sense.DEF:
a
fraternity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frat boy member of a fraternity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔大学〕男生联谊会〔兄弟会〕成员

Sense.DEF: showing a special friendliness to other people because you share interests or ideas with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔对志同道合的人〕友好的﹐亲如手足的
Sense.EXAMPLE: fraternal solidarity amongst union members
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会成员兄弟般的团结

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 兄弟会组织﹐共济会

Sense.DEF: relating to brothers
Sense.EXAMPLE: fraternal loyalty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兄弟之间的忠义

Sense.DEF: one of two children born at the same time to the same mother, who developed from different eggs rather than from the same egg, and who do not look alike
Sense.TRAN: 异卵双胞胎之一〔外貌不相似〕

Sense.DEF: all the people who work in a particular profession or share a particular interest
Sense.TRAN: 教育界同仁/科学界同仁/犯罪团伙等

Sense.DEF: a club at an American college or university that has only male members
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国大学里的〕男生联谊会﹐兄弟会

Sense.DEF: a feeling of friendship between members of a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔团体成员间的〕情谊﹐兄弟般的友谊
Sense.EXAMPLE: fraternity between nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国与国之间的情谊

Sense.DEF: to be friendly with someone, especially if you have been ordered not to be friendly with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指违反禁令与某人〕交好﹐亲善

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The troops were forbidden to fraternize with the enemy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队严禁亲敌。

Sense.DEF: a fratricidal war or struggle is one in which people kill members of their own society or group
the crime of murdering your brother or sister
the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been charged with tax fraud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控骗税。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举欺诈
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was found guilty of fraud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被判犯有诈骗罪。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is not what it is claimed to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt like a fraud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉像个骗子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police exposed the letter as a fraud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方揭露那封信是骗局。

Sense.DEF: someone who has committed a fraud
intended to deceive people in an illegal way, in order to gain money, power etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fraudulent insurance claim
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欺诈性保险索赔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fraudulent statement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骗人的声明

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欺诈活动/行为

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was accused of fraudulently using a stolen credit card.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控盗用偷来的信用卡。

Sense.DEF: full of problems etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their marriage has been fraught with difficulties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻困难重重。

Sense.DEF: full of anxiety or worry
Sense.TRAN: 焦虑不安的﹔非常紧张的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fraught atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 焦虑的氛围
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fraught situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人担心的形势
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie sounded rather fraught.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉的语气显得颇为忧虑。

Sense.DEF: if cloth or other material frays, or if something frays it, the threads become loose because the material is old
Sense.EXAMPLE: The collar had started to fray on Ed’s coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德外套的领子开始出现了磨损。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had frayed the bottom of his jeans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的牛仔裤裤脚已经磨破了。

PIC.HEADING: FRAY 磨损
PIC.PICCONTENT: frayed jeans 磨毛牛仔裤

Sense.DEF: if someone’s temper or nerves fray, or if something frays them, they become annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tempers soon began to fray .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火气很快就上来了。

Sense.DEF: an argument or fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three civilians were injured during the fray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个平民在冲突中受伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He launched himself into the fray.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冲上前去一起打。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other soldiers quickly joined the fray, launching missile attacks in the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他士兵也立即加入战斗﹐在城里发起导弹袭击。

Sense.DEF: to be completely burnt
to feel very tired and anxious
feeling tired and anxious, for example after a journey or because you are very busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting left me feeling completely frazzled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会开得我精疲力竭﹑烦躁不安。

Sense.DEF: someone who is extremely interested in a particular subject so that other people think they are strange or unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fitness freak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健身迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: a religious freak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教狂热分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer freak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机迷

Sense.DEF: someone who is considered to be very strange because of the way they look, behave, or think
Sense.EXAMPLE: These glasses make me look like a freak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我戴这副眼镜看上去像个怪人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women who studied engineering used to be considered freaks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学工程的女性过去常被视为怪物。

Sense.DEF: someone who always wants to control situations and other people
something in nature that is very unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Due to some freak of nature, it snowed in June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天生异象﹐6月里下起了雪。

Sense.DEF: an unexpected and very unusual event
Sense.EXAMPLE: By some freak of fate, he walked away from the crash completely unhurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在命运的奇特安排下﹐他在车祸中毫发无损。
Sense.EXAMPLE: April’s sales figures were a freak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月份的销售额一反常态。

Sense.DEF: unexpected and very unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a freak result
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反常的结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was crushed to death in a freak accident .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一场离奇的事故中被压死了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men drowned when a freak wave sank their boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突如其来的海浪打沉了那些人的船﹐他们都淹死了。

Sense.DEF: to become suddenly angry or afraid, especially so that you cannot control your behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Ben heard about the accident, he just freaked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本一听说出事便大惊失色。

Sense.DEF: to become very anxious, upset or afraid, or make someone very anxious, upset or afraid
Sense.TRAN: （使）产生强烈反应﹔（使）心烦意乱﹔（使）吓得要死
Sense.EXAMPLE: People just freaked out when they heard the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到这个消息﹐民众反应激烈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole idea freaked me out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个想法把我吓得半死。

Sense.DEF: very unusual and strange, and sometimes frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: freakish weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反常的天气

Sense.DEF: strange or unusual and a bit frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie was kind of freaky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片有点古怪吓人。

Sense.DEF: freckles are small brown spots on someone’s skin, especially on their face, which the sun can cause to increase in number and become darker
having freckles

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长雀斑的脸/皮肤

Sense.DEF: something that is free does not cost you any money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Admission is free for children under 9.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 九岁以下儿童免费入场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All students are offered free accommodation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有学生都免费住宿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send for our free information pack for more details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知详情﹐请来函索取我们的免费信息包。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a special free gift with this month’s magazine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本月杂志附赠特别礼物。

Sense.DEF: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew he could be free in as little as three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道只要再过三年他就能自由了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With one leap he was free!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一跳他就自由了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked out of the courtroom a free man .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从法庭走出来﹐成了自由人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们呼吁政府释放所有政治犯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判无罪﹐当庭释放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些动物可以在公园里自由奔跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of dogs roam free on the streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成百上千条狗在街上随意游荡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She broke free from her attacker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挣脱了袭击她的人。

Sense.DEF: allowed to do or say whatever you want, or allowed to happen, without being controlled or restricted by anyone or anything
Sense.TRAN: 能随心所欲的﹐不受限制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a free and open discussion about religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就宗教问题进行了一场自由﹑公开的讨论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Remember, you are free to say no.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐你是可以说不的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Newspapers today are entirely free from government control.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的报纸完全不受政府控制。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Women are struggling to break free from tradition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女在努力挣脱传统的束缚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I longed to be free of my family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我渴望从家庭中解脱出来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He became president following the country’s first free elections last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年该国首次举行自由选举之后﹐他当上了总统。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would all support the principle of free speech .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们全都支持言论自由的原则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the first time in its history, the country has a free press .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国有史以来第一次有了新闻自由。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patients are now allowed free access to their medical records.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人现在可以随意查阅自己的病历。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The legislation will allow the free movement of goods through all the countries in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项立法将允许货物在所有欧洲国家间自由流通。

Sense.DEF: if you are free, or have some free time, you have no work, and nothing else that you must do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m free next weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个周末我有空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you free for lunch tomorrow?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你明天有空吃午饭吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last I was free to concentrate on my own research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于有空集中精力进行自己的研究了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t got a free day this week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个礼拜我一天空闲都没有。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Children these days have very little free time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的孩子很少有空闲时间。

Sense.DEF: something that is free is available to use because it is not already being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is this seat free?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个座位空着吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid we don’t have any free tables this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕今天晚上我们这里没有空桌了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used his free hand to open the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用空着的手去开门。

Sense.DEF: not suffering from something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last she was free of pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的疼痛终于消失了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of the patients are now free from symptoms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多患者现在症状都消失了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stress-free life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有压力的生活

Sense.DEF: not containing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All our drinks are free from artificial colourings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的饮料都不含人工色素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fat-free yoghurt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱脂酸奶

Sense.DEF: if something is free of tax, you do not have to pay tax on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This income should be free of tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项收入应当是免税的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tax-free earnings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 免税的收入
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an opportunity to buy duty-free goods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买免税商品的机会

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they can do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feel free to ask questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请随便提问吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I use your bathroom?’ ‘Yes, feel free.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以用一下你的衞生间吗？”“可以﹐请随便。”

Sense.DEF: relaxed, friendly, and without many rules
Sense.TRAN: 无拘束的﹐随便的﹔不拘礼节的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that life wasn’t going to be so free and easy now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道现在生活不再那样自由自在了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the free and easy atmosphere of university life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学生活无拘无束的气氛

Sense.DEF: someone who lives as they want to rather than in the way that society considers normal
to let someone do whatever they want or need to do in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The producer was given a free rein with the script.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制片人可自由处理剧本。

Variant.LEXVAR: there’s no such thing as a free lunch

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not expect to get something good without having to pay for it or make any effort
used, usually humorously, to say that you are or should be allowed to do something, after someone has said that you should not do it
Sense.TRAN: 这是个自由的国家〔一般作幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a free country. You can’t stop me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个自由的国家﹐你阻止不了我的。

Sense.DEF: to get something without paying for it or working for it, because other people are paying or working for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are encouraging all workers to join the union rather than just taking a free ride on those who do join.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们鼓励所有工人加入工会﹐而不是坐享其成。

Sense.DEF: to be very generous with something
Sense.TRAN: 慷慨使用某物﹔随意给予某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to be very free with other people’s money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用起别人的钱来似乎很大方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is always free with her advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是慷慨提出建议。

Sense.DEF: to use something that belongs to someone else when you should not
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that they had been making free with our food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他们一直随便拿我们的食物吃。

Sense.DEF: something that is free is not held, blocked, or restricted
Sense.EXAMPLE: We opened both doors to allow a free flow of air through the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把两扇门都打开﹐让空气在室内自由流通。

Sense.DEF: a free chemical substance is not combined with any other substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: the amount of free oxygen in the atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大气中游离氧的含量

Exponent.DEF: something that is free does not cost you any money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parking is free after 6 pm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午6点之后停车免费。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were giving away free tickets for the concert.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在发放免费的音乐会门票。

Exponent.DEF: without having to pay for something that you would normally have to pay for
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He offered to fix the car for nothing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主动提出免费修车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children under five can see the show for free.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 五岁以下儿童免费观看表演。

Exponent.DEF: if a shop or company provides an additional service at no extra cost, they do it without asking you for any more money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The shop will install the cooker for you at no extra cost.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店会来安装炉具﹐不额外收费。

Exponent.DEF: free – use this about things that a company, theatre, hotel etc gives people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔公司﹑剧院﹑酒店等〕馈赠的﹐免费供应的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Honeymooners receive a complimentary bottle of champagne in their hotel room.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜月夫妇可在酒店客房获赠一瓶香槟。

Exponent.DEF: if food or drinks are on the house, the owner of a bar or restaurant says you do not have to pay for them
Exponent.TRAN: 由〔酒吧或餐厅〕付费,免费招待
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These drinks are on the house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些酒水免单。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to leave prison or somewhere they have been kept as a prisoner
Sense.EXAMPLE: He expects to be freed quite soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他预计很快就能获释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The terrorists have at last agreed to free the hostages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子终于同意释放人质。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was freed from prison last week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上周获释出狱。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to say and do what they want, after controlling or restricting them in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The press has now been freed from political control.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界现在已经摆脱了政治的控制。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She longed to be freed of her responsibilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她渴望能卸下肩上的责任。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Art frees the imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术可以释放想象力。

Sense.DEF: to move someone or something so that they are no longer held, fixed, or trapped
Sense.EXAMPLE: He struggled to free himself, but the ropes were too tight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挣扎着想脱身﹐但是绳子太紧了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t free the safety catch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拉不开保险栓。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the victims have now been freed from the wreckage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已从残骸中救出所有受害者。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone suffering from something by removing it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new drugs that can free people from pain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的止痛药
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last the country has been freed from its enormous debts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国最后被免除了巨额债务。

Sense.DEF: to make something available so that it can be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to free up some of the disk space on my computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要在我电脑上释放出一些磁盘空间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This should free some money for investment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样应该能腾出一些钱来用于投资。

Sense.DEF: to give someone time to do something by taking away other jobs that they have to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Taking away the burden of administration will free teachers to concentrate on teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解除教师的行政负担可以让他们有时间集中精力来教学。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have freed up some staff to deal with the backlog of work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已腾出一些员工来处理积压的工作。

Sense.DEF: without payment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children under four can travel free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四岁以下儿童免费乘坐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can get advice free from your local library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可向当地图书馆免费咨询。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He offered to do the work for free.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主动提出无偿做这项工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All these services are available to the public free of charge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些服务均向公众免费提供。

Sense.DEF: not fixed or held in a particular place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ropes were now hanging free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绳索现在松垂着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gold chain swung free around his neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条金项链在他脖子上松松地晃荡着。

Sense.DEF:
a
free transfer
; the process by which a player moves from one football club to another, but the new club does not pay any money for him
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got Kevin on a free from Manchester United.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文是从曼联队自由转会到我们这里的。

Sense.DEF: without something that you do not want
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trouble-free journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无忧无虑的旅行
Sense.EXAMPLE: duty-free cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免税香烟
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salt-free diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无盐饮食
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live in the house rent-free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住这房子是免租金的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not responsible to anyone else and can do what they want
very informal and relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the free-and-easy atmosphere of the local pub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地小酒馆里无拘无束的氛围

Sense.DEF:
to smoke a pure form of the illegal drug
cocaine
something that you are given free, usually by a company
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常由公司分发的〕免费物﹐赠品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company paid for the minister to fly out to Australia on a freebie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司出资供该大臣免费飞往澳大利亚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A waiter was handing round freebie glasses of wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务生在分发免费葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: someone who joins in a war in order to steal other people’s goods and money
not born as a slave
Sense.TRAN: 生来自由的﹐生为自由民的

Sense.DEF:
talks between
trade unions
and employers about pay or working conditions that are not controlled by law
the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: People here like their freedom and privacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rights and freedoms of citizens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公民的权利与自由

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We do not have the freedom to do just what we like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不可以随心所欲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the freedom to vote
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举自由

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tighter security measures are restricting our freedom of movement the right to travel .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 更为严苛的安全措施限制了我们的行动自由。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The First Amendment guarantees freedom of expression .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《第一修正案》保障了言论自由。

Sense.DEF: the state of being free and allowed to do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wheelchair gives him the freedom to go out on his own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮椅使他能够随意独自外出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tracksuits are designed to give you freedom of movement the ability to move your body freely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动服的设计是要让人穿着能够活动自如。

Sense.DEF: the state of being free because you are not in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoner was recaptured after only 48 hours of freedom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名囚犯才自由了48小时就被抓了回去。

Sense.DEF: the state of not being affected by something that makes you worried, unhappy, afraid etc
Sense.TRAN: 从某事物中摆脱﹐不受某事物之苦

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The contraceptive pill gave women freedom from the fear of pregnancy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 避孕药使女性无需担心怀孕。

Sense.DEF: the right or ability to choose whatever you want to do or have
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new satellite TV channels offer viewers greater freedom of choice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的卫星电视频道让观众有了更多的选择。

Sense.DEF: the legal right of people in some countries to see information which the government has about people and organizations
in Britain, an honour given by a city to someone who has done something special
Sense.TRAN: 荣誉市民 〔英国颁给有特殊贡献的市民的荣誉〕

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Riding a motorbike gives me a feeling of total freedom.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑摩托车给我一种自由无羁的感觉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Teachers are given considerable freedom to choose their teaching methods.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师有相当大的自由来选择教学方法。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our personal freedom is being restricted more and more.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的个人自由受到越来越多的限制。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: freedom to have any political/religious beliefs
freedom to teach or study any ideas

Collocate.COLLOC: have the freedom to do sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have the freedom to travel nearly anywhere in the world.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界各地我们几乎想去都能去。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Filmmakers today enjoy more freedom than in the past.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今电影制片人享有的自由比过去多。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The student movement played an important role in the struggle for political freedom.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生运动在争取政治自由的斗争中起了重要作用。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the legal right to say what you want
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We will defend freedom of speech and oppose censorship.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将捍卫言论自由﹐反对审查制度。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the right to hold/practise any religious belief
the right of people to meet as a group for a particular purpose
the right of newspapers to publish what they like, free from political control

Sense.DEF: someone who fights in a war against an unfair or dishonest government, army etc
the principle and practice of allowing private business to operate without much government control

the movement of someone or something through the air without engine power, for example before a
parachute
opens after someone has jumped out of a plane

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The spacecraft is now in free fall towards the Earth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航天器现在向地球自由下落。

Sense.DEF: a very fast and uncontrolled fall in the value of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the free-fall in housing prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价暴跌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy is in free fall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济一路下滑。

Sense.DEF: not connected to or influenced by anything
Sense.TRAN: 自由浮动的﹐无联系的﹐不受影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a free-floating exchange rate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由浮动汇率
Sense.EXAMPLE: a free-floating currency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由浮动货币

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
freephone
a situation in which there is total freedom and anything can happen - used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: the free-for-all of sexual activity in the 1970s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70年代的性放纵

Sense.DEF: a noisy quarrel or fight involving a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: A controversial penalty decision sparked a free-for-all at the end of the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 终场前一个有争议的判罚引起了一场混战。

Sense.DEF: freeform music or art does not have a standard structure or form, and uses new ideas or methods
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐或艺术〕独创的﹐不按传统形式的

Sense.DEF: drawn by hand without using any special tools
when you completely own a building or piece of land for an unlimited time
Sense.EXAMPLE: They bought the freehold of their house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们买下了房子的自由保有权。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The property will be sold freehold.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 此处房产出售自由保有权。

Sense.DEF: an owner of freehold land or property

in Britain, a
pub
that can buy beer from different
breweries a company that makes beer etc
, rather than being controlled by one brewery
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国可出售各种品牌啤酒的〕自由酒吧﹐自由酒馆

Sense.DEF:
a chance for a player on one football team to kick the ball freely from a position shown by the
referee
, given because the other team has done something wrong
working independently for different companies rather than being employed by one particular company
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works freelance from home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在家做自由职业者。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 自由新闻工作者/撰稿人/摄影师等

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He’s freelancing for several translation agencies.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是多家翻译机构的自由译者。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes food, drink, or other things from other people, without giving anything in return - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 吃白食的人﹔占便宜的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the practice or principle of having sex with people without being faithful to one person or without being married
Sense.TRAN: 自由性爱﹔自由性爱主义

Sense.DEF: without anyone stopping or limiting something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s first freely elected president
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国首位自由选举产生的总统
Sense.EXAMPLE: EU members are allowed to travel freely between member states.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟成员国国民可以在成员国之间自由旅行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In France he could write freely, without fear of arrest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法国﹐他可以自由写作而不必担心被捕。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We went outside so that we could talk freely without being overheard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走到外面﹐这样就可以自由畅谈而不会被人听到。

Sense.DEF: if something moves freely, it moves smoothly and nothing prevents it from doing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was breathing freely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呼吸顺畅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If your muscles are tense, blood cannot circulate freely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果肌肉紧张﹐血液就不能畅通地循环。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The injury prevented him from moving freely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次受伤使他不能活动自如。

Sense.DEF: very easy to obtain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Information is freely available on the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网上信息唾手可得。

Sense.DEF: to agree that something is true, even though telling the truth is difficult or embarrassing
Sense.EXAMPLE: They freely admitted using the drug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坦率地承认吸毒。

Sense.DEF: generously and willingly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave freely to charity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她慷慨捐献善款。
