Sense.DEF: someone who is not a slave
an economic system in which prices are not controlled by the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: a free market economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由市场经济

Sense.DEF: someone who thinks that prices should be allowed to rise and fall naturally and should not be fixed by the government
a man who belongs to a secret society in which each member helps the other members to become successful
the system and practices of Freemasons
a freemium service is a service, for example on the Internet, with a basic level that is free and a better level that people can choose to pay for – used in business
Sense.TRAN: 〔因特网服务等〕免费加增值的〔指基础功能免费﹑增值功能收费﹐用于商业〕

Sense.DEF: the official act of forgiving someone for a crime
a period of time in a school day when a student does not have a class
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校里的〕自由课﹐自习课﹐空课时

Sense.DEF: an arrangement by which a company or organization pays the cost of telephone calls made to it
Sense.TRAN: 免费电话﹐对方付费电话〔由接电话的公司或机构支付电话费的办法〕

Sense.DEF: a port or airport in one country where goods from other countries can be brought in and taken out without being taxed
an arrangement by which a company or organization pays the cost of letters that you send to it by post
Sense.TRAN: 免费邮递﹐收件方付资邮递〔由收信的公司或机构支付邮资的邮递方式〕

Sense.DEF:
an atom or group of atoms with at least one free
electron
, which combines with other atoms very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is thought that free radicals can damage cells.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由基被认为会破坏细胞。

Sense.DEF: relating to a type of farming which allows animals such as chickens and pigs to move around and eat naturally, rather than being kept in a restricted space
Sense.EXAMPLE: free-range eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 散养蛋

Sense.DEF: the sport of running through city streets and jumping between buildings
a plant with pleasant-smelling yellow, white, pink, or purple flowers
not fixed to a frame, wall, or other support
Sense.EXAMPLE: a freestanding bookcase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立式书架

Sense.DEF: able to exist on its own and not as part of something bigger
Sense.EXAMPLE: The modules can be offered as freestanding courses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些单元可以独立开课。

Sense.DEF:
a swimming race in which swimmers can use any style they choose, usually
crawl
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 100m freestyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 100米自由泳

Sense.DEF: a sports competition in which competitors can use any movements they choose
Sense.EXAMPLE: freestyle wrestling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由式摔跤

Sense.DEF:
a
rap
song in which the singer says words directly from their imagination, without planning or writing them first
someone who has their own opinions, ideas, and beliefs, rather than accepting other people’s - used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 思想自由的人﹐自由思想家〔含褒义〕

Sense.DEF: free-to-air television or television programmes do not cost extra money to watch
Sense.EXAMPLE: free-to-air television coverage of rugby league matches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可免费收看的橄榄球联盟赛电视转播

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the goods coming into or going out of a country are not controlled or taxed

poetry that does not have a fixed structure and does not
rhyme
a situation in which members of the British parliament can choose how to vote rather than following the choice of their political party
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国议会中不必依从所属政党意愿的〕自由投票

Sense.DEF: free computer software, often available on the Internet
a very wide road in the US, built for fast travel
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Central Freeway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央高速公路

Sense.DEF: to ride a bicycle or drive a vehicle down a hill, without using power from your legs or the engine
Sense.TRAN: 〔骑自行车或开汽车下坡时〕滑行

Sense.DEF: not worried about rules or what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 随心所欲的﹔自由放纵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the girls envied me my independent, freewheeling life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女孩羡慕我这种随心所欲的独立生活。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth of your own free will
Sense.DEF: to do something because you want to, not because someone else has forced you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came of his own free will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是自愿来的。

Sense.DEF: the ability to make your own decisions about what to do, rather than being controlled by God or Fate
if a liquid or something wet freezes or is frozen, it becomes hard and solid because the temperature is very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake had frozen overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖上一夜之间就结了冰。

Sense.DEF: to preserve food for a long time by keeping it at a very low temperature, or to be preserved in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll freeze that extra meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想把多余的肉冷冻起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tomatoes don’t freeze well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 番茄不宜冷冻。

Sense.DEF: if a machine, engine, pipe etc freezes, the liquid inside it becomes solid with cold, so that it does not work properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water pipes have frozen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水管已经冻住了。

Sense.DEF:
if it freezes outside, the temperature falls to or below
freezing point
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think it’ll freeze tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得今晚会上冻吗？

Sense.DEF: to feel very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: I nearly froze to death watching that football match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看那场足球赛差点把我冻死了。

Sense.DEF: if a government or company freezes wages, prices etc, they do not increase them for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has been forced to cut spending and freeze public-sector wages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府只得削减开支﹐冻结公营部门的工资。

Sense.DEF: to legally prevent money in a bank from being spent, property from being sold etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court froze their assets .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院冻结了他们的资产。

Sense.DEF: to stop moving suddenly and stay completely still and quiet
Sense.EXAMPLE: I froze and listened; someone was in my apartment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然停下来仔细听: 有人在我的公寓里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She froze with horror .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吓呆了。

Sense.DEF: to stop a film or video in order to be able to look at a particular part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He froze the picture on the screen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把屏幕上的画面定格。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is very frightened or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 某人血液凝固〔指十分惊恐〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard his scream and felt my blood freeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到他的尖叫声﹐我觉得自己血液都凝固了。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately prevent someone from being involved in something, by making it difficult for them, being unkind to them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did you freeze me out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们为什么排挤我？

Sense.DEF: if an area or pool of water freezes over, its surface turns into ice
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake has frozen over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖面全结冰了。

Sense.DEF: if a machine, engine, or pipe freezes up, the liquid inside becomes solid with cold so that it does not work properly
to suddenly be unable to speak or act normally
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t know what to say. I’d just freeze up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道说什么好﹐整个人呆住了。

Sense.DEF: a time when people are not allowed to increase prices or pay

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a freeze on pay rises
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冻结加薪

Sense.DEF: the stopping of some activity or process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government have imposed a freeze on civil service appointments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对公务员实行了人事冻结。

Sense.DEF: a period of extremely cold weather
a short period of time, especially at night, when the temperature is extremely low
freeze-dried food has been frozen and dried very quickly in order to preserve it
when you stop the action on a video at one particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press the freeze-frame button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按下定格按钮。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment in which food can be stored at very low temperatures for a long time

a part of a
fridge
in which food can be stored at very low temperatures for a long time

a part of a
fridge
in which food can be stored at very low temperatures for a long time
above or below the temperature at which water freezes
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was well below freezing last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚气温降到了零下好几度。

Sense.DEF: extremely cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s freezing in this house. Can’t I turn on the heating?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里冷极了﹐我不可以开暖气吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were freezing cold in the tent last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们在帐篷里都冻僵了。

Sense.DEF: below the temperature at which water turns to ice
Sense.EXAMPLE: freezing fog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰雾

Sense.DEF: the temperature at which water turns into ice
the temperature at which a particular liquid freezes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alcohol has a lower freezing point than water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精的凝固点比水低。

Sense.DEF: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods
Sense.TRAN: 〔船﹑火车或飞机运载的〕货物﹔货运
Sense.EXAMPLE: freight services
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货运公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll send your personal belongings by air freight and your furniture by sea freight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送﹐家具将以海运方式运送。

Sense.DEF:
a
freight train
to send goods by air, sea, or train
Sense.TRAN: 〔用飞机﹑轮船或火车〕运送﹐托运〔货物〕

Sense.DEF: part of a train which carries goods
a ship or aircraft that carries goods
a train that carries goods
relating to France, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 法国的﹔法国人的﹔法语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an excellent French wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上等的法国葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: people from France
the language used in France, and some other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you ask for directions in French?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用法语怎么问路？

Sense.DEF: used to say sorry for swearing
Sense.TRAN: 原谅我的粗话﹐请原谅我言辞不恭

Sense.DEF: a long thin green vegetable that is usually cooked and eaten whole

a long thin
loaf
of white bread

a mixture of oil and
vinegar
that is put on
salads
Sense.TRAN: 〔用油和醋调制成的〕法式色拉调料

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of potato that has been cooked in hot oil

a musical instrument made of
brass
, that is curved round into a circle with a wide opening at one end
a kiss made with your mouths open and with your tongues touching
Sense.TRAN: 〔舌头和舌头接触的〕法式接吻

Sense.DEF:
a
condom

a long thin
loaf
of white bread
Sense.TRAN: 法式长棍﹐法式长条面包

Sense.DEF: a man from France

a hairstyle in which the hair is put into a
plait
that starts from the top of the head at the back
a hairstyle in which the hair is combed across at the back of the head, rolled under, and pinned
a clear liquid put on wooden furniture to protect it and make it shine

a long thin
loaf
of white bread
Sense.TRAN: 法式长棍﹐法式长条面包

Sense.DEF: pieces of bread put into a mixture of egg and milk and then cooked in hot oil

a pair of doors made mostly of glass, usually opening onto a garden or
balcony
a woman from France
someone who you have a friendly relationship with but is really an enemy or competitor
Sense.TRAN: 友敌〔指实际上是敌人或竞争对手的朋友〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office is full of frenemies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里许多人既是朋友﹐又是竞争对手。

Sense.DEF: frenetic activity is fast and not very organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rushes from job to job at a frenetic pace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发疯似的不停地跳槽。

Sense.DEF: frenzied activity is fast and uncontrolled, usually because it is done by someone feeling very anxious or excited
Sense.TRAN: 狂乱的﹔疯狂的﹔异常激动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A woman was stabbed to death in a frenzied attack on her home tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚一名女子在家中遭遇疯狂袭击﹐被刺身亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: frenzied efforts to find a solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻求解决办法的疯狂努力

Sense.DEF: a state of great anxiety or excitement, in which you cannot control your behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a frenzy of religious feeling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂热的宗教情感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The women were screaming and in a frenzy to get home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些女人尖叫着﹐拼命地往家赶。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doreen had worked herself into a frenzy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多琳一阵狂怒。

Sense.DEF: a time when people do a lot of things very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a frenzy of activity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵忙乱的活动

Sense.EXAMPLE: a selling frenzy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抛售

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when a lot of people get involved in an activity in an uncontrolled way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film put America’s moviegoers into a feeding frenzy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片在美国影迷中掀起了一阵热潮。

Subsense.DEF:
an occasion when a lot of wild animals, especially
sharks
, eat something in a very excited way

Sense.DEF: the number of times that something happens within a particular period of time or within a particular group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the frequency of serious road accidents
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the higher frequency of diabetes in older people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人中较高的糖尿病发病率

Sense.EXAMPLE: Side effects from prescribed drugs are being reported with increasing frequency more and more often .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处方药的副作用正越来越频繁地被报道出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The relative frequency of fraternal twins has halved since 1950.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自1950年以来﹐异卵双胞胎的相对出生率下降了一半。

Sense.DEF: the fact that something happens a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

Sense.DEF: the number of radio waves, sound waves etc that pass any point per second
Sense.EXAMPLE: This station broadcasts on three different frequencies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家电台以三种不同的频率广播。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dolphins produce a high frequency sound.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚发出的声音频率很高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the frequency range of the human ear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人耳听得见的频率范围

Sense.DEF: happening or doing something often

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her headaches are becoming less frequent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头痛发作得越来越少了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车频频驶过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是家里的常客。

Sense.DEF: to go to a particular place often
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bar was frequented by actors from the nearby theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒吧常有附近剧院的演员光顾。

Sense.DEF: very often or many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was frequently drunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常喝醉。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something often happens, or that something happens a lot , rather than say it happens frequently .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说something often happens或something happens a lot﹐而不说it happens frequently
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I often see him. OR 或 I see him a lot .

Sense.DEF:
a painting made on a wall while the
plaster
is still wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔在湿灰泥墙面上画的〕湿壁画

Sense.DEF: adding to or replacing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just make some fresh coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来重新煮点咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report provides fresh evidence about the way the business was run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告提供了有关该公司运营方式的新证据。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to start again on a fresh sheet of paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得拿张新的纸重新开始。

Sense.DEF: good or interesting because it has not been done, seen etc before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ryan will bring a fresh approach to the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞安将带来一种新的工作方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need some fresh ideas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一些新的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s take a fresh look at the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们换个角度来看这个问题吧。

Sense.DEF: done, experienced, or having happened recently
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were fresh fox tracks around the hen huts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡窝周围有狐狸刚刚留下的足迹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident was still fresh in her mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这起事故她仍然记忆犹新。

Sense.DEF: when you start something again in a completely new and different way after being unsuccessful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope Jim and I can get back together and make a fresh start .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望吉姆和我能够复合﹐重新开始。

Subsense.DEF: fresh food has recently been picked or prepared, and is not frozen or preserved

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The beans are fresh from the garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些豆子是刚从园子里摘来的。

Subsense.DEF: fresh flowers have recently been picked

Sense.DEF: air from outside, especially clean air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s open the windows and have some fresh air in here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打开窗户﹐来点新鲜空气吧！

Sense.DEF: fresh water contains no salt and comes from rivers and lakes
pleasantly clean or cool
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fresh minty taste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清新的薄荷味
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a light, fresh wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是种清淡的葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: pleasant, bright, and clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen is decorated in fresh blues and greens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉刷厨房用的是明快的蓝色和绿色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has brown hair, hazel eyes and a fresh complexion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一头棕发﹐绿褐色的眼睛﹐气色很好。

Sense.DEF: if the wind is fresh, it is quite cold and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fresh breeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清凉的微风

Sense.DEF: full of energy because you are not tired
Sense.TRAN: 精神饱满的﹐精力充沛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always seems fresh and lively, even at the end of the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去总是精力充沛﹑生气勃勃的﹐即使一天下来也是如此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite his busy day he arrived looking as fresh as a daisy not tired and ready to do things .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管忙了一天﹐他到的时候仍然神采奕奕。

Subsense.DEF: having just finished your education or training, and not having a lot of experience
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s fresh out of law school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚从法学院毕业。

Subsense.DEF: having just come from a particular place or experience
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The team is fresh from their victory over the French.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队刚战胜法国队。

Sense.DEF: to behave rudely in a way which shows sexual interest, or lack of respect
Sense.TRAN: 对异性放肆﹔对某人无礼

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the freshness of the early morning
the freshness and vitality of youth

Sense.DEF: recently made, cut etc
Sense.TRAN: 新做的/新切的/现磨的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: fresh-ground coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新磨的咖啡

Sense.DEF: to have just used your last supplies of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m fresh out of beer. Will you take a cola instead?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啤酒刚喝没了﹐可乐你要吗？

Sense.DEF: to make something look or feel clean, new, attractive, cool etc
Sense.TRAN: 使干净﹔使面目一新﹔使吸引人﹔使清新
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to buy some white paint to freshen up the bathroom walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备买些白色涂料把浴室墙面重新刷一下。

Sense.DEF: if the wind freshens, it gets colder and stronger
to add more liquid to a drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waitress freshened our coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女招待给我们续了咖啡。

Sense.DEF: to wash your hands and face in order to feel clean and comfortable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fiona’s gone to freshen herself up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲奥娜去梳洗打扮了。

Sense.DEF: a student who has just started at a college or university
fresh-faced people have a face that looks young and healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fresh-faced youth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝气蓬勃的年轻人

Sense.DEF: recently ground, picked etc
Sense.TRAN: 新磨的/新摘的/新做的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: freshly ground pepper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现磨的胡椒粉

Sense.DEF:
a student in the first year of
high school
or university
having water that contains no salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: freshwater lakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡水湖

Sense.DEF: living in water that contains no salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: freshwater crabs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡水蟹

Sense.DEF: to worry about something, especially when there is no need
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t fret – everything will be all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心——一切都会好的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s always fretting about the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是为孩子发愁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: men of fifty, fretting that they’re no longer young
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因不再年轻而烦恼的50岁男人

Sense.DEF:
one of the raised lines on the fretboard of a
guitar
etc
Sense.TRAN: 品〔吉他等乐器指板上凸起的细条〕

Sense.DEF:
the long piece of wood on the
neck straight part
of a
guitar
against which the fingers press the strings to change the note
Sense.TRAN: 指板〔弹吉他时手指按压的部分〕

Sense.DEF: anxious and complaining, and unable to relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child was tired and fretful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这孩子累了﹐很烦躁。

Sense.DEF: a tool for cutting patterns in wood
cut or shaped into complicated patterns as decoration
Sense.TRAN: 刻成[形成]回纹[万字]图案的

Sense.DEF: patterns cut into thin wood, metal etc or the activity of making these patterns
Sense.TRAN: 回纹格子细工（工序）﹐万字浮雕细工（工序）

Sense.DEF: relating to Sigmund Freud’s ideas about the way the mind works, and the way it can be studied
Sense.TRAN: 弗洛伊德学说的﹔与弗洛伊德学说有关的

Sense.DEF: a Freudian remark or action is connected with the ideas about sex that people have in their minds but do not usually talk about
Sense.TRAN: 〔言语或行动〕与性压抑有关的

Sense.DEF: something you say that is different from what you intended to say, and shows your true thoughts
Sense.TRAN: 〔泄露真实想法的〕漏嘴﹐口误﹐失言
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Friday 星期五

Sense.DEF: friable rocks or soil are easily broken into very small pieces or into powder
a member of a religious group of Catholic men, who travelled around in the past teaching about Christianity and who were very poor
Sense.TRAN: 〔古时天主教的〕托钵修士﹐云游传道修士

Sense.DEF: a place where friars live
food consisting of small pieces of meat in a thick white sauce
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken fricassee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原汁煨鸡块

Sense.DEF: a sound, such as /f/ or /z/, made by forcing your breath through a narrow opening between your lips and teeth, or your tongue and teeth
disagreement, angry feelings, or unfriendliness between people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Having my mother living with us causes friction at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈和我们一起住就会给家里造成矛盾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the usual frictions between parents and their teenage children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长和十几岁的孩子之间常见的摩擦

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His independent attitude was a constant source of friction with his boss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他我行我素的做派一直是他与老板不合的根源。

Sense.DEF: the natural force that prevents one surface from sliding easily over another surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Putting oil on both surfaces reduces friction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两面都上油可减小摩擦力。

Sense.DEF: when one surface rubs against another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要经常检查绳索﹐因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

Sense.DEF: the day between Thursday and Saturday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s Kate’s birthday on Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五是凯特的生日。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Diane won’t be here Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五黛安娜不来这里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you meet me Friday morning?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五上午你可以和我碰个头吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a terrible time last Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周五我过得糟透了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re flying to Vienna this Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个礼拜五我们要坐飞机去维也纳。

GramExa.GLOSS: Friday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her appointment is next Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的预约在下周五。

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Fridays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We got married on a Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们结婚是在一个星期五。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, used for keeping food and drinks cool

a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, of which one part is a fridge and one part is a
freezer
Sense.TRAN: 〔有冷藏室和冷冻室的〕电冰箱

Sense.DEF:
a
magnet
with a picture on it or in an interesting shape, used for decorating the outside of a
fridge
having been cooked in hot oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: fried chicken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸鸡

Sense.DEF: unable to think clearly, because you are tired, anxious etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: My brain is just totally fried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脑子里乱得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: someone who you know and like very much and enjoy spending time with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jerry, this is my friend Sue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里﹐这是我的朋友休。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always out with her friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她常同朋友们一起出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of her closest friends died at the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的一位密友周末过世了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met Jim through a friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经一位朋友介绍﹐我认识了吉姆。

Sense.DEF: to be someone’s friend
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been friends with the Murkets for twenty years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和穆尔克特一家是20年的老朋友。

Subsense.DEF: to become friendly with people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jenny has always found it easy to make friends at school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮在学校总是很容易交上朋友。

Subsense.DEF: to become friendly with someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He made friends with an old fisherman.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和一位老渔夫交上了朋友。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not having a romantic relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going out with Nathan – we’re just good friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有与内森约会——我们只是好朋友。

Sense.DEF:
someone who supports an organization such as a theatre,
art gallery
,
charity
etc by giving money or help

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Friends of the Tate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰特美术馆赞助团

Sense.DEF: someone who has the same beliefs, wants to achieve the same things etc as you, and will support you
Sense.EXAMPLE: our friends and allies around the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在世界各地的盟友
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shot him a quick glance as if unsure whether he was friend or foe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迅速地扫了他一眼﹐似乎不能肯定他是朋友还是敌人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, you’re among friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐这些都是自己人。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has created a link with you on a
social networking site
on the Internet, by visiting your
webpage
and clicking on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has thousands of friends on MySpace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在聚友网上有数千个好友。

Subsense.DEF: used by a member of parliament when speaking about another member of parliament
Subsense.TRAN: 我尊敬的朋友〔议会议员间的称呼〕

Subsense.DEF: used by a lawyer when speaking about another lawyer in a court of law
Subsense.TRAN: 我博学的同仁〔法庭上律师间的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: to not like or be a supporter of something
Sense.TRAN: 反对某事物﹐不赞成某事物﹐不支持某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m no friend of socialism, as you know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道﹐我不支持社会主义。

Sense.DEF: a member of the Society of Friends
used humorously to talk about someone you do not know, who is doing something annoying
Sense.TRAN: 我们的/你们的那位朋友〔幽默用法﹐指你不认识的﹑惹人厌烦的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our friend with the loud voice is back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的那位大嗓门朋友回来了。

Sense.DEF: to know important people who can help you
Sense.TRAN: 有大人物帮忙﹐有贵人相助

Sense.DEF: someone who helps you when you need it

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the friend you like the most
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fiona was her best friend.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲奥娜曾是她最好的朋友。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one of the friends you like the most
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s a good friend of mine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我的好朋友。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a friend who is very important to you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d like you to meet a dear friend of mine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 来认识一下我的一位亲爱的朋友。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who has been your friend for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We went to see some old friends who had moved to Harlow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去看望几个搬到哈洛的老朋友。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who was your friend when you were a child
someone who is a friend of both you and someone else
a friend you like a lot and intend to keep

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Suzie has plenty of friends.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏齐有很多朋友。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Liz and Vanessa soon became friends.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹和瓦妮莎很快成了朋友。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have remained friends ever since.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 此后他们一直是朋友。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 我的/你的/比尔的等朋友
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A friend of mine is going to Tokyo next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一个朋友下周去东京。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I managed to get tickets from a friend of a friend.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从朋友的朋友那里弄到了一些票。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the friends sb has

Exponent.DEF: someone who you know and like very much and enjoy spending time with
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s going to Palm Springs with some friends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将和几个朋友去棕榈泉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Amy’s a close friend of mine .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米是我的一位密友。

Exponent.DEF: someone who you know and see sometimes, but who is not one of your close friends
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We borrowed the money from one of Paul’s business acquaintances.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从保罗生意上的一个熟人那里借了一笔钱。

Exponent.DEF: a friend – used especially about boys or men
Exponent.TRAN: 朋友﹐伙伴〔尤指男孩或男人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He always goes to the pub with his mates on Friday night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 周五晚上﹐他常同朋友一起去小酒馆。

Exponent.DEF: a friend – used especially about men or young people
Exponent.TRAN: 朋友﹐伙伴〔尤指男人或年轻人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s out playing basketball with some of his high school buddies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在外面跟几个中学里的朋友打篮球。

Exponent.DEF: a friend – pal sounds rather old-fashioned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They met at school and have remained close pals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在读书的时候认识﹐之后一直是亲密的朋友。

Exponent.DEF: a friend – used about powerful people who will help each other even if it is slightly dishonest
Exponent.TRAN: 朋友〔指会以不诚实手段相互帮忙的权贵〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the President’s cronies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是总统的一个亲信。

Exponent.DEF: someone who spends time with you, doing the same things as you – used about animals as well as people
Exponent.TRAN: 同伴﹐伴侣〔既可指人,也可指动物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: travelling companions
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅伴
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His dog was his constant companion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的狗时时刻刻陪伴着他。

Exponent.DEF: a woman’s female friends
a man’s male friends
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a night out with the lads
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 与几个哥们儿外出的一夜

Sense.DEF:
to add someone to your list of friends on a
social networking site
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never friend someone I haven’t met in real life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不加没见过面的人为好友。

Sense.DEF: having no friends and no one to help you
behaving towards someone in a way that shows you like them and are ready to talk to them or help them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a friendly smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲切的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve found a great pub – good beer and a friendly atmosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找到了一家很棒的酒馆——啤酒好﹐氛围也亲切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why is he suddenly so friendly towards you, Charlotte?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么他突然对你那么友好﹐夏洛特？

Sense.DEF: to be friends with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Betty’s very friendly with the Jacksons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂同杰克逊一家人非常要好。

Sense.DEF: not at war with your own country, or not opposing you
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家之间的关系〕友好的﹐非敌对的
Sense.EXAMPLE: friendly nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 友好国家

Sense.DEF: a friendly game is played for pleasure or practice, and not because it is important to win
Sense.EXAMPLE: a friendly match against AC Milan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与AC米兰队的友谊赛

Sense.DEF: not difficult for particular people to understand or use
Sense.TRAN: 用户/客户友好的﹐方便用户/客户的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a user-friendly computer program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用户易操作的电脑程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: a customer-friendly shopping mall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方便顾客的购物广场

Sense.DEF:
not harmful to the environment,
ozone layer
etc
Sense.TRAN: 对环境无害的/不破坏臭氧层的/环保的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: eco-friendly washing powder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保型洗衣粉

Sense.DEF: bombs, bullets etc that accidentally kill people who are fighting on the same side
Sense.TRAN: 误杀自己人的火力[炮火]

Exponent.DEF: behaving towards someone in a way that shows you like them and are ready to talk to them or help them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a friendly smile
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 友好的微笑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The local people are very friendly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人很友好。

Exponent.DEF: friendly and caring about other people, in a way that makes people like you and feel comfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was such a warm caring person and everyone loved him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为人热情体贴﹐大家都喜欢他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We received a very warm welcome .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们受到了热烈的欢迎。

Exponent.DEF: friendly and kind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Chris is a nice guy. I’m sure you’ll get on with him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯人不错﹐我敢肯定你会和他相处得好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t very nice to the other children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对其他孩子不是很友善。

Exponent.DEF: friendly and easy to like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tom was an amiable young man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆是个和蔼可亲的年轻人。

Exponent.DEF: friendly to someone who has just arrived somewhere
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a welcoming smile
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热情的微笑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The group are very welcoming to new members.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个团体相当欢迎新成员。

Exponent.DEF: friendly and eager to make visitors comfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I found Japanese people to be very hospitable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得日本人很好客。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a cheerful and friendly way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a genial host
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 友好的主人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was in a genial mood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心情愉快。

Exponent.DEF: friendly and polite but formal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two nations have always maintained cordial relations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国一直保持着友好的关系。

Exponent.DEF: friendly and easy to talk to – used especially about people in important positions
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指身处要职的人〕友善的﹐易攀谈的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The head teacher is very approachable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长很平易近人。

Sense.DEF: a game played for pleasure or practice, and not because it is important to win
an association in Britain that people regularly pay small amounts of money to, which then provides them with money when they become old or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕互济会﹐互助会﹐互助储金会

Sense.DEF: a relationship between friends

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The friendship between father and youth deepened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父子之间的友谊加深了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his friendship with Sam
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与萨姆的友谊

Sense.EXAMPLE: her close friendship with her aunt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与姑母的亲密友谊
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lifelong friendship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一生的友谊
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two boys formed a deep and lasting friendship .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个男孩子建立了深厚持久的友谊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He and Bob struck up a friendship began to be friends .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和鲍勃交了朋友。

Sense.DEF: the feelings and behaviour that exist between friends
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could always rely on Gary for friendship and support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是可以依靠加里的友情和支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Indians have extended the hand of friendship shown that they want to be friends with another country .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度人伸出了友谊之手。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
fryer
long thin pieces of potato that have been cooked in hot oil
a type of cow that is black and white
Sense.TRAN: 霍斯坦种乳牛﹐黑白花乳牛﹐荷兰牛

Sense.DEF: a decoration that goes along the top of the walls of a room or a building
Sense.TRAN: 〔墙壁顶部沿边的〕横条装饰﹐雕带﹐饰带

Sense.DEF: a small fast ship used especially for protecting other ships in wars
used to emphasize something you are saying when you are angry, annoyed etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t open the frigging door!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打不开这该死的门！

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling of fear
Sense.EXAMPLE: You gave me such a fright creeping up on me like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这样不声不响地过来﹐吓了我一跳！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got an awful fright when I realised how much money I owed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道自己欠了那么多钱﹐我吓了一大跳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was shaking with fright.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吓得发抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several of the children cried out in fright.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个孩子吓得大哭了起来。

Sense.DEF: to be very afraid of something, especially so that you run away from it or do not do something that you were going to do
Sense.TRAN: 受惊吓〔尤指因而逃走或未做计划的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bird took fright and flew away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿受了惊吓﹐飞走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had promised to marry him, but took fright at the last moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她答应嫁给他﹐但是到了最后一刻又畏缩了。

Sense.DEF: to look untidy or unattractive
to make someone feel afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t stand so near the edge! You’re frightening me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was frightened by the anger in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers used to frighten me, but not now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑过去让我感到害怕﹐但现在不了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: frighten sb to death/frighten the life out of sb
GramExa.GLOSS: make someone feel extremely afraid
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He drove at a speed which frightened Lara to death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车的速度把拉拉吓得要死。

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal go away by making them feel afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terrorist activity in the area has frightened most tourists away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的恐怖活动已经把大多数游客都吓走了。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something by making them afraid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He frightened me into staying silent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吓唬我要我保持沉默。

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal so nervous or afraid that they go away or do not do something they were going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The investors were frightened off by the company’s low profits that year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者被该公司当年的低利润吓跑了。

Sense.DEF: feeling afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be frightened. We’re not going to hurt you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别害怕﹐我们不会伤害你的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was frightened of being left by myself in the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我害怕一个人被留在屋里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her father had an awful temper and she was always frightened of him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爸爸脾气坏﹐她向来怕他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy was frightened to speak.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男孩子不敢说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s frightened that her ex-husband will find her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怕前夫会找到她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: To tell the truth, I was frightened to death very frightened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐我怕得要命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frightened horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹受惊的马
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse frightened, which describes a feeling, and frightening, which describes something that makes you feel frightened. 不要混淆frightened和frightening﹐前者形容感觉﹐后者形容令人害怕的事物: a frightened child 一个受了惊吓的小孩 | a frightening experience 一次可怕的经历

Exponent.DEF: feeling worried because you might get hurt or because something bad might happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was too frightened to say anything.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我害怕得一句话也说不出。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many animals are frightened of fireworks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多动物害怕烟火。

Exponent.DEF: frightened. Scared is less formal than frightened and is the usual word to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 害怕的〔较frightened随意﹐为日常英语中常用词〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m scared of dogs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怕狗。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Old people are too scared to go out of their homes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人害怕走出家门。

Exponent.DEF: frightened. Afraid sounds more formal than frightened or scared .
Exponent.TRAN: 害怕的〔听上去比frightened和scared正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children are often afraid of the dark.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子常常怕黑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was afraid that I might say the wrong thing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怕说错话。

Exponent.DEF: frightened and worried that something bad might happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was alarmed at the thought of performing in front of an audience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要在观众面前表演﹐她便慌了起来。

Exponent.DEF: frightened that something bad might happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They are fearful of another terrorist attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们担心再次发生恐怖袭击。

Exponent.DEF: very frightened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looked terrified as the plane took off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机起飞时他看起来很害怕。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: James was absolutely terrified of losing his only child.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯极其害怕失去自己唯一的孩子。

Exponent.DEF: very frightened – used especially when you are so frightened that you cannot think or move
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s absolutely petrified of spiders.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到蜘蛛她会吓得无法动弹。

Exponent.DEF: very frightened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to make a speech, and I was scared stiff.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因为要发言心里怕得要命。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was scared to death of her father.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怕父亲怕得要命。

Exponent.DEF: if you do something in terror, you do it because you are very frightened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People fled in terror as the building went up in flames.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼着了火﹐人们惊恐地逃走。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do what you want by threatening them
making you feel afraid or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 令人害怕的﹐吓人的﹐可怕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Going into hospital can be very frightening for a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去医院对小孩子来说可能是很可怕的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the most frightening experience of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我一生中最可怕的经历。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s frightening to think what could happen if terrorists did get hold of nuclear materials.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦恐怖分子拥有核原料﹐其后果简直不敢想象。

Exponent.DEF: making you feel frightened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Being held at gunpoint had been the most frightening moment of his life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 被人用枪指着是他这辈子最可怕的一刻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The experience was very frightening.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次经历很可怕。

Exponent.DEF: frightening. Scary is less formal than frightening and is very common in everyday En-glish.
Exponent.TRAN: 吓人的〔较frightening随意﹐日常英语中很常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The movie was really scary.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片很恐怖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were some scary moments.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些时候很吓人。

Exponent.DEF: frightening, especially because violence, cruelty, or danger is involved
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因涉及暴力﹑残酷或危险〕令人毛骨悚然的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a chilling tale of revenge, murder and madness
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于复仇﹑谋杀和疯狂的恐怖故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court heard chilling details about the attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭听取了那次袭击案中令人毛骨悚然的细节。

Exponent.DEF: frightening and strange, especially because something involves ghosts or powers that people do not understand
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因涉及鬼魂或人们无法理解的力量〕阴森恐怖的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The forest is really spooky in the dark.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑暗中﹐那片森林实在是阴森吓人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spooky coincidence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 离奇的巧合
Exponent.EXAMPLE: spooky stories
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖故事

Exponent.DEF: frightening in a way that makes you feel nervous, especially when you are not sure exactly why – used especially about places, people, and feelings
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指地方﹑人或感觉在原因不明的情况下〕令人毛骨悚然的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This place is really creepy. Let’s get out of here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方真让人毛骨悚然﹐我们出去吧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a creepy guy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖的家伙

Exponent.DEF: strange and frightening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was an eerie silence immediately after the bomb went off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹爆炸后随即是一片恐怖的寂静。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an eerie light
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 诡异的光
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an eerie feeling
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐惧的感觉

Exponent.DEF: making you feel frightened, nervous, or lacking in confidence
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Big schools can be an intimidating place for young children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 太大的学校对孩子来说可能会是个吓人的地方。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Giving evidence in court is often a rather intimidating experience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出庭作证往往是相当令人畏怯的经历。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the intimidating presence of a large number of soldiers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群士兵气势汹汹的出现

Exponent.DEF: frightening because you think someone is going to hurt you, even though they have not said or done anything violent – used especially about someone’s expression or voice
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指某人的表情或声音〕恐吓的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The woman had a very menacing look.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女人一副凶巴巴的样子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I’d like to have a word with you outside,’ he said in a menacing tone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “出来和我说句话。”他语带威胁地说。

Section.SECHEADING: VERY FRIGHTENING 令人非常害怕的

Exponent.DEF: extremely frightening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a terrifying thought
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的想法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The experience was absolutely terrifying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次经历极其可怕。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She spoke of the terrifying ordeal a very bad experience when three armed men burst into her house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谈到三名持枪男子闯进她家的那次可怕经历。

Exponent.DEF: very frightening and involving danger, in a way that is exciting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hair-raising stories
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊险故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hair-raising motorcycle ride through the streets of Havana
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶摩托车在哈瓦那街头的惊险狂奔

Exponent.DEF: very frightening – used about films, stories etc that involve frightening or cruel events
Exponent.TRAN: 〔影片﹑故事等〕令人毛骨悚然的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spine-chilling novel by Stephen King
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬•金的一部恐怖小说

Exponent.DEF: very frightening – used especially about sounds
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blood-curdling scream
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人心惊肉跳的尖叫声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blood-curdling growl
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人不寒而栗的咆哮

Sense.DEF: unpleasant or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been a frightful accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了一起可怕的意外。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how bad something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was a frightful mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发乱得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m frightfully sorry about the delay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于这次延误我深表歉意。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex
not friendly or kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guard looked at us with a frigid stare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

Sense.DEF: very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: the frigid air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷的空气

Sense.DEF: a decoration that consists of narrow piece of cloth that has many small folds in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a white blouse with frills at the cuffs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿了一件袖口有褶边的白衬衫。

Sense.DEF: attractive but unnecessary features

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was just a comfortable flat with no frills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是一套舒适的公寓﹐没有华而不实的装饰。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We supply basic, no-frills tractors at low prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们低价供应没有花哨功能的基本型拖拉机。

Sense.DEF: decorated with lots of frills
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frilly skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多褶边的裙子

Sense.DEF: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头棕色直发﹑留着刘海的高个子女孩

Sense.DEF: a decorative edge of hanging threads on a curtain, piece of clothing etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔帷幕﹑衣服等上的〕穗﹐缘饰﹐流苏

Subsense.DEF: not completely belonging to or accepted by a group of people who share the same job, activities etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a small group on the fringes of the art world
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术界边缘的一个小群体

Subsense.DEF: at the part of something that is farthest from the centre
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Nina remained on the fringe of the crowd.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜一直在人群的外围。

PIC.HEADING: FRINGE 刘海﹔流苏
PIC.PICCONTENT: fringe BrE【英】/bangs AmE【美】刘海；fringe 流苏

Sense.DEF: a group, event etc that is less important or popular than the main group etc, or whose opinions are not accepted by most other people involved in the same activity
Sense.TRAN: 边缘[非主流]团体/事件/问题等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used a party conference fringe meeting to defend terrorism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他利用政党大会期间的分组会议为恐怖主义辩护。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The environment is no longer a fringe issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境不再是一个边缘问题了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fringe religious sect
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个边缘宗教派别

Sense.DEF: to be around the edge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A line of trees fringed the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水池的周围种了一圈树。

Sense.DEF: an additional service or advantage given with a job besides wages
Sense.TRAN: 〔工资外的〕补贴﹐附加福利﹔附带的好处﹔边缘福利
Sense.EXAMPLE: A competitive salary with fringe benefits will be offered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提供包含额外补贴的有竞争力的工资。

Sense.DEF: plays by new writers, often on difficult subjects or written in unusual ways, that are not performed in the main theatres
an unnecessary and useless object or decoration
Sense.TRAN: 多余无用的东西﹔花哨的装饰品

Sense.DEF: a piece of plastic shaped like a plate that you throw to someone else to catch as a game. The game is also called Frisbee.
to search someone for hidden weapons, drugs etc by feeling their body with your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were frisked at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在机场被搜身了。

Sense.DEF: if a young animal frisks, it runs and jumps playfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lambs were frisking around the pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小羊在羊圈里蹦来跳去。

Sense.DEF: full of energy and fun
Sense.TRAN: 活跃的﹔活泼的﹔欢蹦乱跳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frisky horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹欢蹦乱跳的马

Sense.DEF: feeling sexually excited
a sudden feeling of excitement or fear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A frisson of alarm went through her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵恐慌传遍她全身。

Sense.DEF: to waste time, money, or effort on something small or unimportant
Sense.TRAN: 〔在微不足道的事情上〕浪费〔时间﹑金钱或力气〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He frittered away a fortune on fast cars and gambling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他买跑车﹑赌博﹐挥霍了很多钱。

Sense.DEF: a thin piece of fruit, vegetable, or meat covered with a mixture of eggs and flour and cooked in hot fat
Sense.TRAN: 〔以水果﹑蔬菜或肉作馅的〕油炸馅饼

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 油炸苹果/玉米/香蕉等馅饼

Sense.DEF: if something is or goes on the fritz, it is not working correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: My TV is on the fritz.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的电视机出故障了。

Sense.DEF: behaviour or activities that are not serious or sensible, especially when you should be serious or sensible
Sense.TRAN: 轻浮的举止﹔愚蠢的表现
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think such frivolity helps the organization’s public image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这种愚蠢的行为无益于这个组织的公众形象。

Sense.DEF: something that is silly and unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try not to be distracted by the frivolities of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要为凡尘俗事而分心。

Sense.DEF: not serious or sensible, especially in a way that is not suitable for a particular occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court discourages frivolous law suits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院不鼓励随意上诉。

Sense.DEF: a frivolous person likes having fun rather than doing serious or sensible things - used to show disapproval
if your hair frizzes, or if you frizz it, it curls very tightly

Tail.EXAMPLE: how to give your hair more shape and less frizz
Tail.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何让秀发更有型﹑少卷曲

Sense.DEF: frizzy hair is very tightly curled
a woman’s or girl’s dress
Sense.EXAMPLE: a party frock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宴会礼裙

Sense.DEF:
a long loose piece of clothing worn by some Christian
monks
a knee-length coat for men, worn in the 19th century
a small green animal that lives near water and has long legs for jumping

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a frog in your throat
Sense.DEF: to have difficulty in speaking, especially because of a sore throat
a very offensive word for someone from France. Do not use this word.
someone who swims under water using special equipment to help them breathe, especially as a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police frogmen have been searching the lake looking for a weapon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的蛙人一直在湖中寻找一件凶器。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to walk somewhere by holding their arms very tightly by their side or behind their back
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某人〕按紧[反剪]双臂押走

Sense.DEF: frog’s eggs
to play in an active happy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lambs frolicked in the next field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小羊在一旁的田野里嬉戏。

Sense.DEF: a fun enjoyable game or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone joined in the Saturday night frolics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都参加了星期六晚上的欢乐聚会。

Sense.DEF: starting at a particular place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you get from here to Colchester?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里到科尔切斯特怎么走？
Sense.EXAMPLE: an empire stretching from Syria to Spain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 版图从叙利亚一直延伸到西班牙的帝国
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is on the main road from Newport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾馆位于从纽波特出来的主路上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ernest twice ran away from home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧内斯特两次离家出走。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about the distance between places or people to mention one of the places or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We live about five miles from Boston.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在离波士顿大约五英里远的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large Victorian house only fifty yards from my workplace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离我工作场所只有50码的一幢维多利亚式大房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was standing only a few feet away from me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在离我只有几英尺远的地方。

Sense.DEF: starting at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll be here tomorrow from about seven o’clock onwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天大约7点钟以后他会在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to tell her on her birthday – that’s two weeks from today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算在她生日那天告诉她——离今天还有两个星期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From now on, I will only be working in the mornings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在起﹐我只在上午上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: housewives who work from morning to night without stopping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从早忙到晚的家庭主妇

Sense.DEF: used to say what condition or situation something is in before it changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: translating from French into English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从法语翻译成英语
Sense.EXAMPLE: When she arrived, things just went from bad to worse got even worse !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到了之后情况简直越来越糟！

Sense.LEXUNIT: from place to place/house to house etc
Sense.DEF: to a number of places
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went from house to house asking if anyone had seen the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挨家挨户询问是否有人见过这个孩子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: from day to day/from minute to minute etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that something continues or keeps changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: My health is improving from day to day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的身体在一天天好转。

Sense.LEXUNIT: vary/change etc from sth to sth
Sense.DEF: to change or be different according to the person, situation, time etc involved
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treatment will vary from patient to patient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗方法因病人而异。

Sense.DEF: used to mention the two ends of a range

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prices range from £10,000 to over £100,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格从一万英镑到十万英镑以上不等。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a place where you can buy anything from a handgun to a rocket launcher
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从手枪到火箭发射器都能买到的一个地方

Sense.DEF: used to say where someone is when they see or watch something
Sense.TRAN: 从〔表示看或观察的位置〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: From the top of the hill, you can see for miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从山顶上可以看到很远的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a man watching us from behind that fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个男人在那道篱笆后面看着我们。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something is before it is removed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pulled her chair away from her desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把椅子从桌旁拉开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philip snatched the book from my hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普从我手中一把夺过书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a knife from his pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从口袋里掏出一把刀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Subtract three from fifteen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十五减去三。

Sense.DEF: used to say where someone would normally be, when they are not there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy’s absence from class has been noted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男孩没来上课引起了注意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a brother, but he’s away from home at present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有个哥哥﹐但他现在不在家。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something was or who had it before you obtained it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got the idea from Colin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个主意是科林帮我出的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know where the information came from?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道这消息是哪里来的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gray caught smallpox from his nephew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷是从他侄子那里传染上天花的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll show you a short extract from one of our training videos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我放一小段我们的训练录像给你看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We usually buy our cheese from a shop in the market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通常在市场里的一家商店买奶酪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to choose the right answer from a list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须从列表中选取正确答案。

Sense.DEF: used to say who sends or gives something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had received a bill for nineteen dollars from St Peter’s hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到圣彼得医院寄来的一张19美元的账单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a phone call from John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接到约翰打来的一个电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to get permission from the owner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要取得物主的许可。
Sense.EXAMPLE: with lots of love from Elaine used at the end of a letter or on a card
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分爱你的伊莱恩〔用于书信或卡片的末尾〕

Sense.DEF: used to say where someone was born, where they live, or where they work
Sense.TRAN: 来自〔表示出生地﹑居住地或工作场所等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We invited speakers from all the regions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们邀请了各地的演讲者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students from all faculties will have access to the machines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各院系的学生都将可以使用这些机器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a man from the tax office on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个税务局的人来电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m from Yorkshire I was born in Yorkshire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是约克郡人。

Sense.DEF: used to state the cause of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: mothers who are exhausted from all the sleepless nights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因连夜无眠而精疲力竭的母亲
Sense.EXAMPLE: Death rates from accidents have been on the increase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故死亡率呈上升趋势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patient suffering from stomach pains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胃痛病人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The community benefits from having an excellent health service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个社区因为出色的医疗保健服务而受益。

Subsense.DEF: used to say what made you form a particular opinion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: From what I’ve read, the company seems to be in difficulties.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所看到的﹐这家公司似乎处境困难。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s obvious from a quick glance that the plan has changed dramatically.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一眼就能看出﹐计划有了很大变化。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how a subject is being considered
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These changes are ideal from my point of view.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看这些改动非常好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We have spent a lot of time looking at the problem from all angles.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用了很多时间从各个角度来考虑这个问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say what substance is used to make something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bread is made from flour, water, and yeast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面包由面粉﹑水和酵母做成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cabinet constructed from chipboard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胶合板做的储藏柜

Sense.DEF: used to say what is prevented or forbidden

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These problems have prevented me from completing the work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题使我无法完成工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who have been disqualified from driving
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已被取消驾驶资格的人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tourist coaches will be banned from entering the city centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游车将禁止进入市中心。

Sense.DEF: used to mention something bad that you do not want to affect someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ways of protecting yourself from attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护自己免受攻击的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: I will keep you safe from harm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会保护你不受伤害。

Sense.DEF: used when you are comparing things or people to mention one of the things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s quite different from her sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和她姐姐很不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our two cats are so alike, I can never tell one from the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的两只猫很相像﹐我向来就无法区分它们。

Sense.DEF:
a thick creamy food made from milk and similar to
yoghurt

a leaf of a
fern
or
palm 1 2
the part of something that is furthest forward in the direction that it is facing or moving

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ricky stepped forward to the front of the stage and began to sing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里基走到舞台的最前面﹐开始唱了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took ages to get to the front of the queue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了很长时间才排到队伍的最前面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She always sits at the front of the class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是坐在教室的最前面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found a good place on the bus, on the top deck, right at the front.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在公共汽车上找了个好位置﹐就在上面一层最前面。

Sense.DEF: the front of something is the side or surface that faces forward

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harvey ran quickly round the front of the car to try and open the other door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈维很快绕过车头去开另一扇车门。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the control panel on the front of the machine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器前面的控制面板

Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore an old sweater with a coffee stain down the front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着一件旧毛衣﹐前面有一道咖啡渍。

Sense.DEF: the most important side or surface of something, that you look at first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dean sent me a lovely postcard with a picture of Bolton Abbey on the front.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪安寄给我一张漂亮的明信片﹐正面是博尔顿修道院的照片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s on the front a picture of her is on the front of this month’s magazine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上了本月杂志的封面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s an introduction at the front of the book in the first pages .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书前面有一篇序言。

Sense.DEF: the most important side of a building, where you go in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben had just finished painting the front of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本刚粉刷完房子的正面。

Subsense.DEF: further forward than someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was standing in front of her in the lunch queue, and they just got talking.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排队买午餐时他排在她前面﹐他们就说起话来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He walked along in front of me, holding the lantern.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提着灯笼走在我前面。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, something ran across the road in front of the car.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐有什么东西从车子前面跑过了马路。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An old wooden desk stood in front of the window.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗前摆着一张旧木桌。

Subsense.DEF: facing someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The door opened and Harriet stood in front of him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门开了﹐哈丽雅特站在他面前。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She sat down in front of the mirror and brushed her hair carefully.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在镜子前坐下﹐仔细地梳起头发。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Billy crouched in front of the fire to warm his hands.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利蹲在炉火前暖手。

Subsense.DEF: outside a building, near its entrance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was a small garden in front of the house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子前面有座小花园。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was raining as we parked in front of the hotel.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天正下着雨﹐我们把车停在酒店门口。

Subsense.DEF: if you say or do something in front of someone, you do it where they can see or hear you
Subsense.TRAN: 在某人的面前﹐当着某人的面
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t swear in front of the children!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要当着小孩的面说脏话！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The match was played in front of a crowd of 8,000.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛在8,000名观众面前进行。

Subsense.DEF: if you have problems or difficulties in front of you, you will soon need to deal with them
Subsense.TRAN: 某人面临着〔难题或困难〕

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法: in front of, opposite
F2NBox.EXPL: In front of a building means directly outside the front of it and on the same side of the street. in front of a building
F2NBox.TRAN: 是指在建筑物的正前方﹐在街道的同一边
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The car stopped in front of our hotel.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 车子停在我们酒店前面。
F2NBox.EXPL: Opposite a building means outside the front of it on the other side of a street, area of land etc. opposite a building
F2NBox.TRAN: 是指在建筑物的对面﹐隔着街道﹑地块等
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the shops opposite the school

Subsense.DEF: ahead of something or someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He drove straight into the car in front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下子撞上了前面的车子。

Subsense.DEF: winning something such as a sports match or competition
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His goal put Leeds back in front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的进球让利兹队再度领先。

Subsense.DEF: in the area nearest the most forward part of something, or nearest the entrance to a building

Sense.DEF: in a particular area of activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the technical front, there have been a number of important developments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术领域有了一系列重大进步。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Excellent teamwork from our staff has brought improvement on all fronts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们员工的精诚合作使得各方面都取得了进展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the domestic front, de Gaulle’s priority was to secure his government’s authority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在国内事务方面﹐戴高乐的重点是确保政府的权威。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Schemes of this kind enjoyed success only on a limited front.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种方案只能在有限的领域取得成功。

Sense.DEF: the area near the entrance to a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up! The taxi is out front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点！出租车就在门外。

Sense.DEF: in the front part of a car, next to the driver or where the driver sits
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom, can I sit in the front?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈﹐我能坐前座吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: in front of the television/TV/computer etc
Sense.DEF: watching a television or using a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average child spends three to four hours in front of the TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般小孩要看三到四个小时电视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spend most of my time sitting in front of a computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大部分时间是坐在电脑前。

Subsense.DEF: money that is paid up front is paid before work is done, or before goods are supplied
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We need two hundred pounds up front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要预付200英镑。

Subsense.DEF: directly and clearly from the start
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to tell potential clients this up front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一开始就要向潜在的客户说明这一点﹐这很重要。

Sense.DEF: the place where two areas of air of different temperatures meet, often shown as a line on weather maps

GramExa.GLOSS: an area of warm or cold air

Sense.DEF: a wide road next to the beach where people can walk for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could always go for a stroll along the front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们随时可以沿着滨海大道散散步。

Sense.DEF: your chest, or the part of your body that faces forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve spilled juice all down your front!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把果汁洒得整个胸前都是！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was asleep, lying on his front with his head turned to one side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头转向一边﹐趴着睡着了。

Sense.DEF: a legal business that someone operates in order to hide the illegal activities that they are involved in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The casino was used as a front for cross-border smuggling operations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家赌场被用来为跨国走私打掩护。

Sense.DEF: if you put on a front, you behave in a way that is happier, braver etc than you really feel

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny didn’t want Adam to see how worried she was. So she put on a brave front .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮不想让亚当看到她有多担心﹐于是摆出一副勇敢的样子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His arrogance is just a front. Deep down he’s really insecure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的傲慢不过是掩饰﹐内心深处他很没有安全感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When disciplining children, it is important that parents present a united front show that they both feel the same about a situation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母管教孩子的时候要意见一致﹐这一点很重要。

Sense.DEF: used in the name of a political party or unofficial military organization
Sense.TRAN: 阵线〔用于政党或非官方军事组织的名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the People’s Liberation Front
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人民解放阵线

Sense.DEF: the area where fighting happens in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: He joined the army, and was immediately sent to the front .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参军后立即被派往前线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband was shot down over the Western Front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫在西线上空被击落。

Sense.DEF: a side of a large important church building
Sense.EXAMPLE: the west front of Rouen cathedral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁昂大教堂朝西的一面

Sense.DEF: at, on, or in the front of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of his front teeth had been knocked out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有两颗门牙被打落了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the front cover of ‘Hello!’ magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《Hello!》杂志的封面
Sense.EXAMPLE: the front wheel of his bicycle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自行车的前轮
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dog’s front legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗的前腿

GramExa.GLOSS: at the front of a house
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We walked up the front steps and into the reception area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走上前门的台阶﹐进入接待区。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We got there an hour early in order to get seats in the front row.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了坐到前排座位﹐我们提前一个小时就到了那里。

Sense.DEF: a front organization is a legal one that is run in order to hide a secret or illegal activity
Sense.TRAN: 起掩护作用的﹐作幌子的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a front organization for importing heroin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个为海洛因输入打掩护的机构

Sense.DEF: a front vowel sound is made by raising your tongue at the front of your mouth, such as the vowel sound in ‘see’
if someone fronts something such as a musical group or a television programme, they lead it and are the person that the public sees most
Sense.TRAN: 领导〔乐队〕﹔主持〔电视节目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fronted by Alan Hull, the band had a number of memorable hits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队在艾伦•赫尔的带领下﹐创作了许多令人难忘的畅销曲目。

Sense.DEF: if a building or area of land is fronted by something, or fronts onto it, it faces that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was fronted by a large ornamental lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子前面有个很大的景观湖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel entrance fronted onto a busy road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店入口对着一条繁华的马路。

Sense.DEF: to be covered or decorated at the front with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large building fronted with marble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢正面由大理石砌成的大型建筑

Sense.DEF: the part of a building or piece of land that is along a road, river etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物临街﹑临河的〕正面﹔临路地﹔临河地

Sense.DEF: at or relating to the front part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the frontal armour of the new tanks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型坦克的正面装甲

Subsense.DEF: a direct attack on the front of an army
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The minefields make an all-out frontal attack impossible.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷区使得正面的全力进攻无法展开。

Subsense.DEF: an attack or criticism that is very strong and direct
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After the election, the party launched into a frontal assault on the British media.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选过后﹐该党派开始正面抨击英国媒体。

Sense.DEF: relating to the front part of the head
Sense.EXAMPLE: the frontal lobes of the brain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大脑额叶

Sense.DEF:
a weather
front 1 12
in a very important position, where it will receive attention
Sense.TRAN: 重要的[地]﹐中心的[地]﹐需要关注的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prayer in schools has become a front-and-center issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校内祷告已经成为焦点问题。

Sense.DEF: the front row of seats on each side of the British parliament, on which the leaders of the political parties sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国议会的〕前（排）座（位）〔为各政党领导人的席位〕

Sense.DEF: someone who sits on a front bench in the British parlia-ment
the desk where visitors go when they arrive at a hotel or organization
the main entrance door to a house, at the front
the border of a country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lille is close to the frontier between France and Belgium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里尔靠近法比边境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troops established a road block on the frontier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队在边境设立了一个路障。

GramExa.GLOSS: a town etc on a frontier
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 边陲小镇/边疆地区/边防站等

Sense.DEF: an area where people have never lived before, that not much is known about, especially in the western US before the 20th century
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指20世纪前美国西部的〕边远地区﹐荒野地区﹔边疆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a novel about a family’s struggle on the American frontier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 描写一家人在美国边远地区奋斗的小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: space, the final frontier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太空﹐最后的边界

Sense.DEF: the limits of what is known about something

GramExa.GLOSS: discover new things

Sense.DEF: a man who lived on the American frontier, especially in the 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指19世纪美国的〕边远地区居民﹔边疆开拓者

Sense.DEF: a picture or photograph at the beginning of a book, usually opposite the page with the title on it

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Fruit is usually uncountable.

Sense.DEF: the part of a plant, bush, or tree that contains the seeds
the good results that you have from something, after you have worked very hard

a large
bat small animal like a flying mouse
that lives in hot countries and eats fruit

producing good results

if a plan, project etc comes to fruition, it is successfully put into action and completed, often after a long process

Sense.DEF: feeling annoyed, upset, and impatient, because you cannot control or change a situation, or achieve something

Sense.DEF: the fact of being prevented from achieving what you are trying to achieve

Sense.DEF: to change important figures or facts to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sibley has been fudging his data for years now but no one noticed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西布莉多年来一直在篡改数据﹐但没有人发现。

Sense.DEF: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a fuel such as coal or oil, produced by the gradual decaying of plants and animals
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Global warming may be caused by burning fossil fuels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球变暖可能是燃烧化石燃料引起的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What do we do with the spent nuclear fuel?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要如何处理用过的核燃料？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a solid substance, such as coal, that is used as a fuel
used in a house
that burns without producing smoke
that does not contain lead
a fuel that harms the environment as little as possible

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People need to learn how to use fuel more efficiently.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们得学会如何更有效地使用燃料。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use fuel as the source of power
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Will this engine run on unleaded fuel?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种发动机用无铅燃料吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use all the fuel available and have none left
put fuel in a vehicle’s fuel tank

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The increase in fuel costs is severely affecting pensioners.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃料费用上涨严重影响了领取退休金的人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Insulating your house will cut your fuel bill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 给房子装上隔热材料可降低燃料费。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a container for storing fuel
an instrument for measuring fuel
a machine that forces fuel into an engine
amount used
how well a vehicle uses fuel, without wasting any

Collocate.COLLOC: sth is running low on fuel
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it does not have much fuel left
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plane was running low on fuel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机快没油了。

Sense.DEF: to make something, especially something bad, increase or become stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: His words fuelled her anger still more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话火上浇油﹐使她更愤怒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Progress was slow, fueling concerns that the stadium would not be finished on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进度很慢﹐人们越来越担心体育馆能否按时完工。

Sense.DEF: if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better fuel up at the next town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好在下个小镇加油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The van was fuelled and waiting in the basement car park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小货车加好了油﹐在地下停车场等着。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that combines two different
elements
, such as
oxygen
and
hydrogen
, to produce electricity in order to supply power to a vehicle or machine
a fuel-efficient engine or vehicle burns fuel in a more effective way than usual, so that it loses less fuel
Sense.TRAN: 〔发动机或汽车〕省油的﹐低油耗的

Sense.DEF:
a method of putting liquid fuel directly into an engine, which allows a car to
accelerate
more quickly
air inside a room that feels heavy and unpleasant because of smoke, heat, or too many people
Sense.TRAN: 〔室内因烟雾﹑热气或人过多产生的〕污浊空气
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fug of the bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧的污浊空气

Sense.DEF: someone who is trying to avoid being caught by the police

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fugitive from US justice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个在美国司法制度下逃脱的罪犯

Sense.DEF: trying to avoid being caught by the police
lasting for a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: rare and fugitive visits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难得的短暂访问

Sense.DEF:
a piece of music with a tune that is repeated regularly in different
keys
by different voices or instruments
full of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eventful day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多事的一天

Sense.DEF: having the quality of something or causing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: restful colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宁神怡目[素淡]的色彩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it painful?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛吗？

Sense.DEF: the amount of a substance needed to fill a particular container
Sense.EXAMPLE: two cupfuls of milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满满两杯牛奶

Sense.DEF: as much as can be carried by or contained in a particular part of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: an armful of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一抱花

Sense.DEF:
the point on which a
lever bar
turns, balances, or is supported in turning or lifting something
if you fulfil a hope, wish, or aim, you achieve the thing that you hoped for, wished for etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Visiting Disneyland has fulfilled a boyhood dream .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪士尼乐园之游使童年梦想成真。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being deaf hasn’t stopped Karen fulfilling her ambition to be a hairdresser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失聪并没有阻止卡伦实现当美发师的抱负。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was then that the organization finally began to fulfill the hopes of its founders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到那时﹐该组织才终于开始实现其创办人的愿望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an analysis of how different countries are attempting to fulfill their political goals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不同国家如何努力实现其政治目标的分析

Sense.DEF: to do or provide what is necessary or needed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good police officer is not fulfilling his role if he neglects this vital aspect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名好警察若是忽略这一重要方面﹐就是没有尽到自己的本分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain was accused of failing to fulfil its obligations under the EU Treaty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国被指责未能履行欧盟条约所规定的义务。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Much of the electrical equipment failed to fulfill safety requirements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多电器未能符合安全要求。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is little doubt that the scheme fulfils a need for our community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐这计划会满足我们社区的需求。

Sense.DEF: to do what you said you would do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to see him fulfil his promise to reorganize the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望看到他履行重组军队的诺言。

Sense.DEF: to be as successful as you possibly can be
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to make sure that all children are able to fulfil their potential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想确保所有的小孩子都能充分发挥自己的潜能。

Sense.DEF: if your work fulfils you, it makes you feel satisfied because you are using all your skills, qualities etc
Sense.TRAN: 使有满足感﹐充分发挥…的才能

Sense.DEF: to feel satisfied because you are using all your skills, qualities etc
Sense.TRAN: 有满足感﹐充分发挥自己的才能
Sense.EXAMPLE: She succeeded in fulfilling herself both as an actress and as a mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为演员和母亲﹐她都非常有成就感。

Sense.DEF:
if a
prophesy
is fulfilled, something happens that someone said would happen
happy and satisfied because your life is interesting and you are doing useful or important things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adult education helps people achieve more fulfilled lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成人教育可以让人生活更加充实。

Sense.DEF: making you feel happy and satisfied because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nursing is still one of the most fulfilling careers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护理仍是最令人有成就感的职业之一。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being happy and satisfied with your life because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you looking for greater fulfillment and satisfaction in your work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在寻求工作上更大的成就感与满足感吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep sense of fulfilment that makes life worthwhile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让生活变得有意义的一种深深的成就感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The real joy of the priesthood is helping people find personal fulfilment .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事神职工作最大的快乐就在于帮助人们寻求个人的满足感。

Sense.DEF: when something you wanted happens or is given to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fulfillment of a long-held dream
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个夙愿的实现

Sense.DEF: the act of doing something that you promised or agreed to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are wondering if they will ever see the fulfillment of the government’s campaign pledges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众不知道能否看到政府履行其竞选诺言。

Sense.DEF: containing as much or as many things or people as possible, so there is no space left
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was completely full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车坐得满满的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t talk with your mouth full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘴里塞满东西时不要说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The class is full, but you can register for next term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个班已经满了﹐不过你可以注册下学期的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kitchen was full of smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里全是烟。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be crammed/stuffed/packed etc full of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ted’s workshop was crammed full of old engines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德的车间里堆满了旧发动机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: McQuaid filled his glass until it was three-quarters full.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦奎德将杯子倒到四分之三满。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bath was full to the brim completely full with hot water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴缸里满满一缸热水。

GramExa.GLOSS: completely full
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The filing cabinet was full to bursting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件柜塞得满满的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that a place is packed when it is full of people.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示某处满是人时﹐人们常说a place is packed
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The trains are always packed in the rush hour.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 上下班高峰时﹐火车上总是挤满了人。

PIC.HEADING: FULL 满
PIC.PICCONTENT: The box is full.箱子满了。；an overflowing bin 装得满出来的垃圾桶；a bulging wallet 鼓鼓囊囊的钱包

Sense.DEF: complete and including all parts or details
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please write your full name and address on the form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在表格上填写全名和地址。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Health Centre offers a full range of services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗中心提供全套服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lotus will not reveal full details until the Motor Show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路特斯公司要等到车展才会披露全部细节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The BBC promised a full investigation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国广播公司承诺展开全面调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think he’s telling us the full story everything he knows about the matter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他没有告诉我们全部实情。

Sense.DEF: the greatest amount or highest level of something that is possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: rising prosperity and full employment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益繁荣以及充分就业
Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity helps disabled children reach their full potential .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该慈善机构帮助残障儿童充分发挥自身潜力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few customers take full advantage of off-peak fares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很少有顾客充分利用淡季票价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parker was driving at full speed when he hit the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕克全速行驶时撞到了墙上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The roses were now in full bloom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰现已盛开。

Subsense.DEF: to contain many things of the same kind
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a garden full of flowers
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 百花齐放的花园
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His essay was full of mistakes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的文章错误百出。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The music papers were full of gossip about the band.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家音乐报上全是有关该乐队的传言。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Life’s full of surprises, isn’t it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活中总是有各种意想不到的事﹐对吧？

Subsense.DEF: to feel, express, or show a lot of a particular emotion or quality
Subsense.TRAN: 〔感觉﹑表达或表现出〕充满某种情感[特质]的
