GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lucy was a happy child, always full of life .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西是个快乐的孩子﹐总是生气勃勃的。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was full of praise for the work of the unit.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对该部门的工作赞不绝口。

Subsense.DEF: to talk or think a lot about a particular thing
Subsense.TRAN: 老是说着某物﹔一心想着某物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was full of plans for the wedding.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满脑子都是婚礼的计划。

Sense.DEF: having eaten so much food that you cannot eat any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: No more, thanks. I’m full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要了﹐谢谢。我吃饱了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize an amount, quantity, or rate

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We devote five full days a month to training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一个月有整整五天时间用于培训。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His pants rose a full three inches off his shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的裤脚离鞋面足足有三英寸。

Sense.DEF: busy and involving lots of different activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before her illness, Rose enjoyed a full life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生病之前﹐罗丝享受着丰富多彩的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go to bed. You’ve a full day tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡觉去吧﹐你明天的事排得满满的呢。

Sense.DEF: having or giving all the rights, duties etc that belong to a particular rank or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only full members have the right to vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有正式会员才有投票权。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a full driving licence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式驾照

Sense.DEF: to have a high opinion of yourself – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first impression was that he was a bit full of himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一印象是他有点自以为是。

Sense.DEF: a rude expression used to say that someone often says things that are wrong or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t listen to Jerry. He’s full of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别听杰里的﹐他净胡说八道。

Sense.DEF: made using a lot of material and fitting loosely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dress with a full skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裙摆宽大的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: large and rounded in an attractive way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: clothes for the fuller figure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合较丰满体型的衣服

Sense.DEF: having a strong satisfying taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now you can enjoy Nescafé’s fuller flavour in a decaffeinated form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在可以享受雀巢更香浓的去咖啡因咖啡。

Sense.DEF: pleasantly loud and deep
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich full sound of the cello
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大提琴圆浑的音色

Sense.DEF: not a reduced price
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re over 14, you have to pay full price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你超过14岁﹐就得买全票。

Sense.DEF: so that all the people in a place can see, especially when this is embarrassing or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 在某人眼皮底下〔尤指令人尴尬或震惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The argument happened on stage in full view of the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场争论就发生在台上﹐观众看得一清二楚。

Sense.DEF: if an event or process is in full swing, it has reached its highest level of activity
Sense.TRAN: 处于全盛阶段﹔在热烈进行中
Sense.EXAMPLE: By 8.30, the party was in full swing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到8点半时﹐派对进入高潮。

Sense.DEF: doing something with as much energy and effort as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: With last season’s misery behind them, it’s full steam ahead for the Bears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上一赛季惨败后﹐熊队现在全力以赴。

Sense.DEF: to be excited and have lots of energy
as strongly, loudly, or quickly as possible
Sense.TRAN: 最大马力地﹔最大音量地﹔尽快地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heater was on full blast but I was still cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖气开到最大了﹐可我还是觉得冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car stereo playing Wagner at full blast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以最大音量播放瓦格纳作品的一台汽车音响

Sense.DEF: moving as fast as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran full tilt into his arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她飞奔着扑进他怀里。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people are in full cry, they are criticizing someone very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone who’s seen the world’s press in full cry can understand how Diana felt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见识过全球媒体猛烈抨击的人都能理解戴安娜的心情。

Sense.DEF: in the best or most complete way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed believes in living life to the full .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德相信生活要尽可能充实。

Sense.DEF: to be in the same situation in which you began, even though there have been changes during the time in between
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fashion has come full circle and denim is back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚兜了一圈又回归原点﹐牛仔布再次流行。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: draw yourself up to your full height

Exponent.DEF: containing as much or as many things or people as possible, so there is no space left
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The train was nearly full.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这列火车几乎满员。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cupboard was full of clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣柜里放满了衣服。

Exponent.DEF: full of something – use this about a container when a lot of things have been put into it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The envelopes were filled with cash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个个信封里装满了现金。

Exponent.DEF: completely full of something – use this about a container when lots of things have been put into it, often in an untidy way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The case was stuffed full of clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 手提箱里塞满了衣服。

Exponent.DEF: completely full of people – use this about a room, train etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a packed restaurant
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的餐厅
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The courtroom will be packed with journalists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭上将挤满记者。

Exponent.DEF: extremely full of something
Exponent.TRAN: 塞满（某物）几乎要爆裂的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her wardrobe was bursting with coats and shoes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的衣橱里外套和鞋子都快装不下了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a small garden bursting with fruit and flowers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 结满果实﹑开满鲜花的小花园

Exponent.DEF: so full that you cannot fit anyone or anything else in – often used when you think there are too many people or things
Exponent.TRAN: 塞满的﹔挤满的〔常用于表示人或物过多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In summer, the hotels are crammed with tourists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季﹐酒店里挤满了游客。

Exponent.DEF: full of people, animals etc that are all moving around
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rivers are teeming with fish.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 河里满是鱼。

Exponent.DEF: used about a container that is so full that the liquid or things inside it come out over the top
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an overflowing bathtub
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 溢水的浴缸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drawers were overflowing with magazines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽屉里装满了杂志。

Exponent.DEF: used about a vehicle or a ship which has too many people or things in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an overloaded fishing boat
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 超载的渔船

Sense.DEF: including the whole of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The debt must be paid in full .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欠款必须全部偿清。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His statement on the handling of prisoners is worth quoting in full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他关于如何处置囚犯的那番话应该完整地引用。

Sense.DEF: directly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked him full in the face as she spoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话时直视他的脸。

Sense.DEF: a player in a football team who plays in defence, stopping opponents from getting the ball

car
headlights the main lights at the front
that are on full beam are switched to a position that makes them shine very brightly and straight ahead
done with a lot of energy or in a complete way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conflict could escalate into a full-blooded war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冲突可能升级为全面战争。

Sense.DEF: having parents, grandparents etc from only one race of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father is a full-blooded Cherokee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲是个纯血统的切罗基人。

Sense.DEF: having all the qualities of something that is at its most complete or advanced stage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drop in shares could develop into a full-blown crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票价格下跌可能会发展成一场全面的危机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: full-blown AIDS
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全型艾滋病

Sense.DEF: a hotel offering full board provides guests with all their meals
Sense.TRAN: 〔宾馆提供一日三餐的〕全食宿
Sense.EXAMPLE: A two-night break costs £125 full board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两夜的全食宿要125英镑。

Sense.DEF: a full-bodied wine or other drink has a pleasantly strong taste
Sense.TRAN: 〔葡萄酒或其他饮料〕浓郁的﹐醇厚的

Sense.DEF: a full-bodied sound is complicated and interesting
fast and with a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate took a huge slice and was going at it full bore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特拿了一大块﹐狼吞虎咽地吃了起来。

Sense.DEF: printed using coloured inks rather than only black and white
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full-colour brochure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩色的小册子

Sense.DEF:
a method of defending in a strong way in
basketball
the use of pressure or influence by several groups on someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔施加压力或影响的〕全面出击﹐全面攻势
Sense.EXAMPLE: The DEA and the Justice Department put a full-court press on the drug barons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缉毒局和司法部向大毒枭发动全面攻势。

Sense.DEF: full-cream milk is ordinary milk without any of the fat removed
special clothes worn for official occasions
Sense.EXAMPLE: officers in full dress uniform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿礼仪军服的军官

Sense.DEF: dried clay made into a powder that is used to clean cloth or oil
showing the whole of someone’s face
Sense.TRAN: 显示整个脸部的﹐正面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In portraits, chiefs were invariably shown full face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画像里﹐酋长总是以正面示人。

Sense.DEF: covering or protecting your whole face
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full face helmet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全护式头盔

Sense.DEF: full-fat milk, cheese etc contains all the fat that is naturally in it
completely developed, trained, or established
Sense.TRAN: 全面发展的﹔经过全面训练的﹔成熟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: India has the potential to become a full-fledged major power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度有潜力成为全面发展的大国。

Sense.DEF: showing the whole of the front of someone’s body without clothes on
Sense.EXAMPLE: scenes of full frontal nudity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正面全裸镜头

Sense.DEF: done in a direct and strong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full frontal attack on the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府的正面抨击

Sense.DEF: a full-grown animal, plant, or person has developed to their full size and will not grow any bigger
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物﹑植物或人〕完全长成的﹔成熟的﹔发育完全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A full-grown elephant may weigh 2,000 pounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年大象的体重可达2,000磅。

Sense.DEF: an occasion at a cinema, concert hall, sports field etc when there are no empty seats
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影院﹑音乐厅﹑体育场等的〕满座﹐满席﹐客满
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billy Graham is a speaker who can be sure of playing to a full house .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葛培理是一位能保证满座的演说家。

Sense.DEF:
three cards of one kind and a pair of another kind in a game of
poker
Sense.TRAN: 〔纸牌戏中的〕满堂红﹐满贯〔一手牌中三张点数相同﹐另外两张点数相同〕

Sense.DEF: a mirror etc that shows all of a person, from their head to their feet
a skirt etc that reaches the ground, or is the longest possible for that particular type of clothing
Sense.TRAN: 垂地长裙/垂地连衣裙/长大衣等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full-length evening dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂地晚礼服

Sense.DEF: a play etc that is the normal length
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stravinsky’s only full-length opera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉文斯基唯一的一部足本歌剧

Sense.DEF: someone who is lying full-length is lying flat with their legs straight out
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ali was stretched out full-length on the couch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里腿伸直平躺在长沙发上。

Sense.DEF:
if you turn the
steering wheel
of a car to full lock, you turn it as far as it can be turned
if you give someone full marks, you praise them for doing something well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not the most stylish mobile, but full marks to Marconi for originality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然不是最时尚的手机﹐但马可尼公司的创意却是匠心独运。

Sense.DEF: the highest number of points you can get for school work
the whole amount of something that people want and expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ice cream was covered in sauce, nuts, chocolate - the full monty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰激凌上有调味汁﹑果仁﹑巧克力——应有尽有。

Sense.DEF: the moon when you can see all of it as a complete circle
after a period of time, when a situation has developed
Sense.TRAN: 在适当[时机成熟]的时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he’ll tell us what’s bothering him in the fullness of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定他会在适当的时候把他的烦恼告诉我们。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being large and round in an attractive way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a red gloss on your bottom lip to give it fullness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下唇使用红色唇彩让它显得丰盈饱满。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being complete
the quality of having a pleasantly strong taste or deep sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: This recording has a fullness and warmth that brings out the brilliance of the piece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这版录音圆浑而温情﹐演绎出了乐曲的精粹。

Sense.DEF: the condition of being full
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have a feeling of fullness after even a small meal?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是吃一点点就会有饱胀的感觉？

Sense.DEF: extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re going for full-on glamour, add some sparkly jewellery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想要显得光彩照人﹐那就加一些闪光的首饰。

Sense.DEF: covering all of one page in a newspaper or magazine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full-page advert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整版广告

Sense.DEF: as complete or thorough as possible
Sense.TRAN: 最大限度的﹔彻底的﹔全面的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 全面的进攻/战争/暴乱等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government will conduct a full-scale inquiry into the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府将会全面调查坠机事故。

Sense.DEF: a full-scale drawing, model etc is the same size as the thing it represents
Sense.TRAN: 照原尺寸的﹐与实物一样大小的

Sense.DEF: of the largest possible size
Sense.EXAMPLE: The battery can run a full-size laptop for 12 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种电池可供标准笔记本电脑运行12小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full-size basketball court
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标准篮球场

Sense.DEF: a point (.) that marks the end of a sentence or the short form of a word
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put a full stop at the end of the sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 句末要加上句号。

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a sentence to emphasize that you do not want to say any more about a subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have a reason. I just don’t want to go, full stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有理由﹐我就是不想去﹐不必多说了。

Sense.DEF:
a full-term baby is born after a
pregnancy
of the normal length
the end of the normal period of playing time in a sports game
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the ball went in, the referee blew his whistle for full time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球进了﹐这时裁判吹响了终场哨声。

Sense.DEF: for all the hours of a week during which it is usual for people to work, study etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作﹑学习等〕全日制的[地]﹔专职的[地]﹔全职的[地]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works full-time and has two kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她做全职工作﹐还有两个孩子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The success of the series enabled her to concentrate full-time on writing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系列作品的成功使她能够专心从事全职写作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re looking for full-time staff at the library.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆正在招聘专职工作人员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We aim to double the number of young people in full-time study .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是让全日制学习的年轻人人数翻倍。

Sense.DEF: to be very hard work and take a lot of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keeping pace with changes is a full-time job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟上变化的脚步是很难的。

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant is fully booked this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚这家餐厅订满了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elisa has not fully recovered from the incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉莎还没有完全从这个事件中恢复过来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am fully aware of your problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的问题我全知道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The changes in policy are fully described in the review.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策的变化在报告中有全面的描述。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fully accept that what he says is true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全同意﹐他的话属实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This concept is discussed more fully in Chapter 9.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一概念在第九章中有更详细的论述。

Sense.DEF: wearing clothes, including things such as shoes
Sense.EXAMPLE: She collapsed fully dressed on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和衣躺倒在床上。

Sense.DEF: completely developed, trained, or established
Sense.TRAN: 全面发展的﹔经过全面训练的﹔成熟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: After seven years of training she’s now a fully-fledged doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经过七年的培训﹐现在已是个完全合格的医生了。

Sense.DEF: a fully-grown animal, plant, or person has developed to their full size and will not grow any bigger
Sense.EXAMPLE: After six weeks, the larva emerges as a fully-grown beetle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六周以后﹐幼虫长成了一只发育成熟的甲虫。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something angrily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mick was fulminating against the unfairness of it all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米克在控诉这一切的不公。

Sense.DEF: a fulsome speech or piece of writing sounds insincere because it contains too much praise, expressions of thanks etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话或作品〕过分恭维的﹐有太多溢美之词的﹐虚伪的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book contains a fulsome dedication to his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中有一篇给他妻子的虚华的献词。

Sense.DEF: to try to hold, move, or find something with your hands in an awkward way
Sense.TRAN: 笨手笨脚地做﹐胡乱摸找

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dressed, her cold fingers fumbling with the buttons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿上衣服﹐冰冷的手指笨拙地扣着纽扣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I fumbled around in my bag for a cigarette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在包里摸香烟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She reached round to fumble the light on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伸手摸索着去开灯。

Sense.DEF: if you fumble with your words when you are speaking, you have difficulty saying something
Sense.TRAN: 支支吾吾地说话﹐笨嘴笨舌地说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Asked for an explanation, Mike had fumbled for words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被要求作出解释时﹐迈克支支吾吾地找话说。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The second candidate fumbled her lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二个来应试的人念砸了台词。

Sense.DEF: to drop a ball after catching it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quarterback Rattay was hit and fumbled the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四分卫拉蒂被撞了一下﹐弄丢了球。

Sense.DEF: to be angry about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sat in the car, silently fuming about what he’d said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在车里一声不响﹐为他刚才的话生着闷气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’ve no right to be here,’ he fumed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你没有权利待在这里。”他气呼呼地说道。

Sense.DEF: to give off smoke or gases
strong-smelling gas or smoke that is unpleasant to breathe in
Sense.TRAN: 〔气味浓烈或难闻的〕气体﹐烟雾
Sense.EXAMPLE: paint fumes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆烟雾

Sense.DEF:
to remove disease,
bacteria
, insects etc from somewhere using chemicals, smoke, or gas
Sense.TRAN: 〔为消毒﹑杀菌﹑杀虫等而用化学品﹑烟或气〕熏蒸﹔烟熏

Sense.DEF: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting
Sense.TRAN: 娱乐﹐有趣的经历[活动]﹔乐趣
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty of fun for all the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以让全家人玩得很开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were having so much fun, I hated to call them inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子玩得很开心﹐我不忍心把他们叫进来。

Variant.LEXVAR: just for the fun of it

Sense.DEF: if you do something for fun, you do it because you enjoy it and not for any other reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: I simply believe that killing animals for fun is wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是认为杀死动物取乐是错误的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like most people her age, Deborah struck up relationships just for the fun of it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像大多数同龄人一样﹐德博拉谈恋爱只是为了好玩。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is enjoyable to be with because they are happy and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll like her, darling, she’s great fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会喜欢她的﹐亲爱的﹐她这人挺有趣的。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is not serious and shows happiness and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan’s always so cheerful and full of fun .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简总是那么开心﹐那么有趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her sense of fun made her very popular at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的幽默感使她在学院里很受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evelyn would tease her, but only in fun .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊夫林会取笑她﹐但只是闹着玩的。

Sense.DEF: activities, behaviour etc that are not serious – often used to show disapproval
to make unkind, insulting remarks about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 嘲弄某人/某物﹔拿某人/某物开玩笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not making fun of you. I admire what you did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是拿你开心﹐我很欣赏你的作为。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not true or will not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m going to Barbara’s house.’ ‘Like fun you are! Come and finish your chores first.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要去芭芭拉家。”“开什么玩笑！先来把家务干完。”

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you have fun at the party?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在派对上玩得高兴吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The whole village joined in the fun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 整座村子的人一起尽情欢乐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: seems to be enjoyable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The picnic sounded like fun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐听起来很有意思。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I never realized what good fun fishing could be.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没有意识到钓鱼这么好玩。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The show is great fun for all the family.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场表演全家人都看得津津有味。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not likely to upset or offend anyone
something is not at all enjoyable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Being stuck in a traffic jam for three hours was no fun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇上交通阻塞被堵三小时并不好玩。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be what someone enjoys doing –used especially when this seems strange to you
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 是某人觉得好玩的事〔尤用于觉得奇怪时〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Camping in this rainy weather is not my idea of fun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种雨天去野营﹐我可不觉得好玩。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be a very enjoyable part of doing something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Planning a vacation is half the fun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为度假做准备也是很大的乐趣之一。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The kids had a lot of fun singing and dancing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子唱歌跳舞﹐玩得很开心。

Exponent.DEF: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you ever been windsurfing? It’s really good fun.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你玩过风帆冲浪吗？真的很好玩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I just want to relax and have some fun.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想放松一下﹐找点乐子。

Exponent.DEF: the feeling you get when you enjoy doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I get a lot of enjoyment out of working with young children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和小孩子在一起我很开心。

Exponent.DEF: an experience or activity that makes you feel happy and satisfied
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The game was a pleasure to watch.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看那场比赛真是件乐事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of her greatest pleasures was walking in the mountains.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最大的乐趣之一是在山间漫步。

Exponent.DEF: a time when you enjoyed yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The kids all had a great time .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们全都玩得很愉快。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I remember the good times in Japan.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得在日本的快乐时光。

Exponent.DEF: things such as performances and films which are intended to be enjoyable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Three musicians provided the entertainment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名乐师做了表演。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What do you do for entertainment around here?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在这里表演什么？

Exponent.DEF: a way of resting and enjoying yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I play the piano for relaxation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弹钢琴消遣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her work left little time for relaxation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作使她几乎没有时间放松。

Exponent.DEF: the time when you are not working, when you can enjoy yourself – used especially in compounds
Exponent.EXAMPLE: leisure activities
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 休闲活动
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the leisure industry
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 休闲产业
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People have more leisure time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们有了更多的闲暇时间。

Exponent.DEF: activities that you do to enjoy yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: recreation facilities
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 娱乐设施
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The park is not just a place for recreation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座公园不只是个娱乐消遣的地方。

Sense.DEF: enjoyable and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try snow-boarding -it’s a really fun sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试单板滑雪——是个很好玩的运动。

Sense.DEF: a fun person is enjoyable to be with because they are happy and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a really fun person to be around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有她在一起真开心。

Sense.DEF: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does
Sense.TRAN: 〔事物的〕功能﹔作用﹔〔某人的〕职责

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In your new job you will perform a variety of functions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在新的工作岗位上﹐你将要履行许多不同的职责。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The church fulfils a valuable social function.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会起着很重要的社会作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The nervous system regulates our bodily functions eating, breathing, going to the toilet etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经系统控制着我们身体的功能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bauhaus architects thought that function was more important than form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包豪斯学派的建筑师认为功能重于形式。

Sense.DEF: a large party or official event
Sense.EXAMPLE: This room may be hired for weddings and other functions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间可以租来举办婚礼或其他活动。

Sense.DEF: a quantity or quality whose value changes according to another quantity or quality that is related to it
Sense.TRAN: 函数﹔随变数而变化的因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: The degree of drought is largely a function of temperature and drainage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干旱程度主要取决于气温和排水。

Sense.DEF: one of the basic operations performed by a computer
to work in the correct or intended way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flights in and out of Taipei are functioning normally again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进出台北的航班又恢复正常了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her legs have now ceased to function .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know I can’t function cannot perform normal activities without a coffee in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道的﹐我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

F2NBox.HEADING: Register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something works rather than functions .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示某物正常运作﹐一般说work﹐而不说function
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If the system is working as it should, you’ll be paid within two weeks.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果系统正常运作的话﹐你会在两周内收到款项。

Sense.DEF: if something functions in a particular way, it works in that way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an understanding of how the economy functions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于经济如何运行的一种看法

Sense.DEF: if something functions as a particular thing, it does what that type of thing normally does, or is used as that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: A library is functioning as a temporary hospital to cope with casualties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个图书馆被用作临时医院﹐以处理伤亡人员。

Sense.DEF: designed to be useful rather than beautiful or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 为实用而设计的﹐实用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: buildings that are sensitively designed, not purely functional
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计细腻而非单纯实用的建筑

Sense.DEF: something that is functional is working correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: By 2004, the Supertram is expected to be fully functional .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到2004年﹐超级电车将全面运行。

Sense.DEF: relating to the purpose of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two departments have slight functional differences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个部门功能稍有不同。

Sense.DEF:
food that is designed to improve health and lower the risk of disease, for example by increasing the amount of
vitamins
in it, or removing some of the
fat
the idea that the most important thing about a building, piece of furniture etc is that it is useful
one or all of the operations that a computer, software program, or piece of equipment is able to perform
someone who has a job doing unimportant or boring official duties
Sense.TRAN: 〔做繁琐工作的〕职员﹐工作人员﹔公务人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liberal Party functionaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由党职员

Sense.DEF:
a key on a computer
keyboard
that tells the computer to do something
a word that does not mean anything on its own, but shows the relationship between other words in a sentence, for example words such as ‘but’ or ‘if’
Sense.TRAN: 功能词〔如but或if等﹐本身并没有实际意义但表明句子中其他词之间的关系〕

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

Sense.DEF: money that an organization needs or has
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sale is being held to raise funds for the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在举行拍卖为该校筹集资金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: claims that ministers had misused public funds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长们滥用公共资金的说法

Sense.EXAMPLE: The park remains unfinished due to lack of funds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于缺乏资金﹐公园一直没有完工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Museum is so short of funds has so little money it may have to sell the painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆资金极其紧缺﹐可能不得不卖掉那幅藏画。

Sense.DEF: an organization that collects money, for example to help people who are ill, old etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We give to the Children’s Fund every Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每年圣诞节向儿童基金会捐款。

Sense.DEF: a large supply of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a fund of stories about his boyhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有说不完的童年故事。

Sense.DEF: having enough money to do something
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc
Sense.TRAN: 为〔活动﹑组织﹑事件等〕提供资金﹐资助
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project is jointly funded by several local companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目由几家当地公司联合出资。
Sense.EXAMPLE: government-funded research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府资助的研究

Sense.DEF: relating to the most basic and important parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fundamental difference in opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看法的根本区别

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Novice programmers sometimes make fundamental errors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新手程序员有时会犯根本性的错误。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

Sense.DEF: very necessary and important
Sense.TRAN: 必不可少的﹔十分重要的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water is fundamental to survival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水是生存所必需的。

Sense.DEF: someone who follows religious laws very strictly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hindu fundamentalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度原教旨主义者

Sense.DEF: a Christian who believes that everything in the Bible is completely and actually true

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 原教旨主义信条﹔基要主义信条

Sense.DEF: in every way that is important or basic
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conclusions of the report are fundamentally wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告的结论从根本上来说就是错误的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The political culture of the US is fundamentally different .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的政治文化迥然不同。

Sense.DEF: the most important ideas, rules etc that something is based on
Sense.TRAN: （某事物的）基本原理﹐基本法则﹐基础
Sense.EXAMPLE: an introduction to the fundamentals of design and print production
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计与印刷生产基础导论

Sense.DEF: money that is provided by an organization for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: College directors have called for more government funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院董事呼吁增加政府拨款。

Sense.DEF:
someone who collects money for a
charity
, political party etc, for example by arranging social events that people pay to attend

an event that is organized to collect money for a
charity
, political party etc
Sense.TRAN: 募捐活动﹐筹款活动﹐募捐会

Sense.DEF: the activity of collecting money for a specific purpose, especially in order to help people who are ill, old etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Action Pack full of fundraising ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲了许多募捐方法的一本《行动宝盒》

Sense.DEF:
a religious ceremony for burying or
cremating burning
someone who has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the minister who conducted the funeral service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主持葬礼的牧师
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

Sense.DEF: used to warn someone that they, and no one else, must deal with the results of their actions
Sense.TRAN: 这是你自作自受〔警告某人为其行为的后果负责的只能是自己﹐而不是别人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to organ-ize a funeral
Sense.TRAN: 丧葬承办者﹐殡仪业人员

Sense.DEF: the place where a body is kept before a funeral
relating to a funeral or the place where someone is buried
Sense.EXAMPLE: a funerary monument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墓碑

Sense.DEF: sad, slow, and suitable for a funeral
Sense.TRAN: 悲哀的﹔沉重的﹔适合于葬礼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: funereal music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哀乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: moving at a funereal pace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步履沉重地缓行

Sense.DEF: a noisy outdoor event where you can ride on machines, play games to win prizes etc

connected with or caused by a
fungus
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fungal infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真菌感染

Sense.DEF: a chemical used for destroying fungus

a simple type of plant that has no leaves or flowers and that grows on plants or other surfaces.
mushrooms
and
mould
are both fungi.
a small railway that carries people up and down a steep hill or mountain, pulled by a thick metal rope

a style of music with a strong
rhythm
that is based on
jazz
and African music
Sense.TRAN: 乡土爵士乐﹐放克乐〔一种以爵士乐和非洲音乐为基础的音乐风格﹐节奏强劲〕

Sense.DEF: very unhappy, worried, or afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s in a funk about giving her talk on Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在为星期天的演讲犯愁。

Sense.DEF: a strong smell that comes from someone’s body
to avoid doing something because it is difficult, or because you are afraid
modern, fashionable, and interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a touch of style with these functional yet funky wall lights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用这些实用而不失时尚的壁灯来增添些许格调。

Sense.DEF:
funky music is simple with a strong
rhythm
that is easy to dance to
having a bad smell or a dirty appearance
a thin tube with a wide top that you use for pouring liquid into a container with a narrow opening, such as a bottle

a metal
chimney
that allows smoke from a steam engine or steamship to get out
if you funnel something somewhere, or if it funnels there, it goes there by passing through a narrow opening
Sense.TRAN: （使）流经漏斗形空间﹔（使）通过小口子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police at the barriers funnelled the crowd into the arena.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 栅栏旁边的警察指挥着人流进入体育场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Incoming tides funnel up the channel with enormous power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涨起的潮水汹涌地冲进河槽。

Sense.DEF: to send money, information etc from various places to someone
Sense.TRAN: 使〔资金﹑信息等〕汇集[集中]
Sense.EXAMPLE: His office funneled millions of dollars in secret contributions to the re-election campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的办公室汇集了数百万美元的秘密捐款用于连任竞选。

Sense.DEF:
a number of different
cartoons
in a newspaper or magazine
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或杂志上的〕（滑稽）连环漫画栏

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is unexpected or strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: Funnily enough, I was just about to call you when you called me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说来也巧﹐我正要打电话给你﹐你就来电话了。

Sense.DEF: in an amusing or strange way
Sense.TRAN: 有趣地﹐可笑地﹔古怪地﹔异常地

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the adjective funny in spoken and written English. 形容词funny在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the adjective funny is much more common in spoken English than in written English. This is because it is used in a lot of common spok-en phrases. 本图表显示﹐形容词funny在口语中的使用频率远高于书面语﹐因为它大量出现在常用口语短语中。

Sense.DEF: making you laugh
Sense.TRAN: 使人发笑的﹐有趣的﹔滑稽的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you remember any funny stories about work?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能想起工作上的什么趣事吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wickedly funny scene from the film
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中恶作剧似的滑稽场面

Sense.EXAMPLE: the funniest man in Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国最滑稽的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: If this is your idea of a joke, I don’t find it at all funny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你觉得这是个玩笑﹐那我认为它一点也不好笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily, when I explained the situation, he saw the funny side recognized that it was partly funny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好在我把情况解释了以后﹐他看到了好笑的一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His laughter stopped her mid-sentence. ‘ What’s so funny? ’ she demanded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的笑声打断了她的话。“有什么好笑的？”她厉声问道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not funny don’t laugh , Paul; poor Teresa was nearly in tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没什么好笑的﹐保罗﹐可怜的特雷莎都快哭了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use funny to mean ‘enjoyable’. Use fun. 表示“令人愉快”不要用funny﹐而要用fun: The picnic was really fun. 野餐真的很开心。

Sense.DEF: unusual, strange, or difficult to explain
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a funny feeling something was going to happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有种奇怪的感觉﹐有什么事情要发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s that funny smell?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是什么怪味？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s funny how you remember the words of songs, even ones you don’t really like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是不懂﹐歌词你怎么都记得﹐就连不喜欢的也能记住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s funny that the kids are so quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真怪﹐孩子们这么安静。

Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s funny. I was sure I had $5 in my purse, but it’s not there now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪﹐我皮夹里明明有5美元﹐可现在不见了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People tell me I ran the greatest race of my life, but the funny thing is I can’t remember much about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都说我跑了平生最好的一场比赛﹐但奇怪的是﹐我竟然记不太清了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a funny old world strange or unusual things happen in life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个离奇的世界。

Sense.DEF: appearing to be illegal, dishonest, or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 非法的﹔不老实的﹔错误的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something funny going on here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里正进行着某种非法勾当。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember, Marvin, no funny business while we’re out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐马文﹐我们不在的时候别胡闹。

Sense.DEF: if you give someone a funny look, you look at them in a way that shows you think they are behaving strangely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hunkered down, ignoring the funny looks from passers-by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我蹲下身﹐不去管路人投来的古怪目光。

Sense.DEF: feeling slightly ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always feel funny after a long car ride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间坐汽车后我总觉得不大舒服。

Sense.DEF: slightly crazy
Sense.TRAN: 有点疯癫的﹐精神有点失常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: After his wife died he went a bit funny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子去世以后他就变得有点怪怪的。

Sense.DEF: if a machine, piece of equipment etc goes funny, it stops working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just turned it on and the screen went all funny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚开机﹐屏幕就出问题了。

Sense.DEF: used when someone is laughing at you or playing a trick and you do not think it is amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Very funny! Who’s hidden my car keys?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么好笑的！谁藏了我的汽车钥匙？

Sense.DEF: used when you are serious or do not want to offend someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not being funny, but we haven’t got much time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是在开玩笑﹐我们时间不多了。

Sense.DEF: used to describe something you like because it is small, unusual, or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town centre is crammed with funny little shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇中心挤满了千奇百怪的小店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his funny little grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他微微咧嘴的怪笑

Sense.DEF: used when someone has described something as funny and you want to know whether they mean it is strange or amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Tim’s a funny guy.’ ‘Funny weird or funny ha-ha?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “蒂姆是个奇人。”“是奇怪还是有趣？”

Exponent.DEF: making you laugh
Exponent.EXAMPLE: John told me a really funny joke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰给我讲了一个很有趣的笑话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s very talented and funny.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她才华横溢﹐也很风趣。

Exponent.DEF: funny and enjoyable. Amusing is more formal than funny . It is often used when something is a little funny and makes you smile, rather than laugh.
Exponent.TRAN: 有趣的〔较funny正式﹐指某事物有点滑稽﹑让人发笑﹐但不是大笑〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an amusing anecdote
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 趣闻
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He found the whole incident rather amusing .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现整件事相当有趣。

Exponent.DEF: intended to be funny – used about stories, films, articles etc that have situations that are a little funny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: humorous stories
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽默故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The movie is meant to be humorous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部影片想拍成幽默片。

Exponent.DEF: using words in a funny and clever way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: witty remarks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 妙语
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How witty!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真风趣！

Exponent.DEF: extremely funny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children thought it was hilarious.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们觉得滑稽极了。

Exponent.DEF: funny in a strange or silly way – often used when something is not intended to be funny
Exponent.TRAN: 〔本无意惹人发笑的事物〕滑稽的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was quite comical watching him trying to dance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看他拼命跳舞的样子真是滑稽。

Exponent.DEF: a comic film, play, novel etc is intended to be funny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a comic drama
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜剧

Exponent.DEF: done for amusement or enjoyment, and not intended to be serious
Exponent.TRAN: 轻松愉快的﹔有趣而不严肃的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The programme is a light-hearted look at recent political events.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目戏说近期政治事件。

Exponent.DEF: a film, play, or television programme that is intended to be funny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a comedy by Shakespeare
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚的一部喜剧

Sense.DEF: the soft part of your elbow that particularly hurts when you hit it

an expression meaning a
psychiatric
hospital that some people consider offensive – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 精神病院〔有些人认为该词具有冒犯性﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
a man who works as a
comedian
– used in newspapers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nation’s best-loved funnyman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内最受人喜爱的滑稽演员

Sense.DEF: money that has been printed illegally

another expression for the
funnies

a woman who works as a
comedian
– used in newspapers etc
Sense.TRAN: 女滑稽演员〔用于报纸等〕

Sense.DEF:
an event in which people run a long distance in order to collect money for
charity
the thick soft hair that covers the bodies of some animals, such as cats, dogs, and rabbits
the skin of a dead animal with the fur still attached
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fur coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裘皮大衣
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fur-lined jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛皮衬里夹克
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ban on fur farming keeping and killing animals for their fur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止毛皮兽养殖

Sense.DEF: a coat or piece of clothing made of fur
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lady Yolanda was swathed in elegant furs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约兰达夫人穿着一身雅致的毛皮大衣。

Sense.DEF: a material that looks and feels like fur

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pair of gloves trimmed with fake fur
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有仿毛皮边的一副手套

Sense.DEF: a harmful or unpleasant substance that sometimes forms on surfaces that are always wet, such as water pipes
used to say that an angry argument or fight starts
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re both feeling frustrated, the fur may fly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你们俩都觉得不顺心﹐就有可能会发生争吵。

Sense.DEF: to become covered with an unwanted substance

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Symptoms include dry lips and a furred tongue.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 症状包括嘴唇发干及长舌苔。

Sense.DEF: very angry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Residents in the area are furious at the decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的居民对这一决定感到愤怒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was furious with herself for letting things get out of hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生自己的气﹐怪自己把事情搞得不可收拾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her family are furious that her name has been published by the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字被媒体曝光﹐她的家人为此很恼火。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was absolutely furious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怒不可遏。

Sense.DEF: done with a lot of energy, effort, or speed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neil set off at a furious pace .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔狂奔起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a furious row over the proposals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The action is fast and furious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行动很迅猛。

Sense.DEF: a furled newspaper, flag etc has been rolled or folded neatly
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸﹑旗帜等〕卷起的﹐叠整齐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He held a furled umbrella in one hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一只手里拿着一把收拢的雨伞。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring length, equal to about 201 metres, which is used in horse racing. There are eight furlongs in a mile.
Sense.TRAN: 弗隆﹐浪〔长度单位﹐用于赛马﹐约合201米﹐8弗隆为1英里〕

Sense.DEF: a period of time when a soldier or someone working in another country can return to their own country
Sense.TRAN: 〔在国外服役的士兵或国外工作人员的〕休假期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young soldier home on furlough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回国休假的年轻士兵

Sense.DEF: a period of time when workers are told not to work, especially because there is not enough money to pay them
Sense.TRAN: 停工期﹐歇工期〔尤因发不出工资〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: workers forced to take a long, unpaid furlough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被迫长期停薪休假的工人

Sense.DEF: a short period of time during which a prisoner is allowed to leave prison before returning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morton stabbed the man while on furlough .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫顿在准假期间用刀捅了人。

Sense.DEF: a large container for a very hot fire, used to produce power, heat, or liquid metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于产生动力﹑热量或用以熔化金属的〕火炉﹔熔炉

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to heat a building
to put furniture and other things into a house or room
Sense.TRAN: 为〔房屋或房间〕配备家具
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买下房子后﹐他们没有钱买家具了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a room furnished with a desk and swivel chair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆了一张书桌和一把转椅的房间

Sense.DEF: to supply or provide something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John was furnished with a list of local solicitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰得到了一张当地事务律师的名单。

Sense.DEF: the furniture and other things, such as curtains, in a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: a home furnishings store
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家居用品店

Sense.DEF: large objects such as chairs, tables, beds, and cupboards
Sense.EXAMPLE: I helped him choose the furniture for his house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我帮他挑选房子里用的家具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t think of a single piece of furniture in my house that I bought new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不出家里有哪件家具是新买的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: office furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室家具

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Furniture is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it. furniture
F2NBox.TRAN: 为不可数名词﹐无复数形式﹐其后用动词的单数形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The furniture was easy to transport.
F2NBox.EXPL: You can refer to one or more pieces/items of furniture.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示一件或多件家具时用 piece(s)/item(s) of furniture
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Some new pieces of furniture have been added.

Sense.DEF: a sudden expression of anger among a large group of people about something that has happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The security leaks have caused a widespread furore.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全漏洞激起了广泛的公愤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the furor over the oil embargo
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油禁运引起的公愤

Sense.DEF: someone who makes or sells fur clothing
a deep line or fold in the skin of someone’s face, especially on the forehead
Sense.EXAMPLE: A deep furrow appeared between his brows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眉间出现了一道深深的皱纹。

Sense.DEF: a wide deep line made in the surface of something, especially the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: the regular furrows of a plowed field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犁过的地里齐整的犁沟
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river cuts a long straight furrow between the hills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条河在山间冲刷出一条又长又直的沟壑。

Sense.DEF: to make the skin on your face form deep lines or folds, especially because you are worried or thinking hard
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔脸部〕起皱纹〔尤因烦恼或苦苦思索〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quin’s brow furrowed in concentration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奎因双眉紧锁﹐全神贯注。

Sense.DEF: to make a wide deep line in the surface of something
Sense.TRAN: 犁﹔在…开出沟槽﹔使形成车辙

Sense.DEF: covered with fur or short threads
Sense.TRAN: 覆盖着毛皮的﹔毛茸茸的﹔柔软的
Sense.EXAMPLE: furry kittens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的小猫
Sense.EXAMPLE: pink furry slippers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的粉色拖鞋
Sense.EXAMPLE: furry leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的叶子

Sense.DEF: used humorously to talk about animals in general
Sense.TRAN: 毛茸茸的朋友〔幽默用法﹐泛指动物〕

Sense.DEF: more, or to a greater degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: A spokesman declined to comment until the evidence could be studied further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位发言人拒绝在证据得到进一步验证之前发表评论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flavour of the wine is further improved during the aging period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄酒口感在陈化过程中进一步提升。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whaling in Australia was stopped. But the Australian government went further said or did something more extreme and proposed a global ban.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚已停止捕鲸﹐但是澳大利亚政府更进一步建议全球禁捕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marcus sank further and further into debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马库斯的债越欠越多。

Sense.DEF: to take action at a more serious or higher level, especially in order to get the result you want
Sense.TRAN: 进一步做某事〔尤为取得所需结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police do not propose to take the matter further .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方不打算进一步追查此事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Critics want the government to take this a stage further and ban the film altogether.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评人士希望政府的这一举动能更进一步﹐全面禁止这部影片。

Sense.DEF: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: They walked a little further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又往前走了一点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His farm is located further away from Riobamba than his brother’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的农场比他兄弟的农场离里奥班巴更远。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His hands moved further down her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手在她背上继续往下滑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从没有到过比圣迭戈更往南的地方。

Sense.DEF: into the past or the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five years further on, a cure has still not been found.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年过去了﹐仍未找到对症的疗法。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The records don’t go any further back than 1960.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记录没有1960年以前的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It might be a sign, much further down the road in the future , of a change in policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能是未来政策改变的一个迹象。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce something additional that you want to talk about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Butter sales have fallen because margarine has improved in flavor. Further, butter consumption has decreased because of links to heart disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄油销量下滑是因为人造黄油的味道有了改进。此外﹐因为与心脏疾病有关﹐黄油的消耗量也减少了。

Sense.DEF: used in letters to mention a previous letter, conversation etc about the same matter
Sense.TRAN: 关于某事〔用于书信﹐提及上次有关同一事件的信件﹑谈话等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Further to your letter of February 5th, we can confirm your order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于贵方2月5日来函﹐我们确认贵方之订单。

Sense.LEXUNIT: nothing could be further from the truth
Sense.DEF: used when you want to say that something is completely untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: People often described him as a bitter academic, but nothing could be further from the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们经常说他是个爱发牢骚的书呆子﹐但事实完全不是那样。

Sense.LEXUNIT: nothing could be/is further from sb’s mind/thoughts
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is not thinking about or intending something
Sense.TRAN: 某人根本没在想[打算做]某事

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth must not go any further
Sense.DEF: used to say that something you are telling someone is secret or private
more or additional
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are there any further questions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有其他问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have decided to take no further action .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定不采取进一步行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Visit our website for further details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知详情﹐请访问我们的网站。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cook gently for a further 10 minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再用文火煮10分钟。

Sense.DEF: until you are told that something has changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lacunza ordered the suspension of the elections until further notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉昆萨下令暂停选举﹐等待另行通知。

Sense.DEF: to help something progress or be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dedicated his life to furthering the cause of world peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一生致力于推动世界和平事业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan had been using her to further his career .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦一直在利用她来发展自己的事业。

Sense.DEF: the act or process of helping something progress or be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the furtherance of science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 促进科学的发展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff are encouraged to use information resources in furtherance of their own professional interests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工被鼓励使用信息库以促进自身专业发展。

Sense.DEF: education for adults after leaving school, that is not at a university
Sense.TRAN: 继续教育﹐进修教育﹐成人教育

Sense.DEF: in addition to what has already been said
Sense.TRAN: 此外﹔而且﹔不仅如此﹔更有甚者
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is old and unpopular. Furthermore, he has at best only two years of political life ahead of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年纪已老﹐又不得人心﹐而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

Sense.DEF: most distant
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the furthermost corner sat a tall thin man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最远的角落里坐着一个高瘦的男人。

Sense.DEF: at the greatest distance from a place or point in time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a huge tapestry on the furthest wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最远的那面墙上有一张巨大的挂毯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He walked slowly toward the end of the jury box furthest from the judge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地向陪审团席离法官最远的那头走去。

Sense.DEF: more or to a greater degree than other people or things, or than before
Sense.TRAN: 最大程度的[地]﹔最大限度的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maltby’s book has probably gone furthest in explaining these events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫尔特比的书对于这些事件的解释可能最为详细。

Sense.DEF: behaving as if you want to keep something secret
Sense.TRAN: 偷偷摸摸的﹐鬼鬼祟祟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was something furtive about his actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为有点鬼鬼祟祟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chris kept stealing furtive glances at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯一直在偷偷摸摸朝我看。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She opened the door and looked furtively down the hall.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开了门﹐鬼头鬼脑地朝走廊里张望。

Sense.DEF: extreme, often uncontrolled anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shaking with fury .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我气得发抖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo stepped forward, her eyes blazing with fury .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔满眼冒火地走上前来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report was leaked to the press, much to the president’s fury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告被泄露给了媒体﹐令总统大为光火。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of extreme anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Go on then!’ shouted Jamie in a fury . ‘See if I care!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那就请便！”杰米怒吼道﹐“我才不在乎呢！”

Sense.DEF: a state of very busy activity or strong feeling
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑感情等的〕激烈﹐热烈﹔狂热
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was listening with such a fury of concentration that she did not notice Arthur had left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听得如此入迷﹐甚至没有注意到阿瑟走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a fury of frustration and fear Nina bit his hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜一时间又恼又怕﹐咬了他的手。

Sense.DEF: with great effort or energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went out and played like fury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去疯玩了一通。

Sense.DEF: used to describe very bad weather conditions
Sense.TRAN: 狂暴﹐猛烈〔用于形容坏天气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last the fury of the storm lessened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风暴雨终于减弱了。

Sense.DEF: one of the three snake-haired goddesses in ancient Greek stories who punished crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊神话中的〕复仇三女神之一

Sense.DEF: a wild bush with sharp stems and bright yellow flowers
a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power
Sense.EXAMPLE: two 13 amp fuses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两根13安培的保险丝
Sense.EXAMPLE: I taught him how to change a fuse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我教他怎么换保险丝。

GramExa.GLOSS: make it melt by putting too much electricity through it

Sense.DEF:
a thing that delays a bomb,
firework
etc from exploding until you are a safe distance away, or makes it explode at a particular time
if someone has a short fuse, they get angry very easily
to join together physically, or to make things join together, and become a single thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The egg and sperm fuse together as one cell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卵子和精子结合﹐形成一个细胞。

Sense.DEF: to combine different qualities, ideas, or things, or to be combined
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their music fuses elements as diverse as Cajun, bebop and Cuban waltzes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的音乐融合了卡津音乐﹑博普爵士乐和古巴华尔兹等不同元素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leonard takes Carver-style dirty realism and fuses it with the pace of a detective story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦纳德采用了卡佛式的肮脏现实主义﹐并将它与侦探小说的节奏结合起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We intend to fuse the companies into a single organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算将各家公司合并成一个机构。

Sense.DEF: if electrical equipment fuses, or if you fuse it, it stops working because a fuse has melted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lights have fused again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯的保险丝又烧断了。

Sense.DEF: if a rock or metal fuses, or if you fuse it, it becomes liquid by being heated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lead fuses at quite a low temperature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铅的熔点很低。

Sense.DEF: a box that contains the fuses of the electrical system of a house or other building
if a piece of electrical equipment is fused, it is fitted with a fuse
the main part of a plane, in which people sit or goods are carried

a soldier in the past who carried a light gun called a
musket
a quick series of shots fired from a gun, or a quick series of other objects that are thrown
Sense.TRAN: 〔枪炮的〕连发﹔〔某物的〕连续投掷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fusillade of bullets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹的连发

Sense.DEF: a quick series of questions or remarks
Sense.TRAN: 连珠炮似的问题﹔一连串的话

Sense.DEF: a combination of separate qualities or ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her work is a fusion of several different styles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的作品是几种不同风格的融合。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the best fusion cuisine in the whole of Vancouver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全温哥华最好的混合料理

Sense.DEF: a physical combination of separate things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the energy that comes from the fusion of hydrogen atoms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氢原子聚变所产生的能量

Sense.DEF:
a type of music which mixes
jazz
with other types of music, especially
rock
Sense.TRAN: 〔爵士乐与摇滚等音乐风格的〕混成音乐﹐合成音乐﹔爵士摇滚乐

Sense.DEF: another word for a hydrogen bomb
anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指对小事的〕紧张不安﹔大惊小怪﹐小题大做
Sense.EXAMPLE: James said he’d better be getting back or there’d be a fuss .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯说他最好回来﹐否则就会有人小题大做了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Steamatic enables you to clean any carpet with the minimum of fuss .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸汽清洁器可以让你轻轻松松地清洁地毯。

Sense.DEF: attention or excitement that is usually unnecessary or unwelcome
Sense.EXAMPLE: They wanted a quiet wedding without any fuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想安安静静地举行婚礼﹐不大事铺张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Until I heard her sing I couldn’t see what all the fuss was about why people liked it so much .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到她的演唱之后﹐我才明白她为什么会引起这么大的轰动。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a fuss/kick up a fuss (about sth)
Sense.DEF: to complain or become angry about something, especially when this is not necessary
Sense.TRAN: （因某事）大吵大闹﹔（因某事）大惊小怪
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josie kicked up a fuss because the soup was too salty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔西因为汤太咸而大吵大闹了一番。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why you’re making such a fuss about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搞不懂你为什么对此大惊小怪。

Sense.DEF: to pay a lot of attention to someone or something, to show that you are pleased with them or like them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物关爱备至
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make a fuss of your dog when he behaves properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗儿守规矩的时候就要宠宠它。

Sense.DEF: to worry a lot about things that may not be very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop fussing - I’ll be perfectly all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再瞎操心了——我会很好的。

Sense.DEF: to pay too much attention to small unimportant details

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul was fussing with his clothes, trying to get his tie straight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗在不厌其烦地整理衣服﹐试图把领带弄直。

Sense.DEF: to behave in an unhappy or angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby woke up and started to fuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝醒过来﹐开始哭闹了。

Sense.DEF: to pay a lot of attention or too much attention to someone or something, especially to show that you are pleased with them or like them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物过于体贴[关心]
Sense.EXAMPLE: His aunts fussed over him all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的姑母们对他一直宠爱有加。

Sense.DEF: to not mind what happens or is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where do you want to go?’ ‘I’m not fussed.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想去哪里？”“我无所谓。”

Sense.DEF: someone who worries about unimportant things
Sense.TRAN: 大惊小怪的人﹐为小事烦恼的人

Sense.DEF: very concerned about small, usually unimportant details, and difficult to please
Sense.TRAN: 爱挑剔的﹔过于讲究的﹔难以取悦的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sue was fussy about her looks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 休对自己的外表很挑剔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of small children are fussy eaters they dislike many types of food .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小孩子挑食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want to go out or just rent a movie?’ ‘I’m not fussy’ I don’t mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想出去还是租影碟来看？”“随便。”

Sense.DEF: fussy clothes, objects, buildings etc are very detailed and decorated – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 过分琐碎的﹔装饰太多的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The furniture looked comfortable, nothing fussy or too elaborate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家具看上去很舒服﹐没有过多装饰﹐也不过于繁复。

Sense.DEF: with small, exact, and careful actions, sometimes showing nervousness
Sense.EXAMPLE: She patted her hair with small fussy movements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧张不安地轻轻拍着自己的头发。

Sense.DEF: a type of rough heavy cotton cloth, worn especially in the past
words that sound important but have very little meaning
if rooms, clothes, buildings etc are fusty, they have an unpleasant smell, because they have not been used for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑衣服﹑建筑物等〕发霉味的

Sense.DEF: ideas or people that are fusty are old-fashioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: fusty old academics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古板的老学究

Sense.DEF: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a futile attempt to save the paintings from the flames
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图将那些画从大火中抢救出来的徒劳之举

Sense.EXAMPLE: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我努力想再次入睡﹐但怎么也睡不着。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is futile to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was futile to continue the negotiations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 继续谈判下去也是枉然。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: This sums up Owen’s thoughts on the futility of war.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就是欧文的战争无益思想。

Sense.DEF:
a
mattress
used for sleeping on, especially in Japan
likely to happen or exist at a time after the present
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are now more able to predict future patterns of climate change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在更有能力预测未来气候的变化模式了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been able to save this land from development and preserve it for future generations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们保全了这块土地﹐没有去开发﹐而是把它留给子孙后代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the debate over the future development of the European Union
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于欧盟未来发展的辩论

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who will be your wife, husband, son-in-law etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 未来的妻子/丈夫/女婿等

Sense.DEF: the form of a verb used for talking about things that are going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the future tense
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将来时态

Sense.DEF: something kept for future reference is kept in order to be used or looked at in the future

Subsense.DEF: the time after the present
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What are your plans for the future?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你未来有什么打算？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It may be useful at some time in the future.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以后什么时候也许用得着。

Subsense.DEF: the form of a verb that shows that something will happen or exist at a later time. In the sentence, ‘I will leave tomorrow,’ the verb is in the future.

Sense.DEF: what someone or something will do or what will happen to them in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The islands should have the right to decide their own future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些岛屿应当有权决定自己的未来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ferguson is optimistic about the future of the business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗格森对公司的前途很乐观。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a leader who will shape the organization’s future
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将决定该组织未来的一位领导者

Sense.DEF: from now
Sense.EXAMPLE: In future, staff must wear identity badges at all times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从今以后﹐员工必须时时刻刻佩戴身份牌。

Sense.DEF: to have a chance or no chance of being successful or continuing
Sense.TRAN: 有/没有前途﹐有/没有未来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does this school have a future?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校有前途吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is likely or not likely to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt there was no future in farming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得种田没有前途。

Sense.DEF: goods, money, land etc that will be supplied or exchanged in the future at a time and price that has already been agreed

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – Meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say what will happen in the future
Collocate.EXAMPLE: No-one can predict the future of boxing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人能预言拳击运动的未来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say or show what will happen in the future
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some people think that dreams can foretell the future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为梦能预言未来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: know what will happen in the future
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wish I could see into the future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望自己能预知未来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think about or plan for the future
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She could now look to the future with confidence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在能自信地展望未来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think carefully about the future and decide what you are going to do
it is in a particular thing
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人/某事物的未来在于某事物

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country has a great future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国前景远大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing signs of being successful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her future as a tennis player looks promising.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她作为网球运动员似乎很有前途。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not clear or decided
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The college’s future is now uncertain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该学院现在前途未卜。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: without anything to make you feel hopeful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The theatre is losing money and its future looks bleak.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座剧院在亏本﹐前景暗淡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very soon
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There will be no major changes in the immediate future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会马上有重大变化。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: soon
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A new product launch is planned for the near future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划不久就推出新产品。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a long time from now
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don’t worry about what might happen in the distant future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 遥远的将来会发生什么﹐我并不担心。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: as far into the future as you can possibly know
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The population is expected to keep growing for the foreseeable future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在可预见的将来﹐人口会持续增长。

Collocate.COLLOC: in the not too distant future
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite soon
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’re planning to go there again in the not too distant future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们计划在不久的将来再去那里一次。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人对未来的希望/担忧/计划
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What are your hopes for the future?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对未来有什么期许？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what will happen

Section.SECHEADING: THE TIME AFTER NOW 以后的时间

Exponent.DEF: the time after now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What will life be like in the future?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 未来的生活会是怎样？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company is hoping to expand in the near future soon .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司希望在不久后进行扩张。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something will always happen in the future, starting from now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The meetings will be held once a month from now on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在起﹐每月开一次会。

Exponent.DEF: for a long time in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In years to come, people will look back on the 20th century as a turning point in history.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将来当人们回眸20世纪时﹐会视其为历史的转折点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nuclear power stations will still be needed for a long time to come .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 未来很长一段时间内仍然需要核电站。

Exponent.DEF: use this to talk about what will happen over a period from now until a long, short etc time in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We don’t know what will happen in the long term.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 长远来看会发生什么﹐我们不知道。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the short term, things look good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 短期内情况不错。

Exponent.DEF: used when talking about what is likely to happen in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are some big changes on the horizon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 即将发生一些重大变化。

Section.SECHEADING: WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO SB/STH某人/某事物会发生什么

Exponent.DEF: what will happen to someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He knew that his future was in films.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己的前途在电影业。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shareholders will meet to decide the company’s future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东们将开会决定公司的命运。

Exponent.DEF: someone or something’s future – used especially when you are worried that something bad could happen
Exponent.TRAN: 命运〔尤指担心不好的事发生〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fate of the hostages remains uncertain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人质依然命运未卜。

Exponent.DEF: what will happen to someone in their life, especially something important
Exponent.TRAN: 命运﹐天数〔尤指人生中重要的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sartre believed that everyone is in charge of their own destiny.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨特相信每个人都是自己命运的主人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He thinks that it is his destiny to lead the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得自己命中注定要领导这个国家。

Exponent.DEF: what will happen, especially concerning business, the economy, or the weather
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The economic outlook looks good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济前景乐观。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Here is the weather outlook for tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在预报明天的天气。

Exponent.DEF: the idea or possibility that something will happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the awful prospect of another terrorist attack
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 再次发生恐怖袭击的糟糕可能性
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Prospects for a peace settlement don’t look too good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成和平协议的前景不妙。

Exponent.DEF: what will happen to a person, organization etc in the future – used especially when talking about whether or not they will be successful
Exponent.TRAN: 命运〔尤用于谈论是否成功〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fans are hoping for a change in the club’s fortunes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷希望俱乐部能时来运转。

Sense.DEF: the form of a verb that shows that the action described will be complete before a particular time in the future, formed in English by ‘will have’ or ‘shall have’, as in ‘I will have finished by 5 o’clock.’
to make or plan something in such a way that it will not become ineffective or unsuitable for use in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to future-proof the company’s network
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保证公司网络适应未来需要的计划

Sense.DEF: if something is future-proof, it will not become ineffective or unsuitable for use in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: future-proof software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会过时的软件

Sense.DEF:
a market where
futures
are bought and sold
a style of art, music, and literature in the early 20th century which emphasized the importance of modern things, especially technology and machines
Sense.TRAN: 未来主义﹐未来派〔20世纪初期的一种绘画﹑音乐和文学风格〕

Sense.DEF: something which is futuristic looks unusual and modern, as if it belongs in the future instead of the present
Sense.EXAMPLE: The futuristic sports stadium is the pride of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座超现代的体育场是该市的骄傲。

Sense.DEF: futuristic ideas, books, films etc imagine what may happen in the future, especially through scientific developments
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑书﹑影片等〕幻想未来的﹐想象在未来发生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Orwell’s disturbing futuristic novel, ‘1984’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥威尔的那部令人不安的幻想小说《一九八四》

Sense.DEF: the time after the present
the activity of trying to say correctly what will happen in the future
to waste time, especially by doing small unimportant jobs slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the entire day just futzing around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天我整天都在闲混。

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of
fuse 1 2
thin soft hair or a substance like hair that covers something
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Jack was born he had a fuzz of black hair on his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克出生的时候长着一头细细的黑发。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of soft material that has come from clothing etc
an insulting way of talking to or about the police, used especially in the 1960s and 1970s
Sense.TRAN: 警方〔侮辱性用语﹐尤用于20世纪60年代和70年代〕

Sense.DEF: if a sound or picture is fuzzy, it is unclear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the photos were so fuzzy it was hard to tell who was who.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些照片模糊不清﹐看不出谁是谁。

Sense.DEF: unclear or confused
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a fuzzy line between parents’ and schools’ responsibilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长与学校之间划定责任的界线很模糊。

Sense.DEF: covered with soft short hair or fur
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stroked the kitten’s fuzzy back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抚摸着小猫毛茸茸的背。

Sense.DEF: fuzzy hair is very curly and sticks straight up

a type of
logic
which is used to try to make computers think like humans

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=forward 向前（的）﹔转寄

Sense.DEF: for what it is worth; an abbreviation used in emails, to say that you are not sure if what you are writing is very useful
Sense.TRAN: 不论有没有用〔电子邮件中的缩写﹐表示不确定正在写的东西是否很有用〕

Sense.DEF:
used when you are talking about the word
fuck
but do not want to say it because it is offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mommy, Billy said the f-word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐比利说脏话。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=freeway 高速公路
the abbreviation of 缩写=foreign exchange 国际汇兑﹔外汇
the abbreviation of 缩写=special effects 特技效果

Sense.DEF:
another form of the suffix
-ify

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=fiscal year 财政年度﹔会计年度

Sense.DEF: used especially in short business notes and emails, when you are telling someone something they need to know
Sense.TRAN: 供参考〔尤用于商业便笺和电子邮件中〕
